reviews.content: What is Kantara ?A mysterious forest and so is the movie.It starts with a mystery whether God exists and our traditional rituals holds any truth in them.The story slowly unfolds and its very engaging, I have watched it in Hindi but the efforts are very much visible in the great dubbing as well.The comedy and dialogues are very well done in very shot time after the Kannada release and success.Very Beautiful cinematography , I have enjoyed the large landscapes our beautiful country has to show.The Climax is very beautifully shot and acting are top notch.The very existence of God is challenged by some but some higher power is always above all of us.MUST WATCH.

reviews.review_title: The most gripping climax in Indian Cinema!
reviews.content: Here comes a once in a lifetime movie! The story weaves itself from the past into the present nicely. The dhaiva aradhana is the centerpiece and gives it a deserved recognition. The language, nuances, and culture is depicted well.The story is true to life and the performances are great. The role of the mother is outstandingly played by Manasi. Achyuth Kumar is versatile and carries his role very well. Supported by the entire cast and crew, very true to life dialogues and events. The absorption of the spirit into a human body transforming itself into a whole new avatar is engrossing.This one is for the big screen.

reviews.review_title: People just over hyped this one !!!
reviews.content: I remember everyone around me talking non stop about this movie and I thought it would be really that good. However, that was not the case at all, people have showcased herd mentality on this one.About the movie, the story is pretty straightforward (nothing new) but thats not at all bad if the screenplay and acting are good enough but in this case it is not the case. Rishab Shetty's acting is alright, nothing to boast about. Like other recent movies, this one also has a tinge of negative portrayal of masulinity This is a mediocore movie at best and I have seen lots of under rated movies better than this one in every aspect of cinema.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best Movie so far !!!!
reviews.content: The expectation for Rishab Shetty movies usually high for me always but this one for sure standout from rest of his movie and one of his carrier's best movie also the best performance. Never expected climax acting to be this much by Rishab shetty !!! It's a top notch!!Final thought ,this movie should be celebrated for it's making, story line,content, performance by all the lead and supporting actors and Kishore Sir , Achyut Kumar Sir performance is great as always , it's a must watch for everyone.Not to mention ,this is my first time review for a film and i couldn't stop myself to write about the film.. Repeat mode On !!!

reviews.review_title: Superb acting, Fantastic movie, National award potential,
reviews.content: Fabulous.. Fantastic movie.. a must national award pick. It has all elements carefully presented. Great piece of acting and direction, felt very natural and movie moving seamlessly. Watch the movie in any language and you will appreciate.The story line looks very genuine and could be real in many parts of India. The belief and culture attached to grama devata and responsibility of those settlements or people to preserve the forest and nature is really well taken.. The twists and climax is too good and what a piece of acting.. one major thing I noticed is acting is not looking Obvious, no heroics, no beautiful glamours.. watching another time for sure.

The movie is good i am not saying it is all that bad but rating it 10 really i was shocked . A good story but feels similar to other movies like karnan, asuran . Just impresses with 1st 15 min. And then on same old predictable story about poor and rich,greed and politics . Even got bored in between. Surely Not a masterpiece by miles as people are stating. Nothing extraordinary. Just simple good story executed well but nothing new . I think lately people are fake rating movies on platforms to get movie more attention which is really bad. If this goes on soon rating concept will be laid to waste really and it will be hard to distinguish between good and medicore movies.

reviews.review_title: A Must Experience in Big Screens Movie ! 🔥
reviews.content: The Movie starts with a small SPARK, which takes its own time, moving in its own pace, and then it ENDS with a Wildfire, the Climax being the most intense part of the Movie. The Background Score, Action Scenes, Songs, Cinematography, Storytelling each perfectly placed and of top notch Quality. Obviously, being a Commercial Movie, it has its commercial 'Indian Cinema Mass Masala' elements to it, but its rightfully done with funny jokes as well as gripping the viewers to their seats. Movie is set in some 1950's and it has its old school, Forest-Village creepy kinda ambience. A Must Watch Movie ! 🔥

reviews.review_title: Plagiarism killed the entire uniqueness of this film
reviews.content: I agree with the other reviewer this movie is a complete waste of your time.I would have given 5 out of 10 stars for the concept, direction and acting but recent allegations of plagiarism deserves 1 star.Apparently they have stolen the "varah roopam" song that was the only highlight of the entire film. Remove it and you have nothing.But yes if you are into cheap adult comedy, you may enjoy certain scenes in this movie. Otherwise its very boring.Warning: Many reviews appear to be fabricated and paid for as has been the trend recently with other movies. And this about it if they can steal the song, can't they game the rating system.

Kantara is the best movie which is rooted to Dakshina Kannada Culture which Shows the richness of Daivaraadhanne (Spiritual Belief). Not only the culture but also the importance of Forest and Tribal People. High Visual Effects (DOP - Arvind Kashyap) , Awesome BGM (Music - Ajaneesh Loknath), Very good comedy, Emotions, romance and mixture of everything is Kantara. The purity of the Culture/Belief is very cautiously taken care of by Rishab and his team, while creating such movie. 0 hyped dialogues, Full of sensible content with fun mixed and what more do we as an audience expect from a movie. But this is not a movie but a Masterpiece. Rishab should get a National Award for such a wonderful Direction+Acting. This movie is not meant for OTT but must be enjoyed in Theatres for the audio and Visual Treat. THE CLIMAX!! Best climax till date. Last 20-30minn Rishab just stole the show.

reviews.review_title: Thrilling entertainer and an Experience beyond Cinema
reviews.content: Watch it in original language 'Kannada'. The most extraordinary movie ever made in the history of Indian Cinema. Technically brilliant. Engaging throughout. Action is badass. BGM is out of this world, u will never forget once u listen to this score. It has thrill, it will give u chills and even scare u in some areas. It is the complete package. Every Indian should watch this. Our culture is represented very accurately and with immense pride. To overseas audience, if u want to understand the essence of Indian culture, this should be ur go to movie. Don't watch Bollywood rubbish. Rishab shetty u are a gem. Proud to be from Karnataka. It's an experience I will never forget.

reviews.review_title: Movie fits the bill. It's not terrible, but it's not particularly outstanding.
reviews.content: As I sat down to watch the latest blockbuster, I couldn't help but feel a sense of anticipation. Unfortunately, my excitement was short-lived as the movie failed to deliver the impact I had hoped for.The acting was decent enough, but the characters were shallow and underdeveloped. The performances were satisfactory, but nothing that would leave a lasting impression. The special effects were passable, but they failed to dazzle and left me wanting more.The story was unoriginal, a tired retread of other movies that have been done before. It was predictable from start to finish, leaving me feeling like I was watching a rerun. The pacing was slow, dragging on for what felt like an eternity, and I found myself checking my watch multiple times. The cinematography was average, failing to add any flair or creativity to the film.However, the movie wasn't a complete disappointment. There were a few scenes that stood out, keeping me engaged and on the edge of my seat. But unfortunately, these moments were few and far between, and they weren't enough to save the film as a whole. The script was weak, the dialogue was clunky, and the humor fell flat. The characters were one-dimensional, and their relationships were not well-explored.The movie's soundtrack was forgettable, failing to add any depth or emotion to the film. The ending was unsatisfying, feeling rushed and leaving loose ends untied.Overall, this movie was a letdown. It was average at best, lacking the depth and impact that makes a great film. It's not a must-watch, but if you're looking for something to pass the time, it's worth a watch. But if you're looking for a film that will leave you thinking long after the credits roll, this isn't it. It's a movie that you'll watch, forget about, and move on. It's a forgettable experience that fails to leave a lasting impression.

This movie is just overhyped and overrated one just because it is based on some kind of hindu /kannanda culture. The rating and worldwide collections shows it has surpasses KGF chapter 1 and 2, but in the plot there is nothing that can compare to the plot of KGF chapter 1 & 2.The film shows villagers life of a particular region and their rituals and believes. The acting of the actors and actresses was well. But only shiva character has been built properly, other character's development was incomplete.I don't know what makes the people like the movie so much that it surpasses KGF!! In my opinion it is an average scripted movie.

The move has a good start and a good end. Some impactful scenes. Everything else is filler. Bad acting, poor character development, sloppy editing and very shoddy storytelling. It is an amateurish attempt. I had a hard time sitting through this movie and only did so because of the good imdb rating. All the songs sounded like they were copied. One scene in the end looked like a scene from mad max. I think there is more cut and paste work that I couldn't catch but that explains why the whole thing is not cohesive.I think all the hype is via marketing stunts. Have to be careful going forward. If the movie hasn't captured and kept your attention in the first 30 minutes it is unlikely to later.

reviews.review_title: Can't understand why people going bizarre about this movie
reviews.content: To be honest, I totally knew the story before stepping into the theatre but still hoped for a surprising or amazing visual and audio experience that people are praising vehemently. I watched the whole movie with that expectation. But me and many others were definitely misled. The movie is nothing but a loud action over-the-top south Indian flick. Maybe people have put their divine and spiritual view while watching but as a true movie buff who appreciates movies irrespective of the language, i can say it is totally disappointing. The climax people are praising about is so loud i had to close my ears. I just couldn't find a single person in the theatre who was satisfied with the movie. I can see why good Indian movies are not appreciated as these bogus movies are.. sole reason is that 80% people don't apply their own senses and just follow the herd. Praise whatever majority praise and boycott whatever majority says. No brains applied.

I haven't seen a worse movie than this one. I wasted so much time. The actor is so bad!!! I am shocked that a movie that promotes animal killing is getting all this appreciation. I hate it!I haven't seen a worse movie than this one. I wasted so much time. The actor is so bad!!! I am shocked that a movie that promotes animal killing is getting all this appreciation. I hate it!I haven't seen a worse movie than this one. I wasted so much time. The actor is so bad!!! I am shocked that a movie that promotes animal killing is getting all this appreciation. I hate it!I haven't seen a worse movie than this one. I wasted so much time. The actor is so bad!!! I am shocked that a movie that promotes animal killing is getting all this appreciation. I hate it!

Hats off to choose this concept, words fall short to describe rishab's performance
He absolutely stole the show
I saw the Telugu dubbed version and witnessed rishab for the first time
His performance touched me itself , I can't imagine what the kannada people might be experiencing
The climax made me gave it a complete 10
He being the writer and director also makes it even more unbelievable
One person being so perfect is just phenomenal
The other actors , all the star caste did a wonderful job
Music also must given credit , bgm was just awesome having the mysterious vibe to it , songs(even in the dubbed version) were very nice
This movie deserves National award without an iota of doubt
Rishabh deserves a national award for sure.

How does this have a rating of 9, I went into the film with medium expectations and came back out wanting to jump from my building.The movie is so basic where the final villain suddenly gets Thanos strength and start lifting people with one hand.I don't try to look for logic in most Indian movies, I watch just for fun but this movie was just a dragged out mess where I knew by the halfway mark this guy will take over the role of the guy screaming ohhh everywhere.I am really sad and concerned about the 9 rating for a film like this, are the Indian audience going to wat anything up? Sadly the movie is setup for a 2nd part guessing that will get a 10 rating as well...

The base story is a straightforward 80s story of the villagers fighting against outside and inside powers that wants to rule over them. But for the most part of the movie, it adds an authentic representation of the culture and dialects of Tulu Nadu tribes engagingly to create a fresh perspective of it. The film does have some outdated comedic moments repeating that don't work for me at all, and a few things that are added for commercialization. There were also some twists and turns without proper exploration which just felt convenient. But even with all those problems, this film is one of the best films of the year.The film works at its best when it focuses on the mystical aspects which was glorious. Those sequences made the film what it is for me, but they were too few and I would've wanted to see more of that. The cinematography and music really worked hand in hand to make the movie as impactful as it is. The climax sequences used the audio-visual potential of the medium in a masala genre to portray the mystic mythology of the land which was absolutely ecstatic to watch.

This is just a below average movie. Not sure why so much of hype for this one . I felt like only last 10 minutes was worth watching only because it gave some good visual experience. Overall the movie was very slowly paced with not much drama and obvious predictable ending. Expected a lot by reading other reviews and initial hype received so far. So my verdict is this is just a below average and ok to be watched . This will never go to my must watch recommendations. I saw some reviewer's categorized this as a must watch which definitely is not . So if you watch with over expectations you will be disappointed for sure !!

reviews.review_title: Hype, Hype and only hype - nothing else!
reviews.content: Well, I've been fooled by all the social media hype over this film, taking all the pain and convincing my family to watch this film on the big screen.The cinema hall was packed, and to no surprise, there was a lot of cheer, and applause during the start of the narration, and to some extent, I was also kicked up with the emotion to see something spectacular. The start was okayish, with clean graphics, not overkilling the experience and what followed after the start was an ABSOLUTE nightmare!!!!The film does not have anything to offer than a lame story of feudal lords exploiting the poor. The execution is also so pathetic that it does not go above the mediocre level. This was the point I was waiting anxiously for the climax, for all the hype surrounding the finale and Rishab's performance.The climax was even disastrous, not sure what kind of performance was that from Rishab, it was just average and at times the loud scream was irritating, I did not feel any divinity in this movie at all, it was far far away to bring peace within me, I was irritated and broken to see a failed movie being celebrated like a cult classic.Nowadays, the greatest fear is checking social media reviews for sincere opinions. It was an equal embarrassment to face my family as I did promise them amusing folklore, and it turned out to be a nightmare!Kindly stay away, and watch it on OTT, if you have leisure time!

reviews.review_title: Climax suddenly became unintentional comedy Don't believe the hype
reviews.content: This movie is a routine ramsey brothers style 70s story with a rock bgm mix and some good real locations plot is so over the top lol and the acting is laughable no real character depth and the central conflict of the film is outdated the whole Devine intervention thing is comical this movie deserves more thn my rating but i am giving it one just to make a point about how routine and overrated this movie is with a plot that we ve seen a thousand times only positives are music and cinematography that's it story acting characters etc are below par coming to it's so called clult climax i people started laughing suddenly.

reviews.review_title: Great making, still wants to have more...
reviews.content:
RATED 7/10
Language: Kannada
Media Partner: Prime Video
Source: NilThe movie is raw and authentic, that makes this movie more unique in presentation. The camera work is awesome.The cast and acting is too good. Rakshit used the ambience and the festival perfectly to make this venture to navigate in different genres like adventure, horror and crimeBelow negative observations, might be because of over hypes:
The forest fight scenes reminds me of pushpa.And the festival reminds me of "shuzhal"...I was expecting more on how this festival interwoven with the presentation, but it was just used as another propertyThe climax looks more cinematic compared to the previous blocks, bit disappointed with cliche climax fight.Great making, still wants to have more...

reviews.review_title: Poorest form of Dubbing & High Pitch Sound
reviews.content: The story and acting is top notch. Ppl from South India will love the movie as they can easily get connected to culture of Tribal people and Demigods. For others it will be bit difficult to digest the movie. Sometimes it gets to a level which renders movie unwatchable further. The main reason majority of Bollywoodians will not like the movie is poorest form of dubbing and extremely loud noise throught the movie. It becomes unbearable after half an hour. If dubbing improves and noise decibals reduces then movie can become somewhat enjoyable.If you need a different kind of movie experience and can tolerate extremely high pitch sound for almost 3 hours and if you can ignore most garbage dubbing till date, then go for it.

reviews.review_title: Goosebumps and tears: You don't watch it, you experience it!
reviews.content: I have watched this movie 2 times and every time I watched it, I had goosebumps throughout the last 20 minutes. I found tears in my eyes many times which was accompanied by shivers down the spine. That's how great the last 20 minutes were!I was spellbound and rooted to my seat for about a minute after the movie got over!!The BGM is super good! I've kept on binging it for the last couple of weeks now ..Rishab Shetty's acting and storytelling is just fantastic! There is not a single dull scene in this movie. Every scene has something going on. There is action, romance, comedy, thrill, horror and finally a divine experience in this film!

reviews.review_title: Technically brilliant but zero entertainment value
reviews.content: Went to watch Kantara with a lot of hope after all the hype, especially about the last 20 min, but was disappointed to find a movie with an inconsistent plot and unnecessary violence, which seems to be the trend nowadays with movies like KGF, Pushpa, etc. While the movie is technically brilliant and brings out the local customs and traditions with genuine flavour, we kept waiting for the climax since there seemed to be nothing concrete in the movie itself. And when the climax came, we wondered what the fuss was all about. Everything was so predictable and nothing was new. But I guess general quality of Kannada films is such that this movie is probably head and shoulders above the rest. Can't think of any other reason for this to be highest rated Indian movie on IMDB!

Amazing!!!!!!!I have never been to a movie thrice in just one week.Visually delightful.Splendid storytelling.I went to the cinemas to watch but had a houseful board so couldn't watch it. That same night i got a message from a fellow movie buff about this again. I saw it as a sign and went on the day of Diwali. And what a surreal experience.The movie talks about a wide array of topics like the land to its ancestry, the concept of paap, friendship, conflict of two thought points and the whole idea of rituals in a contemporary society in a very fresh and micro regional perspective.Just amazing i would say.

This movie is really epic cinematic adventure for 2 & half hours... Kantara is funny at many instants which is unexpected... Thrilling at many levels... Engaging throughout start to end... Surprising at climax and by character arcs! This is truely masterpiece at many linear and non linear aspects.. Storywise kantara is really simple but at same time it present newness by adding various elements and made that routine plot a masterclass! Kantara background score is amazing at note.. It's pitch and placement is super.. Cinematography, Costume Design, Colour Correction and Makeup is upto the mark... Definitely treat in theatres and I'll give oscar to Rishab Shetty for last 20 min 🔥

reviews.review_title: A flawless movie, each and every shot is worth watching, comedy at its peak
reviews.content: This movie and story line can't be reproduced.....you don't need a copyright for this. I have seen many only speak about the climax......but, the entire movie is beautifully crafted which has equally balanced all the stuff.I am proud to have South Canara's culture as a part of Karnataka, in turn a pride of IndiaYOU WILL NOT BE BORED, EVERY SHOT IS AT ITS PERFECTION.....i didn't know Rishab Shetty has an another shade....the fights are natural......THE JOKES ARE THE HIGHLIGHT OF THIS MOVIE.When there is a horror scene, it will be immediately accompanied with comedy to cool you down.... Every character has justified their role.When Kantara is displayed at the end of the movie, you will surely say WOW.... So, watch it in theatres for such an immersive experience.Hombale became a brand.....

reviews.review_title: A Big Screen Must Watch movie.
reviews.content: Spectacular.Visually delightful.Splendid storytelling.The movie talks about a wide array of topics like the land to its ancestry, the concept of paap, friendship, conflict of two thought points and the whole idea of rituals in a contemporary society in a very fresh and micro regional perspective.The writer / director and lead actor Rishab Shetty shines in this marvellous movie. The female lead Sapthami Gowda looks picture perfect as the woman torn between life and duty. Kishore Kumar G. As the Forest Officer Murali is top notch.The shining work by cinematographer Arvind Kashyap is visible in each frame by means of carefully blending the story with his framing of visual poetry.The background score is gritty, the music encapsulates local sounds and folklore perfectly and this movie makes you wonder how much we have to learn from our own music before going to look for melody in the west.The fight sequences, the dance of "daiva" and the makeup as well as costumes department have done magic.Locations are all real and the art department has done a beautiful job in capturing the essence of the story with utmost honesty. I can see Kantara as one prime example of how to tell a story effectively.

reviews.review_title: Too much of overdramatic scenes.. only the ending song is good.
reviews.content: This movie has a very typical story and the same plot of landowners vs locals dispute with some extremely overwhelming behaviour by the protoganist whi is also kind of someone who treats and sexualizes women as objects. Every scene is exaggerated.The charismatic part of the movie is the dakshina Kannada/south karnataka ritual which is beautiful. The song in the end with the dange art form is merismerising. There are however allegations that this song is copied from a song made 5 years ago called navarasam. I have watched the start of it and it does have an uncanny resemblance. The theme of the bands song itself seems like the movie plot. If this is true then the production house should apologize and give credit to the creators. But even with the song, I think the movie is extremely overhyped. It's nothing great but a typical story with a glorious song. 10/10 for the song in the ending.. 5/10 for the rest of the movie.points for copying and not giving credit to small independent artists.

I don't understand why people are creating so much hype about this below average movie , This movie had all the qualities of a bad movie . Bad storytelling, No character development, No emotions , No thrill ,No comedy, bad dialogues . Whats the point of watching a movie if it's not entertaining or conveying any message properly? May be the kannada people can connect with it but the movie is so not upto the mark to connect to the other audience. Bollywood has made so much better thrillers like Andhadhun And Monica oh my darling i am not going to suggest this to someone instead of those . Wake up people don't create hype for something non deserving like kantara. And no one in the critics is talking about how cheesy its lovestory was atleast tell the truth which can be clearly seen in the movie , everyone is stuck on the climax and that too is below average. People are just respecting what kannad cinema has made in such a low budget and their dedication but that is not going to make the movie super and Oscar deserving.

What a movie, what a spectacle #KANTARA is... An absolute cinematic brilliance.A movie made on budget of mere 12cr has earned more than 150cr on B. O. has every element what you need for in a great movie.#Kantara is based on #BhootaKola festival done in #Karnataka and how was its origin and how it impacts the main lead Shiva played by Rishab.Written & Directed by the main man himself, #RishabShetty is a genius in himself. Post the brilliant #GGVV which also starred #RajShetty the expectations were very high from the Shetty brothers and they delivered & how.The last 30mins of the movie are just sheer cinematic brilliance. Rishab has performed out of his skin and excelled in every aspect in this movie.A movie which should be seen in big screens and surely should not be missed...!!

What a waste of time. But it has to be a good rated movie as it is a movie from the South right?The beginning is really great with a great plot but the story line is dumb. The acting skill of the main character playing shiva is really great. He made the 5 minutes of ending is really appreciable.My expectations were really really high. But I literally wasted more than 2 hours.I was eagerly waiting for the man in the mask to appear the whole time and to create the suspense and all the unexpected turns, but no. They have wasted more time to show the villagers and their lifestyle.A great opportunity ruined.

reviews.review_title: A Spiritually & Visually Splendid Demigod Tale Owned By Rishabh Shetty's Spine-Chilling Presentation.
reviews.content:
Kantara (2022) :
Movie Review -Rishabh Shetty's Kantara is making a lot of waves outside the Kannada border, and rightly so. Kannada cinema gave a loud and faulty mass entertainer like the KGF franchise and reached every corner of the nation, and to some extent, of the world. But how many moviegoers in India know that Sandalwood has made much better films? Let's keep others aside for a moment and take Rishabh Shetty's films, for instance. From "Lucia" (2013) to "Ulidavaru Kandanthe" (2014), "Kirik Party" (2016), "Sarkari Hi Pra Shaale" (2018), and "Garuda Gamana Vrishabha Vahana" (2021). He has done so many quality films as an actor and director, but all we care about is KGF (outside Kannada market). That's unfortunate, but thankfully we have some sensible critics and movie buffs who make these unknown films famous. The quality of these films is way ahead of KGF, but the hype isn't. Well, this is the same case everywhere, be it any cinema industry across the globe. Let's just hope that this picture will change in our digital era so that filmmakers will be encouraged to make some really solid films. Kantara happens to be one of those films, and coincidentally, it came in the same year as "RRR". Now what's the connection between these two films? I'll tell you soon.Garuda Gamana Vrishabha Vahana was set in a crime world but used the local traditions and spiritual beliefs to present the same old crime-noir-tale in a new way. In the same way, Kantara attempts to be a socially important film by trying to be spiritually extra powerful. The film captures spiritual and superstitious essences in the simplest possible way, while the visually astonishing climax covers most of its flaws. We have had some recent films talking about the importance of animals and forests, but believe me, none of them had a spellbinding climax like Kantara. Had it not been for the spiritual phenomena in the climax scene, Kantara might have ended up way behind the line. One can even say that it is another version of RRR trying to be religiously powerful with a larger-than-life superfictional extravaganza.Kantara is set in a South Kannada village where demigods are believed to be the guardians and their energies encircle. The land has been protected by the demigods for years, but now modern civilization is there to hunt for development. Shiva (Rishab Shetty) belongs to the family of demigods, who performs Bhootha Kola in the village. His father did it until his death, and now his brother is carrying on the family tradition. Unable to get over his father's death, Shiva sees horrible visions regularly. A new forest officer, Murali (Kishore), takes charge of the village and starts a crossing battle with Shiva for protesting against redevelopment. Shiva gets support from the landlord (Achyuth Kumar), who is everyone's favourite. The entire narrative revolves around the land and what surprises it has for you can't be revealed here.Even though it's a predictable story, Kantara still manages to hold your attention with its rural set-up. The screenplay is messy from the start but thankfully reaches the destination on a strong note. While doing so, it fails to explain many things, including the intellectual social speeches at the end. Like I said, RRR and this film have some similarities, and the concrete writing is definitely one of them. RRR missed logical statistics, and Kantara is no different. In that film, you saw Ram Charan transforming into Lord Ram in the clikax, while here you see Rishabh converting into a demigod. How? Please don't ask.It's not just about this spiritual sequence, but even many normal scenes lack logic. Rishab's fight scene with the FO was so childish. I mean, the guy literally beat 15-20 people and yet the officer didn't shoot. And when he did, he just left him helpless. Shiva too seemed helpless there, and did nothing. What logic was there? Even in the climax, you have our villain sitting on the chair, shooting men off while the entire village group is standing up against the gang of goons, just like we had the Avengers vs. Thanos army in "Avengers Endgame". Don't ask me if the villain kills the hero. I mean, that's just too outdated.Now coming to the most amazing part of the film: the acting. Rishabh Shetty as Shiva will go down in memory lane as one of the greatest performances by any Kannada actor of his generation, and all thanks to the astonishing act in the last 10 minutes. He is just mind-blowing there. Kishore gave me a feel of The Rock (Dwayne Johnson) sometimes, but that only helped to improve my viewing experience. Sapthami Gowda's character looks so real and organic. Why don't we have such realistic heroines in every film? The romance was a little too much, unnecessarily, but loved chemistry with Rishabh in some scenes. The supporting cast is highly commendable, including Achyuth Kumar, Pramod Shetty, Manasi Sudhir, Shamol Guru, Prakash Thuminad and Swaraj Shetty.Kantara is quite a long film, and that's why it gets a little boring somewhere in the middle. The screenplay runs without any motive, and hence it hurts the repeat value of the film. If you ever feel like watching this film a second time, I am sure you will not watch the entire 150-minute film. You will just see the last 10 minutes and forget the rest of the 145 minutes. How good is that climax, though. Goosebumps! The music should have been better, especially with romantic songs. Oh gosh, how much I missed that "Sojugada Sooju Malinge" here.. Nevertheless, the background score satisfied my hunger.The cinematography is fantastic, but the editing could have been more crisp. Rishab Shetty has made a film that no Kannada villager will ever forget. The cultural and traditional values are kept too high by the director. "Rangi Taranga" had done it previously, but Kantara is a level up because of the importance of the issue it handles. Rarely do we see classes and masses both shouting in the cinema halls, and Kantara's conclusive part made that rare thing possible. Overall, a worthy flick with some amazing sequences for a modern Kannada cinema that sets the bar for other industries. Indeed, recommended.

Seriously, this is a very average film but was hyped as Oscar worthy film. Bottom-line is don't trust the reviews.

If you watch this movie without much expectation and keeping away the hype that it created, then you will enjoy it for sure. Cinematic beauty of coastal Karnataka, local rituals of Tulu tribe (Bhoota Kola), the build-up of story is pretty good.But few areas disappointed me. As a audience, I was eagerly waiting to see more of Daiva/ Varaha-roopam/ Guliga Deva, but those were shown in hurry and did not satisfy me fully.The climax was the only good thing that the movie offers. Rishabh Shetty's acting skills in that climax has really impressed me.Overall it was a good one-time watch movie......

I feel disgusted that we mumbaikar wasted our time and energy on watching Bollywood.This is a rare gem. The direction and acting of the protagonist leaves you numb. How could someone pull off such an acting and direction.So much of hardwork and detailing on every scene.Every shot was raw and authentic.Im watching this movie on the fourth week and I couldn't believe my eyes the theatre was full on a Tuesday night. The crowd was filled with every age group and we all enjoyed and clapped for this movie.The climax was epic, it will bring tears to your eyes and goosebumps. Pls go watch it and support.

reviews.review_title: This is such mind blowing movie
reviews.content:
What a movie...What a movie...What a movie...
Background music, direction, acting, costume, makeup and casting all are right upto mark.All actors have performed exceptionally well specially the main star cast.Climax is breathtaking.This movie may become favorite of national award functions and may be for some other Pan masala award functions.Every scene is nicely executed and specially climax won't let you leave the theater.Those whose brains are not developed enough to think beyond Karan Johar may not like this movie.Other than everything, the movie puts Indian values and philosophy at higher ground.

I am still in awe thinking of the movie. I have never given a 10 to a movie. I was going to give a 9 but couldn't convince myself for giving 1 less of perfection. I almost feel I came out of the movie enlightened. Every technical aspect of the movie is wonderful. Acting, Action, cinematography, direction, music...Movie is not just a representation of Dakshina Karnataka region but every Indian can relate to this.Every artist should watch this Indian Cinema.I will be thinking about this movie for several days. A must watch in the theaters.I will be watching every movie Rishab has acted/directed after seeing this one.Very inspiring, spiritual, soulful piece of art.

This movie is a classic. It proved how the culture of the land needs to be appreciated and encouraged. The Writer, Actor and Director Rishab Shetty is one rare personality who knows how to showcase the movie and hold audience at the edge of the seat. Every scene has a purpose and every character has a meaning. There are no fillers anywhere. The pre climax and climax are the show stealers. The way the movie is picturized shows the deep knowledge and vision the makers had for the movie. No wonder it is attracting the audience all over India. I just hope many such moves will come in future which shows the nativity of the land.

reviews.review_title: Overhyped Movie,Only the Climax was Worth Watching
reviews.content: I think People who are calling this movie a Masterpiece does not really knows what actually is a Masterpiece movie. Movies like "The Shawshank Redemption,3 Idiots, Jersey(2019),96,Premam,KGF Part 1" deserves to be called as a Masterpiece. But People now a days started calling every single movie a Masterpiece. This movie is like something you have already seen except the last 10 minutes. Last few minutes were the only true deserving moments where this movie is creating so much buzz around. The acting is top notch. But the story was normal. I have already seen many movies with this type of story. Many people are trying to emphasize on the fact that this movie has shown the beauty of the respected culture. It was shown indeed but not much enough. So overall I want to say that this movie was overhyped by the people who blindly supports South Indian movies and think that if a particular movie is from South,then it has to be good. Even I am a South Indian,but I didn't liked movies like Pushpa,KGF 2. They don't even deserve the ratings of 8/10.

A great movie from rishav shetty also his acting was faboulous. No word is enough to describe this movie.What is called a movie! Its not a movie its a story that connect you from the beginning of the end. It is the movie where we feel us kike a tribal and connect with god rituals..this movie start a new genre in not only India I think also in world. reviews.review_title: Story + Direction + BGM + Last scene = Masterpiece
reviews.content: I am from Gujarat and watched it in hindi. I don't watch movies frequently but when I heard about this movie and it's hype, I couldn't control myself and gave it try. As I mentioned about main 3 points which I liked the most, story is lengthy but you won't get bored because directors has justified it's time by giving the perfect direction. Then the music & BGM gives the perfect touch to this movie, director and his team has worked very well on the BGM and sound.I have no words for the acting, Oh my god🙏 the last scene gave me the goosebumps. I am still in the Kantara world, those faces are in front of my eyes.Last scene has gave the perfect justification and grabbed the movie's level on the top.Must watch this movie if you like to try something new and the culture of kannada people, and yes there's God.

As the film begins, it gets so engaging from its first minute.A village that is struggling for its land and internal conflicts within each other is the basic premise of the story..
Actor Rishabh Shetty who is also the writer and director of the film showcased the exact flavors of the roots, religion, and beliefs of the Indian culture. He knows what he is making and what he wants to tell to the people through this movie. And his sincerity toward his work has been reflected in every single frame of this film..
Technical aspects of the film are the cherry on the cake.Background score. Cinematography, (especially the color pallet of this film), direction, and screenplay are on point..
Effortless acting by every single actor deserves a shoutout. You are seeing the village tribe in the movie. Not an actor playing a role. Hats off to everyone..
One of the best parts of this film is everything is so Raw. Makers know what they are showing. The rowdy language, the relationships, the characters, and their beliefs, are the essence of village life. Everything is well portrayed and that's why the audience easily gets connected to the story..
The last 20 minutes...
The last 20 minutes are pure magic of Cinema.You can cry, you can shout, you can scream, you can be at the edge of your seat, you can stay silent with wide eyes. No one guarantees what will happen to you.Just get ready to enjoy the finest experience of the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Movie made with pure soul and Determination
reviews.content:
You will never see movie like this in your lifetime, it just a chance when we see this kind of movie in Bharat,
In this time when our youth is completely underwear of our ancient Gods and religious, this movie just combine them all with our youth power tribal system and our forest system together to tell the truth in our life. Hats off to the director, actor and writer which is Rishabh Shetty, this movie has a very nice cinematography very nice dialogues even in dubbing and you can also see the emotional touch every time every second when you watch this movie I feel completely attached to this movie and I will remember this movie throughout my life I will suggest that you must watch this movie once in your life.Lots of love.

reviews.review_title: A mixed bag with fantastic end.
reviews.content: Is movie unique? Answwer would be definitely yes. The acting and cinematography is great.However, the whole essense of the movie is in its last fifteen minutes. And rest of the movie just feels more like a drag or a filler. The movie just keeps building on the theme. And at some point I even started getting bored as the main story was just not taking off. It just felt like they kept showing the village life. Amd it felt like social dram than a thriller.The movie could have been condensed and thus it would have given it much faster pace. The female actresses character could have been developed further.

That kind of Movies doesn't needs any promotion and marketing. The content, acting, action, music, and cinematography itself is promotion.I have nothing to say about that movie but without writing the IMDb wouldn't allow me to submit so I must say that that kind of movie makes once in a decade and that movie is Kantara.Awesome content, great cinematography, strong action, solid acting and most important is Background music/ Voice of devaa Marvelous.So I had to gave 100 points to this movie but IMDb has only 10 rating. It's overhyped a lot. The amount of hype this movie has received is beyond my imagination. I didn't like the story at all. What could have been wrapped up in a 45 minutes documentary has been stretched too much. Just to show the last scene where the dev appears, the movie has more than 2 hours of the script. This is like a Bollywood movie showing irrelevant things just for the length of the movie. I always like movies from the south industry but this disappointed me very very much. The whole movie has nothing other than the 'Wo Wo wo' thing. The movie is 45 minutes dialogue, and the rest 'wo' screams. I don't recommend this at all. Below average.

We saw Avatar, Inception, Tenet, etc but this is beyond cinema.What a great peace of Art. We are destroying our Nature and in turn Nature started asking it back by way of Covid or whatever u remember. We are encroaching every natural resources to satisfy our need. This movie is last warning to all of us who have forgotten our culture. We all were once Villagers but now became Urban and killing everything.We all must be ashamed of what we did and what we are doing. Need not to send Rockets to Mars or Moon. Need to find our soul here only. Kantara is not only a movie but indeed a God's msg...

reviews.review_title: No words to describe this masterpiece
reviews.content: When i first saw the reaction of rakshit shetty. I decided to watch this movie if it releases in telugu. When it did i wwnt and watched it. OMG. After Rangasthalam this was the movie i got complete satisfaction and my eyes filled with some kind of positive tears i would say.Not sure wen will i get to see this kind of movie again. Thanks to the makers and especially rishabh shetty. He hits a home run with this film.He showed the culture with such details that ppl from other parts of the country can also easily invested and travel with those characters.Last 20 minutes are nxt level.🔥🔥I request everyone to go watch it in big screens.Its an experience nobody should miss.

reviews.review_title: The Masterpiece you should never miss
reviews.content: The movie's story is simple but it's the acting which makes you fall in love with this masterpiece. The way each character of the movie has played the role is fantastic. Frame by frame you keep thinking about the culture showcased in the movie and the end of the film you feel the desire to just watch the culture showcased live once in the lifetime.The last 15 minutes of the film 😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍, you just can't get your eyes of the screen. It's just mind-blowing that the hero who kept running from the family culture the entire life just turns into the beast everyone wants and showcases the true nature and beauty of the Demigod around which the entire film revolves.

reviews.review_title: Expected too much form this movie. Extremely disappointed
reviews.content: This movie has a exquisite theme, but the overall acting, character behaviour script etc is typical 90s south Indian style. Incidents occuring are extremely exaggerated. The culture and traditions, rituals depicted are top class and depicted nicely but that's not what the movie is entirely about. I have heard the theater experience is excellent for the last song in the movie and probably that's where all the love and hype comes from. But movie as a whole is nothing substantial and pretty basic. Acting at the end is beautiful but otherwise I'd say it a bit over the fence. Nothing extraordinary and we need to set good benchmarks.

It's a complete package of something never seen before. This movie excels in every department. Name
acting :10+/10 .Direction : 10+/10
BGM : 10+/10
Music :9/10
Cinematography : 10+/10
Script : 10/10Nothing compromised at all. I have seen this kind of a movie after a long time.The last 15 min is extremely powerful and unimaginably outstanding.Respect for every one who was associated with this project. I am a North Indian and I did not know about this tradition but ohh my my this movie made me bow down to the God shown here...Magical ride. This movie will win a national award. Extremely extraordinary.

Everyone had mentioned how good the movie is and the acting, I'm here to say the whole making of this movie is top notch from music to cinematography. Divine theatrical experience which should not be missed, thanks Rishab and team hombale to gifting us this gem in KFI.Talking about the movie itself, not a minute i felt i was out of the story at all, i was so involved in the world of kanthara, those last 20 mins is among the best 20 mins of my life. I did go again to watch this in theatres just for that last 20 mins. Rishabh has excelled in all three departments of his, pure dedication can be seen in each scene. This kind of commitment from the cast and production team is what we need to take Indian cinemas globally. We should give this movie a try at Oscars.

Excellent cinematography attached with a great story and natural acting. In no moment you would feel that these are actors or we are watching a cinematic performances. All raw and still cinema. Great background music, well balanced scenes. Director has stuck to the story and main theme.Rishabh Shetty, Kishor Kumar G are the star performers in the acting area. Background score is loud at times but required. Use of various instruments and natural sounds keep you emotionally attached to the scene. Cherry on the top is the message that film delivers. Nature at the center, with tribal backdrop and excellent excellent cinematic expression which again i would say is raw, extraordinary and legendary!

reviews.review_title: Interesting premise but extremely wasted potential, dull and boring.
reviews.content: Kantara is a period action movie focused on the conflict within a forest village between a hot headed hunter and Kambala champion Shiva and forest ranger Murali. The movie glorifies animal cruelty as Shiva takes passion from exploiting bulls and happiness from killing animals. The landlord Devendra is his close friend and supporter, and Shiva constantly becomes a thorn on Murali's side. When Murali calls out Shiva's violent practices that endanger the forest wildlife or consume it's resources he and the villagers get into fights, not only with him but Shiva's temper causes him to fight other villagers. He also starts overhunting for fun and cutting down trees just to piss Murali off, which eventually leads to him getting arrested when he nearly kills Murali. All in all this is the majority of the movie, the potential here is that Shiva could have been humbled and reformed from his violent actions, specifically if the village demigod Panjurli taught him. Murali also could have been less violent and explained his cause for safeguarding the forest. The movie is dragged out with this until it's revealed in a twist that Devendra was trying to acquire the land for himself out of greed, and Murali and Shiva quickly have a rushed reform despite the lack of reason too, as they had hurt each other not too long ago. When Devendra gathers men to try to destroy the village Shiva, Murali, and their armies clash with his, and Shiva gets possessed by Panjurli to defeat Devendra. The premise is good but the plot and execution is extremely bland, there was room for character development for interesting characters but nothing as such happened. Shiva was a firm believer in Panjurli, he could have started out as flawed and violent but learned an emotional lesson. Murali became friends with the villagers too quickly and was more victimized by Shiva, but he's still a villain. Shiva's girlfriend Leela could have been conflicted trying to settle the war. Devendra worked and the final battle between him and the villagers/rangers was good, but that was it. The rest of the movie was quite boring and I could have easily improved the plot. I'm confused at why this has acclaim and I believe this of all movies does not remotely deserve it. This is not worth watching, but if you really want to, go for it.

reviews.review_title: Overrated movie. Could have been way better
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong... Kantara is an extreme well executed movie with an amazing bgm and a few extremely engaging scenes. You simply cannot forget the scenes with the demigod as they have intense visuals that are very frightening.With a 10-15 crore budget, this movie surpassed all expectations. But to say that it is 'the best movie in cinema' and that it is miles beyond films like RRR and Baahubali is incorrect. Some people even claim that Kantara deserves an Oscar. This is what I have a problem with, considering its numerous flaws:1) Underuse of the demigod:Scenes with the demigod are captivating and kept me hooked to the movie. Especially the amazing start that featured the demigod and the villagers. But after that, the movie becomes, at best, average. Focusing more on the character and the unnecessary romance was a BIG mistake. Instead, if the film provided a backstory to the demigods and included a couple of more scenes featuring the demigod, the story would have been much more engaging.2) Overacting and unnecessary fight scenes:Scenes involving Shiva's mother reminded me of Balamani played by Ramya Krishnan in Liger. The overacting and irritating dialogues simply gave me a headache.Also, there were several fight scenes that seemed unnecessary. By removing them and focusing more on the demigod, they could have significantly upped the storyline.3) The climaxAlthough the climax was extremely well executed, it was quite predictable. With the hype Kanatara has received in the past few days, I expected something unimaginable and out of the world. But the output was very predictable and straight forward.Also, the fight between the villagers and goons could have been reduced and the display of a possessed Shiva could have been stretched. Also, the demigod should have been presented more frequently in the climax.Overall, I give this movie 7/10, considering its low budget. It was slightly better than average and could have been made grand by using the demigod more frequently.

reviews.review_title: Perfect mix of Mangalore(dakshina kannada) folklore and action entertainment..
reviews.content:
The story starts with a king who has all the riches but couldn't find peace/sleep and happiness.. The whole movie is about how he finds he's peace with tribal people and their demigod and how the generation of king family is effected by this demigod..
When you ask the question, who answers? Is it the Demigod or the person who carrying the demigod for he's own personal interest...
The lead character shiva played by rishab shetty is not a non believer but a believer who hasn't embraced it because he never felt the need of it...
The folklore embraces the varaha avatar of Vishnu and it's visualized beautifully on screen through many arts and references throughout without glorifying it..
The best thing about this is, how the movie depicts the folklore, forest conflict and politics without overdoing any one of it.. It's a tight script with great screenplay, action and cinematography...
The last 16 to 20mins shows how good rishab shetty can be and it's his career best performance... While the rest of the characters have done justice to their role it's rishabh shetty who carries this to the end...

This movie represents one of the lesser known "Diety - Daiva - Force of nature" worshiping side of the people coastal Karnataka. The story is gripping and fast paced which keeps the audience engaged throughout the movie. The cinematography is spot on which helps people to notice the various aspects of the culture and soak in the vibrance in the nature, dressing and know how's of the region. People who are not from the region or are unaware of the culture would find it a bit hard to follow some parts of the movie. Subtitles are very well done and does deliver the message as intended in Kannada and Tulu. The songs and tunes remain with you after you leave the movie hall as well. Long time since one saw a movie that was so well done and put together.

Visual Spectacle is probably used for movies like Bahubali and RRR which relies on excellent quality of cinematography and vfx combined and this movie did that with such an untouched yet very daring subject. One need guts to write, act and direct such a masterpiece which is related to tulunadu culture and folklore. Specially the last 10 minutes blew my mind. The fights and its sequences are raw, nothing extraordinary done yet shot beautifully. All supporting characters did their respective roles with utmost sincerity. Sandalwood is doing excellent work with their recent work. I would want to watch it for the 2nd time. Take a bow Rishabh Shetty.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I enjoyed after a long time

First movie to bring out native traditions that are unknown to many of us after a very long civilization gap of barbarian invasions. Amazing performance by all. Storyline is simple and extremely powerful in its message. Amazing representation of the Indian South-western coastal traditions and customs. Bhoota Kola - Mindblowing. Deva Panjurli & Guliga significance & representation is beyond words. Kambala race was awesome - took the crew one full month to achieve these scenes. The Daiva
The jam packed theatre was in total awe for the last 30 odd minutes with folded hands at the turn of events & the performance.I can't think of a single department of this that hasn't performed awesome.Looking forward to seeing it again in Tulu after seeing it for the first time in Kannada.

The film by itself isn't extraordinary, its rushed up, its formulaic and cliched as well. But one feels the passion and honest effort the filmmaker and team have put in. Sometimes that is enough for receiving appreciation. One feels for the story, the community depicted because it is a common story across the world of human greed and environmental devastation versus traditional sustainability of indigenous people. This film certainly could have made a more poignant and deeper impact if it would have stayed on course, if it would have allowed its scenes to breathe a bit more. This film didn't have to be paced like KGF but it is. And it is in this pacing of the film that it loses subtlety and depth. It is this attempt to be everything at once that derails the film's possibility of being better than what it is. The film really stands out for the spirited performances of the cast, they elevate it to a whole new level and thats what keeps us spellbound. Some great drama here. Could have done with a bit more cinema.

Visually the scenes are good. Without any sensible display the police keeps changing its action- at one moment seems villain and suddenly changes tack and becomes supportive of villagers. The pace is good and things keep happening but in the end overall nothing special and left me hugely disappointed.

Never felt excited to know what's going to happen next. It's a masala movie May be will be better enjoyed in a community drama setting! If the movie has a king and is not based on history or an epic then it's hard to digest at this time and age!Some people may argue about special effect, cinematography, blah, blah! My answer to that is you bought all the expensive meat and vegetables, put a lot of food color but you don't know how to cook . You even forgot to put salt!Please stop overhyping movies like this, KGF, Pushpa..,

reviews.review_title: Great concept Ruined by overused storyline
reviews.content: Watched it only on OTT and this movie is better suited for a Theatrical experience as the Visuals were stunning. First half was well set with all the folklore elements and the entire movie stayed true it's cultural theme and didn't deviate too much.... the second half was... well... VERY PREDICTABLE.That Landlord I knew was definitely a bad person from the start from his mannerism etc. What was even more cringe for me was that police part. Like why even show his initial character thing when you are going to show him like some sort of a messiah at the end? Facepalm moment that was.Otherwise I liked the camerawork, that Singara Siriye song I surprisingly liked, and some scenes were nice like the jump-scare moments, the talk between hero and the villain after he knows he only killed his cousin.

reviews.review_title: The great reviews are all lies by the movie team
reviews.content: First of, the last 20 minutes script is repeated by all the liars as they want you to watch the movie till the end because they know you may just stop watching boring content by then... when you see reviews that talk about last 20 min, it's all lies (the movie plot takes a minor twist, but it's not earth shattering)... Overall, this movie is pure garbage... Typical South Indian movie where the hero can fight 25 people alone... This is just recast into a ridiculous plot to showcase the same lame script that has been used in thousands (if not millions of movies)... The movie team is VERY smart in paying people to write good initial reviews (false marketing) with great ratings to dupe new viewers into watching it. Save your time and don't watch the movie. If you have wasted your precious time behind this garbage, I encourage you to create an account and review the movie so it deserves a true rating (not a false marketed rating)

Today I went for VR cinema theatre to watch Kantara and I must say that this is a gamechanger and masterpiece movie like K. G. F series. It has blended various genres like action, horror, fantasy, thriller and other commercial masala elements to engage the audience and it can be call it as a new-gen masala film by introducing popular folklore culture in Udupi/Mangalore, which we haven't witness in other films.Rishab Shetty is the powerhouse of this entertainer with his mannerism, comic timing and body language (in the climax last 30 minutes) is superb and also excels as a master storyteller who tells a predictable and simple plot in an engaging way and the showcase of Bhoota Kola culture deserves a standing ovation. Sapthami Gowda is also good but her character isn't etched well. Kishore is also superb and deserves applause for his acting and their rovalry in the film reminds of Karnan and recent Malayalam blockbusters like Ayyappanum Koshiyum and Kaduva. Achyuth Kumar is also brilliant in the film and watch out for his character twist in the climax. Pramod Shetty, Prakash Thuminad and other actors comic timing is superb and evoked funny bones.Action sequences are the USP of this film and is well choreographed by Vikram More (who also worked in K. G. F Chapter 1), the 30 minutes war scene, the Kambala race fight and interval were goosebumps worthy and makes the audience to watch it again. Cinematography by Arvind S. Kashyap is superb as they showcased Bhoota Kola culture in a good way. Editing by K. M. Prakash and Pratheek Shetty were also superb. Musical score and soundtrack by B. Ajaneesh Lokanath was good, though one song "Singara Siriye" was good, others were below-average, but the musical score (bgm) was praiseworthy. Direction was awesome in the film as Rishab Shetty perfected a cultural film with commercial elements to enthrall Karnataka and foreign audiences.Overall, Kantara is an engaging action thriller with masala elements, comic-dialogues, simple plot, entertainment value, action sequences and good performances makes it so enjoyable and feel that it is not a routine film at all. The film is worthy-watch in Cinemas instead of OTT. So go grab a ticket and buy a popcorn and watch this action-packed entertainer, you will be happy. Don't regret yourself as you didn't watch it in theatres and watch it in IMAX. After watching the film, i felt that this was very engaging like K. G. F.

In the current times where the audiences are straight away rejecting the movie based on quality. Here comes a movie, which is strongly based on a story and the on art of showing the story on screen.From the very 1st day, I heard it from many folks how good it was. This started building a huge expectation for me on the movie. And when i opened the bookmyshow to check the bookings, it was never in green. And finally we, a group of 11 got the booking on our day and time of convince.The movie started off with a back-drop story and this background is very important for the entire events of the movie. And the movie kept us on the tip of our seats throughout. The story seemed to be simple and a comedy, but all of a sudden, something strange would happen. This made us keep our focus and relax at the same time. Every character is trying to bring something onto the table. And all of a sudden there was a murder for no reason, this perplexed us. And the story takes a turn with this.The final 20-30mins was in vibrant mode. Literally all of us were resonating by absorbing the final enact.The movie started off with a short story, then it let us audience settle down but with an occasional & random surprise. And the final part of the movie is so vibrant that it stays in our minds even after we walk out of the movie theater. After a day of watching, the climax is still in front of my eyes. In awe!!!

That's why kannada movie was running at 15 Rs while all other languages ticket cost would be at 150.Finally pathetic and boring movie.

reviews.review_title: With Kantara, Kannada film industry has just made a mark
reviews.content:
Kantara
A movie review by Rajesh PuvvadaA casual conversation lead me to a movie recommendation, and that's how I chose to go to Kantara. I tried for the tickets for this Kannada movie in Pune, and trust me I could not find a decent seat in any of the theaters. They were all almost full this morning. Finally I got a decent Gold class seat for a late night show. I chose to book the expensive ticket against the option of watching this movie in the forthcoming weekend. Don't ask the logic behind this decision. I had a gut feel and urge to watch at the earliest.The movie commences wonderfully with a flashback. Artwork, cinematography, costumes and the cast were a perfect fit. Usually art work takes a back seat at Kannada movies, may be due to budget constraints, but for this movie the thought process towards the artwork was fabulous. A narrative will guide you for sometime until the cast speak up, I felt the narrative was paced, there was a palpable urgency in it. That's not a deterrent.The movie spins around the belief system. The traditional "Bootha Kola" and the associated beliefs. The initial song is a fusion of Carnatic and softrock to a "Bootha Kola" performance. Though it sounds offbeat, the combo was fantastic.Trust me, the movie will grasp you into its fold. The amount of detail they have presented about the life and times living with the forest range, the kind of language, expressions, the day to day lifestyle was absolutely brilliant. I did not understand the dialect of Kannada the movie mostly carries, but it not bother me at all. My eyes were switching quickly between the subtitles and the scenes and I never wanted the movie to release me from its grasp.Rishabh Shetty, aces his performance as the current generations protagonist. The accent, the facial expressions and the screen presence was never falling short at the same time it was not overdone either. It was well balanced. He lives into the character and made me to live in his world. His side kicks and the cast around him played aptly.Achyuth Kumar peaks in his role delivery at the end of the movie. His portrayal is that friendly, approachable and cool headed landlord and he delivers it quite well.The choice of the heroine can never be underestimated. I am sure Sapthami Gowda is a new kid on the block, but she plays her part decently well.As usual Kishore Kumar plays his role as a rough conservationist well. In my view he is the most unsung roughies in the film industry. I have seen him deliver decent performances in Vada Chennai, Ponniyin Selvan, She (OTT TV series), Sarpatta Parambarai etc..,. You can never ignore his presence in any of the movies mentioned above. Yet no one speaks much about him after watching the movies. I would probably would like to raise a toast for this actor.The conflict between greed, god fearing traditional believers and the science based environmentalists is what the movie's plot is all about. Though the traditional beliefs are questioned flippantly, once in a while the belief system shows its existence by the acts of nature or by the mysteries in a thick forest or like a intense dream. I appreciate the smartness in handling of this mysteries in a very natural and a logical way.Greed will never win the might of the traditional believers and the environment conservators, together.Its after a very long time I had a very strange feeling while watching this movie. That is, I never wanted this movie to end. I wanted to remain in the strong grip of the movie. I have a longing to get back into its grasp this weekend.The underlying message of the movie is not to remain flippant about traditional beliefs and rituals while working along with the people who have the common purpose. I enjoyed this every bit.I am going with a 9.5 /10. I don't know when I gave such a rating before.Just ensure you Live in the grasp of this movie, over and over again. Kudos to Kanada Cinema, its a harbinger of good times to come for this industry.

The last 10 mins of the movie are okay else it is just an overhyped below average movie. The male protagonist drinks liquor, kills wild animals, smokes weed, objectifies woman and engages in deforestation and extreme violence. There is no social message of why all this is wrong and might be an encouragement for the viewers to indulge in these malpractices. Few of the scenes are absolutely cringy and the script is predictable. The writing is loose at my parts of the movie. I waited for months to watch this movie but I am very disappointed with all the hype around it. Still could not understand how this was a spiritual experience for many people.

This movie is a never seen before masterpiece!!!Rishab Shetty is a wizard who has casted this magic spell on the big screen.The way he has carried the role with such ease yet sheer commitment towards the story.You might feel this as a regular larger than life south Indian movie at the beginning but then it takes you to a wonderland.With such small budget he has managed to make this so big with astonishing cinematography is commendable.Fight scenes are awesome and creative. The way he choreographed every scene is a treat to the eyes.Must Must watch in theatre. Last 15 minutes had dropped my jaw. Just amazing. Kudos to Rishab Shetty.

This movie has shown that even regional movie , if good, can become pan India without publicity. The movie has shown one of the hidden cultural activity called as bhootha kola which most of us don't even know until we watch this wonderful movie. It's far better than the Hindi movies who just try to play with the Hindu culture. This movie has actually won the heart of every indian and every hindu for this same reason. A must watch movie.

reviews.review_title: Surreal experience. This is peak Indian Cinema!
reviews.content:
Deeply rooted in local folklore, mysticism set against a fictional backdrop of a village in southern india, this movie thread a fine line between period social issues, man's relationship with God and Nature.There is a lot of maturity with which the story and cinematography has been handled. Movie was beautifully shot in picturesque locales, stunning pan-shots and aerial shots unlike most jarring, epilepsy inducing Indian cinema. The soundtrack helps us transcend the visual experience to a surreal experience which is just as well implied by the raw dog performance rishab Shetty delivers.Rishab Shetty is the star of the show - no contest. We are lucky to be alive to witness this bombastic performance by Mr Shetty, but a word needs to be said about Prakash thuminad who always keeps us entertained his quirky, slapstick-witty dialogue. Kudos to the writes to involve all the navarasas in both writing and sound design.There is no other Indian movie like Kantara. I'm glad this movie released in 2022, just so it opens the eyes of all those pretentious western reviewers and Indian alike how mediocre of a movie RRR was and the farce they took part in.THIS IS INDIAN CINEMA!After watching the film over 8 times, in multiple languages - I strongly suggest Kannada followed by telugu as the best versions. Hindi version imo is poorly translated.Since most have finished watching Kantara, here is how I interpreted the movie with all it's parallels.1. Lead character is Shiva. Both a destructive personality and a protector all in one character. This is evident with his protective nature kicking in in the 2nd half, destructive in the first. Duality of man personified.2. Shiva in relation to Leela. In a grand sense the movie ends with the story being told to shiva's son, on the whole becoming a Shiva-leela.3. Murali - named appropriately is the forest officer. His sole job being the preserver of the forest runs parallel to his namesake Vishnu.4. Kailasa - where shiva resides.5. Mahadev - another nod to the wise lord shiva consuming ganja, but wise. He shows the way and leads the blind i.e Shiva.6. Devendra - the antagonist shares a name with Indra deva, who is most often associated with trickery, fondness for alcohol. Indra by mythology is also the reason for poison that comes from churning the ocean. The poison that lord shiva takes in, so the rest can have the amrut.7. When the celebration of kola starts in 3rd act, an interesting dialogue occurs. The nalike (patron who dons the role of a palaka) asks "O preist - O landlord, what do you think lies ahead for you?"
they reply, if it is poison we ask our kshetrapalas to take it, if it is amrut - please confer it on us.This is a chekovs gun. Nothing in this movie happens without a reason, and As per the principle, you will see both how the poison that is let upon the village taken full on by the palaka, and the call back to the sword of the king in first act.8. The demigod in first act is Panjurli. The demigod in final act is Guliga.The characters are so well written that you can see the maturity of panjurli in the first act, and the devastative guliga in the last act.Guliga is always hungry, that's the reason for his primary havoc. Only feeding him can calm him.When the final act begins, the injury on the head is symbolic of opening the third eye, which is usually followed by destruction of evil. The opening shot of guliga begins with a stopped fire torch attack, this followed by fully concious wanton movements.That begins the avahana and the initial arati. The torches are always held close to the body as the belief is such that the spirit shouldn't escape the medium into the material world.After that shot, you see guliga beat up the small fry following which begins the hunger. That's when the villagers start the naivedyam to calm him. Once calm, the usual proceedings continue.. Emding with Justice dished out.9. The final kola doesn't happen immediately after the last fight sequence, as Leela is now pregnant it must be about 7 to 8 months into the future.The final closing scene is not only the reunion of father and son, but also iconically panjurli and guliga. The disappearing Shiva in final act not only strengths the belief in the local legend, it confers legitimacy to everything that happens to the shiva during the final act and what he did to Devendra.10. Staying true to the name, the movie ends as a legend.PS : The sound "Whoa" is not a gimmick. Guliga kola involves making sounds that mimic sounds a wild boar makes. The closest reproduction of the sound a boar grunt makes is the interpreted whoaa. Kola is all gestures and sounds.This movie truly is a work of art. This will always be in my global top 10.

If you look closely, this movie is a lot of noise but no real story. 3 stars are only for the awsome way it's filmed and superb performances. But its a big zero for substance.At the end it's just another story of a hero having super human capabilities. He can single handedly fight and destroy 100s of enemies. There wasn't even a need for a demi god to support him towards the end there 🙂
A lot of build up for the presence of demi God throughput the movie but at the end its just like any other horror movie where a spirit enters a character and creates havoc. The way movie started was awesome and you were looking forward to a meaningful narrative from that point on. A big letdown and a very highly overrated movie.

We felt deeply connected and can only done by Rishabh Shetty being deeply rooted to place can pull this off. Movie with no flaws watched it so many times brilliant acting by cast , mind-blowing music and camera work .Last few minutes felt vibration throughout body seeing Rishabh acting felt divine blessings behind it ,tears rolled down eyes at end 🙏This needs to reach highest audience across India.Summary: Kantara which shows our desi games like kambala as well as it represents our culture very proudly.

This type of movie is needed to take Indian cinema to the next level unlike Bollywood dumbs. Must watch in the theaters. I wish to watch a 3d version of it again. Rishab Shetty transfers himself to 'Daiva's. Then you will know how much effort went into making this movie!The tribal life and customs of the village are depicted so well in this movie that you will be mesmerized to see it.

If somebody has to rate the move on the following skills here is my rating
1. Acting Skills - 20 out of 10. Yes. I am not exagerrating nor I am a fan of these Hero. You will not see any actors playing any role. So Natural unlike typical bollywood style no buildup, no unnecessary stunts. I am rating all 20 out 10 for all the actors involved in these movie. The Energy levels of the lead characters - I recommend all Bollywood stars to take lessons from him.2. Direction - When people said it is worth for Oscar, I was not believing. Though I have seen many oscar awarded movies, definitely this is something that can be nominated from India.3. CINEMATIC EXPERIENCE : Short of words to praise this masterpiece.WATCH IT TO FEEL THE EXPERIENCE OF NEVER IN CINEMA INDUSTRY. GOOSEBUMPS GUARANTEED.

reviews.content: One of the best movie 🍿 recently i have watched that to from KFI what a story, Screenplay and acting by all cast, loved it very much, Rishab Shetty gave one of the gem to the pan india , he came with local village story that going global so happy to see movies like this from Regional industries, last climax scene gave goosebumps , perfectly performed and that scenes stole all hearts of audiences , pure Goosebumps from that too watching indian moview.This moview has all, Drama, romance, Comedy , Serious acting which the reason PAN india Audience loving it , must watch moview for all movie freaks.
