The culture, the cinematography, the visuals, the bgm, the acting, the story, the fight sequences, the dialogues all just fire. You will definitely miss out the best film of 2022 if you do not watch it in the theatres. One of the finest movies I have ever watched. Kudos to all the actors for putting up their best for the film. And uffff, the climax. Believe me, you do not want to miss the feeling of the climax in theaters. Please book your tickets and run to your nearest theatres. Its easily the best film I've seen for years as a film lover. This film is worth your time and money. You'll even want to watch it more than once in the theatres.

What a movie. It's as if Godess Saraswati made Rishab Shetty create this magnificent story. The very fact that greed of land is the mother of all evil is very well explained. Hope all the land grabbers learn from this and this includes some large Nations who have large huge land mass and yet are after more. I always feel tribals are protectors of forests and they only take as much as they need. Hope we all learn from the movie and Rishab Sir, this movie is beyond Oscars :). I didn't feel one second of this movie pass by. And in all this complex subject you also ensured enough comic scenes and they were very smart. God bless or must I say Guliga blesses you and your team for making this movie.

The opening line should be its not just moving its an unique experience one ever had. Story is really out of the box concept. Superb direction, Execution of the concept is just next level wonder. Here comes acting part and the acting is just as amazing as the story. Casting was properly done and it was reflecting in the movie. That constant bonding was there which keeping you attached all the time. The best part of the last 15-20 Mins. I can bet that you will definitely gonna have once in a lifetime experience that you ever had.Over all its a mega blockbuster after a long long time. Worth watching such master piece.

reviews.review_title: Phenomenal acting, writing n direction by rishabh shetty
reviews.content: Actor director, writer rishabh shetty phenomenally depicts sanatan culture in the land of tulunad, karnataka... Urduwood can never make such a spiritual thriller as dawoodwood is not connected to indian roots n traditions. How each n every department of this masterpiece has sincerely strived to produce something unique yet being rooted to our sanatan culture and traditoons is a site to behold. The colour palate of the movie gives you a feeling of a spiritual thriller movie. Special mention for exquisite cinematography and such sleek action sequences. And most importantly, the last 40 minutes of the movie is something u have never seen in movies... I guarantee.

reviews.review_title: BRILLIANT...no other better word to put it.
reviews.content: Brilliant movie. Amazing direction, background score and the songs too good. Humor well portrayed. Must watch. It's not a one time watch rather planning to watch again. Congratulations to the team. It is an Indian movie where people are able to connect uniformly. Rishab towards the end was on a different level. The story line is so simple but the way it was shown was mind-blowing. Bollywood need to pull up their sock otherwise its not long they will see its doom. Bollywood had movies catering to whole India once, but it seems they are interested to entertain only certain group of people. Why is that?

Very simple story, but presentation is awesome, thrilling experience in the theatre, sound department done awesome job. Rishab shetty action is plus point to the movie. Rishab done fabulous job in both direction and action jobs. Very well written screenplay, photography department good job. Music is plus to the movie. It touches the Indian culture and and beliefs of some Indian communities. The movie done in very low budget, but the quality of movie is very high. It touches the belief on God. The story line and love track in the movie is also very good. Rishab done fabulous job as a village guy. Overall, very thrilling movie experience in theatre.

Highly overrated.. the hero/protagonist has only one response for everything, start fighting.. seems very uncivilized and arrogant
Following things are glamorized in the movie
Drinking, smoking, killing animals, cutting trees, hitting women, not respecting govt officials and orders..Movie shows that faith can be exploited by those in power for their own benefit, but in the end it kind of reinforces blind faith.Youth enjoying such movies is a serious problem as it normalizes many negative traits, especially the treatment of women.I did not connect with any character or the story line and wasted 2.5 hours. Hope I can save someone that time.

The parts where the daiva is on screen is enthralling and enjoyable to the point where we began rearching about the daiva. Very positive, the film makers could not do justice to this story and tradition.The hero is violent, abusive and objectifies women to the extent that we were cringing all the way. There was nothing hero like in the personality portrayed by the lead actor. Is this really how we want to teach our kids how women are to be treated? Those scenes were not funny at all and were reminders of how far we as a country still need to come to reduce stalking, eve teasing culture and make 50% of India feel safe.Most of it was the same old boring story. Hope someone else makes a better film on the daiva. Lost opportunity to show a good topic.

A visually sumptuous, instantly immersive spectacle mounted with extraordinary vim and vigour, writer-director-actor Rishab Shetty's Kantara, is a heady blend of history, myth, folklore, high drama and stylishly choreographed action neatly wrapped in a form firmly rooted in the cultural milieu it has sprung from. Shetty is also the writer and lead actor of the film. As screenwriter, his output is probably just a touch shy of being perfect, but the script has enough heft and vibrancy to translate into a mass entertainer that is visceral, rousing and unwaveringly riveting.Rishab Shetty is completely terrific in the role of Shiva. He portrayed the emotions to perfection throughout the film. His performance in the climax will leave you definitely shocked. The funny sequences involving Rishab Shetty and his gang evoke good laughs. The love track between Rishabh and Sapthami Gowda is handled very well. The actress looked alluring, and she did her part well. Other artists like Achyuth Kumar and Kishore Kumar got good roles with more prominence to this story and were also fine in it. The action scenes are solid and give a high.On the flip Side , After a racy and delightful first half, post-interval scenes start on a dull note with unexciting and tedious moments. Plus Film's story is predictable and has a lengthy runtime.

Kantara A Unbelievable Stuff... Please go and Watch and Experience...A perfect blend of Social Religious perspective with Administrative System.Culture, Faith, Evil, Ethical Dilemma...and many more angles covered very precisely.This movie shows how our Indian culture Always Great. Storyline also great, This movie have Emotions, Horror, ethical values and so on... This movie only can experience, Not to explain to anyone.This movie brings out Vibes, I literally overwhelmed.I am planning to watch kantara's original version in Kannadaa language. Hindi version also good but i want to feel original vibes.Highly Recommended Movie.

I went to this movie after listening to all the hype, and oh was I disappointed! There was almost nothing special or worth remembering. I agree there was probably a lot of effort put into it's making, but it didn't translate into an exciting cinematic experience at all. Issues remain unresolved, some things aren't explained.Background music is average, I don't understand what reviewers were harping about! The acting is over dramatic, a lot of hamming. Only the police character was grounded.The story was average, nothing special at all. Some plot points were just so convenient, to take the story in a particular direction.The ending is average. What was the hype all about?Please dont compare this movie to Tumbbad! It doesn't even come close to that masterpiece!

Fantastic movie. Must watch in theatres. The end will just blow your mind.Superb acting by the entire cast.Fantastic movie. Must watch in theatres. It's an amazing movie, I never experienced movies like this. This movie opened my mouth for 10 mins and many scenes were well directed and this is unique exprenince for me...I want to admire the work of Rishabh shetty and his team also want to thank for sharing the culture of our Hindu tribes. You have captured the beautiful and incredible Indian culture. Salute to you and your team...I wish you will get National and Oscar awards. The way this movies start from the beginning about which shows the hunger of Indian kings for the spirituality. And in end it's shows how ppl are corrupting their self also this movies gives amazing glimpses of bhootkola.

Kantara is a such a masterpiece... To explain this movie i feel short of words...Yen movie guru...Kathe yenu anu naav noddale iro kathegalalla... Its a routine story but making... My god it's completely on another level..Special shoutout to camera work and editing some shots remains imprinted in your mind hatsoffComing to Music beautiful songs I mean common by this time you have to agree Ajaneesh is a brilliant and intelligent music director he understands the pulse of music lovers, so he takes some beautiful parts of his or others songs and mix it up so beautifullyActing bagge maatadak aagutta people would never expect rishabh Shetty to perform so well he totally nailed it exceptional performance....
My Final statement would be
This movie is a trance that you would never wish to end... Go watch it at your nearest theatres.

This should be India's official entry for Oscar's. What a movie and what an acting and perfect bgm with topping of mind blowing acting from Rishabh. Climax is an absolute joy to watch. Many Hollywood movies can't pull off this good cinematography with these many dark scenes but the whole team did a really great job. Showcasing complex culture Karnataka Udupi region and pulling it off with this brilliance, just hats off to the team.The whole sequence of Bhooth Kola is very chilling experience and have goosebumps every time. There's just one shot of Kambala they pulled that off with excellence. This movie is just about perfection.

A spectacular experience in the theatres. The visuals and the soundtrack are exceptional. Will leave you speechless for a few minutes after you come out of the theatre, and the soundtrack will still be ringing in your ears. The casting is perfect and every actor was exceptional. The film is something I'm unable to describe through words. You'll be sorry for yourself for not watching it in the theatres, if you don't. Watched it twice and felt the same overflow of otherworldly emotions both the times. Make sure you watch it in the original language- Kannada with subtitles so that the true essence of the film isn't lost. This is the kind of movies that we should strive for, the ones which makes us raise our bar as an audience. Huge respect to the people behind this film. Thanks a ton!

This is a 7/10 movie with great beginning and good climax but nothing much in between. I am rating this 1/10 to balance out some overhype in here.The movie begins with a great promise but then falls off the cliff in a mighty fashion. It is only saved in the end by some brilliant acting by lead actor. Only first 20 and last 40 minutes of the movie are worth watching. In between everything else is utter garbage. It's elongated for no reason. After a certain point you do start thinking what is all this hype about. Movie is overhyped out of proportion.In the end, I do not regret watching this movie and would certainly recommend watching it once due to the uniqueness in which story is told and the lead actor's acting. However, you can fast forward a lot of stuff in between to save yourself some time. Those parts do not add anything to the plot or story.

Same stereotypical film from Tamil industry. The hero is something unique despite being indecent boozy type guy. And he wins ultimately. The first 15 minutes is interesting and praiseworthy. Then its the same hero-villain issue and the hero wins. Nothing gripping and interesting. Technically it's good, VFX and effects. But the content needs some innovation and maturity.Tamil industry should be serious regarding film making. Only money motivation in films is making this industry flop. This is for tamil people only and heavily lacks global appeal. Though the technicals are good in some way it would be a 4/10 but to balance the rating it would be 1 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Fine but oh my logical mind it is so highly hyped
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong. I am not trying to degrade this movie. I am giving my own opinion. There was a lot of sexism. The main hero keeps fighting for everything for some reason. I am just telling the things I didn't like. Like what are the even trying to tell from this movie.Even if you are really ill of character you can be a representative of God? I hope not.I kinda expected that there would be village people doing this scheme for land in a sophisticated manner. Maybe that's why I wasn't really thrilled by the ending.I have watched Brahmastra and I would say it is better than Kantara. I can count more logical weird things in Kantara than someone else can in Brahmastra. The genres are different but in my opinion. Now if you are wondering I watch bad quality movies only, no. I don't watch old movies rated less than 7.5. I can see quality.Anyway there are a lot of logical incostintencies.The king feels happiness seeing a sword, not from million other things. Also who gives whole village without any paperwork?What, they didn't have something to write on, is it? The action scenes, have weird portions. People fly off some 7 metres away in a kick. Sometimes even with a knee hit.I am very surprised nobody has talked about this and are saying Pathaan's scenes are illogical. Hypocrisy is clearly visible.Well, I feel the basis of story is bad. Neglecting that the mystery at start was good. At start I thought they certainly wouldn't have god in this. This is a globally famous movie. What in the world, it had god in it. Well, I am an atheist but I hope not that this movie went well because of God in it.No consistent story in between. Nothing constructive happened. The fight scene at end was good but other than that and mystery at start it had barely anything.It has proper representation of tribe oppression and a beautiful setting but many elements of the movie like a tree coincidentally falling after it was cut almost on a police car and some other things were weird.In general barely decent but totally not worth 8.6 as for now. It is maybe the hype that caused some of it's success but yeah worth a watch.You may be thinking I am saying bad things. You watch it then repeat what you were saying.

reviews.review_title: Last half hour is just wow!!
reviews.content: The last half hour of the movie is the best part of this movie. I really liked that the makers worked whole heartedly on this project. Very well written and acted by all. If I listen to the praise of a movie in advance, then I have high expectations from that movie, and most of the movies do not live up to those expectations. But this movie never disappoints you. Watching this movie made me want to know more about the famous local folk tales in other parts of India. When I came to know that Rishabh Shetty, who is also the lead of this movie, is also the writer and director of this movie, I started craving to see more of his work. I think this movie has the potential to win National Award. Maybe this will be the next worldwide hit after RRR.

Awesome Movie, Best story with awesome direction and Action.The choreography, acting , script everything is amazing.Everyone must watch. It's one of the best movie in Indian film Industry.We can't even imagine anyone else in Rishabs place as Shiva.This movie is raised kannada industry to an exceptional heights and proud to whole world.The choreography, acting , script everything is amazing.Everyone must watch. It's one of the best movie in Indian film Industry.We can't even imagine anyone else in Rishabs place as Shiva.This movie is raised kannada industry to an exceptional heights and proud to whole world.A MUST WATCH MOVIE IN HISTORY OF CINEMA...

reviews.review_title: Last 20 mins is incomparable to any acting I have seen
reviews.content: Rishab is a magician, who brought to life the vibrance and tradition of Tulunad. The movie will stay with you long after it ends.Action, thriller, comedy and romance it has everything and more.If you know Kannada then the movie takes you to the next level, even otherwise please do watch whichever language options you have.Every character is carefully crafted and add to the richness of the movie.You are not doing justice to the movie if you are not watching it in a theatre.There was a rough patch in the last decade when Kannada movies were short of ideas and creativity.Kantara, KGF and the likes have taken Kannada film industry to world-class cinema.

reviews.review_title: No words to explain the experience
reviews.content: As mentioned have no words in which experience can be shared that felted after watching this materpeiec. Just want to say Thanks with folded hands to Rishab shetty and entire team to portray such a theme that connects well with whomsoever have a faith and belief in God.So any who has any level of connect with the Supreme will be able to understand what I meant to say and explain via writing this review....like you can't explain exactly the taste of water to anybody....until one himself taste the water.So don't wait and just go to have the experience the movie has infused into its viewers.Jist of another level.

It was the one of the craziest experience while watching this film, because first of all the movies related to our culture, second is about the climax of the movie. It was a great and has breathtaking scenes This movie is explain in words so you should watch it. After coming out of the DA theatre, I just called everyone and explain my experience but also I couldn't explain the climax scene. So this is the reason why the movies running for months. I was not expecting expecting this much quantity and quality in this film there is jokes love violence, cunning. , the landlord treated the hero. That's it is ,definitely watch this movie.

This movie is something beyond the boundaries, visuals music acting direction everything is perfectly balanced and Executed. Hats off to Director Rishab Shetty sir for giving such a movie which can be watched again and again and showing our culture in beautiful manner. Just want to say one word about climax extraordinary. Last but not in least big big applause to RAJ B Shetty for big and best cinematography, his outstanding working impacting movie in big rage. Love u all for giving good cinema Congratulations to entire team who worked in this movie and took into next level of making keep rocking.

Goosebumps even till now when i recall the theatre experience watching the awesome story. This is what every Cinema lover should watch. The story holds your attention in every scene and it very well depicts Indian culture and traditions and legends which holds the faith of millions till now. Bollywood should learn from the makers of this movie. Its a true masterpiece that deserves all recognition it can get. Kudos to all actors who did their part very well. I was amazed how the climax suddenly creates a jump scare, goosebumps and tears at the same time.. I am really recommending this movie to everyone.

Was waiting for this movie to be released in Hindi ever since I watched the trailor and it was my first day first show. And I can tell you it was worth my time and money. Happy to see that our regional cinema is doing such research work and executing the minute details of our customs and traditions and presenting it in such a cinematic way. Acting , screenplay and camera work is superb. Hats off to Rishabh Shetty for brilliant Writing,directing and superb acting. If you need a break from romantic and fictional drama,then Kantara is the perfect cup of tea for you. Still after 24 hours of watching it's in my mind .

I'm extremely happy to see that this kind of movies are directing. This movie show us reality of society and their beliefs .Every character and story narration is outstanding.Anyone can get extrime enjoy while watching movie.I personally feel that our nature and human are related tribs not ruin forests but they worship forests.It's our masterpiece.everyone should watch this movie not because it's good movie but it connects us with our belief system.In this movie dance of dev(god) most relef to heart touching.Every shot of movie is like wowww.You have to watch this movie weather you like action cinema or fun or clutural cinema.Thanks.

reviews.review_title: Mindblowing movie. Awesome direction, sounds and acting. Intense divine experience.
reviews.content: Awesome and Mindblowing movie. This movie concept is different with deep meanings.Such an intense divine experience. Unique and deep-rooted movie. Rishab Shetty's direction and acting are on next level. BGM and visual arts are extremely good. It's not going out of my mind. Watch with a good sound setup. I want more such movies from Rishab Shetty. Such deep rooted movies showing indian culture always got my appreciation.I really want part 2 of Kantara. There is a lot of scope for part 2. It can be a prequel or sequel. The movie does seems to be in such a way that a prequel is planned like Baahubali or KGF2.

Best movie till date. Theatre Experience is Maximum. Really loved it. Rishab, Kishore, sapthami gowda acting is bessstttt. Even Deepak rai and Prakash acting to be mentioned All supporting role acting is good. GURUVA role played by Swaraj shetty is toooo good. Loved every bit of the movie. Best movie till date. Theatre Experience is Maximum. Really loved it. Rishab, Kishore, sapthami gowda acting is bessstttt. Even Deepak rai and Prakash acting to be mentioned All supporting role acting is good. GURUVA role played by Swaraj shetty is toooo good. Best movie till date. Theatre Experience is Maximum. Really loved it.

reviews.review_title: 2 hours story spice up the climax 20 minutes 🔥
reviews.content: It is impossible for a director and an actor to be the same person in a film crew and score on both sides. Direction and acting are well balanced in performance in the film.The film itself is experimental and succeeds in creating a new experience, A display of Tulunad culture by Rishabh Shetty and his team beautifully showcased the Bhutakolam and Thaulava culture without a single minute being boring. The songs are particularly heart touching and the cinematography is at peak level, especially the night scenes with the camera works they shot. The fight scenes are made very realistic, especially the Kambala fight scene, and the co-actors like Murali, Achyut and the female characters of the film have given their acting at a high level making it Rishabh's masterpiece.

Kantara (2022)Depicting Supreme God Vishnu's third incarnation on earth called Varaha avtar. The forest tribal community devote to Varaha and considers bhootakola(divine dance of coastal kannada) performer to rudra demigod(Lord Shiva) who is gatekeeper of the community and protects every devotee of Lord Varaha from evil spirits(living/dead).. A promise of ancestors is under threat to be breached by people over lust of materialistic gains where the ancient king had made deal with demigods as bargain for his peace. With such powerful storyline, excellent performance by every actor keeping raw background showing beautiful traditional practices of coastal Karnataka in an ultimate showdown of good vs evil.

All characters played fabulous. Background music , acting, dialogue are superb.This movie won't even make u feel bored for a single minute unless u dont understand the plot. From my view, this was the only movie which made me to watch for the second time, the next moment when I came back watching for the first time. Though the story goes with a simple idealogy, the way they ultimately presented deserves an award!Great music all actors performance is good comedy is also laughable 👍😁😎 overall with minor negative of simple storyline but the ending makes you forgot everything.. A divine experience🔥🔥For the people who is still busy searching reviews, Just go ahead and enjoy the show for once atleast!

The way the culture of tulunadu is shown in such natural way that you feel you are a part of that small village crowd. Watching Rishab Shetty act throughout the movie was a blessing, hatsoff to him for pulling up a story simple yet so powerful.From kambala to bhootakola every culture is shown in a divine manner. For someone who is new to this culture will surely be wooed for sure and it will keep you involved. This movie deserves to be watched in theatre.Even every other character has portrayed itself very well.For now all kannada movies are getting better and better.Climax is the best !!

*KANTARA*An extraordinary film from Rishab Shetty. It's a mysterious drama action film. The film is a must theatre watch film. The making of the film is in another level. If technically spoken the film's frames sound mixing frames etc etc were just lit. The screams were taunting for some time. The perfomance of Rishab Shetty was also really good. Most of the other actors were also nice. The last 15 minutes of the film was just unforgettable. The background score was just goes on with the flow of the film. The making and the background music just let us immerse into the film. There were a little lag felt in some places but its ok. The film revolves around the cultural heritage of the people. There are so many mystery elements some of them are supernatural and cultural. The film overall is a must watch theatre watch film
8 / 10.

Kantara : It's not a masterpiece!!! It's loud, sexist, boring, over the top with an energetic ending ! And probably is copied from a Dhanush starrer "Karnan". The movie is 30 mins longer than needed, running in loops with no importance given to women characters. It will definitely fail the Bechdel Rule. Acting is apt and good in few places. Same mother, same villagers, same friends ...yeah we have seen this thousand times. The screenplay is terrible with nothing left for the audience's imagination. Please don't just show the spectacle let us also picture it in our brains(as said by Naseer sahab). I hope future creators will treat audiences as equals!

Just wow. The story, acting, direction, music are just perfect. It's the master piece that Rishabh Shetty has made. It's not a movie it's a life time experience you never forget. Just wow. I bet you, you haven't watched something like this. This movie is a masterpiece, it has all the shades one expects in blockbuster love, passion, rage, suspense, drama, comedy, romance, action you name it and Rishab Shetty has put that thing in this movie. This movie deserves all the accolades and appreciation around the world, please go and watch this movie in theatres and you will be thankful and pleased, i myself have seen it 3 days before however i am still thinking about it and now it convinced me to write my first IMDB review.Kannada movie and Hombale films are doing terrific job creating and helping moviemakers like Rishab Shetty, i wish they could make a remake of Thumbbad and teach bollywood that content is a hero.

What a movie... I was literally blown away by the dedication and acting of Rishabh Shetty. You need heart of a lion to pick the topic and execute in such a nice way. Mark my words this movie will get National Award. BGM, cinematography, direction and acting all were topnotch. Climax is unbelievable. Rishabh Shetty got such an acting skill. Achyutha Kumar, Kishore acted really well... Daiva, kola, bootharadhane, kambala the classic culture of the Karavali Karnataka has been shown superbly. Goosebumps guaranteed at every scene. Dont miss the climax its the core ot the movie. It is exceptionally well acted and directed movie.

reviews.review_title: And then there were goose bumps !
reviews.content:
Ok .....
It's humanely not possible for an actor to perform this good !!!!PHENOMENAL is the word but will fall short to describe the greatness of this spectacle.Not only the protagonist but the supporting cast did justice to the whole narrative.You simply watch in awe and get so immersed with the story that it all looks REAL ....your pulse pulsates !But .....the climax is what gets you going , like the whole plot culminating to its fulcrum.You get the chills , the yelling and the high pitched sound stirs your core , heart beat races , you either cower behind your fingers or simply marvel at the intensity / height of expression on the face of the hero .....leaving you under a remarkable spell.This is cinema !!!! And I don't think anyone can exact it's wondrous creation for a long time
ENJOY ...RELISH !

reviews.review_title: A Must watch movie along with family/friends
reviews.content:
Superb movie. Mind-blowing Kannada movie..Kantara ..talks about the ancient culture..Superb acting and direction.. One of the best movies i have seen in so many years..So many of us have forgotten our old Culture and traditions. This movie takes us through a journey which explains us the very essence of Bhoota kola in Karnataka ( Theyyam in Kerala) which we see
in south India in the coastal region. This movie gives a clear message on the importance of Bhoota kola and the power which has been protecting us all since the ancient times. The director has explained the whole story so nicely that you won't feel bored for a second. Brilliant cinematography and use of sound which makes its a memorable experience for everyone who watches this movie.

It is very hard to describe the feeling of watching kantara. At the end of the movie i could not stand up from my seats. I was blown away from what I saw. I stayed till the end of credits. It is a cultural celebration of our rich Indian culture and rural deities and rituals. Rishabh shetty has done a fabulous work both as an actor and director. I was in awe of the visuals and cinematography of this movie. Spoiler Alert : the scene where rishabh transforms into guliga daiva is a must watch on big screens. The background score is perfect especially the song varaha roopam will stay with you after the end of the movie. It is a rollercoaster of emotions; romance, Fun, nail biting suspense, some jumpscares, and the climax. This will be the film the kannada film industry will be remembered for.

The movie was amazing ,those who played characters in this movie are excellent, mainly our movie writer, director and actor rishab Shetty sir was amazing person ,movie suspence getting curiosity. And thrilling elements are very good rishab Shetty sir's direction is superb and his acting ia another level the story tells our culture and Indian tradition it is very difficult to tell the old story to new generation people but in these film we clearly understand the movie.and definitely it is Oscar winning movie I watched this movie in Telugu but definitely I have to watch this movie in real language kannada and finally we got another pan indian director and actor rishab Shetty sir.

Truth is one ! Truth is exclusively experiential ! So is Kanthara movie !! How to explain such experiences ? Where are the letters and words ? Even if people learn and expertise all the languages of the universe, such genuine experiences can't be explained..probably it is that feeling which we feel when we rest on mother's lap..that secure feel when father is behind us..it is the confidence of a plant that is deep rooted in the soil..it is the intelligence which navigates a bird in sky..it is the energy which fuels the legs of a tiger..it is also the speed of a deer..it is space..it is time..is it enough !!

I urge you all never miss this movie to watch in theatres otherwise you will regretted. What a movie, epic story telling, best cinematography & versatile director. #Kantara is one the best underrated movie from Indian Cinema like #Tumbbad. Location, dialogue, comedy scenes everything beyond your imagination. #rishbhsetty & his team made this movie more than a masterpiece. I love to watch it again in theatres. Not every movie needs Suspense to be a blockbuster. Climax is far far better than suspense thriller movies. Loved the experience in theatre. Kannada movies are making India proud day by day.

I was going through an emotional rollercoaster watching the climax of this film. What an actor, what a director, massive respect to Rishabh Shetty Ji.The film was gripping from the very first minute, it has comedy, action, drama, horror, and suspense. DO NOT MISS watching this masterpiece in the theatre. This is something that should be enjoyed in the big screen with surround sound. Rishabh has proved his mettle.This film deserves a National award. We need more films that are based on our ancient culture and traditions. The film will definitely be a sleeper hit. The fact that this film was made on a budget of 16 crores shows that the budget doesn't really matter if you have the vision and skills to create a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: It is not a only mythology it is a mystery movie

It is not only mythology. There are so many bult points which you might missed it. So please watch the above link before giving any kind of rating. This movie deserves 10 out of 10 rating. I would like to say thank to the director and team for giving us such a beautiful movie.

reviews.review_title: Don't miss the theatrical experience of this Epic movie.
reviews.content: What a movie. I watched multiple times in theatre. Still this movie stuck in my mind. A scintillating.experience. I wondered how this movie made in such low budget(8cr). Cinematography,Fight sequences,Music,Bgm,Especially Performances of cast,Bhoota kala episodes,Editing,Direction all are perfectly executed. This movie should get national and international awards. I am a Telugu guy and I watched the movie in Telugu. The movie dubbing is perfect and we can feel it as direct telugu film. Still those who are not seen this movie,I tell you to please go to nearby theatres. This movie deserves theatrical experience and you should not get such experience in OTT.

Why people are unnecessarily giving hype to this movie? Why giving oveerrating? How this is unique? Dragged too much. Very predictable. I do respect the divinity, tradition and values, but this movie doesnt require that high rating. Too boring. Yes, performance may be good, photography may be good. But there is nothing that this should grt over rated. There are even more better movies. Not at all felt interesting. I am writing review just because of overrating and hype which is making other movies down that may be more better than this. Considering collections is not good as that will come for sure because of releasing in multiolr languages and numerous theatres/screens.

The movie keeps you to be in connection with the go since the day trailer launched. Any movie to be out and out entertaining and successful, the captain of the ship plays a very vital role in all stage of the process right from the drafting till the release. Here the captain man is Mr. Rishab Shetty, an amazing artist and very talented writer makes it an effort not to neglect the movie.Scene by scene, the visuals are treat to watch for. When the background music and melody blends with the graph, the beauty is inevitable to experience. Particularly the action in the movie in association with the cultural sports genre is just wow, which showcase the effort put up in observing, practicing and bringing it out to the top notch. Just amazed by the story and screen play, the climax..... Just Mesmerizing.

Honestly the movie is good which have shot in forest with a very normal script.The theme of the movie is to believe god and the rituals which is being followed by tribal people till now. And politicians who are trying to get back the land through forest officers.There are lot of other movies which had a better scripts. But people who likes to explore or witnesses the subject related to god, tribes or rituals followed by them, and forest based movie will surely like this.Music seems to be good and realistic without any modern bass or trebled ones.The hero did a wonderful job and overall it is a normal movie to watch.

When I saw the movie, it depicted realism in next level, Actor with Finest acting truly worth watching. Indian Cinema needs this type of commitment for all aspects. South Indian Culture is totally rich with their Traditions, while Bollywood don't have a this type risk taking actors directors, This Era totally go for South Blockbuster Era, South Cinema Upgrade With Time, Indian Film Industry Depends on South Industry For All the Aspects Of Cinema, the time is not so far when south cinema won the oscars, may be it will beat hollywood in upcoming time. As indian i proud of our Cinema Industry....

This movie was an enthralling experience! Tulunadu culture in all its glory! It's a visual treat. Some scenes will leave you shaken up. Great acting, dialogues and cinematography. A really entertaining Kannada movie after a long time. I would be watching this 2 days in a row in theatre and wouldn't even mind that. Do make sure you watch it in a theatre to fully enjoy it. The locations chosen are also scenic and the tribal culture is also shown beautifully. Pretty well researched. Rishabh Shetty's performance especially at the end will leave you awestruck. I hope they make more movies like this in Kannada industry.

reviews.review_title: Kantara movies is a folk spiritual explore with in us...
reviews.content: Rishab Shetty Sir hat's off to you...You made a masterpiece movie and gave a cultural explore to world...The way you perform was absolutely mind blowing! The climax was superb and made me to cry...Nature always loves us . But we humans are always greedy...All the characters gave a best performance...If you see around world people are attached to there folk and culture.Some say it's a Village and some say it's a County...In the movie you can find a blend of cultural folk and traditional values well made...I request to movie buff and other people should must watch the movie.Once again, I thank to the whole team of Kantara...

reviews.review_title: Rich Indian culture which was ignored
reviews.content: Grounded to grassroots of culture and religion. This is what Indian audience wants respect our religion and find the contents and showcase them public will appreciate that now Indian audience is waked up and want to see hidden Indian cultures on the big sets and no doubt south film industry is on that track so being getting rewards of appreciation from the Indian and global audience as well so keep it up and drag out more such content full movies and show our rich Indian culture globally expecting more such movies in future to watch in the end hats off to the performance of rishabh sherry and team,🔱🙏🚩

reviews.review_title: Absolute garbage, don't waste your time
reviews.content: I don't usually write reviews here, but I specifically wanted to for this one given the hype for this piece of trash in the name of filmmaking. The premise is set under a fantasy of a god and how his special ability/power has been passed onto the protagonist. However, the entire movie goes by with no display or demonstration of said power and ability. They keep teasing it until the last 10 mins, where the protagonist yells and beats a few goons into submission.The plot is promising, but is executed poorly. This movie will make your ears hurt. The whole film is full of screams that go "wooooaaahhh" for no reason. The background score is unpleasant and a nuisance. Don't waste your time with this one.

This is probably the 3rd Kanada film (after 2 KGFs) that I've watched and I could easily say that there's going to be a boom in this industry in the upcoming years to come, I'm really excited to see what's next from the Kanada film industry.The film has the usual story/plot that's been portrayed in many films like Sura, Avatar, etc, nothing new at all, but every film becomes unique with the makers' touch and this one with the touch of the director playing the protagonist is so special that it pulls you into the world with a mesmerising act, magical kinda powers, electrifying sequences, very good action scenes, and even though the faces are all unknown to the audience, those actors have played the role given to them with so much perfection that it just makes you gravitate towards their world in the film.The first half felt being driven away by the misty forest environment with a touch of mystical story-telling and a massy introduction with a rogue kinda characterisation, even the silliest funny dialogues are also enjoyable to an extent, basically making you engaged almost throughout the 1st half; in the 2nd half becomes somewhat rudimentary like the usual cliche films but in the climax, you are shown a sequence where you just get submerged into it and it gives you an electrifying shock that shooks you up with the protagonist's performance and even though there were sign languages that aren't that much understandable, you'd still feel like you understood the message the actor wanted to convey.The romantic sequences, songs & even BGM weren't that good but still, the film stood out, that's a big feat achieved if you ask me.This film is something very special that has come out recently and a must-watch for those film fanatics who'd expect something different to consume, it is definitely a never to be missed kinda film for sure.And finally here's the reality:PS-1: the film has the best plot, best twist, best actors, etc, you name it, there's everything best in itKantara: hold my beer 🍺 , 😂

Just not worth the hype!Not giving spoilers however watch with so much hope looking at the imdb rating. But clearly if you remove both the extremes (10 rated and 1 rated) - you get a better idea of the quality.The movie starts with a good looking plot, which just gets lost for 90% of the movie. And then only returns for last 10 minutes.And the obsession of this type of cinema with casual sexism is another signature plot!Acting: for most part the acting is ok, and then a couple of out of ordinary scenes are definitely appreciated. But all in all, in was simply another publicity gimmick by entertainment giants like Netflix.

reviews.review_title: It's not just a Movie.. It's a MASTERPIECE
reviews.content:
Its my 4th time watching the movie:-It's a masterpiece work done by Rishad shetty & team..
The story is really mind blowing,
There is never a drop in scenes where you feel low in entire movie.For non Dakshina Kannada people- Kindly get some idea of Daiva aradhane before watching the movie, so that you get an idea what is it about & you understand what's the movie about.Rishab shetty:- The last 20min we don't have words to describe, It's just the goosebumps & Chill we feel on the spine.G. O. A. T level of acting.Caste:-
Kishore, Sapthami Gowda, Manasi Sudhir, Achyuth Kumar, Pramod shetty, Deepak Rai, Prakash Thuminad, Vinay bidappa, Mime Ramdas.Acting was really great for their roles.But Naveen D padil was really a disappointment in the movie..
Kindly please don't cast these people and spoil the movie..
Coastalwood is already screwed casting them in all the movies, so kindly don't screw Sandalwood casting them.Directions:- Rishab shetty:- Your just took Sandalwood to another level.You definitely deserve a National Award.Cinematography:- Arvind S. Kashyap:- The art of capturing a story visually & the technic used in the movie is a beautiful work.

Movie is good but but its being overhyped. Its has nothing new in terms of story or plot. Acting is first class but if you have seen a lot of south movies you would feel movie is a bit repetitive. I am specifically talking about Hindi version, it may be a different experience for South viewers. I went expecting a lot after the reviews and facebook publicity but I was actually just waiting for the movie to end. There are much better movies you can watch like Tummbad. All time I was thinking that if Tumbbad had recieved this kind of promotion and publicity it would have been one of the top movies of all time.

I wish i could give 0 . Absolutely boring plot. The story is not at all engaging. Shocked to see good reviews for this movie. Director sir, writer sir what is the movie about?? What are you showing in the movie? Is it targeted for certain audience only? I don't think there is any meaningful thing in this movie. Right from beginning it fails to draw the attention with a very dull plot. Pushpa also showed story of forests but it has story and class. This movie doesn't set the story line properly. It feels like the director took a camera and started shooting in a village near forest. I'm disappointed more because the reviews showed extraordinary feedback, however it is no way near to the quality i expected. I wish it had better start. It pissed me off in the very first hour. All in all I'm disappointed!!!

reviews.review_title: Khan Review - This movie should hurt hindu sentiments
reviews.content: Not a great story but brilliantly made with complete entertainment. The director has done a good job, back ground score is good, location very beautiful, actors are good, comedy punch line is very funny, action scenes though unbelievable like all South movies but executed very well, complete entertainment with value for money, the climax is superb.Now coming to the negative aspects- This movie very comfortably promotes superstition which can have a very bad effect on huge masses who are already superstitious, It promote drinking alcohol is very cool, consuming narcotics is perfectly fine when in fact today the media is using drugs with bollywood to get TRP's, Encroachment on government land, attacking government officials who on duty try to stop encroachment, insulting threatening officers who on duty are stopping poaching, It encourages destroying forest and smuggling woods, it shows the hero who as per today's perception of society has all the negative traits representing god, the leading lady being a hindu before marriage very comfortably spend the night with hero and also gets pregnant where as aamir khan ad is getting boycotted.

reviews.review_title: Another Overhyped Flick From South - MAC Reviews
reviews.content: I still do not know why people were rating it so high & glorifying it so much as it has nothing much to offer. Not even in a single department. Its a typical South Indian Film with over the top action sequences & illogical scenes & scenarios.+ves : Nothing much but Rishab Shetty's acting in the climax was quite impressive. In some of the scenes, camera work was really good. A few jump scares looked terrifying as well.-ves : A lot. Firstly, The plot. There were infinite loopholes in the plot. The film was looking good in the first 20-30 minutes as it was giving us a clue that it would present itself as a Mystery Thriller but definitely its not, rather it is a disappointment. The film deviates from its main plot. Screenplay is too slow especially in the second half. Only WOOOOOH is the point around which the whole story revolves (*giggles). Music is not impressive as well. Action scenes & climax was filled with over the top illogical sequences. I feel that they should have released it as a short film instead. Characterization was very weak as well. Forced romance & forced comedy also spoiled the taste of the picture.To conclude, its definitely a disappointment for me. I recommend you to save your precious time, money & energy. Skip this one.

It was a one-time watch, but I found it very ordinary. If I have not heard so many good things about it, I would not have continued till the end. A story of some rich guy trying to trick some uneducated tribal people to take their land - how unique is that. And some minor scenes of divine intervention - also very common. It is always a big red flag when the director plays the lead, and also the action hero who fights and trashes the co-actors; this movie is no exception. I have watched the Hindi version, so I can give some benefit of doubt that the dubbing might have devalued the acting a bit, which generally happens. Otherwise, I found the acting very one dimensional. None of the character had a gray or subtle tone to them - just either good or bad. And loud acting is always easy, but shouting is not necessarily expressing. I found very little effort also in introducing the characters as humans, but instead just put in roles as pillars paving the path for the hero to show his greatness. And the director is the hero, he is in all the scenes, he is the good guy, he also gets the girl, and he also kills the bad guys at the end. Probably we should mature beyond these kinds of stories.

Overrated asfA simple and worn out cliched screenplay with stereotypical characters & cliched predictable twists along with a misleading fantasy touch to it just to coat and overshadow it's uninteresting narrative.KANTARA turned out to be the most overrated flick of this year for me and one of the most overrated movies of all time.Maybe this must be my inability to understand art & music but VARAHA song, be it in there or not did nothing at all rather than the fact that it was suitable for those opening & ending scene.Idk why people were so damn disappointed with it's removal/altercation smh.Rishab Shetty was fantastic in that last act though.And some of the bhoota kola scenes were aesthetic but there ended the positive points I have for this flick.I really wished and kept on hoping while watching the flick that it would change tonally and go deep into its fantasy and mythological themes but it just never went there even quarterly.It felt like just a mere plot device to give the lead character that power drive at the end and to induce curiosity and create a connection regarding his nightmares and the demigod.Nothing more.I really liked the way Shetty showcased the demigod scenes and the rituals.Wish he had written a mesmerizing and immersive folkhorror Or folklore instead of a typical masala movie coated partially with mythological elements and technical goodness.5.5/10.

Director Rishab Shetty's Kantara (aka mystic forest) is a story of tribals who inhabit the forest in coastal Karnataka - Tulunadu region. Rishabh has also written the story and stars as the lead. The story which is largely set in 1990s strings together strands from an earlier century as well as 1970s, weaving these three timelines in a brilliant blend of mythology, folklore and movie magic.The narrative yarn is spun around multiple conflicts - some overt and some simmering undercurrents which are on the verge of eruption. Nevertheless, the primary fault line traces the near unending conflict between humans and nature as the humans continue in their vain quest to conquer, own and control nature - land and resources - to satiate their utmost avarice.Rishabh Shetty mounts the movie on a canvas that is deeply drenched in the earthy hues of its milieu and richly textured with unique cultural ethos of the coastal Karnataka.His story presents an eclectic mix of emotions ranging from resonant spirituality, rustic love, healthy oodles of irreverent humour, primal rage, greed that is almost genetic as it transcends and consumes generations, juxtaposed with firmly held beliefs of a close knit community and how such beliefs permeate and define their lives.Within moments into the film, Rishabh magically transports the viewers to the verdant space where his story unfolds with Kola, Kambala, nocturnal hunting and much much more, thanks largely to the songs and background score by B. Ajaneesh Loknath along with the superb cinematography of Arvind S Kashyap who conjure up an immersive experience.Rishabh Shetty excels in the role of Shiva as he emotes with ease through the character arc which sees him go from a irresponsible ruffian to the transformation with a final tour-de-force. He is complemented well by a supporting cast including an excellent Kishore, ever-dependable Achyuth Kumar, Pramod Shetty, Sapthami Gowda and the rest. Rishabh's control on the medium as a director is evident through the entire runtime of Kantara, especially as it crescendos to a phenomenal final stretch that packs the potency akin to a force of nature.Rishabh the writer cooks up a heady cocktail - masterfully mixing up the sensational with the subtle and the surreall; this is one happy "made-in-heaven" marriage of mystique philosophy and mass masala moments.A delectable coastal Karnataka delicacy that is cooked to perfection to delight the discerning viewers.As the final visual vanishes from the screen, the viewers leave with the lingering legend of Kantara lurking in their minds.AN UNFORGETTABLE & UNMISSBALE EXPERIENCE !!

Everyone take a bow to rishab shetty. This man is the star of this movie. I really loved his performance in the movie. I really dout someone else can do it to this perfection. Especially his perfomance in the climax, oh my god just something of different level. The writing is really good, that also done by rishab shetty. I really loved the way they blend the folklore, the village, the forest, the government, the cast system everything into the story. Everything is connected nothing feels out or forced in the story. The detailing, the honesty with wich this movie is made is really commendable. The cinematography is really good. The shots in the night were really nice. The music is amazing, elevates many scenes. All cast members gave a amazing performance. The action sequences were really good.The small issue I had with the movie is it's Predictability, we could predict a few things, but still the way the movie is made it hooks us with the story till the end.

Kantara deserve not award but awards.A must watch to experience magic.A simple "Danta Kathe" (Folk Tale).This movie is a gem. 70% of the movie is commercial entertainment but the last 30% is energy draining, hypnotising & engages you to focus only on screen. I never had goosebumps while watching whole movie, but after ending I felt I never ever blinked once watching climax and I totally lost awareness of my surroundings that's how much engaging this movie's climax is (I was watching the movie in a housefull theatre I felt I'm witnessing it personally and alone, you get AR experience without AR devices).

I'm not even sure why this movie has such a high rating, the only good part was the first 15 and last 15 minutes of the movie.The drama was stretched for too long and could have been cut to 2 hours which wouldn't had been boring. I thought KGF was far better and this should be streamed not watched in theatres.I do have to say the direction, effects and the mythological element was fascinating but apart from that there is nothing new to be witnessed.This looks like any other movie in terms of drama and other elements. Overall a new concept and if you want to experiment something new that Bollywood doesn't have and will never understand, please watch this!

This movie deserves Respect, love, support and also little research

Could not believe such a high quality movie could come from local movie industry. Hands down one of the best movies of the Indian industry.... with utmost respect and admiration. It takes lot of courage to make something like this - I hope to see more movies along these lines.

The movie is simply superb and covers all the bases - be it Story, Acting, Screenplay, Cinematography and Last but not least, DIRECTION. The Movie is narrated well and all the actors ass value to the script. The BGM is mind blowing. You literally get goosebumps during the Climax.
