There is never a dull moment in the movie and keeps you captivated. You should not miss this Masterpiece of a movie. Speaks a lot about our rich culture and sacred practices. Keep up the good work Rishab Sir! Hats Off to you!!! 💐🙏😊

No words to describe this movie, last 15 mins climax will give you goosegumps.Direction, acting all at different levelIf you don't watch it in theatre trust me guys you will miss gem of a filmWhat a sound effect. Hats off to you Rishabh Shetty , I became your fan after seeing theclimax.First half is superb and the 2nd half is next level, simply gem of a movie.Feeling like going and watching it for the second time.The sound director this movie ,hats off to you brother.This should surely go to Oscar for nomination. Kannada movies are at different level all together.This is 200 cr movie.

reviews.review_title: Larger than life with deep rooted folklore based theme
reviews.content: Kantara- A deeply rooted, folklore based theme etched directly from a dark history where kings or powerful people overpower tribals. Rishab Shetty has outdone himself as the writer, director and actor. His expressions in every scene is captivating and character shown is larger than life.Background score is top notch and brings back the local, rich tribal culture who has a strong voice. Story is bit slow initially but engaging.Climax provides goosebumps moments and invigorates your body.This movie is not everyone's cup of tea due to its unique experiment, with a display of folk and Bhoota Kola version.Kannada movies are rising the bar and such movies will keep the industry afresh!

reviews.review_title: Plagiarised Music and Bad Middle Part
reviews.content: The start and end of Kantara is superb and is a masterpiece but the the rest is not. Recently I also learnt that the music of Varaha Roopam is copied from Navarasam Of Thaikkudam Bridge which is disappointing and ruined my experience of watching a good movie. Coming to the movie itself the middle part was bad. It was too chessy and disrespectful towards women and could have been shown in a better way. The direction and cinematography is really good. Rishab Shetty deserves a standing ovation for making this movie. I watched it in Hindi Dubbed and I recommend everyone to watch in original with subs as the dubbing was bad and too loud.

reviews.review_title: One of the best cinematic experiences!!!!!
reviews.content: This is one of the most mesmerizing cinema ever, every minute is gripping, it will take you to the whole new world, I rate this movie as one of the best made movies ever.If one needs to experience that amazing feeling then they need to watch it in theatres and do not wait for its OTT release or else one is going to miss the epic experience in their life.The climax is next level altogether, it requires a separate review.The movie has depicted Indian tradition and culture so well, the folklore, the connection between man and nature which is a core value in our Hindu belief system is shown perfectly well that everyone watching the movie will get connected to it in a go.Hats off to the movie makers and especially Rishabh Anna.. take a bow.

reviews.review_title: Kanthara is a Modern Day Classic
reviews.content: Kanthara (Ondu Dantha Kathe)Movies are made with the intention of telling a story that will have a climax. #Kanthara Kannada movie is a "Climax" told with a story attached to it.Short review: The most stunning climax I've watched in any movie.Whole thing about climax: Rishab Shetty hails from my land, the Tulunadu or that blessed land between the Arabian sea and western ghats. Tulunadu is divided between different districts of Karnataka and also involves Kasaragod in Kerala. But it is united by a rich Sanatana culture, Tulu language and beautiful fables apart from stunning landscapes.Kanthara is a fable or Dantha Kathe. It begins with a fable of a King transferring his lands to his people in exchange of peace of mind offered to him by Panjurli, the protector "Daiva" of the lands and forests.Then it tells the story of a closely knit community that worships the land, the forest and Panjurli. Transcending through 19th century to later decades of 20th century, it projects the rich culture involving Kambala (Buffalo race of coastal Karnataka), Kola (The protector Daivas appearing in humans to connect to the devotees) and the intricacies surrounding the lives of believers.While we have countless movies that lampoon and insult our culture, here is a movie that magnificently glorifies the culture of a small strip of land in a corner of India. To clear short of rationalist attacks, the movie has a tagline that says, it's a fable. Apart from that, it's just a heady mix of art, lifestyle, language, generosity of people, their faith, pettiness of people in power and the enlightenment of the order of Daiva to live with the nature, not against the nature.Rishab Shetty writes, directs and acts in Kanthara and he does a mind boggling job in all three roles. The national award jury will be confused which of the three deserves the National award more, the Writer or the Director or the Actor. I don't want to be there in the jury. Easiest way will be to give all three awards to Rishab Shetty.Kanthara is unabashed celebration of a culture, the people and their life. It may sound alien to people who don't know the place and culture, like it happens to the Deputy Forest Range Officer in the first half. But the movie grows on the viewers as it moves towards the most stunning climax that cannot be explained. It can only be experienced.Performances of all the starcast is natural and topnotch. The art department, music, background music and cinematography gel beautifully to create an audiovisual treat. It's an apt lesson to Bollywood about how to make an original movie that can enthral without burning hundreds of Crores.I had rated Rishab Shetty's "Garuda Gamana Vrishabha Vahana" directed by Raj B Shetty as one of the Top 5 gangster movies ever made in India. Kanthara cannot be easily placed in a genre. We can call it a fable retold in a realistic setup. It is nothing short of a classic. A modern day classic of "Divine" proportions.The climax blurs the difference between the Human and Divine. Kanthara is once in a lifetime movie experience and enters into my Top 10 all time great Indian movies.Post script: My review may be biased because of my love for my Tulunadu. I attach that disclaimer before I recommend Kanthara to all cinema lovers. The movie comes with English subtitles. Go celebrate Kanthara!

Best movie of the decade undoubtedly. The performance of the lead role is so captivating, it has single handedly got the success to this movie. Watch it for the nativity of tulu nadu, cinematography, music, performances of lead roles and to feel the underlying complex theme of region's tradition and culture.The movie is evenly paced and every scence is made for a purpose and to slowly develop the characters, not once you feel bored. No commercial aspects forced into the movie, no gimmicks whatsoever, just pure cinematic magic. Dont miss this masterpiece and to be watched only on big single screen movie theaters.

reviews.review_title: Thank God....i didn't loose the chance to watch this spectacular masterpiece movie in cinema hall...🔥🔥🔥 Fire movie after the KGF movie from Karnataka...bow to the director
reviews.content: Thank God....i didn't loose the chance to watch this spectacular masterpiece movie in cinema hall...🔥🔥🔥 Fire movie after the KGF movie from Karnataka...bow to the director and actors...Rishabh Shetty....you killed it man.... unbelievable....and thank you so much to let people know about the holy rituals of our true culture. The direction of the movie is way better than other movies. Trust me ...i enjoyed every single moment of the movie. There were no lacks in story telling and I love the way the dubbed entire movie and beautiful songs in Hindi... Please Please Please...send this awesome movie in Oscar...once again...thank you so much for this masterpiece.

After a very long time its hard finding words for this cinematic experience where we see catharsis of a human into a demigod , a simple storyline presented with such ease and poetry it just looks so good, the acting of Rishab Shetty will leave you speechless especially in the last fifteen minutes ,you will be numbed by such powerful histrionics that have not been experienced or the audiences have not been exposed to, the background score adds to the overall experience and being a North Indian i get goosebumps on hearing the Varaha song, what a beautiful fusion of guitar, bharatnatiyam and kola.Hats off to Rishab for giving such a gem during the times of torturing onslaught of stupid cinema of Bollywood.Advice to Bollywood: We are fed up of you throwing same stuff with same stale actors again and again , change yourself or audiences will change you.

reviews.review_title: God is not a myth. It's a human emotion that turns myths into reality.
reviews.content: #kantara.God is not a myth. It's a human emotion that turns myths into reality.We should question myths but not question the trust behind questioning myths. Some myths are the base of our belief system toward peace and harmony.The climax Schenes are great and the way the god teaches people to stay united and peaceful - then disappears as if the job done is so intense and powerful. Bollywood can't make this kind of content in the next 100 years.Everything is just awesome in this movie.Direction, acting, Story, light comedy, visuals. Rishabh Shetty is definitely a great director but he has proved himself to be an excellent actor. Worth watching in theatres!!

reviews.review_title: Movie is meant for theatrical experience
reviews.content: What an experience, i was shivering for good 30 minutes post the movie got over. Rishab Sir has acted like as if gods had possessed him. What is local experience on global scale.10 years back a movie like Kanthara would have been mocked , or considered too arty and shelves just for the film festivals , but today traditional local indigenous experiences are being celebrate on mass level. What is progress for movie creators as well as audience.India has many such stories, success of Kanthara should encourage more local directors to come up with local stories of celluloid.This movie is to be best experienced on bigger screens only.

reviews.review_title: Movie only for the blessed Ones
reviews.content: There was no acting at all, as they look so real. Just like normal villagers these actors have completely justified their roles. Everyone was so perfect. I was trying to find fault which i hardly could. And Rishab rocks with his multi talent personality. No other actor is even a km near him. He has thrown everyone away. My hero Rishab was last nail in Bollywood coffin. I would fall in his feet as he is real good of Indian movies man. Salute to such a performance. He is director, story writer and what not. A one man army. Though i dont understand kannada i went for kannada version with subtitles. You will repent if you dont watch this in theatre.

Watched the movie yesterday it was a phenomenal experience to watch this masterpiece what a cinema it just blown my mind pls watch it only in theatres it will be a lifetime experience & it worth the hype hats off to the whole team for making this masterpiece. Pls go & watch this & make more & more people know about this movie the efforts to make this masterpiece shouldn't go waste if we will respect this cinema then only we will get quality cinema like this in future not having any hopes from Bollywood industry but atleast south industry is there to save the art of making real cinema. They deserve all the love & respect.

reviews.review_title: Mostly stolen and inspired from a small band's song
reviews.content: The album song by a small band which has the same theme of an old traditional art being threatened and bullied by changing times. Movie theme as well as the song was copied without giving due credit. For people who love this song, the plot is nothing new.The hype being made by people and movie marketers has turned into a mass shysteria with people ending up abusing the original content creators for existing and the band which has a case in court for palgariam is being abused, attacked and threatened by mobs of the production house followers. The irony is that this situation is exactly what's being depicted in the movie.Movie on the other hand too is nothing exceptional but probably loved because of a song and corresponding performance.

Eeshwara's sankalpa that the director conceptualized the way and executed it. Every deep interviewer asked Rishab how did he conceptualized last 20 mins and his answer was some energy was driving the movie. One can nothing but wonder how this movie is even possible. In my village in AP too, there are instances where people feel Godly instances; heard the same across many other places in India. But in later ages this energy was misused and people could not tell if one was genuine or pretending
Last 20 mins is too good.The shout has immense energy.Background music is too good.Camera man did awesome job.

reviews.review_title: One of the best Indian movie
reviews.content: This movie would be understandable to those people who know village culture and there lifestyle. It is an Oscar winning movie for me. All the department is perfect. The last 20 minutes climax is the best climax i have ever watched even Hollywood could match this movie standards. It's must watch movie. Rishab Shetty is an all rounder his acting, writing direction is top notch. You really should not miss this movie. I still don't understand why this movie rating is 9.3 it must be 10. You will enjoy this movie only in theatre because of the sound effects the movie has is top notch. Please do watch.

Wow, what a movie!!!Kantara is one of those movies that really brings out the raw emotions, it is truly deserving of the praise, it has received so far.The movie is set in a fictional coastal karnataka village. And director and Lead actor Rishab shetty have captured the very essence of the culture of coastal Karnataka throughout the movie. Every scene and dialogue is filled with it. Only a person who is steeped in that culture can pull it off. Whether it is the Kambala race, boar hunting or the romance scenes or even the comedy scenes, you can see the nativity of the same.Every member of the cast has done a splendid job. Not even one character seems out of place. The script is too tightly written that you don't feel bored even for one minute and you are enthralled by the story.The direction is spot on and the camera work is amazing, whether it is the capture of the beautiful forest or the fight scenes. But the best is capturing the Devine moments of Booth Kola.And finally Rishabh Shetty has done a splendid job as lead actor. The last 20 minutes of the movie is divinely. This is probably a performance that can never be repeated.All in all a movie that must be watched not once but more. I am up for watching it again.

I waited long to watch this movie to be streamed. Honestly, I don't want to read any review before watching the movie, that would spoil my viewing experience.Finally got it in Prime. All I got is disappointment. I waited, waited, and waited for something to happen big until the climax. But what I saw was 1980's 90's R. K Selvamani movie. It is very old story told several times in Tamil cinema.The climax of Amman gave more goosebumps than this.Out of this Rishab Shetty's acting that the end. Should get a national award for the Climax acting, he really nailed it at the end. But the character arch to become a God is completely missing. There is clearly no reason for the forest officer to change his mind, should gave a solid reason.Please watch "Marmadesam, Vidathu Karuppu." each and every character in the village has a respectful character arch.Final though Tumbbad wins a surprisingly good movie award from me. Please watch that too.

It's a simple movie, but it effect every single person sitting in the theatre from Rishabs acting, and that's why it's a massive blockbuster. I think we should invent a new word to describe this movie. Some might even feel the Devine intervention will thin them. You can never take this movie out of you, ever. Even the director would have never expected the influence of this movie on the audiance. It looks like the Rishab also had Devine intervention while doing this scene. It's very difficult to imagine to perform at that par without it. The world will never forget this movie. My bet on Oscar for this movie.

Coming to Kantara, this film has so many layers of complexity and it's amazing Rishab expresses a lot while keeping it grounded, rooted and minimalistic. With unending sound of the biosphere set in Tulunadu as a conjunction between ecology, greed of man, civilization and everything in between sums up the tone of the film. I loved the idea of the flashback and voiceover to set things going from the start. On the other hand, this is a proper commercial film so expect all the genre troupes, elevations, guy falling head over heels in love and a story done to death. But Rishab stands out as he chooses this inalienable closeness of mother earth and man, adds the main ingredient, i.e. Is ENTERTAINMENT!

This type of movie comes once in a decade .Rishabh Shetty have done awesome job . Cinematography,music,character ,screenplay all are world class .This movie deserve Oscar. Amazingly scripted ; well narrated with cultural setting to convey social message. Acting by every cast is simply wonderful . Storey takes us through fictional event built around preserving forest land, fauna and religious rituals around panjurli ( demigod).Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre. In climax scene you will feel Ike god transcend from screen to your soul.

reviews.review_title: when big producers and good production house team with the talented director such master piece emerge
reviews.content: When big producers and good production house team with the talented director such master piece emerge. One of the best movie of 2022 from India. I heard all other Bollywood movies are flopped.. now they know what actual the viewers want to see in the new movies... Rishabh Shetty, Raj b Shetty, Rakshit Shetty are the gems of Kannada film industry and more of their movie should come so that we the viewers have the mesmerizing amazing feeling while watching their movies.... don't wait for this movie to release in Amazon prime as you will lose the fun of watching such good story telling on TV. Have a watch at it at the big screen. I heard people are not getting tickets but wait for to get the ticket and have a look at it there.

This is under same banner who produced the KGF 1&2, will produce Salaar. This is another master piece by them. They uplift their kannada film industry to new level. This movie shows us tradition of Karnataka. I'm now aware of that tradition. I felt very spritual while I was watching.The show was almost full I can say that, because all the expensive seats were booked for same day we couldn't book recliner, So had to choose late night show.Whats good in film is Filmography, Photography, Cinematography & direction is too good, Visual effects & BGM goes hand in hand. Somehow I feel south industry makes BGM is so good that we can forgot some flaws in film very immediately.

Why do have so many practices that we have brushed away by tagging them as superstition? Why did we need such practices in the first place? This movie answers a lot of this questions in a beautiful way... How to avoid friction between humans and nature? Whom does the forest belong to? To its people or to the government who wants to protect it? This movie has started a whole new thought process in my mind.. To self claimed intellectual in me started questioning all my evolved beliefs with lot of western influences and started thinking how we all gave up our roots and succumbed ourselves into the unknown reality.

After hearing all the hype for the movie I just went for it. The movie for me was medium paced with lots of great moments through out. From the first minute to the last the film takes us on a journey that we can just sit, watch and enjoy. The cinematography of the movie is top notch, that pics up every nuances of the forest and the people. Rishab man this is some top tier stuff and hats off for the story, direction and acting. After all this the climax 20 minutes steals the show. I was prepared for something like that from the beginning, but the way it was crafted just had me at the edge of my seat. For me the Malayalam dub was a bit of a let down as it felt like it was rushed to complete dubbing for sooner release. Also the BGM, and music of the movie was also equally important and fantastic that makes this movie a total package.

reviews.review_title: A terrific tell of people, forest, torturers told in massy entertaining way
reviews.content: Kantara is a massy entertaining movie about the spirit of the forest and the people who earn their livelihood from it with typical massy entertaining way parallelly run with the rural legends which sets up some exemplary craftsmanship from Risab Shetty as a director and an actor. Every shot of the movie feels like a good piece of potrait because of the solid cinematography from Aravind S. Kashyap. Putting asid all the technicalities , the main treasure of the movie is the screenplay and the actor Kishore. A solid moviea and a must watch. This movie prices that a movie about village people , and the beauty of the forest can also bring a huge box office return if the heart of the movie is in the right place.

I love PAN India movie I heard from everyone that ending is so awesome where it was below average nothing special, I still remember Anniyan's climax sceen, every seen of Pushpa including music, KGF both part and more more movies which I can rate 10/10 but this can be good documentary didn't find commercial movie material in this movie, see Tumbad if you want to see good cinematography see Ankhon Dekhi for great acting skill and contents when compare to those movie this is really really below average for me. I watched today and I had very high expectation but disappointed no doubt direction and acting was awesome by each one in the movie but failed to impress me.

This movie shows the Tulu culture that may be unknown to many people as me. I got to know about the culture from this movie only. I had a profound impact after watching this movie.The scenes are well-designed, and you will feel it happening in the movie. You will move along with the movie; this is so well made. You will feel the scenes happening in your surrounding. There are some Jump Scares in the film, and I am still unable to get out of the same even after one week of watching the movie.It also has some spine-chilling scenes and audio, which is not evil, but those are still ringing in my ear, and I am still shivering at night when I think about the movie.This movie is a must-watch. It has mythology, romance, comedy, culture, social message, sports, and all genres you can think about. Watch this movie in one go only, and you will enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Just an ordinary local land acquisition movie
reviews.content: Good acting in general but Seen lot of similar movies land grabbing stories run by local rowdies or politicians etc in 80's and 90's. This one is related to local God but in general story line is not interesting . May be It's been hyped by local audiences who can relate this story but for an outsider it's totally an average movie. Camera visuals are very average when you compare to recent films. First half is boring and second is little bit moving with well predicted story line . No surprise moments . Music is good . Frankly speaking , it made me little sleepy when I watched in Prime during first half but i made myself motivated to watch as it's been hyped so waiting for turnaround!!

reviews.review_title: A rare combination of divinity and entertainment
reviews.content:
I thoroughly enjoyed the movie right from the first scene till the last one and especially last half an hour when the battle starts between the villagers and the hencmen's of Devendra Suttur and the arrival of Guliga daiva in Shiva , truly a goosebump sequence
The movie is perfect blend of divinity and entertainment in today's world cinema where the movies are just seen for entertainment without any serious thoughts
Kantara stands apart from such kind of movies and is one more masterpiece of South industry in 2022 , after movies like RRR , KGF 2 , Ponniyin Selvan 1 and Vikram amongst others respectively.

Wowww, goosebumps after goosebumps, i have never seen or felt anything like this, everything about this movie is divine, the music the cinematography, the story, the performances, Simply Awesome, Rishabh Anna thank you so much for this amazing experience. 🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏. Everyone should watch this masterpiece with there families to get to know what is movie making is about and how deep a movie can impact on ones conscience. I have no words to describe how beautifully Rishabh Shetty has shown the various rituals and traditions of sanatan dharma, my koti koti pranam to you Shetty Anna, and i wish to see more of such ventures.

reviews.review_title: The forests echo the language of gods.
reviews.content: There are some stories which god decides to tell, humans are merely the medium, kantara is that story.The more you are aware of and respect the elements, the closer you reach to the One who created them.Kantara is visceral and primal. Its unbridled rawness makes our masked selves uncomfortable.It blurs the lines between the realms of intuition and experience. It roars into you and demolishes your faux sense of control by creating a moment of reckoning and truth.But, most important of all, Kantara illuminates the recognition, that you may abandon the gods, but the gods won't abandon you. All that is needed is a moment of complete surrender.Nivedita Tiwari via Twitter.

Movie speaks about a divine godly force that has been worshipped by people from the tribal ages. It's an eye candy of experience to people who love watching story driven old mythological stories.I only hope that Rishabh Shetty and team keep bringing out such hidden stories to the modern generation.. it not only educates them about the old beliefs, but also shares the old gens point of view of things that were shared down to multiple generations.Make up artist have done a wonderful job and also Rishabh and all the supporting actors have done an amazing job. Keep up the good work guys. You guys are a testament of "Hard work and talent working in synergy"

Long time ago I watched "7aum Arivu" a Tamil film. It gave me chills in the beginning for the first five or ten minutes but later I kept wondering why I was watching it... Now years later comes Kantara. I got the similar chills in the beginning but later begins the same kind of stuff that is seen in most of our films... However there's something else in this movie... The almost two hours of average movie period turns into thrilling entertainment in the concluding 10 minutes with a mind-blowing performance by Rishab Shetty that gave me goosebumps.. hats off to a brilliant display of acting, editing, sound and visuals.

reviews.review_title: I was speechless for couple of hours after the movie
reviews.content: I was lost in the movie. Everything is so perfect. Storyline, song placement, no judgements and conclusions. The music throughout the movie is perfectly aligned, no songs are unnecessarily placed, in fact songs are part of the story. Depiction of the culture of costal Karnataka, indigenous people and their practices, forest, mystery, The act of GuLiga and at the end, and after the thunderstorm of GuLiga, the Varaharupam song. OMG, this is an epic. Unfortunately, if someone does not know about the Costal Karnataka practices, they would not be able to connect it so well. Happy to see such meaningful movie running well and people accepting it.

reviews.review_title: Kantara the best Indian Kannada tradition based movie
reviews.content: Watched like it has all ingredients, salt, everything. I think it is going to be nominated for the Oscar. Class is in each and every aspect of the movie. What I can say just awesome. Thanks bro Rishabh. It was a folk Indian tradition reflects the traditional kannad ritual. Really Really a true act and it's really Good acting. It represents the tullu kannad community and it's traditional worship. It is based on true events and tradition with a story based on a lesson for the generation. It is based on a culture so Google the things do not judge, just read and learn, I have watched this movie. I have give 10 stars as it deserves thanks.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie, just Hype and overrated
reviews.content: I was expecting something like Tumbbad after reading synopsis/summary on IMDB and it's rated 9.2 so I thought it should be mythological like Bahubali or Tumbbad.Whole movie is based on wild boars, in most of the film, main character is hunting them. In the name of 'mythology', main character dreams about a boar like every 30 minute for 10 seconds, that's it.In my opinions it is a typical South Indian movie with mild references to Hindu mythology.The ratings are result from bombardment of 10 rating by the people who are influenced by the culture shown in movie, not by story itself. I have been watching movies based on ratings and reviews on IMDB since 2008 and it has been quite helpful. Now a days you can't trust IMDB rating because now new movies are often full of fake ratings like this one. Its should be rated not more than 7.5/10 according to the story.Hope, my review helps! Wrote this after many years because I wanted to point out this trend.

The movie is very bad and i suggest not to watch it.The whole movie is very bad and is nonsense
The character just scrames ahhh ahh and is mad.The storyline is bad and yet many people loved it the people in south might like it but we can't.The fighting is also bad and can't also understand which character is which and the fighting is nonsense too.The horror part is also not good enough too scare people and also 3times the demigod comes to scare.The acting is very bad yet some people like it
Songs are also not good and and the tunes is also not good enough for vibing
I hate this movie....

reviews.review_title: I love this movie and will probably consider it an all-time favorite.
reviews.content: I had the pleasure of seeing this incredible film, and I am in complete awe of it. The way that it communicates powerful and important messages with grace and meaning is truly remarkable. It is thrilling, inspiring, funny, raw, and genuine all at the same time. It is a beautiful representation of a different culture and perspective, and it is a reminder of what can be accomplished when powerful stories are told. As an American, I have seen the best of our movies go downhill for decades, so being able to watch a movie like this from another culture is so refreshing and inspiring. It is a reminder that powerful stories can still be told, and it is a reminder to never forget the importance of human perspectives. This movie is an absolute must-see, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a powerful and meaningful story.

I have seen a lot of movies but this one is very special in a sense that it connects me with my roots. I started thinking about our Kuldevata and how he protects me and my family. How all the rituals we perform has some divine meaning to them. It's truest a BHARATIYA movie which depicts our culture in respectable manner. The background scores won't leave for days I promise you and the climax.... I have no words what I felt in the last 20 of the movie. It transcended me into a different demention. Never knew such a humble movie can give me so much joy. PLEASE WATCH THIS IN THEATRE AND EXPERIENCE DIVINITY.

Yesterday I was this movie and the most important thing what is the direction marvelous direction and the still the Marbles acting and this movie should be given to the Oscar in next year and this is ab wonderful movie I never see the movie like this is it true experience of Hindi cinema is beautiful colours and mythology and drama and full of action. This movie is belong to the local mythology drama where you can believe your god is still there and they always help you and every condition. Dear all this is my humble request to all of you please fast the Indian most dramatic mythology action suspense thriller movie of Indian cinema.

Oh boy what a movie, the story is pretty much similar to Karnan, but the fact is its way better than karnan. The boar the demigod dreams everything syncs with karnan, its way better than karnan. Kantara seems to be the best. A simple story and screenplay nothing new but the intensity shown and the way i can connect with my ancestoral gods. Yes it was really touchy for me since we have a beleif of our ancestrol gods we worship in our village which is a general custom. I could really connect with the core story since it was related with ancestoral gods. The climax was a epic unbelieveable. Overall a good film and if u r from village u will sure love this film. Rishab shetty omg he just killed with his performances , the best so for from him as i know. Kishore and the antogonist did their roles very well. There was a bit of commercial content cleavage and stuffs which can be avoided but it goes well within the story so no issues. But could have avoided. Kudos to the camera work which is really good and the vfx too. Pls do watch it in amazon prime.

Especially the. Background score, cinematography, Lighting, Storyline, Climax. Hard work of respective team is clearly visible in the making of the movie-may it be the cameraman or the music composer. Ever department in the movie making have exceeded in respective performances.Introduction of Rishab Shetty who plays the protagonist in the movie is extraordinarily picturized. Lot of hard work by the actor himself in doing the stunts is commendable.Personal feeling is that the first fighting scene could have been avoided. But having said that, overall I should. Say that this is a MUST WATCH movie.

Kantara staring Rishab shetty, Saptami gowda, Kishore, Achyuth kumar in lead role has a solid script with well crafted screen play
The story line revolves with the conflict between tribal people and present generation localites who are greedy with them
Bgm and varaha roopam song sounds excellent, beautiful piece of cinematography with minimal lighting effects and good camera works,all characters was given good importance on screen
Very good acting performance in
the first 15 minutes and the climax 20 minutes which was absolutely unimaginable, where devotion marks the end, full credits to rishab shetty, must watch it in theaters
Kantara deserves a National Award for sure.

Interesting story and climax. The humour does work some times. But two things are serious issues. The dubbing in Hindi is bad. And it takes away a lot from authenticity of the story telling. Secondly, the first half of movie is slow. A 20 minutes taken of would have made the story telling brisk and interesting.Acting is reasonably good and so is characterisation of most of the actors. Loved the makeup and simplicity of production. The music is forgettable though.Now there is talk about sending the movie for Oscars. Definitely not that standard. There are many more amazing movies. Just because it has interesting climax does not make it Oscar worthy.

reviews.review_title: Once in a while such movie's come
reviews.content:
I will not delve into regular things which others have covered. What I find very interesting is
The ending is explained in the beginning, still I doubt anyone can pick it up
Yamaha rx100. It was craze in india during 1990. Movie was in 1990.Panjurli and Guliga are two different demigods. Panjurli gives prosperity and direction where Guliga punishes. In the end which one comes alive. Guess it.Varaha song background saxophone sound is very similar to kadri gopalnath tune. We never gave it big deal.Beautiful song corriagraphed inside the tile factory. I couldn't understand in the beginning. Only second time I realised it.The fight scene with rain and fire, was class above. Never ever experienced such scenes.Village background captured early morning with mist was really beautiful.Only thing which I regret and wish was not there is peeping scene, and one more romance scene.

This is not just a movie but an experience. It's like you sit on a roller coaster and feel that you've never felt before. The overall experience cannot be put into words. Its something that I've never seen before in any movie. Everything in the movie seemed too perfect. The background music of the movie is so well that it perfectly resonates with the scenes. The climax gives you goosebumps that will continue even after you're out of the cinema hall. Each moment of the climax scene is so well put that it takes the viewer to another level. It's is a must watch movie. I don't think we are gonna see this type of movie with such experience anytime soon.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Amazing Masterpiece, It's Rishab Shetty Way All The Way !!!
reviews.content: The story begins in the 18th century when a king gives a piece of land to the tribals in exchange for peace, joy and prosperity. Centuries later, consumed by greed and selfishness, the king's successor tries to threaten villagers during Bhoota Kola to return the land. But his mysterious death puts an end to the debate. Twenty years later, forest officer Murali, who considers himself the custodian of forest, tries to put an end to 'unscientific rituals' of the forest-dwellers, in a bid to save the forest. But hot-headed Shiva, who believes that the forest does not need to be saved as it is not in danger, takes Murali head on. Though their intentions are same, their way of dealing with it is poles apart. This results in several heated arguments and fights between the two. Leela (Saptami Gowda), a newly appointed forest guard, is initially caught in the crossfire between the villagers and the forest department. But she quickly takes a stand, which puts Shiva in trouble. Landlord (Achyut Kumar), who is also the successor of the dynasty, and now a local politician, also has his eyes on the ancestral property. Who does the land actually belong to ?A predictable storyline that is embellished with technical brilliance to make it a unique experience. Kantara is a Rishab-Shetty-show all the way. He shines as the director as well as the protagonist. The cinematography pulls you into the film and makes you a part of it. The first half has a very engaging storyline and apt comedy with quirky one-liners in coastal dialect. The second half, however, delves deep into the actual story of culture and tradition, blended with a little bit of mystery. The biggest take away is the pre-climax and climax, which is conceived and performed to perfection. Rishab Shetty's performance in the last 20 minutes is chilling. Since he comes from the coastal region, the mannerisms have come out effortlessly on screen. The movie shows the hidden, aggressive side of Rishab as an actor.Kishore gives an equally powerful performance as forest officer. His bald, clean-shaven look adds gravitas to his role. Saptami Gowda has nothing impactful to do till the climax and she has put up a decent show. Achyut Kumar, as a cunning landlord, is a valuable addition. Pramod Shetty, Praveen Tumbe and others have played impactful fillers. The way all these characters come together to tell a compelling story is brilliant.The film is a visual grandeur. DOP Aravind Kashyap has done a brilliant job with lighting and frames. A lot of attention is given to the making, which is dipped in folklore. Situational village comedy works well for the film. The film explores the culture of Tulunadu without any compromise. B Ajaneesh Loknath's music is soothing. With plenty to savour for both mass and class audience, Kantara undoubtedly makes for a wonderful experience.Rishab's biggest victory, I believe, is that he's been able to transport his audiences to this tiny hamlet and be involved in everything going on there. Taking a rooted tale and presenting it to a larger audience is a gamble; not everyone may take a shine to it. But if you at least manage to create an iota of interest in the subject among this audience, it's a job well done. Kantara may not be perfect on all counts, but it will go down in history as a film that will be remembered for all the right reasons.

Just two words for this movie classic and connecting. Being Goan I could get connected to this movie in its first 15 mins only.We have tradition in Goa called Shigmo where actual God come into person body. I could relate this movie to this.This movie is just a maasterpiece. The writers and directors have thought upon all the expects and actors dedications towards the acting are just Marvel.Dialogue delivery, expression an timing of sound effects are much much better than lots of high budget Bollywood movies.Hands up for such great movie and all cast along with the people in supporting.Thanks for giving such Masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: Must watch. First 2 hours is good last 30 minutes is very very good 👍
reviews.content: The story is simple. Around 150 to 200 years before, a local king ends up giving away a portion of his land to a group of tribals. The tribals settles in this land and make it their homes. Current time, Govt considers this land as forest encroachment and orders the tribals to vacate the place. The descendents of the King also get involved in this and they feel that they are the owner of this land.Everyone has given a brilliant performance and Rishab steals the show in the climax. Achyuth Kumar, Sapthami, Kishore, Pramod Shetty and other supporting actors have done great justice to their role. The last 30 minutes is the best I have seen in the recent past. Do not wait till it comes to OTT. Its a theatre movie.

reviews.review_title: A gritty tale expertly woven around a culture and nature.
reviews.content: The buzz around Kantara has been more than unreal. It has been some achievement for this film to gain the popularity nationwide despite not being a pan India release. The increased level of popularity for Sandalwood due to other big releases earlier this year also has helped the cause. But this doesn't take away the fact that Kantara is a well-made film satisfying mass audiences and critics alike. Rishab Shetty has got the right balance of entertainment with good storytelling.The incidents in the movie span across almost a century relating to a piece of land and the inhabitants. The story is all about different kinds of conflicts between humans, nature, and a higher power. There are some fantasy elements added to the mix as well, but it is also shown in such a way that it is left up to the viewer's discretion. Rishab Shetty again excels in introducing the audience to some new cultural elements of the coastal region and its people. You can see the enhanced production values as compared to his previous movies as this is produced by Hombale Films. However, the budget has been spent to perfection and doesn't seem unnecessarily extravagant. Cinematography is exceptional and the sequences shot in the dark are not hard to watch unlike most other movies. The action sequences seem a bit choreographed which can seem unnatural for a movie like this, but it definitely adds to the look and feel of this film. The choice of keeping the main timeline around 1990s gives a lot of creative freedom to the director especially with respect to some characters. One of the best things about the movie is the well-integrated innocent humour. It was very refreshing to see the old school humour but none of it felt repetitive. The dialogues are majorly in the native dialect and subtitles will definitely be helpful even for the Kannada audience at times. The background score is very apt and feels deeply connected with the movie's theme. Although most things near perfect the movie kind of has a conflict with its own theme at times. The movie sometimes goes from a serious track to comedy in no time without really atoning to the consequences.This has to be Rishab Shetty's career best performance as an actor. All credit goes to him for handling an intense role while directing the movie. As lauded by many, his performance in the last few minutes and his characteristic shout (scream?) while donning the 'Kola' getup is a once in a lifetime experience. Kishore (as Murali) and Achyuth Kumar has tailor made roles for them. However, the character arcs of both Shiva and Murali could have been much better especially considering the events that lead to the climax. Manasi Sudhir as Shiva's (Rishab Shetty) is very natural and really suits the character. Sapthami Gowda and other supporting actors around Rishab Shetty do their part. Deepak Rai Paanaje as Sundara is hilarious and subtle. I hope to see him getting more comedic roles in the future. The movie nails it with respect to the casting and it is good to see that they haven't unnecessarily spent money on popular actors for limited roles.Kantara is definitely a one of its kind film and yet another rich cultural juggernaut from the Sandalwood Shetty clan. It truly deserves all the recognition and accolades for adding another feather in Sandalwood's cap.

Kantara is a Kannada film written & directed by & starring Rishab Shetty, who weaves a deeply cultural story with divinity, village politics and the ever shifting relationship between Nature and Humans. A forest village protected by a Demigod, comes under threat when the landlord tries to reclaim the lands which were donated by the former king. Rishab plays the character of Shiva, a delinquent who is haunted by the demigod because he avoids his destiny and what a magnificent performance by him, throughout the film he is complex, loud and subtle at the same time and in the climax he just sends shivers down everyone's spine. The cinematography especially of the nighttime by Arvind Kashyap is gorgeous. Sound design plays a big factor in this film as well as the background score. The action is well designed with some neat camera work. There is a lot of comedy by Shiva's buddies in the first half, which is really fun to watch but it dampens the serious turn that it takes later and lessens the impact of the climax. But its such a unique theater experience, especially for urban audience, who remains far away from this ancient cultural mysticism of our country and divine acts of deities.

reviews.review_title: Good but dont understand the hype
reviews.content: The second half of the movie is where it picks pace. The cinematography is good, locations look real and the characters also are portrayed realistically. The basic story is of a wayward drinking stealing short tempered ruffian guy finding his true call and duty to his tribe which elevates him beyond humanity in the end.The fight scenes are shot well. The story had no twists for me and the first half dragged a bit. The main premise of the movie was around forest land but I felt they never make a strong point on conservation but more on the land rights of the natives. In fact the Hero is killing animals ,cutting trees and attacks the forest officer who questions the encroachments. Yes the tribes have the first right but the forest must also survive for them.Maybe it was the language and cultural barrier, I could not understand the hype behind the movie. Yes Rishabh Shetty deserves the Best Actor award for his phenomenal efforts.

The entire cast and crew of Kantara have taken the art of storytelling on a large canvas, to another level.One of the frames suddenly had my daughter jumping on to my lap :)The understated humour embedded in mtiple scenes had me and my wife laughing uncontrollably.Typical Dakshina Kannada words and phrases replete in the dialogues was a treat to hear in a theatre, especially for non resident Dakshina Kannadigas like me.Powerful visualisation and narration of folklore, traditions and rituals have never been weaved into a blockbuster movie like this, ever before. Brilliance of the lead actor is so bright that it pales rest of the cast to a certain extent.Will watch it again.

The Dop and cinematography was lit .Kudos to Hombale for believing in such a content and producing it and I'm looking forward for all their production movies . This is called real masterpiece. The cinematography, writing, screenplay, comedy timings, beautiful nature, and most importantly climax. How can someone act like that way. Rishabh shetty is really awesome. No one can beat him. This is the true cinema of our indian culture. We have to proud our culture our talent. reviews.review_title: A movie that I am still seeing inside me
reviews.content: There are movies that we watch and forget. There are some we love, and then move on to the next one. There are some that we remember for a few days. Only a few start living and growing inside you with every day passing.Kantara is one such masterpiece.Dedication to the roots and conviction in the story are the two elements that stand out about Rishabh Shetty. Of course, Kantara also puts him on a pedestal of the best all-time all-around talent Indian Cinema has produced thus far.Everything about this movie is mindblowing; the music (Varaah Roopam is still ringing inside me), action, comedy, underlying themes, and the layering of issues. Most importantly, how Rishabh ropes all this in a fantastic entertainment package without losing devoutness towards the village deity is just out of this world.It made me remember my childhood visits to our village and has rekindled my curiosity and reverence for our Kul Devta.It is no ordinary movie but a masterclass of movie-making and a must watch for all, irrespective of age, town, status. It will connect you with your roots and give you goosebumps even after you are out of theatre.

No one could have imagined such a movie before, Its ending is very different Absolutely divine feeling Bollywood people should take a lesson from this Such a film is rarely made in Bollywood. Rishab Shetty has done a wonderful job as an actor and director. And the story he wrote is amazing and relates to reality He has shown the culture of India in the right way From the moment the film starts, a connection is felt with the film Such a movie is made once in decades. This movie shows Hinduism in a proud way Doesn't run agenda like Bollywood. We should support this movie and those who have not seen it, they should go and watch it, It's a feeling.

The story revolves around a mysterious forest and Its Villege and The Daiva, It A Action Packed Thriller Story With Romance and Horror Elements, A Story based On culture and Rawness Of the Village Of 90's, The cinematography Is mind blowing and The background Music Gives Goosebumps, You can see the hard work In Every scenes. The actors acted so well it doesn't even feel like a Movie, feels like you are actually vitnesing the Story as it happening.The Story is Good, 1st half Is to introduce the charters and village, And the second half The revolt of the village and the Demigods Wrath, about the last 20mins of the film. It Can't be explained by words, It must be experienced. This Film is Must Be enjoyed At theaters and Don't wait for the ott release. It an experience For sure.In the end I just want to say.The story is the king! And the last 20mins Climax is the crown.

reviews.review_title: A brilliant film with some shortcomings

reviews.content:
This film was unnecessarily long but it is a good fun watch when the action sets in.The film is competently made with good acting scripts and filming. The demigod is both weird and interesting.The story has its typical elements of sexism where all women are just trophies to be won or bumps on the journey road for the lead character.The main actor is quite bearable and does an entertaining job. I can't say i remember much about the movie a day after watching it. But the two things i can't forget are
The pot smoking.....
And the WWAAAAAWWWW. Which i believe is an effect of pot smoking. Lol.

This movie is once in a lifetime movie ,the movie is purely a rooted movie based on the western karnataka and its culture .The movie has beautiful cinematography and the visual is mesmerizing the man behind is rishab shetty he killed it every department berote acting the direction and the story writing all were to the point .The climax 15 min will give you that goosebumps thar when you leave the hall you feel a divine positive energy running down in your veins .A divine blockbuster this movie was .This movie depicts the human and nature relationship in a complete different way really love it. It is the best movie of 2022 according to me.

OMG! It's just incredible.kantara will blow your mind just prepare yourself to witness the phenomenal performance of Rishab shetty...i am still in shock that how can they make such a extraordinary climax.from its cinematography to its bgm everything is top notch. Humbly thanks to Rishabh Shetty for giving us this masterpiece. Those climax sequence solely deserves 10/10.don't miss this movie at any cost it is just a divine experience to watch it in large screen as possible.truly cinematic experience deeply rooted in its culture and tradition.. thinking of its climax still gives me goosebumps.🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

Awsome fim you will find humour action story. Cinematography direction and story telling is awsome. The buildup for climax is good and the climax will definitely give you guys ghoosbumbs. The songs are ok but the bgm will give u next level feeling how to make normal shots made a masterpiece director knows very well. You guys will not be dissapionted at all this is my guarantee. Film will does not make you feel bore at any piont of time, but the pace of the film reduces in the middle half but you guys are not gonna feel it because of comedy. If you guys want to summarize the film in a word i will say MASTERPIECE.

The movie is exceptional well written story .I grew up in Malnad seeing many such Demi GOD acts dint make any sense out of it back then but blown away by the multi aspects of the subject and it's portrayal in the movie . The movie transcends you into kantara world and climax leaves you mesmerized .Each and every one has acted so well . Can't help but compare the SHIVA in this movie to SHIVA in bhramhastra both are learning their lineage and power but this character has authencity. Budget does not matter talent and genuine story telling matters . Kudos to whole team for hardwork and genuine interest in sticking to root of the subject.

One of the best movie, I watched yet. The story is really good it Never look we are feeling bored. The Director and contain, acting is really good.. and it give a sense of nature like how we are running the life of schedule tribe..one day someone come and say this is government land and you have to leave ..it's show the face of society and the believe of their system..I can watched this movie again..The acting is really superb and the dance by devta is really good..I still can feel the vibe of the movie..and the end is different..I recommend to watch it ..worth for money..will feel you watched something good..

Really good movie, watch it for Rishab shetty acting, funny, catchy writing songs ok ok
Background score - yeah it's good
Production value is good
Movie feels rich no compromises on executing this.But story dint convince me, still could have made better
Initially feels like hero has a big problem ahead and makes it interesting to know how he gone solve it but later it take light turn n gets diverted.Not with major twist, would still recommend to watch it for good theater experience. Like many other says climax acting is amazing on a routine plot.Long way to go Rishab shetty keep up the good work.

Being a Mangalorean, witnessing the bhoota kola and the power of the daivas is nothing new. But, the way it is depicted in the movie is unbelievable. Was trying to find faults, but did not get a chance. Such was the energy, dedication, acting (or should I call it daiva personified).The last 15-20 mins shows why Rishab as an actor has to be looked out for!!! I will not call it acting as it looked soo real that I am lost for words!!!The only one thing that I felt was it was stretched a little bit towards the end with all those violence, but no regrets... enjoy the movie and learn about the beauty of Tulunadu culture.

reviews.review_title: Over-hyped but still one time watch!
reviews.content: It's the same age old story of rich exploiting the poor that has been told in Indian cinema since early 20th century sprayed with some supernatural/godly elements with very good camera work, acting, location and music.The quality of movies have come down so much that even an average outing gets over-hyped and becomes a hit! This is one such example.There is also a trend now for over the top mindless action like KGF, RRR, karthikeya 2 etc. This one clearly scores over them with more believable action sequences, except the final one which can be justified as godly act.Not bad, decent one time watch.

Must watch movie, believe or not, it is made with comparatively very very low budget of 16 Cr and you can expect a better making quality (SCRIPT, DIRECTION, ACTION, MUSIC, SCREENPLAY, BGM.... Etc) than Bahubali, KGF, Bramhastra any recent Indian movie you name which were made with a very high budget of 100 Cr to 500 Cr.Initially it was released in one language KANNADA, gradually through mouth words it's created a hype and the movie itself created demand for dubbing to other languages. And it's pure dominance of South movie on bollywood.It's a pride of Indian culture , Indian cinema, sandalwood, South India.

Fantastic must watch movie don't forget able movie. Once in life time theatre experience movie this movie is great than KGF2, RRR & BAHUBHALI. PLEASE watch and feel the experience. This movie is unforgettable it can blow up your mind. I highly recommend this movie to others just watch this and feel the once in a Life time experience. I this you explore the south indian culture. This movie is really enthusiastic and provide next level of energy in your body. This movie contain all themes LOVE, ROMANCE, COMEDY, CRIME , DRAMA , THRILLER, HORROR, ADVENTURE, ACTION, HISTORICAL, CULTURAL, etc. PLEASE GO & WATCH.

reviews.review_title: The best movie ever from sandalwood....
reviews.content: Kantara is a representation of Coastal Karnataka culture. It depicts the belief of people on Daiva and Panjurli. Panjurli means the divine spirit of wild boar. It speaks through the body of human in the festival named Bhootha Kola. You will never get bored a single minute, as the movie contain comedy, action, romance, drama, horror and whatnot. The direction is done superbly. Rishabh has done extraordinary in direction and acting both. Other cast have also gave their best. The last 15 minutes of the movie will give you goosebumps for sure. The movie is recommended for true movie lovers. Give it a watch with your family, and I'm sure your money will not be wasted.

Lot of violence and silly drama
Wasted 3 hrs.Very poor, not worth.Whole movie is based on wild boars, in most of the film, main character is hunting them.Very poor recommendationIt has absolutely nothing. I repeat nothing for anyone to get entertained. All that "waaaoooh" shouts all over the movie. No story, no good action, no suspense, no drama, no horror, NOTHING, In the name of 'mythology', main character dreams about a boar like every 30 minute for 10 seconds, that's it.Kantara is poorly executed movie which didn't deserve the hype it has received .My expectations were really really high. But I literally wasted more than 3 hours.8.6/10?!! What a joke!

What a movie...I literally don't have any words to express about this masterpiece blockbuster movie "KANTARA". I Went to the #Kantara movie as a fan of Director Rishab Shetty and came out as a die hard fan of Actor Rishab Shetty. Whole team effort and hard-work paid off. Especially the last 20 minutes Bhoota kola sequence and the performance level of Rishab Shetty will take your breath away.Apart from a Kannadiga as a Tuluva #Kantara is not just a movie for me it's the emotion our culture & tradition.Definitely Rishab Shetty deserves the national award for this outstanding performance.Take a bow king #Rishabshetty.

reviews.review_title: Legendary Kannada movie etched in history books!!!
reviews.content: When a director showcases his best talent of direction, vision, storyline, acting etc.. you end up having 'Kantara'. Stellar acting, mind boggling music, amazing cinematography of the movie makes you believe in your roots, culture, how to strike a balance between good vs evil and humans vs animals. First 15 minutes and Last 20 minutes of the movie shouldn't be missed. Goosebumps guaranteed!!Even after watching the movie, for days you will still be in the world of Kantara. That is the impact this one will have for sure.Hats off to team 'Kantara'. Rishabh Shetty ain't just a normal human. He is a visionary and waiting for his future projects anxiously.

Actors are good but i don't find any suspense or drama in it. Do watch tumbaad you will get Goosebumps after watching, cinematography is best plus story is meaningful and at last you will get a message from movie. But from kantara what message you got who have rated it for more than 8+ rating, answer it to my question so that i might get what i missed in the movie.

Eye feast to watch .superb direction acting and music ..All departments excelled and superb climax .last 20 mins is ultimate ..expecting national award for Rishab All departments excelled and superb climax .last 20 mins is ultimate ..expecting national award for Rishab All departments excelled and superb climax .last 20 mins is ultimate ..expecting national award for Rishab All departments excelled and superb ii climax .last 20 mins is ultimate ..expecting national award for Rishab All departments excelled and superb climax .last 20 mins is ultimate ..expecting national award for Rishab Shetty.

ONE OF THE BEST MOVIE OF 2022
"RISHABH SHETTY" the director, actor and writer, the ONE MAN ARMY. Magnificent Performance was given by him. Especially the CLIMAX, CLIMAX has my HEARTI mean LITERALLY WHAT A CLIMAX! .....this is called A CINEMA EXPERIENCE . THE WAY RISHABH SHETTY PERFORMED IN CLIMAX , IT WAS NEXT LEVEL..... NEXT LEVEL
THE MOVIE HAS EVERYTHING WHAT A CINEMA LOVER WANTS.THE WAY the Traditional, cultural activities of Karnataka region is shown it was PHENOMENAL.The BGM, CINEMATOGRAPHY,COLOR GRADING, VISUALS, FEEL OF the VILLAGE all were just BEAUTIFULMANY MANY BEST WISHES & CONGRATULATIONS TO THE ENTIRE TEAM OF KANTARA.

Kantara not only manages to entertain and engage audience throughout the movie but also conveys deep rooted karavali culture and social issues related to forest land and projects each one's perspective regarding the land. It essentially gives a divine experience to the audience. Rishab Shetty ,single handedly done a fabulous job in direction, acting and story . Choreography, screenplay and backgrounds music need to be mentioned as well extraordinary in this low budgeted movie. Rishab is able to maintain the perfect balance for treating the audience with content, entertainment and spirituality. Hats off to the entire team , great work !

One Of The Greatest Movie Experience In My Life! Gave Me Goosebumps In The Climax.. Get Emotional In The End. Rishab Shetty Acting Was Killing And His Direction Is Mind Thrilling Blowing~ What A Brilliant Performance! Totally Bang. BGM Is Solid As Always In Kannada Industry..Kantara is NOT A Movie. It's An Experience.. 1st Half Is Lightly Lengthy, But In The End It Doesn't Ever Matter! I Really Love The Climax. After I Read Some Context About Guliga The God.Now I Am Fully Satisfied With The Story Of Legend Kantara! Must Watch~ Pure Theatre Experience. Highly Highly Recommend..
I Really Appericiate The Whole Team! What A Bang.

reviews.review_title: More work on story aspects were needed
reviews.content: It's hard work good but loud music rave reviews all can understand but what's with south movies one man necessarily main character beating 15/20 equally hefty goons. So predictable clitches. Suddenly the cop turns good. Villains brilliance vanishes and acts like a foolish man. All other villagers are helpless but for one man.. few scenes stand out but not a masterpeace by any means. Good teamwork n kudos to the team. All south movies try hard to look realistic with poor looking guys hunble n all but in fights the hero can kick a man sending him fly into the space. What's realistic in that. Drushay scored in many aspects. Can't say same about the sequel. No doubt there is a lot of talent there. Looking forward to good stuff.

They have taken it well .. made a commercial movie with traditional practices going on since generations and man/nature balance as central theme .. very well written script - it is made without any judgement or getting intro trap of science vs superstitions and just shows culture the way it is - a belief system.. the climax is very well made and so powerful. The themes handles are deforestation, greed of man, corruption, mythology, Demi gods, villages, agriculture... it's all interspersed very well into a strong script. The starting 1 hour of the movie to me was a little dragging and boring though but in the second half it picked up..:

In my lifetime, 1St time watched a movie but felt the protagonist is not acting.. No words it's a devine experience. Oscar does not have the qualifications to award "This movie" . So guys don't ask for Oscars.Initially i was little hesitant to watch this movie, but thank God my friend forced me to go as he booked without my knowledge. Thanks Nitin to force me to go to watch with you.This movie is a regional movie but Indian mainstream movie production houses and their actors won't be able to make this kind of movie if they take birth 100 times. This movie is made with only 16 crores but the director and actors put 1000crore rupees feelings.

Only good thing in movie is mythology part, story is old and pathetic but the acting and the direction was mind-blowing, i don't know why south indian cinema is so obsessed with eve teasing, Bullying and same old bad boss vs good villagers story 😅
I guess only good thing in movie is when devaa arrived on screen but the climax was amazing, i haven't seen anything like this from years, last i watched tummbad the only movie than deserve 10 out of 10 on IMDb india, but unfortunately no one cares about the masterpiece.Kantara is good but not best, few sequence are good that means only 30 to 35 mins movie is good otherwise same old story.

This terrific movie shows how our culture is deep rooted inside us! Never seen such movies it's so beautifully executed, brilliant acting by Rishab Shetty. The last 30 mins would the highlight of the movie and it is so beautiful to watch and experience the divinity, indeed such a beautiful climax. This should be rated as all time great Indian movie.This movie doesn't need any awards as movie itself is an award given to the people. Showing our great culture, belief and what not
Having said when film has become emotion of the people and so many goosebumps moments 👍🏻For the better experience people must watch this movie in theaters!

Strong story, Great acting, superb direction and cinematography. You don't just watch this movie, the movie get you involve. You can feel the vibes as you are present in the actual scenario in the climax. If by length of movie you think it's long movie then don't worry, not a single minute is shoot out of context. Every character as justified their role and we can sense the rawness required by the character. This movie define what is actually needed to make a great movie and that is not big budget, glamorous actors, great VFX but a good story and directors version to portrait it's character so that the story just follows out of the character.

It is a Cinema Masterpiece.I have no other words but will need to write more to be able to post my review. Actually I am glad that I am doing it.Worth watching. Unparallel theater experience.Everything one can talk about, this movie excels in all.Very different concept, something new but still turns out to be amazingly creative and powerfully entertaining.I saw the Hindi dubbed version, which many a times takes away the feel and emotions of the scenes due to dubbing, but in this case I was left with no less than getting the actual impact the movie would create on someone as an audience.This one should be watched by all for sure. This movie will make you feel satisfied and proud about the enormous talent we have in our country.Hats off and Thank You to Rishab Shetty.

Excellent movie,Rishab shetty you killed it,direction acting & story everything is excellent, and the climax part was superbbb..
It's a legend for kannada film industry..
Heroin Saptamigouda looks pretty cute,Kishor sir is a legend bcoz he is versatile actor,another hit for Hombale films,and Achchut kumar sir superbbb..

reviews.review_title: GOOSEBUMPS! The Era of New World Cinema has begun
reviews.content:
To say it in the style of Paul Heyman, it is not a prediction, it is a spoiler; Rishabh Shetty will surely win the National award for this performance in Kantara.Kantara is a Masterpiece and will be remembered for the next 100 years to come.Amazingly beautiful sets, costumes, sound work by the music team. Especially the climax scene. It actually invokes your forefathers from the dead.One thing that I felt which was missing is, the deapth in the character of Guruva. Few love scenes could have reduced and the character of Guruva could have been given some more screen time.Other than that. This film deserves Great awards in the coming years and Rishabh shetty Nailed it. Makers, Thankyou for the experience
That's the review. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Best climax and acting i ever seen in indian cinema
reviews.content: Its simple awesome story they made into astonished, unimaginable. Every characters in movie beautifull acting and no word for rishab shetty writer director, mismerized acting. Best cinematography, best story, unimaginable climax, no words to say about rishab acting, from entry seen to climax just wow. Rishab given a exapmle of movie cant be hit by high budget big star. Its just just story, acting and execution makes movie bring fans attract to theatre. This movie not 3 hours entertainment. I never made a review of any indian movies but this movie forced to write a review. Like to see more to come from rishab shetty.

A pure divine experience of culture, it's rituals and the spiritual energy behind those rituals.. Every shot in this movie is a visual treat for the eyes..
The bgm is felt in your gut with its intensity.. The actors are another level with their ability to express through the characters..the rawness is deeply rooted in indian culture absolutely unapologetic and truly beautiful.. The fight scenes, emotions, music.. And then finally the climax.. An experience i would never forget.. Rishabh Shetty transcends to a different dimension in these powerful scenes, embodying the essence of the fierce energy of the gram devata.. Ah.. Blissful.

reviews.review_title: One time watch - missed opportunity! Could have been better
reviews.content: Don't believe the hype! Firs 20 minutes and last 10 minutes is what people are raving about. Thes rest of the movie is a typical movie.They should learn from movie like tummbad where the storyline keep people engaged throughout and deliver with solid ending.This one is just not worth the hype!The leads acting is good but gets diminished through sloppy screenplay and unnecessary elements.The director didn't know what kind of movie he wanted to make, songs are useless and don't add to the story. Characters are loosely written and the main diety is not fleshed out as it should have been to keep audience engaged.Just a typical revenge story with supernatural elements added to it.

I have seen Kanthara movie in tamil today at Chennai. First time watching Rishab Shetty movie. Last 30 minutes of movie shows what a great actor he is. Movie full of comedy, action, sentiment, soulful. Thanks for the multi talented actor/director/writer Rishab Shetty for given this movie. Great experience to watch this movie in theatre.All the characters in the movie have done a great job. If possible release increase the show time for this movie in other states.Narrating the story to the audience is a skill and Narrating an intense story in a simple way to understand requires more talent and Rishab Shetty is master in it.

This is one masterpiece that can be made once in a decade!Rishab Shetty, has come out with a wonderful these to depict the rich culture of Hindu traditions from the coastal Karnataka. Watch it in theatre to feel the trance!The BGM is fantastic, the music is soothing - especially the "Varaha Roopam" will remain in your ears for a long time. The cinematography is awesome which perfectly shows the a village in the backdrop of the forest thats back from 90s.Please watch it in theatre and dont wait for it to hit the OTT. Sure, you would want to watch it many times to feel and connect with the divinity the movie takes you in the last 20 mins :)

Story is routine one and seems to be ok and heros performance is better than other actors performance, too much of shouting by the particular characters makes you annoyed during movie watch. It's a one time watch movie and if you have kids lesser than 5years it's better to watch in OTT then going to movie theater. Most part of the movie is running in dark back groud visuval effets to be improved. Dubbing is not as good as expeteted would have concentrated on this part as well. Expect hero no one is projected well in the movie which show director skills hear aswell. Movie is hyped not considering the reality.

One of the best movies in Indian cinema. Rooted story, stunning visuals, impeccable actors, deeply resounding music and spiritually invigorating. The story, direction and acting by Rishab Shetty is poetic. Very rarely do you get to see a movie that unites the country. Amazing movie. One of the best movies I have ever seen...It shows the culture and trust on Daiva...Best wishes to the team.... Whole family cam sit and watch this movie together...What an acting... Superb.....
This kind of the movies are expected...One of the best thing to see our Sandalwood movie are going to the National and International level...So happy that all over the world people are watching, recognising and appreciating our movie... People should make these kind movie in the future... Bollywood also should learn to make these kind of movie in future... People have become educated to select and watch the movies now a days.

reviews.review_title: Masterpiece - it's an offering not a movie
reviews.content: The movie is a lesson in the art of story telling - how our lives are intertwined across generations with the land, nature and the deities who act as the bridge between the two. Rishab Shetty and the creators have ensured that the screenplay and cinematography is so water tight that the audience is bound to their seats from the start till the end.There is not a single dull moment in the entire movie where each scene or frame complements and enriches the next one. The Daiva-Aradhane, be it in the form of darshanas or nema/kola has been depicted authentically. So have the other aspects of tulunadu village life like kambala, kor-da-aata, farming, hunting, collecting firewood/leaves, even the clothing is authentic.The final 10 minutes of the movie is a spell-binding divine experience which needs to be seen and felt.Kudos to Rishab and his entire team.

reviews.review_title: No other movie can take place of this one.

This is the best movie I have seen ever. By all means. The most important thing is it has valuable meaning and message for people. Nature is first and forever. In our busy routine, we are forgetting the tradition and our roots. This movie take us to the life we need to live in. Dharma is the way to live life.

Until I watched this movie, my all-time favourite Indian movie was PS-1 which has intellect, sophistication, complex politics, seduction, and of course the unmistaken grandeur that emitted . It is a well researched and well crafted movie.Just contradicting PS-1 came Kantara which gave raw cultural values. The movie made on such low budget gave everything that an audience wants to see. Splendid acting, crafty dialogues, vivid colors of Bhootha Kola, heart pounding horror, catchy BGM, local musical pieces, exemplary cinematography, and when you think you have seen it all, comes the climax. My eyes are still wide open and my jaw is still fallen on the floor of the theater.I have watched it twice in 24 hours. I am going again for the 3 time today.It is a lifetime experience that cannot be missed. I am not going to wait for its digital edition because this is a movie made for big screens.

reviews.review_title: Master class in art film making, take a bow Rishabh Shetty
reviews.content: It's not every day you see a movie, which leaves a lasting impression long after the curtains come down! Its not every day , every facet and ingredient of the movie not only excels by itself but blends so well with all others to make a fabulous and unique movie, its not every day that a subliminal message about the burning issues of environment, ecology, and its protection , man versus nature is so beautifully and subtly brought out, its also not every day a movie can actually glamorise and respectfully depict what most urban dwellers would have dismissed as mere superstition and blind faith, aspects like Kola, gram devathe, Panjurli, Guliga, incredibly rich but rooted traditions of coastal Karnataka aka tulunaadu! As the curtains come down in any normal movie, there is a huge rush to exit the halls, not this time, half the people were glued to their seats , not knowing what has hit them, this says more than anything about the movie!

First of all let me talk about the climax.When I was watching the last 10 minutes of the movie I was literally shivering in the theatres. I just thought it was me. But at the end of it everybody were sharing their experience of shivering. So I thought I wasn't alone.The story is out of the box.It's just amazing.The movie starts as an epic and proceeds to be a normal entertaining movie but at the end it exceeds the definition of epic because of the experience.The songs especially"varaha roopam" is just marvelous. Even"singara siriye" is also very melodious. The BGM oh my god ajaneesh Loknath hats off man.And finally to the director actor and writer of the film RISHAB SHETTY take a bow 🙏👏👏
