Absolutely mind-blowing. Rishabh Shetty has produced a gem that's every penny worth watching in a theater. I watched the Hindi dubbed version of it.The story is quite gripping and although the movie is 2.5 hours, it doesn't feel like. Especially the way it respects the Hindu culture, unapologetically, is brilliant.The action sequences are great. Especially when I compare it with Baahubali, they're as clean as that was. With such a small budget, it's commendable that the team was able to manage such clean VFX. I also compare it with a more recent PS1 where the action sequences were not that well executed in terms of VFX.The cast was totally new to me but great job.One thing I particularly liked about the dubbing was that they left out certain dialogs, the one by Deiv, undubbed which was a brilliant move. It gave much more authenticity to the movie and helped keep the impact of those moments on the watching experience intact. That was key, especially in the climax.Talking about the climax, man - that was ABSOLUTELY MIND-BLOWING!!! Kudos to the team for the amazing ending. More than paisa vasool.Overall, A MUST WATCH.

So the overall movie was not good enough to watch more than 1hour. It could be a short film instead of full length movie.

reviews.review_title: This will be remembered as the Golden Age of Indian Cinema
reviews.content: Very rarely do films succeed in transporting you so fully and completely into another world.This film truly feels like a blessing from the gods.I feel blessed to have seen it.The film is not perfect, but its flaws are ultimately insignificant in front of its shining radiance.If Tumbbad and Kantara are any indication of where Indian cinema is heading, then we are all very blessed indeed.I wish this film reaches to the farthest corners of the world and is seen by as many people around the world as possible.I can't imagine the kind of effort and dedication that must have been put into this film.I have no doubt that this will be remembered as either the Golden Age of Indian Cinema or the Great Awakening or something like that.Hats off to the entire film crew - for making this beautiful, amazing, divine film, and putting your heart and soul into it.I still have goosebumps, and I will watch the film again and again and again and show it to as many people as I can.

reviews.review_title: Perspective of South movie should be avoided
reviews.content: Don't go for the movie with the expectations of a south movie. Just experience the movie. Its rawness, its direction, cinematography and the must ActingSecondly do little research about Panjurli and Guligae to understand the setting and culture. Then you can understand and comment as well.Panjurli and Guliage are the Ganas of Shiv. They are worshiped in the form of demigods also known as Bhoota. Also Bhoota means Past in the sense of bhoot kaal. Ancestors here used to worship this shiv ganas, specially panjurli because panji (wild boars) used to destroy their rice fields. Ancestors decided to speak and worship the spirits of this panji and started worshipping panjurli their spirit god (demigod) to save them from all the calamities and menance. Kola is the form of worship done in the form of dance. Hence you see rice is feeded to Panjurli during the Kola, so that panjurli accepts the offerings and save them. Guligae is the kshetrapal, who protects the kshetra. Panjurli and Guliage stay together in Many parts of this region there by protecting the locals.

reviews.review_title: Kantara-will blow you out (mark it you will watch it again and again).
reviews.content: "Kantara" adds one more feather to Rishab Shetty's cap.A cult classic.Kantar showcases the connect of mother nature with it's people and their belief.Kambala and boothakola are precisely acted out and shown in the movie, goosebumps are common throughout this movie.Raw emotions like anger, love, faith, revenge, repercussion, forgiveness, greed, helplessness, fear are beautifully captured, while into the movie one will not feel like he/she is watching it, one will get a feel that everything is happening in front of them in real.Last 15mintues this movie will take you to a different level.A movie one will not be able to get out of their head even after leaving the cinema hall, shiva, bulla, rampa, mural, suttooru, lawyer, shivas mother, kailasa and more will stay along for quiet some time.Not even a single frame or second where one will move his/her head away from the screen.You will fall in love with the movie it's guaranteed.A must watch movie, no doubts you will love it for sure.

reviews.review_title: Breathtaking movie experience amidst Mysterious culture
reviews.content: Watched premiere show of Kannada movie - Kantara (Mysterious Forest) in Mangalore on 29 Sep 2022. Firstly, special accolades for Rishab Shetty, Ajaneesh Loknath for stunning acting & top-class music. The amazing climax choreographed by Raj Shetty will surely be remembered for long time.Engaging grounded storyline depicting conflicts amidst Karavali (Coastal Karnataka Tulunadu) culture & beliefs & forest law & localities livelihood & land greed & casteism is realistically well portrayed.Bhoota Kola spirit worship rituals & Kambala buffalo race are presented in stylized yet authentic way.Stunning cinematography, Haunting BGM, Melodious songs, Good nativity comedy, Thrilling action sequences, Mysterious real forest backdrop around Kundapura region makes a unique cinematic experience. Above all top-notch direction and good performance by all.Overall a superlative movie and a must watch for all in theatre 👌👌👌

reviews.review_title: Pure talent and what a wonderful outcome
reviews.content: Really loved watching this movie. What a story, direction and acting by Rishabh Shetty sir. You have shown us what pure hard work and talent means. A standing ovation to you and your team sir.Thank you for introducing the southern culture to us.Would recommend everyone to watch this movie.After watching this movie, I learned little bit about Rishabh Shetty sir and their tours to Maharashtra, their attire and simplicity shows how down to earth this person is. Do spread love and your culture to the whole India and outside India as well.Music: This has uplifted the movie to next level. The background score with small instruments is remarkable and the song Varah Roopam, which is mixed with electric distorted guitar and classical, another super hit hard work.All the best to the production and the team. Keep up the good work.

reviews.review_title: What a master piece by Rishab Shetty !!!
reviews.content: One Of The Greatest Movie Experience In My Life! Gave Me Goosebumps In The Climax.. Get Emotional In The End. An Astounding movie. Exceptional performance by Rishabh Shetty. The Bhoothakola scene gives goosebumps and brings up tears in the eyes of the viewers. Flawless movie but it would've been great if Leela, female protagonist's struggle between her job and her tribe was highlighted more. Other than that the movie is an Ace. Though the character of Achyuth Kumar was expected to be the Antagonist, writer Rishabh Shetty has exceptionally made the transition of the role. The role of Muralidhar, the forest officer is very well written and has been excellently portrayed by Kishore Kumar. The reference of Varaha, the third Vishnu is mind bending. For those who did not understand the reference. Vishnu incarnated as Varaha in order to save Mother Earth from Hiranyaksha. Similarly in the movie Shiva the protagonist is seen as Varaha who will be saving the land from Devendra. The picture of Varaha constantly haunts Shiva and is consistently given a message. This movie is a blockbuster, which has incorporated culture, mythology and nature in just one movie.

Cinema is an artwork. What a artist envisions, if that is replicated into the minds of the viewers with the medium (the art piece), the artist is successful.In this case, kantara tries to take us into the journey of a tribal village facing off with the landlord king and Statesman officer. With a pinch of love story and friendship of shiva, the protagonist. We can ignore some cheap jokes made by some characters and creepy acts done by the protagonist in order to show his love towards he girl, because its not utopia. This deep dive into the culture of coastal karnataka, in the forest of dakshin karnataka, you can feel every aspect of their lives. Director very smartly inserts a divine aspect of the village into the storyline, and leaves you on your toes. Every character has his story and no one seems to be forced into the story. The bull scene also is neatly put up on the screen. These little cultural aspects of film makes it rooted and more impacting. With action, comedy and love angle, this film makes the audience engage and at the end surprise them with the divine experience. If people everyone in india can feel the divinity in the culture that they never were aware of, I think the cinema is successful in what it was meant to deliver, after that people may have issues with what social issues the film touched, but for me, the film one of the finest films of this decade of India cinema.

I am not into film reviews but I could not stop myself for sharing my feedback on this one. #kantarareview.Off late I have started liking south Indian movies for their unique content and VFX!!With so much of hype around the movie #kantara I was intrigued to watch the movie so much so that I had to inquire if its a UA movie and can be accompanied by a kid. Since the release the movie it has gotten great reviews by lot of celebrities and one of the most reputed ratings website #IMDBRating. Well honestly, I have personally come to a conclusion that either I don't understand or resonate with this kind of cinema or even the most reputed websites offer manipulated reviews. The movie was fast paced with no real sense or purpose, sluggish, silly jokes and a big drag. There were some twist of sorts but they way it has presented was really illogical. With due respect to the director and the entire team but it was a huge disappointment and waste of a festive time. And what's most shocking is the UA rating given to the movie inspite of all the violence, aggressive scary characters, abusive language and a scene which has killing of a small child. I am sorry if I have hurt anyone's sentiments or efforts but I am just saying the truth. So be aware what you are going for and my suggestion is don't take kids along in case you still decide to see how bad the movie is.

Not meant for review, no words to express felling after the watch. We felt deeply connected and can only done by Rishabh Shetty being deeply rooted to place can pull this off. Movie with no flaws watched it so many times brilliant acting by cast , mind-blowing music and camera work .Last few minutes felt vibration throughout body seeing Rishabh acting felt divine blessings behind it ,tears rolled down eyes at end 🙏This needs to reach highest audience across India.

The folk culture song of Bhoothkola is the highlight. I think I will watch the movie in theaters once again. Love how beautifully the script was interwoven. Loved the movie
Representing centuries old living folk culture of Bhoothkola, and the divine worship of Lord Shiva and Lord Varaha. The movie is shot beautifully and the background music is awesome. The folk culture song of Bhoothkola is the highlight. I think I will watch the movie in theaters once again. Love how beautifully the script was interwoven.

A great experience in the kannada culture based movie awesome writing and adaption great performance by Risab Shetty sir as a director and also as a actor.. Good screenplay for a simple classics storyline but music and bgm elevated it to next level... Great music all actors performance is good comedy is also laughable 👍😁😎 overall with minor negative of simple storyline but the ending makes you forgot everything..
A divine experience🔥🔥Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre. 👌👌A great experience in the kannada culture based movie awesome writing and adaption great performance by Risab Shetty sir as a director and also as a actor.. Good screenplay for a simple classics storyline but music and bgm elevated it to next level... Great music all actors performance is good comedy is also laughable 👍😁😎 overall with minor negative of simple storyline but the ending makes you forgot everything..
A divine experience🔥🔥Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre. 👌👌

reviews.review_title: After seeing this movie twice, I didn't find a mistake not even a lack in story or storytelling
reviews.content:
There's a legend that happens around the area, called 'KANTARA', and it's a mysterious forest.I have seen the movie twice in a row! What a Fantastic making! With little much budget of 13 Cr.(Indian-Rupee) what an atmosphere he (Rishab Shetty) made.South-Indian movie never failed to amazed me. During the time of my collage Since 2010, I am a big admirer of South movie. Even those days, we didn't get Hindi or English dubbed of South movie this much, but the language couldn't stop us. Despite the star-kid worthless movies, I was astonished by the low-key camera work and the pure storytelling in Malayalam Hit-'Ustad Hotel'. I have since then developed a deep love for South Cinema. I have seen the movie- 'Ottaal' for more than 20 times. As I have seen this one countless times, I have cried like a child every time.Let's talk about 'KANTARA'. What a masterpiece had been made by Rishab Shetty. Legend says that screaming out is a huge part of the movie, so you will find creaming a lot over the movie.There are a lot of good things happening with this movie because of the acting and makeup. It is clear that story and content are crucial elements for a good movie; this movie contains a good story, and the storytelling is the key to connecting with it.Rishab Shetty Proved that a simple story could be most unique one based on its storytelling.And What a Camera work! Giving you a spoiler that-
"You will find yourself thinking that a great VFX work through the movie, but there's very less amount of Special effect. All those scenes and Fighting segments is mostly created with a Master-camera work rather than VFX.''If I spent a thousand's of my words to describe my experience, it will be very less for this movie. So, Go to Netflix for Hindi Dubbed, or prime video has its Kannada, Malayalam, Tamil and Telugu versions.And find your lesson that- 'A simple story and a unique storytelling can have more impact on making a movie the global hit than tons of money or brainless-unskilled Star-Kids.'

Epitome of film making by the entire team
who worked on Kantara.....This is not just a movie, it's our culture, our tradition that we are slowly forgetting. From Acting to BGM to cinematography to small comical moments this gets everything right and to the point. And just when you couldn't get enough of this the climax comes and blows you away......I watched it twice in theaters and my body was shaking in the last 5-7 minutes of the film. In short my respect for KFI has increased immensely in last few months. Hats off to Rishabh Shetty and team...You guys rocked it🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥JUST A HUMBLE REQUEST: PLEASE WATCH THIS IN THEATERS BEFORE ITS GONE.

reviews.review_title: Performance to be cheer for a Decade....
reviews.content: I have waited almost 2 months to watch this "Kantara" movie after it's initial release,and I must say the waiting was worth it. First time I'm feeling no theatre nearby is a curse for an audiences like me who loves to see powerfull contents like this in the Big Screen. I mean I could just imagine how pumped up people would have felt during it's screening on the theatres with such loud sound effects.. I missed it,coz the theatre nearby is about 65kms far from my place & I didn't have time to schedule my journey.SO coming to the real review. (Rishab Shetty), the writer,director and the leading actor in this movie ; what-a-TALENT you have man! Kannada industry is really impressive. This is the perfect example of justifying how a low budget film should be made. I mean proper utilization of 15Cr. You will not feel it's a low budget movie,kudos it's Powerful BGM,Proper editing,Perfect Slow-MOs' and of course rich gripping Screenplay. This movie is really rich in all aspects. This is what an Indian cinema should be.The best part of this movie is starting 10mins & ending 20mins. The last 15min of this movie is like giving even a paralyzed person goosebumps. WOOW! WHAT_A_PERFORMANCE...Never seen like this in any Indian Cinema. This is a pure redemption of folk-tales and locals believe cultures.. There are 28 states in our country and I feel every state should put forward their hands towards Local Cultures to made story like this. The South Kannada "Bhoota Kola" culture is really impressive for sure. Earlier I've watched Rangitharanga and Vikrant Rona on this same concept and their redemption is here in this Kantara..Unlike Shetty, other characters like Police,Landlord,female lead and friends of protagonist were also did their job perfectly here. You can go for this movie with whole family just a little kissing and casual make out scene present which I think not that much impactable with family audiences.. So finally going with 8 Out of 10 Stars for it. I will not call it a masterpiece like other reviewers but the way this movie present us it's simple storyline is commendable.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful Visuals, Good Story, Great Acting and World's best Climax.
reviews.content: Visuals: picturesque western ghats, green deep Forrest, well-choreographed action sequences.Story: layered characters, twists, story from the perspective of Naxalites, govt & eternal struggle for common people.Mixed in with supernatural religious symbols and finally ending with the much talked about last 10 minutes.The last 10 minutes was a pure adrenaline rush, NEVER saw anything like it in any movie.As an atheist in the 21st century, all these people's beliefs shown on the screen are superstitions to me, but special is the land of India which has produced brave warriors due to these beliefs only.Hats off to Rishab Shetty & team. 30 out of 10. Made for Big screen.( Watched on the Big Screen in Telugu with English subtitles. Wish I understood the language or could see the Hindi version. )

reviews.review_title: Blessed to have movies like this.
reviews.content: The epic art of direction in showing the true faith in divine power is just magnificent. The feelings aroused during watching the movie were like, where can I surrender myself to get such movies again and again. Thank you, Rishab Shetty sir, for setting a benchmark for us. This masterpiece was just shot in about 3 months, in such short span and within a budget of 16 Cr, Kantara team has showed the mirror to all who used to just flow money like water and still lacked the fundamental connectivity with the audience. The beauty of Varaha avatar, how can someone not like of their Gods shown in such beautiful scenery, Thank you again.

reviews.review_title: This would've been a 9 star movie IF.....
reviews.content: If ... I wasn't born in Tulunadu and didn't have any knowledge or idea about daivas / demigods we worship and the cultural significance it has in my native.Absolute top notch cinematography with brilliant visuals and frames of the Forest and the grasslands of Tulunadu is something that will be one of the first things you admire of this masterpiece! One of the three things which make this movie a solid 9.The next being the absolute brilliant performances by every character in this movie no matter how small the role , and a special mention actually bow down to Rishab Shetty , the writer , director and lead of this movie! The performance at the climax being absolutely awe amazing, nothing short of it.The last reason being story and screenplay. Such a well crafted and well written story about daivas of tulunadu which has never been presented on this scale! A special mention as to how gripping and well made the movie is , even the commercial and lighthearted scenes don't act as a downer that's how well made this is!DONT WAIT for OTTs to get this ONE! It's an absolute epic which deserves to be enjoyed in theatres for the full experience, Easily a must watch and one of the best movies in recent times!

reviews.review_title: This is how movie should be made
reviews.content: Jai Tulunad. Amazing movie. The final scenes are memorable. Reall amazed by the production quality. Over-all fun packed movie. There are plenty of cuss words throughout the movie, probably not suitable for very young children.Jai Tulunad. Amazing movie. The final scenes are memorable. Reall amazed by the production quality. Reall amazed by the production quality. Over-all fun packed movie. There are plenty of cuss words throughout the movie, probably not suitable for very young children.

reviews.review_title: Arise awake and stop not till goal is reached
reviews.content: Destroyer, protector both in same character. This movie connects both in music and visual appeal. The story is simple but the story telling is extraordinary. This cinematic experience of the movie is at a different level. The budget of the movie must not decide how you perceive the movie. The portrayal of characters are true to the roots and decorated with very minute details. This movie is a perfect cocktail with each and every character contributing honestly to their bit. The amount of audience connect the movie was able to get in limited resource is unparallel. The background score is still resonating and will continue to do so till its matched with something similar.

Unbelievable!!mind blowing
Watched both malayalam and kannada version
This movie is a gem of indian films
Best film of the decade for sure!!From start to end the movie is so good
The last twenty or fifteen minutes gave me edge of the seat thrill experience
The last movie which i liked this much is everything everywhere all at once
And The Actor,Director All in all Rishab Shetty whaaaat an actor and director he is,Hats of you Sir!!!!and every aspect of the movie
Every Technical crew members done their job very damn good..Gonna soon watch it again just to see Rishab Shettys Performance
A must watch movie.

Watched Telugu version liked it. The Best movie in 2022. Rishabh Shetty acting is top notch. All the characters look natural. The dialogues are really good. It's message oriented movie. The climax is really good. The plus points are Rishabh acting and direction. Try to watch Telugu version it has good dubbing than Kannada. Music is good. Overall good package. Kannada movie industry improved lot bringing new type of story telling. Rishabh can become pan India hero. The climax scene is really good and no boring. Overall very satisfied will watch again. Waiting for kantara part 2. Go and watch with no hesitation.

Rishabh Shetty has shown every aspect of the village very sensitively whether it may be thier traditions, culture, dressing, their festival, daily livelihood, food, untouchability, Injustice upon his village people in some scenes their innocence everything it was complete package of cinematic experience. No one could have presented this film as excellent as Rishabh Shetty has Presented simply Amazing.Action is also so natural you will fall in love with his action.Talking about the technical department making is top notch hatsoff to Hombale films and Vijay Kiragandur Sir for bringing out the best of Rishabh Shetty without compromising in budget, background score by Ajaneesh Loknath is mind-blowing, and talking about DOP Arvind Kashyap has done amazing and ultimate job all characters are well developed and all have acted well Lastly the leader of the movie Actor as well as director Rishabh Shetty has done a fabulous job by creating a cultural masterpiece, comedy and dialogue are also very good last but not the least talking about the climax one has to experience it just experience it We should not review or we can't give ratings for that climax it is one of the Best climax of Indian Cinematic history in my opinion. Just go and experience this masterpiece movie in your nearby theatres.

I had the opportunity to see Kantara in a theatre, and I have to say that it was a truly incredible experience.The cinematography was top-notch, the story line was powerful, and the direction was stellar. The whole movie was just so well put together that I didn't want it to end!It is full of curiosity and suspense, and it does not give you a moment of boredom. The story is really amazing, and I felt good and proud because it is from my state. Rishab Shetty sir did an amazing job onscreen and offscreen as a person.This movie is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. The acting was incredible, and the script was well written. I don't think there is much more to say about it than that; just go watch it!

reviews.review_title: This movie left me spellbounded ngl🔥🔥
reviews.content: This kannada masterpiece left me spellbounded not just only with its storyline and but the way how Risabh Shetty presented this masterpiece beyond our words.The director and lead actor is Rishab Shetty in this marvellous movie. The female lead Sapthami Gowda looks perfect as the woman torn between life and duty. Kishore Kumar G as the Forest Officer Murali is top notch.The shining work by cinematographer Arvind Kashyap is visible in each frame by means of carefully blending the story with his framing of visual poetry.The background score is gritty, the music encapsulates local sounds and folklore perfectly and this movie makes you wonder how much we have to learn from our own music before going to look for melody in the west.The fight sequences, the dance of "daiva" and the makeup as well as costumes department have done magic.Must watch & highly recommended from my side.

reviews.review_title: A deadly amalgamation of women objectification, toxic masculinity
reviews.content: The only watchable thing about the movie was 'Buta Kola' culture (a tribal ritual dance performance). Everything apart from that was ridiculous ranging from the mediocre storyline which has been beaten to death to a glorified misogynistic main character.Most of the movie time has been wasted away in irrelevant scenes which seem extremely random and do not contribute to the storyline in any meaningful way. The story has only been communicated in the initial 15-20 minutes of the movie followed by the last 30 minutes. The movie has been dragged uselessly and has been filled with glorification of the toxic masculinity.

Watched it twice in the theaters- absolutely in awe of the movie. Everything about this movie is excellent- the story, the cinematography, acting, music, lyrics and fight sequences. To watch this movie is to experience film making at its best - as the audience- I experienced a range of emotions thanks to the beautiful storytelling accompanied by stellar acting and cinematography. I remember before I watched this movie - If I asked someone raving about this movie what's the movie...all they'd say is...you have to just watch it and watch it on the big screen. It's an experience- open your heart and mind and enter the world of Kantara. God bless the team who bought this creative masterpiece to life.

Writing this just after watching the movie . Can't believe the kind of experience this movie has created.This movie will leave you spellbound one scene at a time. Everything from the set up in the forest, to the cultural detailing, to acting of each and every actor in the movie ... everything is an 11 on 10.The end will leave you mesmerised by the performance and you would be lost in the Kantara world.As a movie buff I have seen so many movies from Tamil, Telugu , Bollywood , Hollywood but It is unlike anything I have ever seen before ..Tooooooo gooodddHighly highly recommend. Please go watch this movie.

It's well written, directed and executed movie. Cinematography, choreography and music are top notch. Comedy elements are driven very well.Character developments are very good.Even though it needs little more detailing about base of culture, it opens hearts of audience and it dances there with heart beats.More than one character in the movie are celebrated and given enough importance.Even the chemistry of shiva and leela are like perfectly added to the story.No forced comedy, no forced acting, everythinh feels real, especially in the climax.Last part of the movie is going take out your heart and put it on your palms and your your heart will dance. Brilliant made climax.It's just wowww!!

reviews.review_title: Rishab Shetty is India's Toshiro Mifune
reviews.content: Positives - a relevant and topical story. It asks a question that we all can relate to - who does the land belong to? The landlord, the government, the people or to the nature, that was there before us and will be there after us.Rishab Shetty's performance. He is absolutely terrific. He lives and breathes the character. At times, he reminded me of Toshiru Mifune's various characters in Kurosawa masterpieces. Especially, the last 10 minutes of the climax is one that will be remembered for ages to come.The music and cinematography add to the storytelling immensely so much so that they can be considered as other characters in the movie.Negatives - script is predictable and you know how exactly things will turn out eventually. Sometimes the scenes just drag on in a bit to infuse forced and often crude humor in situations. I am still not able to connect the whole "prison break plan" scene to the rest of the movie.Casual and sometimes not so casual sexism - all the female characters in the movie are stereotypes and unidimensional. The hero pinches the heroine on her waist forcibly, secretly watches her bathing naked, kisses her without her permission and it's all ok and no one minds! Another woman's smile is compared with Buffalo's teeth more than once and is supposed to be funny.Promoting superstition and blind faith - the whole village tradition of local deity worship and other local cultural aspects is totally rooted in superstition, blind faith, maintaining the status quo, no scientific temper, no critical thinking and definitely no questioning. The movie is about local tradition where villagers want to keep the land and the forest to themselves but yet are not shown doing anything to protect the forest or even the wild life.

reviews.review_title: Strong story telling and impactful performance
reviews.content: Rishabh Shetty delivers yet another mesmerizing storyline with an equally strong cast and captivating performance.The mystic divinity and its enigmatic presence in mortals is very well captured.Very poignantly depicts the need for successive generations to upkeep and honour the promises made by their ancestorsKudos to the entire team for such a memorable movie.Kannada film industry is delivering successively multiple power packed films.The Indian film industry is waking up to the realisation of remarkably strong presence of South Indian film industry and it's a terrific and heady feeling.Best wishes for many more...

reviews.review_title: A stupendous marriage between folklore and a masala narrative.
reviews.content: How often do we get to see a writer-director-lead actor ace all 3 of these responsibilities like never before? Rishab Shetty achieves it big time and his growth is visible, hats off to this rare talent. Kantara is a epic tale spanning through whopping 120 years. In 1870, a king finds the peace he is searching for in a mere stone which is more of a deity for the tribal people. In return for that stone, he grants them his land. 100 years later, the greed among the descendants to grab this land back from the tribals makes way for the core conflict. Once this is established in the initial sequences, the world of Kantara is firmly built making for the 1990's.The Kundapura tradition, language and belief gives this world a unique identity of it's own. Enters Shiva (Rishab Shetty) who is a wayward "youth", spending much of his time drinking and hunting. He also is running from his past involving losing his father, a bhootakola performer, something he simply fails to outrun. As the lives of Shiva and his people are established, the forest dwellers find their hurdle in the form of the RFO Murali (Kishore), a stubborn honest officer in-charge of protecting the forest. Also there is the landlord (Achyuth Kumar) whom the entire tribe looks upon as their well wisher. The clash between the forest officer and Shiva, along with the tribe excellently takes the story forward without giving up on the deep rooted culture of the tribe. The clash of ego leads to a terrific first half, making way for the clash of beliefs.Though the main reveal of the villain is quite predictable, the second half still has enough meat to keep us speechless as the making, the narrative and the performances come together to keep it as rich as possible. It is here the bhootakola is best used as it justifies being the integral part of the narrative. Despite the risk of going overboard in the third act especially with the pre-climax fight, Rishab Shetty gains full control on the script and elevates it further through his performance to provide a terrific climax.Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: Not a bad one but quite overrated
reviews.content: Saw it comparatively late, heard so much about the movie and was pretty excited to see the movie however as time went by started feeling it is for sure overrated.Many good movies than this one were made and released but unfortunately they didn't made good movie....e.g. Tumbaad.Overhyped as movie lost track after 30 minutes, every scene past 30 minutes makes you think anyhow this was expected.Surely one time watch but not that great too.Acting in end is too good, but overhyped.Definitely much better than typically Indian movies but not that great than many of thr masterpiece this industry have already given.

Tumbbad >>>> Kantara. Tumbbad is much much better movie than Kantara. Kantara is also a good movie but it is little overhyped and story has not that much amount of suspense and thriller. Whenever I remember about Tumbbad, it still gives me goosebumps and I literally went into tumbbad movie thoughts but Kantara didn't give me that vibe. Kantara is appreciated movie but I can not say it is the best movie I saw till now. Tumbbad definitely deserves an oscar.Kantara background music and visuals are on point, there is no doubt. And story is also good but I can say it can be little more better.It is time worthy movie and money worthy also.

Outstanding performance by every one who involve in this masterpiece, I have never seen before movie like kantara, cinematography, acting, sound direction, casting, story are outstanding, a must watch movie, it's a once in a lifetime experience show, the director who showed tribal scenarios in real and rooted way , this movie gives a true message actually that how tribal people live thier lives. Director shows everything in this masterpiece like amazing action thrlling story and suspence with horror gener , mr rishabhs Shetty done all outstanding way like acting , direction , writing, and more , nice movie😎

It's proves that, our industry our pride.. what a cinematography and For me, it's best cinematic experience i have ever enjoyed in this year. Spinal shoots are just amazing as it is. We r proud to promote this kind of films. Proudly it's sandalwood film. What a natural acting. Every actors gave their 100% performance in every act. Just to add rishabh sheetty sir acting is realistic and u can sense every bit of move and act in ur own way. End of the movie, u carry ur own perception and thought process. It's throwing light on our untold traditional bhootardhane. It's highlighting that, if u stand for god(Dharma) dharma stands for u. One of the best in our industry and indian history. Thankk you rishabh sheetty sir and whole members for this beautiful film. As always Kantara..

reviews.review_title: This can make hollywood bow down to indian film industry
reviews.content: One of the most epic and mesmerizing film I have ever seen. Cinematography and direction is on whole another level. Rishab shetty makes u realize what true acting is. The supporting cast will blow your mind and scenes which are shot in real life locations make you amaze. Atlast the story which is deeply rooted to the mangalorian and karnataka culture is one of the main highlights. A very unique concept will blow your mind and you think that you should see it more and more. Overall the movie deserves a 10 out of 10 and a big hats off to rishab shetty and his team for creating such a wonderfull epic.

So firstly last 15 minutes of the movie..which I think is best in terms of all elements bgm, acting, cinematography, direction
But other than ending the whole movie seems average and if you had watched Tamil and malyalam movies then it seems average because in those language these types of stories are common..but what makes this movie watcheble is its last unexpected moments.The director - actor Rishab Shetty did fantastic work and all other artists perfom wellMusic and bgm work very well in movies.Premise of the movie is very good but lack in the middle..but climax work very well.All praises to rishab Shetty 🙏🙏👏

It's a mystical thriller and slice of life......... Top class direction, BGM, cinematography, choreography & touch of spirituality. I watched yesterday night, and the movie's experience is still with me like an hang over and not able to get out of it!!!!!!!!There are times in history of cinema, when nativity of certain culture comes to life, with such authenticity, at the same time keeping the mystical part without dilution, and enhancing audience experience to touch the divinity! Watch to experience it.Kudos to Producer and director for giving us such cult classic!! Whooooooooo.Superb...real feelings of our village and theyyam effect.

It's just Phenomenal, Supernatural, Unbelievable, Unrealistic, Divine, Emotional, Energetic Masterpiece. It has got every element towards making it an out of the world creation- Story, Content, Drama, Action, Thrill, Comedy, Music, Art, Dance, Emotions, Acting, Cinematography, Direction, Realistic locations I cannot explain further. OMG its a movie of a lifetime. Climax is Super-Duper Blockbuster and will leave you inn sheer shivering and goosebumps. Cannot imagine the Perfection put in the playing the climax- the actor no longer remains a human and seems "Daiva" has taken over him completely.

reviews.review_title: This movie is like a blue label. 😅
reviews.content: Great movie, amazing storyline. There was no overacting and no unconnected stories. The main character is built slowly unlike Brahmasrtra movie. The story is a master piece, it is beautifully articulated and incidents are more relatable for someone from sub-urban / villages region near Mangalore.The choreography is amazing. This movie is a proof to anyone who thinks English is a mandatory language to learn to show the skill. Awesome dedication by Rishab Shetty and team. The movie leaves a mark in your memory and you continue to live in the story even after you are done with the movie and return home 😊I hope to see the Hindi version of the movie to be released soon!

reviews.review_title: A treat and masterpiece from Rishab Shetty
reviews.content: No words to explain.... Outstanding Cinema. All departments hardwork shows in the screen. Aravind Kashyap cinematography is next level. BGM and Song from Ajaneesh gives goosebumps. The Director and Actor Rishabh Shetty is fire. Saptami Gowda did excellent and romantic part is very raw and goes with the story well. Kishore and Achyuth Sir perfect casting and brought justice to the role. Subtle comedy by Shiva and Gang keeps the story moving. The last climax is the must watch theatre experience. No words to explain.... Outstanding Cinema. All departments hardwork shows in the screen. Aravind Kashyap cinematography is next level. BGM and Song from Ajaneesh gives goosebumps. The Director and Actor Rishabh Shetty is fire. Saptami Gowda did excellent and romantic part is very raw and goes with the story well. Kishore and Achyuth Sir perfect casting and brought justice to the role. Subtle comedy by Shiva and Gang keeps the story moving. The last climax is the must watch theatre experience and a divine moment. Proud film from Kannada industry and deeply rooted cultural but commercial entertainer. Finally thanks for Hombale Films to backing this project.

I am not able to write a review for this movie in particular.I thought KGF : Chapter 2 was an ultimate experience I ever had and then Charlie 777 succeeded it and now Kanthara super-succeeded and how. Kannada film industry is having a fairy tale of it's own. (Not forgetting GGVV)It takes you through a journey and gives an immense satisfaction by when most epic climax of all time comes on screen. It's Divine.What's interesting is, this is a movie with a great content but not made in a 'award winning, art film' kind in terms of presentation. This is an out and out commercial movie.Rishab Shetty - You made me and I believe all the audience proudest for being part of Karnataka. And your acting throughout the movie goes step by step from good to awesome to great to one of the greatest of all time. NATIONAL AWARD is waiting for you in one way or the other.Went in with an expectation of 'Oh Rishab Shetty's directorial will not disappoint'. Cams out being a fan again after SHPSK. You are a Legend in the making.And Ajaneesh Lokanath and Aravind Kashyap are the souls of this movie.Kishore and Achyuth Kumar prove why they are best in their craft.Well Done. Well Done. Very Well Done.

reviews.review_title: Not as 'Good' as the Hype around the movie
reviews.content:
To be honest, I went to watch this movie after seeing this high rating on IMDB but the movie went out to be a DISAPPOINTMENT !Its not as good as it is being rated... Story is unique and good but too slow in between. Public in the cinema hall were looking at their watches, awaiting for the movie to end.Acting was brilliant by everyone, no complain her.Story was good and out of the box
Screen play is too slow
Direction needs a lot of improvement
Cinematography : AverageOverall, in my view the movie is OK but does not deserve its current rating of 9/10.Its an average movie & its a one time watch.

First of all Kantara is well shot and well acted. We can see every rupee spent on the film and it doesn't look like a low budget film. The story is gripping(until the 3rd act) and is grounded for most part of the film. My biggest issues are with the typical unrealistic fights in the film and super predictable and lame climax which we have already seen a thousand time in Indian Cinema. The arc of the relationship between the Hero and his father is rushed and unimpactful. The only thing the father does throughout the film is Jump scare the hero a couple of times and all of a sudden the hero becomes a messenger of God out of thin air and now shares a good relationship and understanding with his father as they dance and vanish together in the final shot. The entire arc of the villian is boring ,super predictable and nothing new. But despite the flaws the film has some good scenes and Ideas which were explored well. The groundedness and the risks they took with the slow screenplay should be appreciated. Overall it's a decent film with an interesting but also predictable story. One time watch.

Kantara in one word - Spectacular!!The dance of daiva, the background score, the script, the cinematography and the performances; all are to the point and make this a magical spectacle to be experienced only on the big screen. Rishabh Shetty, take a bow for giving us this unforgettable experience!! Last 20 odd minutes of this movie gives you such an experience that can't be explained in words. You will literally feel the tremendous energy emitting from the screen.One more thing, the dubbing also felt to the point and didn't feel out of place at all. So, stop reading anymore reviews and go watch it before it goes out of cinemas near you.

This movie will restore your faith in big screen. A movie experience which will live in your heart and mind for years. Don't miss the opportunity to watch on big screen otherwise when you get to watch it on OTT you will regret why you didn't go to theater to experience it. Everything from the casting, setup, acting, direction and the music is spot on. Even without having any knowledge about the traditions shown in the movie you will find them very intriguing and thrilling to say the least. The best part is the ending which can't be better and serves as a perfect closure for the movie. At the end of movie I was left speechless as to I had experienced in last two and half hours. Again I want to say it is not a movie, it's an experience and a divine one. Don't miss the opportunity to watch it in theater.

Having watched and read rave reviews about Kantara even by Non-Kannada reviewers, I decided to watch this movie in a theater (without waiting for its OTT release).. Reviewers didn't exaggerate!I'm awestruck by the story line, direction and cinematography in lush green Dakshina Kannada, not to mention the special flavor of 'Tulu Nadu' throughout the movie. It truly deserves all the accolades and Pan-india popularity that it has been getting. It brings a new era in Kannada cinema and kudos to all the 'Shettys' for having made this movie.One must watch this movie in a theatre to be able to appreciate the visual effects.

reviews.review_title: Solid ending but too stale untill the last 10 mins
reviews.content: It's really sad how much hype people create to any underdog movie. This movie definitely is one of those.There really isn't much going on untill the very end, and only then you witness something truly unique and outstanding but everything leading upto that moment is way too generic or boring, any event which happens in the movie just feels like director just wanted to fill the run time.Rishabh shetty's performance is truly the best i have seen in a while but sadly this isn't the case for rest of the cast Or maybe that's because the side characters weren't really given any significant dialogue or scene. Every other character just feels like a filler.It's a good movie but solely cause of its last 8 mins.

reviews.review_title: Movie is good because of Climax and the Intro scenes. Unreal WOM marketing to promote the movie the movie as a best piece which it is not.
reviews.content: The film is a descent watch, I would have preferred to watch on OTT. But because of viewers tweets and social media posts , i ended up watching in theaters. Its the same plot used 20 years ago with Divine intervention. Last 10 minutes rishabh's acting is good. One time watchable movie . Background music is average, I don't understand what reviewers were harping about!The story was average, nothing special at all. I really don't know, how IMDB rating is so high for this particular movie. May be the fans vote it high because of their love towards hero , culture or language.Never ever watch a movie based on social media posts of strangers.

Please watch it in theaters to believe it. You have never seen anything like it before. I was also apprehensive but WOW!!!!Rishav shetty is amazing,
## For the movie: The movies is a beautiful amalgamation of ancient and present beliefs of the tribal people of Dakshin Kannada, the story of Panjurli daiva and Guliga daiva(the protector) and modern story making about land encroachment and goons trying to deal in their own way..## The potrayal of Panjurli daiva. By shiva(protagonist's father was awesome but the end when shiva was killed and then he was possessed by Guliga daiva and the performance by rishav shetty OMG !! I saw so many people in the theater including me in pranam gesture unknowingly and their eyes glues to the screen..With the traditional gestures of the bhoota kola and the scream of VOOOW byt the panjurli Daiva nd Guliga Daiva at the end .. you would forget the actors or sombody is acting it all feels so real so that it is scary at the end..What a performance !! You have to see it to belive it..

It's not just a movie. It's an absolute emotion. Loved every bit of it. The climax experience is the best till date. An Absolute master class. It really deserves a national award and Rishab deserves the best actor award in all possible award ceremonies.Everyone please go and watch it in theatres. I can guarantee you that You will be mesmerized.Our culture is so beautiful and Rishab Shetty has made an amazing effort to secure it and transfer it to next generation by making this cult classic.So many goosebumps moments. Hats off to all the writers, aravind kashyap, Ajaneesh, all the actors.Must watch movie. Please please watch it in theatre. You will regret it if you don't.

The reason is that I have watched many yakshagaana and bhootakola acts during my childhood in Mangalore and when I was watching this movie, especially at the climax, I literally felt goosebumps and after the movie, everybody gave a standing ovation.Rishab Shetty excelled both as the director and as an actor, all the cast members have given their best and not to forget an exceptional music and BGM by Ajneesh.Still unable to come out of the world created by Rishab Shetty.Definitely go watch this one, you really don't want to miss this, you will regret it's theatrical experience for sure, you will cherish this experience.

The director is justified his work when it comes the direction , Music director at its best ,
But the story is based on North Karnataka people. About there blind beliefs,
The issues is abt political nd local Cops
Which is been repeated in many movies like pushpa, karnan etc perhaps the screenplay goes too flat that's the biggest hard to watch where I felt sleepy in theatre, But the visuals are really good, As I have seen a lot movies the same story it felt some what slow going anyways the movie went on too slow in 2nd half but in the climax it gave a big comeback.But the sentimental scenes dint work properly .This are the movie positive nd negative.

This is one of the best story telling and screenplay. The best movie I have seen in my life. What a cast and frame for all the cast. Director and Actor Rishab Shetty promising star in the world. Even charcter in this film is mind-blowing. Technical wise i though KGF was the best. But this movie is something else. Very intense climax which I never saw in any of the films for a long time. Indian cinema has been upgraded to a versatile. A simple script executed in a different way. Gods are there to save our land and us which is practically shown in this film. Kudos to the entire Team for huge success.

reviews.review_title: Masterpiece with one of the best climax
reviews.content: What a master masterpiece. The story, the picturization, the BGM, the Acting, the action, the climax best presentation of everything. I will keep this movie as once in a lifetime and am lucky to experience it. What a package.The climax is ultimate..i have never seen such climax in any of the Indian movie yet, seems like South industry is super rich with story and talent. Back to back blockbusters. I will love to see this movie in OSCAR nomination from India, deserve it. Wonderful overall work by the whole KANTARA team. Well-done and congratulations. This one is above Bahubali, kgf , rrr and other superhit films.

reviews.review_title: Watching this movie is a waste of time
reviews.content: Kantara really boils down to several loosely connected scenes... the start of the movie appears promising with hints at horror, mystery, and suspense when a king makes an intense promise with a demigod in a forest of villagers. But from that point on, the movie is just 2 hours of vague references to the demigod and mystery of the forest with no clear thread or plot line tying it together. While the filmography and details are somewhat pleasing at times, the absolute lack of a plot is what deprives this movie of any real purpose or draw to an audience. Save your time, don't make the mistake of watching this movie.

This movie deserves all the awards, choreography, acting , script everything is amazing. It's an Experience. The best climax i have ever experienced. What a masterpiece created by Rishabh Shetty 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻, his character as Shiva will remain in everyone's heart whoever watches the movie. The story line, screenplay, cinematography omg it's all mind-blowing. The entire story revolves around the first 15 minutes prologue. The concept of the movie is "God vs Man" and credit goes to the team for making this fantasy movie not a gimmicky one. There are many scare moment in the film.The narration takes a normal story with commercial elements after the prologue. You have an angry young man as hero and a rogue police cop as villain. The story is predictable and not entirely new.But it keeps you engaged throughout. The music score is brilliant and the forest scenes look authentic, especially the first 15 minutes.Rakshit Shetty has created a new world. Do watch!!

reviews.review_title: MASTERPIECE !!! .... CLASSIC !!! ... A RARE PIECE OF ART !!!

After seeing all these ten star reviews and all the hypel went to watch this in theater. The only positive is Rishab Shetty did great acting for the climax in the last 5 minutes but it is not worth watching this long movie for. Definitely a big disappointment.

Not that good also, when I saw the rating 8.8, I had high expectations from this movie but honestly nothing special in this movie. I wonder why the rating is so high. And the sudden appearance of that person with face paint yelling 'whoa' 'whoa' was just getting into my nerves.. I thought there will be some fantasy supernatural punch.. But there was nothing as such. I mean i can give 5 star for this definitely not an 8 star. Pushpa, minnal murali was far far better and entertaining. It was a long movie and i throughout the movie I was in hope that something interesting is gonna occur but nothing.

Kantara, Kantara ... oh what do I do with you. Do you really deserve 9.0 rating on IMDB? Hmmm yes actually.First thing first - this review is based on my second viewing of Kantara on Prime on first day it was released.I did watch the movie first time in a theatre but I feel my movie experience is severely impacted by very noticeable blaring sound, especially for Indian movies - anyone else feel that way?Anyway, I was eagerly waiting for the movie to come on OTT to watch it again in the comfort of my own home theater with a large screen and reasonable sound system - my den.People say that this movie is good in 2 parts the first 15 minutes and the last 15 minutes with forgettable in between - I beg to differ.Actually the main reason for me to watch it second time was to watch closely the whole movie in its entirely and see if its really worth the high ratings - and it is.This moview is full entertainment - great direction, great story, great music, great cinematography, great editing, great sound effects, great action, comedy (adult) and ofcourse great acting - lifted highly to a different level towards the end.I have a special connection to the movie since I am originally from Mangalore and my dad has deep connection to his own diava temple in our native.So this movie touches me at a level which is inexplicable.To start with, before I knew this movie existed, I happened to visit Pilli Kula this October which is biological park/zoo in the outskirts of Mangalore. I felt a deep connection to the forest area even though I was visiting it for the first time - the whole experience was surreal.I also happenned to visit Sai Radha Heritage which has used as the landlord's house in the movie - again a queer coincidence not knowing the Kantara connection.Coming back to the movie - Kantara is not a movie - it is an experience.However, I was disappointed that they changed the main song on the OTT version but its ok - but it does take away some impact - I am glad I saw it in theater the first time.Nevertheless, I had goose bumps and tears in my eyes both times towards the end- I felt my roots were calling me - I felt my diava is calling me.Your diava is powerful, you take care of your diava and he will take care of you - that is the message I heard.It also made me appreciate the sacrifice and dedication of my dad to uphold these traditions year after year - I feel sad it took me so long to realize what he was doing - he was taking care of his diava.Hats off to Rishab shetty for sharing Kumbala and bhoota kola rituals to not just India but hopefully to the world (hoping an Oscar nomination)

The last 20mins of the movie was divine and unique only the parts which had the scene where the divine tries to contact the hero was good everytime you watch it you will definitely feel the presence of it inside your body. The movie other than that has nothing much to be told about all other scenes or pretty much average and been used or we have seen. But hats off to the last 20mins the direction or the way it was done it's mesmerizing can see the last 20mins 100 time. Rating is for the entire 2 hours or the movie where i didn't feel connected most part of the movie there were good comedy though.

What to say about the film. Never in my life i watched a movie more than 2 times but believe me or not i have this film 7 times,but couldn't be boring. That's how the movie is.People calling it hyped,you don't know the about the culture.BGM was top notch, cinematography was great . Narration of the film was good too. Humour at it best too.Even without the top names the film was a blockbuster due to the power of content.Writing was out of the world , too strong i some areas.Talk about the climax ,never seen in Indian cinema before one of the greatest climax in cinemas history.Masterpiece!

reviews.review_title: Climax even beats the likes of Avengers or any Hollywood
reviews.content: This movie is not just a movie but a cultural revival for Indian audiences who either hates or ignores the Indian culture especially tribal. As an Indian if it doesnt give you a goosebump then what else would not sure. Along with culture it shows how the hipocrisy works to stop the cultural celebration in the name of fake nature activism. Usually I dont go for South movies but this decision I would never ever regret. Rishab Shetty the protagonist OMG.. His acting skill is comparable to vikram from Aparichit movie.. so brilliant.. He is multitalented so will have an eye on him in future for sure.

Kantara is one of the great example for low budget best theater experience . Story set in a fictional mystical village , where the conflict between the villagers and forest police takes place . Kantara brings alive the traditional culture of Kambla and Bhootha Kola . First half was great , right from the first scene they grabbed my attention completely , the way they build the story was intresting . Second half had some pacing issue in between , but 3rd act completely make us to forget those issue . Jump scares in between were well placed and well worked . Rishab Shetty as actor , director and writer did a great job , especially his performance Bhootha Kola was terrific , as a director his making was simple . Technically well made movie , Visuals and cinematography was mind blowing . BGM and songs were topnotch . Overall a must watch movie , please don't miss it to watch it on a big screen .Try to watch it in original language ( Kannada ) , nothing much to complaint Tamil dub was also good too .( Karnan : Ho ho ivangha dhaan Sandalwood aatakarangalo )

Hart's of to RISHAB SHETTY for making such a powerpack movie. No words to describe for this masterpiece. Specially last 15-20 mins is just pure goosebumps. You can feel it or you can sense it but this is perfection. Directing as well as you have to act in the same movie is way more difficult than any work. But Rishab Shetty has done it with ease and perfection. From start till end the movie keeps the fast track pace and keep you at the edge of your seat. Bgm & music sound in this movie is perfectly suitable and it'll give you goosebumps at certain moments. Brilliant cast with acting performance. I've watched in a dubbed version and I'll definitely give the credit for dubbing artist. There's also one thing that I need to talk about this film is that the makeup that they have used to create Kantara is just beyond imagination. It looks so perfectly well and the creativity of that is amazing. You can definitely watch the film for it's amazing storyline, fast paced screenplay and the climax. Don't miss this masterpiece just give it a try and you'll see yourself.... (9/10)

One word .... MASTRPIECE! What a brilliant movie! Super acting, Super direction, Super story, Super music, Super songs, Super cinematography, Super action. Its top notch in all departments. Its a movie not to be missed. The last half an hour of the movie is just out of the world. Its the best climax I have seen in the last few years. Background music is very good. I am impressed to see how a simple story can be directed into a wonderful movie. Rishab Shetty has done it once more. I loved his earlier movie named Garuda Gamana Vrishabha Vahana. Watch this movie too. Another gem from Kannada industry. Kantara a must watch movie. Deserves all awards this year.

reviews.review_title: A thematically appealing film that should win hearts of common audience
reviews.content: A rural legend called Kantara supposedly is protecting this village where Shiva, our main character lives. Shiva is a ruthless youngster who has a troubled past with Kantara. He is eventually tasked with protecting the village from the hands of evil, as a disaster is told to be awaiting in the corner.After KGF, Hombale films has garnered respectable reputation from all over India. Kantara, released under this banner, successfully manages to not only keep this reputation but also increase it.Rishabh Shetty, awes audience with his show stealing performance, as well as from his direction. The sophisticated unraveling of events while maintaining the intrigue on screenplay, thanks to Ajaneesh's background score as well, has clearly worked out.Rishab scores from the very start as the audience are rooted upon their seats as they hear the story of Kantara. Kantara, as a film, kicks off with this kind of curiosity and keeps the audience engaged through the story telling. Subtle humor is another big plus of the movie as it feels authentic, and original.The character of Kishore (the deputy officer) could have been written in a better way as his character's transition from being egoistic and evil to suddenly helping the villagers seemed forced. Also, the character of Leela, could have been better explored as she was also stuck in a battle of conflicts and had some character in her, apart from glamour.The film maker's intelligence is still to be adored, by not giving a rating below 8 at least.Watched on Prime ; 12-12-2022. Kannada. First Time.

Excellent screen play.. Superb cinematography Power packed performance by Rishab Shetty , Kishore, Achyuth Kumar and all Mindblowing climax..Terrific musicAnother masterpiece by Kannada Film Industry 👏👏👏 Hats off to Sandalwood ❤❤❤🙏🙏🙏This is how a folklore should be translated into a commercial movie... 👍👍👍👍 Embedding a mythological concept into a regional legend is an art. Shetty has nailed it both as director and as the main lead of the movie. Simply exceptional work by Rishab...The suspense, thriller, comedy timing all in perfect portion.. Suits family audience as well.. everyone must watch.

Music, acting and cinematography is just wow..you will feel goosebumps in last 30mins..must watch movie in cinema theatre.. don't miss. Watched the movie in St. Louis, Missouri, to a packed house.Absolutely amazing movie! Rishab's acting is unbelievable. The pace of the movie is.stunning. There is no dull moment. There are some scenes which didnt get enough build up to convince, but the movie is far above all those small flaws. All actors have done an amazing job. The movie builds on this strong theme.

The film should be experienced in the theatres. The background music and music of the film really adds to experience. It's been a week since I watched the film and I still cant come of out of the Kantara experience. It's a film with a soul, much unlike the films that are made these days with the pure purpose of making money. reviews.review_title: A splendid Drive of conflict and folk culture
reviews.content: Kantara is a genuinely original Kannada movie based on folk culture....with its dynamic cinematography and story, the essence of the story is told perfectly. Kantara did a splendid fact on explaining the Kola religion and how politics tries to interfering into a normal village. With an unpredictable and chaotic plot fused with a mystery,violence keeps the audience guessing on what could happen next. Potrayl of characters by actors also puts an interest forward.. essence of brotherhood, betrayal and loyalty explained very well in this film, huge praise for the screenplay and directing. A total must watch for fans.

One of the best movie in an Indian Cinema. Especially Rishab Shetty acting is super. I never seen this type of climax. In all the section they are too good, cinematography, back ground music, songs, especially folk...wow amazing experiences. Even fights looks like real. Story telling is amazing. Even you won our hearts in the part of comedy. All the actors given their 100% for this masterpiece movie. It's a raw content Keep growing team.keep entertaining us like epic content.Thank you Kantara team especially Rishab shetty,

reviews.review_title: Excellent acting, excellent technicians but ultimately not for everyone.OVERRATED
reviews.content:
For a movie with only 16 crores budget this is definitely more than what i expected the camera work and other technical aspects remain awesome but the story lacks in few ways,The basic plot line of a man losing his path and originality and later understanding it's importance is a amazing plot which has been seen in many movies but the way they show it is what matters , the movie has good start of 20 minutes with laying a good ground work of bootha kola which is quite amazing and unique but unfortunately the next 1 hour 40 mins is filled with unwanted sexist adult comedies ,love interests and unwanted romance and hero hero fighting like an idiot which is not preferable by all audience , the movie gets quite good after the Villains part does start which does not start until almost the end of movie and the ending is amazing the total endline of the movie is quite amazing but at the end of the day when you watch the movie with your family you know that only 30 minutes(where the real plot lies) of it was worth ,The one uniqueness in this movie is that they showed the greatness of the tradations of malenadu and Tulu nadu and how they were able to execute the plot but we don't get to see that much though.Technical aspects:10/10
Main plot like :7/10.Acting and screenplay: 7/10
Story and execution:4/10
Entertainment:3/10(varies many people won't like the adult comedy some just watch the movie for it)
End line: good movie amazing technical aspect but the movie seems to get diverted from base line for too long
Movie is definitely overrated hopefully for a good reason.

reviews.review_title: Passed as Protagonist Failed in Direction
reviews.content: I went in with high expectations after i learned about this movie it had great reviews. And it failed miserably and had me disappointed. I loved Rishab Shetty's work and as an actor,he surely had a vision but it was a hit and a miss. The story had me wonder where is this going? Alot didn't make sence and failed to hold on to the story and mysteries, It felt Generic and flat and you could just guess what's going to happen next. I hope they can come up with a sequel and unravel the missing puzzle. Supporting actor did a tremendous job and i hope to see them good projects in future.All the best Rishab.

I haven't seen a movie like this in years, I must say it has everything one expects from a movie.Drama, acting, bgm, story all top notch Hats off to the writer and director and actors. I suggest everyone should watch this in hall, enjoy every single bit of it. I think the acting of main lead and the actors playing the God is amazing and it just leads us to believe in the charismatic plot. Movies like these should be appreciated and promoted.Best movie of this year for sure! I wish Bollywood promoted more content like this thanks to the dubbing artist we can witness the master peace in Hindi also lovely movie.

Late to the party so is it worth the hype ? I believe yes. I went with lot of expectations after the hype engine and the movie still managed to keep me hooked. The world building to writing to acting to background score to costumes to lighting to cinematography and direction everything is perfect to the letter T. Rishabh shetty should win a National award for his performance.I have some minor issues like why did the Forest officer all of a sudden had a change of heart ? One event of finding landlord is cheating shouldnt change his heart there should have been an arc around his change. Secondly I feel climax action scene was unnecessary it brought too much noise. May be Rishabh wanted to give it to the masses but the same could have been handled more smartly. It felt like we went from engaging drama mode to full on 300 mode such tonal shift distracted me from my experience. Can anyone tell me why did Shiva disappear in the end ? I understand his father did cuz he wanted to prove that he is the God who is speaking but what was the motto of Shiva's disappearance ?Apart from the minor issues the movie is an experience which is not bogged down by the usual over the top acting and dialogue delivery or physics defying action. Everything is grounded yet elevated by its humbleness. Indian film industry needs to learn from this. This shows that you can also make a smart movie for masses where acting and story is the hero.

Good story, good humour with some fine and decent scary moments and very well acted. The performances of the supporting cast feels natural and I have even the negative role has been acted very well. Action scenes are good and mostly feel real. It is good that it does not overdo the action like some typical south movies.Most of the story felt predictable sometimes but the climax steals the show. After a long time I have seen a climax of a movie this amazing. Rishab Shetty has acted very well in the whole movie but he truly shines in the end of the movie. This is surely worth a watch movie of this year.

I stay away from reviewing but this film deserves a review. I always found a good movie to have a great start, average middle with lot of laughter and fun for entertainment... and the climax should take the bredth away and this movie had all of the above ingrediants... great job by the entire crew... if i have to pick something average about the movie then it should be songs and background... could have been lot better.. anyways, im being too pickiy i guess.. special mention to Rishab's acting in the climax, what a writing and cause the actor was director himself, he was able to undersrand what was needed.. just guessing...

Wow, Brilliant!! Amazing and a must watch movie!! Beautifully crafted local traditions and culture in a cinematic style!!Movie narrates the relationship between the humans and the nature. It's thrilling to see the dense forest coverage in the night.Kambala, a traditional buffello race from the coastal karnataka is most exciting part of the movie. It's really a great attempt to introduce such a rich art to the world.Bhoota Kola is an age old tradition and custom followed in the tulunaadu region, movie highlights it brilliantly and in an interesting way.Definitely a award winning movie!!Rishab Shetty's acting is super awesome.DO NOT MISS THE CLIMAX!!

Rishabh Shetty has created a masterpiece in Kantara. The movie definitely deserves its success and place as the most profitable Kannada movie ever (possibly). The magic of Kantara is across all of its scenes, whether it's comedy, action, or romance. The cinematography, action choreography, production design, etc., have been outstanding and brilliant. It's in the league of or better than mass action entertainers with huge budgets. But this movie was made at a puny budget of around 16 crores and yet managed to leap ahead of most other high-budget, high production value movies.The movie's greatest element is its story and script, which Rishabh Shetty created himself.. The fact that it is soo deep-rooted in his culture has made it such a charming and entertaining plot. The climax scene of Kantara is one of those rare experiences that stick with you for days after watching this movie.So, I would recommend that you go and watch this movie in whichever language you prefer. It's definitely going to entertain you and stick with you.

Divine and ferocious movie. I'm cent percent sure that it wasn't only Rishabh Shetty acting in the climax; there was a divine spirit in him. I'm sure many of them agree with me. This man is going to be talk of the town for a very long period of time in the history of world cinema. Many of us dint know what this coastal Karnataka culture, tradition, celebration, lifestyle etc to this extent. That's what the power of audio and video of a cinematic experience does to one. These kind of movies should be experienced in theatres only.Take your entire family to the movie which represents every village of this land. It's simply mind blowing.Jai Hind! Jai Karnataka!

Superb movie and what a performance Rishab shetty !!! Amazing storyline, action and climax is out of the world performance. Music by Ajaneesh is commendable. Congratulations to the entire team of Kantara. More power to you. Again Hombale films has supported a wonderful creation. Kishore sir has wonderful performance adds tadka to the story. Kannada industry and mainly Kannada film RRR (Rishab shetty, Rakshit shetty, Raj B shetty) have been experimenting with new stories and rooted in kannada culture and tradition. Very happy to see them succeed. This movie also has support from the divine energy as Rishab shetty says " I didn't make this movie. It just happened by the divine grace". When will Bollywood learn their lesson. You don't need big budget to make Good movie. You need content and god actors and Not stars.....God save the big stars. Lol 😁

reviews.review_title: Good but could have been a lot better
reviews.content: The internet is screaming that Kantara is a masterpiece, but don't let that fool you. It could have been, but it is not. The film had a lot of potential to become a masterpiece. But it was not to be. I will later explain where it fell short.I will nevertheless say that Kantara is a good film. And it could have been so much better. It had all the great ingredients. Nevertheless, Kantara certainly is a breath of fresh air in so many ways, considering the overall standard of the Kannada film industry. If you keep that as the benchmark, then wow it's a great film. But not otherwise.Reiterating, I will say that it had all the ingredients for becoming a masterpiece. Unfortunately, there were a few places where the film failed to become one. The theme and premise were intriguing, the director and actors talented, but I guess somewhere the director lost himself in the greed, insecurity and foolishness of appeasing the mass audience. And in that trap, he made those mistakes which stopped the film from becoming a masterpiece.So what are some of the great things about this film?The entire theme of it - the language, the culture, the location, of Tulunadu. The mystery of the Daiva. The film leaves you wondering what the Daivas are capable of. Are they real? The paradox between the human psyche and the supernatural. Plus, the film becomes relatable and nostalgic to people who are from Tulunadu or those who have visited this wonderful place and are familiar with the divine traditions practised there.The film certainly has its goosebumps moments. The background scores and cinematography being significant contributors in that department, are top notch in some scenes. Along with the cinematography and background scores, there are elements of supernatural mystery in the plot as well, which make the film worth watching.The actors are very talented too. And the various expressions in the dialect of coastal Kannada that they speak is delightful. In fact, that is one the main reasons to watch this film The humor is always there. It makes its way even in typically serious scenes. Now that is improvisation coupled with the beauty of this dialect.So there you go - all the ingredients of a masterpiece. What could possibly go wrong? This is where many people who watched this film were confused into believing that this film is a masterpiece.The main thing that I did not like was that the director pressed the overkill button at many places, probably for the reasons that I have already mentioned above. There was a desperation to make it more intense, over-intense, much more than necessary. You may think that an entertaining film is supposed to be that way. But to what extent? Certainly not to the extent that it becomes too conspicuous. There is a desperate hidden attempt to glorify the hero too, which does not fit well in a film like this. You'll know why. Basically, the noise could have been turned down and the craft could have been turned up in this film.That said, overall, a good film worth watching. But only a one time watch - at least for me. Not exactly a must watch. But I will say that this kind of films will set the precedent for better films to come - from the same director or from others. It's so relieving to see that the Kannada film industry is evolving from its cliche livelihood into unique themes and story lines. And that's the best part. Let there come a true masterpiece.......

reviews.content:

The movie is unique for his subject that discovers and tell you more about the tribal culture and values we are unaware of (Most people in urban north India don't even know that there is anything like tribal culture present in India). The acting,direction,cinematography, background score all goes well with the environment of mystic created in the movie. The unexplored subject help it to be excepted by the audience in such a way.
