Well, the movie started interestingly and i felt like the director kind of lost his direction. I don't think the sequences shown to prove the point that he was trying to prove anyway worked. Cinematography made the audience stick to the screens even though it is disturbing to watch the recurring meaning less shouts and events in the film. And after sustaining a 2 hour wait thinking that something interesting is gonna be there. There comes the lead character with guns blazing. Kudos to that actor for the last 20 mins!!!Pros: Cinematography, Sound Effects,Actors,Plot,Climax,
Cons : Narration, Casting,Music,Editing.

reviews.review_title: An awesome movie but reviews need to be more balanced. It is NOT the greatest movie in the history of cinema
reviews.content:
First off, I agree that Kantara is likely the most significant and important movie to emerge this year and that in itself is HUGE given the like of KGF, Pushpa, RRR, Kashmir Files etc. And in terms of impact and ROI (Return on Investment) it's probably the biggest after Dangal (let's not forget that Dangal collected more than 2K crores worldwide, so Kantara has a long way to go). Kantara has amazing cinematography, very original and rooted story, great music, and clearly Rishabh Shetty has vaulted into the top tier of Indian cinema with his multi-faceted effort (similar to what Vishal Bharadwaj did with Omkara).... So no arguments with any of that ....kudos to RS and the Kantara team....👏👏👏.BUT, but ..... We need to stop idolizing this movie as if film history begins with this movie as lots of fans and reviewers seem to be doing. That is totally lopsided and unbalanced, in other words just fanatical mass hysteria - probably because (a) many many people have just started returning to theaters after Corona and (b) this current era coincides with both Bollywood and the Tamil industry hitting more or less rock bottom in creativity (with some exceptions of course).Let's not forget that Indian cinema (and let's not even go to World cinema), in very era and decade has produced masterpieces that stunned and wowed those audiences and raised their goosebumps who were lucky to see the first releases in theaters. As part of our own process of discovery and personal experience we tend to overlook or forget that others have undergone similar arguably more profound experiences with cinema in the past.It is our inability to imagine and live in their shoes that causes us to conclude ours must be the greatest. Just two examples will suffice (and there can be 100's of others....arguably almost all movies in the 8-10 range on IMDB, with more than 10,000 reviews).1. Sholay - I dare anyone to challenge that there is a greater or more thrilling action sequence in Cinema done with real sets, no VFX than the opening train robbery sequence in Sholay, now imagine seeing that for the first time on 70mm in 1976.2. Pulp Fiction by Tarantino - again it is difficult to imagine the impact this had on the whole cinema world on any level or category that you want - Story? Originality? Script? Editing? Dialogue? The movie is Gold. One can arguably divide world cinema history before and after Pulp Fiction
So ....we need to be careful before declaring Kantara as the best thing to happen since sliced bread. It is damn good for sure, but let's all agree it is in Elite Company ....with many others ....(and oh btw.... HUGE shoutout to Tumbbad - in my opinion the most original movie from India in the last many years)

I never could have imagined that i could see anything like this ever in my life. It was a different world. It gives me the same kind of feelings i got in the Avatar. Creating a whole new world and give audience an opportunity to be a part of this great event. As if I were there and a part of the characters in the movie. Experiencing the whole thing right in front if my very eyes. In a single word must say - Horribly AWESOME. And the climax. OMG. Every word is so little for it. I do not know what to say. No words can ever describe it. Thanks all who are related to this movie for making the movie.

What else to anticipate.....
The movie will keep u in ur seat with out getting bored.So simple and delivered well to the audiance .Drama , suspence, love , comedy, triller everything presented up to mark.Kantara is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language action thriller film written and directed by Rishab Shetty, and produced by Vijay Kiragandur, under Hombale Films. The film stars Shetty as a Kambala champion, who comes to loggerheads with an upright DRFO officer, Murali.U can see the efforts of the star by with clean presentation of the movie.A must watch movies and hopefully such movies will be more in Indian cinema.

reviews.review_title: One of those piece of Art that beats high expectations
reviews.content:
Could not watch it in original language so not giving perfect 10This is MasterpieceTajMahal and Pyramid and NewEngland Fall are few of those enchanting moments of life when one get blown away by reality being better than high expectationThe rustic authentic setting, Raw energy of hero and heroine to smallest of character role. reviews.review_title: one of the finest movies ever made in any language -- a true masterpiece!
reviews.content: Saw Kantara this weekend now that it has come on Amazon Prime. Spellbound! What an extraordinary movie, probably one of the finest movies in any language. I have not heard of Rishab Shetty before (my bad!), but he has created a true masterpiece here. The story revolves around a Bhoota Kola tradition in a remote region of Karnataka and about revolves around the local deity in that region. Worshippers of Mutthappan in Kerala can easily relate to this, however to most people the entire Bhoota Kola tradition may seem very surprising and it is about channelizing a local deity (possessed) for a ritual.The movie has a very fine script and storyline. It is about an 'irresponsible' person who is constantly reminded by a deity to take his place and do what is needed. The acting performances are excellent, however, the last 15 minutes were out-of-the-world. In these 15 minutes Rishab delivers a performance that may not even be called 'acting', it was as if he was actually possessed by the deity. Probably one of the best scenes in the history of cinema. I am trying to think of some epic acting scenes by Mohanlal, Mammooty, Kamal Haasan, Al Pacino, Tom Hanks, and I cannot think of a better performance than the last 15 minutes by Rishab in Kantara. I saw the movie on my laptop.... and how I wish I had seen it in a movie theatre.In comparison to the other South Indian languages, Kannada movies have historically taken a backseat. Tamil and Telugu have repeatedly provided us with excellent crossover cinema. Malayalam movies are usually low budget, however, historically they have provided us with world-class storylines and excellent acting performances -- no wonder along with Bengali cinema they dominate India's National Awards. However with Kantara, Kannada cinema has truly come of age... this is spectacular storytelling at its finest. Moreover, you can hear of many people on social media who have begun understanding their roots after watching this movie. The conflicts between tribals and forest officers (government) are also well portrayed. The only minor quibble I have is the use of the word 'demigod' in the subtitles (instead they could have simply used 'god' or 'deity').I don't recall ever writing about a movie that I watched on social media.... but Kantara is on its way to the history books for its unique contribution to world cinema, so I could not resist. It is indeed a masterpiece and a gem of Bharata!

reviews.review_title: Watch it for Direction and Cinematography
reviews.content: To get started the movie is great for its characters,story telling,cinematography,direction and acting. All the characters small or big have done a great job and do complete justice to the roles.You will remember the work of even small characters like Bulla,Rampa,Guruva and many others whose screen presence is certainly felt. The BGM is good and kind of mixes modern rock with carnatic. The songs are above average and might not last long on your mind.Overall the weak part I feel is the story itself. The story telling is good and the movie is certainly a visual treat. Watch the movie for a visual experience and brilliance of the direction. The cultural influence of Tulu Nadu is portrayed in a excellent way and makes you believe that this is how it is done. For me who does not know much about the culture , it did amaze me the way make up has been done and character being carried out.There are a couple of jump scare scenes which I feel were kind of unnecessary. Some romantic scenes also could have been avoided which don't add much of a impact to the story.You will not feel bad to have watched this movie in the big screen. So it is certainly a good watch!!!

reviews.review_title: A legend that needed to be told!
reviews.content:
A tale of folklore and ancient traditions with a strong social undertone of the Kannada people living in the Tulu region shown in world class manner. The lives of the tribal people was captured in a very authentic manner that makes this truly a special spectacle to witness.SOCIAL STATUS:
The film showcases a very strong social undertone lingering in the community and the manner which upper class(read caste) and the lower class is treated at various instances. The film does not talk loudly about discrimination, neither there are scenes directly showing discrimination. However, the few instances in which 'action speaks louder than words' is when we, the audience realise the harsh reality of the people living in that community. Some of the minute details showcased by the director is nerve wrecking and subtle nature of the screenplay really makes us chill through our spine.SPIRITUALITY & ANCIENT TRADITIONS:
This is one of the only and unfortunately few films from India that showcases an actual culture and the staunch religious belief system of a community. The "Varaha Roopam" was shown in its most authentic and truest form without exaggeration. This made the scenes truly intense with intent to give limelight to the actual ancient traditions of tribal people in that part of India. Rishab Shetty was absolutely unapologetic in doing so, which makes this film stand out against the rest.CONCLUSION:
My big cup of tea, a must watch for all cinema fans and those who wants to learn more about the diverse nature of India.

reviews.review_title: There is nothing in this movie
reviews.content: Hands off to Rishab sirs acting. Story could be better. The cinematography is not very nice. The last seen is the only good scene of the movie. But for Rishab sir's research I would like to applaud. Editing is good. Songs are inspired. So could have agreed it is remixed. But ajaneesh is a great music composer. I like the plot which is like - In 1847, a king agrees with Panjurli Daiva/Bhoota (a local deity worshipped in its animist form by the people of Udupi and Dakshina Kannada, which are parts of Karnataka and Kasargod district of Kerala) to give a portion of his forest land to the locals in exchange for peace and happiness granted by a shaman who is supposedly possessed by Daiva. He warns the king that his family and successors should keep the word and not reclaim the land which will incur the wrath of Panjurli's companion, the Guliga Daiva. So story should always have my attention in it.

reviews.review_title: Must watch in theatre. A visual treat!
reviews.content: I watched this twice already and still can't have enough of it. The plot, the climax is just amazing. Has the best background music. I am awestruck. What an amazing movie!!!!I don't think I will enjoy any other movie the way I enjoyed this. It connects with the audience.This movie should be viewed in theatres only and not on mobile or TV. I watched the Kannada version. The script is amazing.This movie should be nominated to the international film festivals as it depicts the rich culture of India unlike other over rated Bollywood movie that makes a mockery of Indian cinema. If you want a different experience then you must watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Good no doubt but can't match Tumbbad
reviews.content: Both Kantara and Tumbaad have seemingly similar genre.Kantara's ending is by the end predictable to me.Personal opnion: Kantara is a good but not grander than currently running PS1 of its time , owing to the latter's magnanimous set.Kantara is good in showing rural setup and highlighting age old traditions down in Karnataka , however, as the story unfolded, instead of it being a suspense ride till the end, it felt to be dragging us to the end , by again and again showing the hero having sudden apperances of the Bhootham.All in all a very good watch and i believe native speakers will find it more comfortable to watch than people who watch this with subtitle.

reviews.review_title: Rooted to core with lots of Goosebumps moment
reviews.content: The story starts with a narration giving background of the story. In another next fifteen minutes of the film, the main plot of the film is planted very clearly. This main plot has been given to the audience very clearly.When the story starts to flourish and introduce it's subplots, this is also very clearly defined. The writting had a quality content which had enough scenes and moments to flourish the subplots. There are no fillers, no artificially added comedy, and no irrelevant masala which is used by the writer to push the movie when subplots didn't had stuff.The story reveals the subplots on a clear and set phase. And at the correct point, the subplots started to roll over towards the climax. The closing of subplots starts so smoothly towards the climax that we feel that movie is very fastly phased which is actually not. The film is phased in its own way and its progress in the same way. This is achieved greatly by the writer.Cinematography is very optly choreographed that feel of the mountain and rustyness of the village is very well presented.All the cast are well placed and they doesn't change the feel of the film in any place. They have all been well explained about their roles and they act even when they are fillers in a scene.Overall, a worthy watch and very well directed film. The message shown in the last ten minutes of the film is beautifully choreographed that it feals so much good. A feel good film with beautifully orchestrated message.

First fifteen minutes were awesome rest whole movie was just pathetic women are just shown as sex objects and sometimes too offending some comic scenes were good but they were way to adult jokes I have seen children less than 12 in my screen with their parents because this movie projected as rooted movie climax was just okay nothing to shout about overall I can say that this movie was just pathetic don't waste your time and money in this garbage movie performance are not good either direction screenplay are equally bad if this kind of movies are projected as cult classic then God save us from these classics.

reviews.review_title: Everything about the movie is outstanding 10/10
reviews.content: To be clear, I am still not aware about the culture & practice shown in the movie, but some how I can relate to my own native deity (Danda Mahaprabhu).I felt so proud to watch the movie & also in the same time felt disheartened how few other movie used to portray our culture & traditions in a negative wayThe movie has everything a moviegoer wants i.e. Story, cinematography, humour, action, little romance, music, thrill/horror & if possible a little social message.Direction was spot on, I usually don't watch Indian movie as they lack the basics of story telling, but my God , Rishab is such a genuine guy.I hope Kantara is send to Academy Awards to get the recognition it deserve.

reviews.review_title: Seeing a good movie after a long time
reviews.content: Wowww, what an amazing movie. I don't know of anyone who has seen this movie only once. Unfortunately, I could not watch this movie in theatre, but still loved it by watching this on my TV. Amazing performance by Rishabh and great casting. I see, lot of reviews saying that this is hyped, I understand that. If you are not familiar with the Karnataka's coastal region culture/way of life and also Bhootha/kola, lot of things in this movie seems very ordinary. So totally agree that not everyone would like this movie. But no matter what the final 15 mins of the movie will be mind blowing to anyone. I must have seen that scene like 10 times on repeat.Great casting, except for Achyuth Kumar. Although he's a great actor, I felt like someone else of lesser fame with more closer accent could have done justice to the role.Lot of fights were not really necessary, could have kept it much real and still had the same effect.Some of the characters needed some build-up. Like the guy who lifts Rishabh in the final scene, just shows up without any history.Bit more depth into the way of life of the villagers. They are mostly just fighting for land and drinking alcohol. Maybe some plot around why they need and deserve the land.But nevertheless, unbelievable movie. Really happy to see such an impactful movie after a long time.

Kantara what a movies yarr the movies tells us how our culture is strong and diviness about god . This movie prove us that that why we should we belive in our cluture and gods . Movie is full of suscespence
some ecence i just like horrer burtythe ending scence is one of best scence in this movies and very poerful scence is the last one somne scence is bored but on that moment the unexcepted comes horrer elemts and many more you can watch this movies with family the climtography of movies is best of all time. The fight scence is also very well designed the loaction is also very well designed go to watch.

This man's acting and direction are top notch. He has created a masterpiece by believing in his culture, in his roots, in his forefathers and in himself. The movie has become magical because of the devotion with which the story of the gods is told.All the actors have done a great job. Artists have created a realistic picture of the rural coastal parts of India.The message is simple - do what is right and you will be rewarded. But the way it has been conveyed with the audience is simply brilliant. We need more movies like this which give us a spiritual experience and elevates the movie experience to a whole new level.

This is amazing movieStory is very different it connects the audience with the nature, village, Animals and even god.Movie delivers you action, drama, romance, fantasy, horror, thriller, suspense all at once.Rishab Shetty and the co actors all did very well throughout the movie you will feel connected.I will not give you much spoilers10 out of 10 for this movie i believe we won't see such greatness anytime soon in the industry.Lesson for Bollywood so called Kumar's Kapoor's & khan's not every movie needs to be made of 100 cr budget if you know how to connect with the audience then simple good story is enough.We need story in Bollywood movies not overacting.Must watch Kantara.

reviews.review_title: One of the Greatest Movie ever made 👌
reviews.content: One of the greatest movies ever made, hats off to Rishab Shetty who did a great character role amazing acting by him. This movie should be sent for oscars. The movie glorifies the demigod Gulika and. Panjurli. The Gulika Davis Kola dance is performed excellently by all the characters who played that role. This movie is a must watch for anyone who wants to seek the reality of the Indian culture and traditions. The best thing about this movie is that this was shot in the real jungle and the scenes were excellent.the narration of the movie is done very well and yet again this reflects the depth in our South Indian talent.

reviews.review_title: Purely for action lovers! Otherwise will break your heart.
reviews.content: I hate to go against the majority, but I found this movie rather disturbing more than half of its time.Firstly, one can't ignore the unnecessary glorification of smoking,drugs, alcohol, hunting, possession of weapons, toxic masculinity and everything wrong! That itself takes away the soul of the movie.Secondly the violence. It was both boring and annoying when most of the fights had no real connection to the story.Thirdly, the main plot was reduced and focused mostly on the triangular rivalry between the hero, forest officer and the landlord. I mean that was tragic considering how the first 15 minutes gave us goosebumps. I wish they had focussed more on the depth of the art and brought the pulse of it to the audience rather than follow the cliched plot of personal rivalry and a savior in the village, who takes his own sweet time , literally waits till the last five minutes to embrace his life path and finally decides not to escape it.Don't get me wrong, I had high expectations after hearing so much about it. And for me , I would have still love it if it stuck to its essence and had let me delve into the history and depth of the art form.Kudos to the music , camera angles and comedy. Otherwise clearly an overrated one.

Kantara is easily the most hyped film of the year. So much discussion revolves around Kantara, with the court case adding some drama as well.It starts and continues decently, at a standard of a 6.5-7/10 movie. The themes explored are very interesting, with a striking line being told by an old man during the bull race. Taking this into consideration, and averaging out this and the climax, it's a 7/10.But, just as an otherwise average movie such as Shutter Island is elevated by the plot twist (same with Saw, Arrival, and Se7en), Kantara is elevated with the truly electrifying climax. When I say that you will never experience anything like this climax, you truly will. If you consider rewatching the film, you'll only want to rewatch the climax. Rishab Shetty's performance here is outstanding, in a scene that could have easily become cringe and unbearable the music and his acting turn it into truly one of the most powerful scenes in cinema.Other positives are the character of Shiva didn't embody good, as is usually the case with fighting-against-oppressor movies. It had numerous flaws: mistreatment of women, drinking & drugs. This makes for a nice redemption arc, and a good sense of closure with the finale. The romance wasn't conventional, and the heroine was an actual character, believe it or not, rather than a well-dressed, make-up covered lamppost to look at.Honestly, massive congratulations to the music team, Rishab Shetty, and the cinematographer for the thrilling climax.

Mind blowing creativity in telling the story of the tribals, landlord, government and the God protecting the forests.What a fantastic way to tell the story, colorful picturisation, and Rishab Shetty's acting is out of this world. Climax is nothing I have ever seen. Each actor in every character have done justice to their roles.This is the kind of demigod practices I have been brought up around and can see how everything has been put together to convey the reality.Music is mind-blowing, graphics perfect enough, overall an effort putting us up for the Oscar's!!!!Very very very...Well done!!!

A perfect theatrical experience.. take a bow Rishabh Shetty... One man show.. Beautiful cinematography, Engaging Screen play.. and Goosebumps action. With just 15Crore budget. One of the best example of cinema marketing putting 15Crore and making 400Crore business just Rishabh Shetty thing 🔥🔥🔥 You are a future of sandalwood. Hope you do more and more films like this💚.. Explore more and more.. And last 20 minutes of film is just lit.. I have never seen that kind of experience ever before.. Hoping you will bring ascar to our sandalwood one day hopping that day comes soon.. Thank you Thank you for Everything you Did💚

Fantastic movie all the very best for your future endeavours 🎉🎊👏🏻👍🏻🙏🏻
Regional tradition has been explained through out the world 👏🏻👍🏻🎊
All the best to the entire team!!!!A great experience in the kannada culture based movie awesome screen play writing and great performance, Great music performance.Mony more sucess to be awaiting for the team hardwork and dedication, especially the climax performance made many peoples to recall their nativity, culture, traditional and divine...Request all of the peoples to explore the movie and feel the fantastic movie, action and extraordinary music play...🙏🏻

I just heard about this movie from others and went to watch it amd i am glad that i did that. No VFX or big stars or fancy action sequences. But still it is one of a kind. Every seen seems real as its shot so precisely. The sound effects and the beats will shake you up. A must watch movie that you can watch with your family and friends both.I just heard about this movie from others and went to watch it amd i am glad that i did that. No VFX or big stars or fancy action sequences. But still it is one of a kind. Every seen seems real as its shot so precisely. The sound effects and the beats will shake you up.

It's haunting even after hours of watching movie.I am glad i watched in theatre and with family who love good movies.Rishab's acting, Ajju's BGM, Arvind's camera work, wow it's a wonder.Everyone in the cast did their job exceptionally well, and the casting is flawless.Ajju's music and Arvind's camera work getting better movie by movie.I can say this is an brilliant movie in all aspects, yet they could have used Kambala for much more time.Rishab and his team's conviction and belief in "Daivas" made this masterpiece. And this masterpiece will make you fall on the feets of Panjurli and Gulika.

What a masterpiece! Overwhelmed, exhilarated, elevated ... I can't describe in words how I felt when I left the theatre.Basically an action movie, the plot revolves around the fight for land between the villagers and the rich antagonist. Rishab Shetty wonderfully blends this theme with the folklore/ myth from Tulunadu, where he hails from.Rishab Shetty should get all the awards for his performance, especially in the last 20 minutes. The role demands a lot of physical acting and he pulled it off extremely well. All the actors did justice to their role. Kishore also deserves a special mention.Technical side, everything is just fantastic. The music, cinematography, choreography, fight scenes.. congratulations to the crew for this amazing work.PS: Kantara is one of such movies which should be watched on big screen. When I write this review the IMDB rating for this movie is 9.1 after 64k ratings. I expect some average reviews once it's available on online streaming platforms or when it telecasts on tv.

The movie starts out great with the prologue. It gives an impression that the movie is going to have a good amount supernatural element or atleast it will be present throughout the movie. But what ended happening is that the supernatural only occured when the plot required it to.The comedy in this movie often comes at the cost of ruining serious moments. At that brings me to the tone of this movie. Ok, I am not to familiar with south Indian cinema, but the tonal shift is just too much alien to me. I don't complain a gradual tonal shift like for example in the south Korean movie Parasite, the movie starts out as a satirical comedy, and by the end it almost becomes a horror drama.The reason I give the example of Parasite is because people think this movie is Oscar worthy.The action scenes are also not good, there are literally so many cuts that it is impossible to understand what actually is going on in the scene other that the fact that the protagonist is winning.Then there is the cliched romance subplot that is totally unnecessary and doesn't affect the plot in any major way.Overall the movie has been overhyped and despite being a decent movie, it's definitely not Oscar worthy.

reviews.review_title: Good movie but not capable of giving 10 starts.
reviews.content: Good movie but not capable of 10 stars. Nice screen play story dialogs and all, animation could be made more detailed. Nice intro intervel and climax. Movie is good but not as much the people are creating hype. You can watch this movie once but not again and again. Again I'm saying good story no issue in story but not unique. Only the concept is unique but story style and all is already present in other movies. I know many people given 10 stars but if really follow movies you would not give as some important things are missing in this movie. If you want to try something new then do watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Once in a life time experience (Truely Raw)
reviews.content: I was amazed by the performance , writting , direction , vision and the indeginious way of potrying our real culture without disturbing the sensitive elements .Lets come to the part which i am feeling bad for myself .This movie is been made for 70MM screen .We are not justifying it by watching it in a small screens .Perfect thrill , again and again , goosebumbs you cant ignore . I bet you will be shocked by the screenplay.Must watch if u know what cinema is .Thank you shetty family , hombale and the whole crew of the Kanatara for making a movie like this .Acting skills are on peak of whole cast.

Had a fantastic and amazing time at the cinemas. There are very few stories which can transcend beyond screen and remain in people's minds. This is one such film. When a movie has tried to depict and portray with such conviction and purity. You find it challenging to rate / review it.The director of this movie Rishab shetty who also is the main lead mentioned the most rooted storied have a global appeal as well, which is true. Instead of trying to ape other industry's movies. Movie makers should also focus on telling stories that is closer to their land. This is a must watch for all movie lovers.

May people belongs to the same culture can connect with the movie. Not for every one.It is basically a movie based on a myth that a god form came inside the body of the person who played it's role during cultural events. And fulfill the wish for something promised by the wisher. The next generation of the king who promised a land for the villagers who wish for mental peace and happiness not belives in this myth and wants that land back from villagers and do various politics for that but the God form came back in the body of the hero and make sure that promised kept unbroken by killing the heir of the king who wants land back from villagers. Nothing new in the story.

The Build up to the movie was absolutely masterclass - even though everyone knew what's going to happen and to a certain extent predictable but hats off to the execution, one knows what's coming and still u want to see how it happens , one of the 1st movies which has an predictable story line but beautiful execution - The last 10 mins was goosebumps - everyone was superb - Rishab is a gem - writer - actor - director - this movie has got it all - just for the sake of watching something which will eventually make u respect the forest and it's inhabitants their folks their legends - well done team.

reviews.review_title: Normal average movie..far from masterpiece or Oscar deserving
reviews.content: No doubt, it is a good film with extraordinary acting (esp by Rishabh Shetty and Kishore Kumar G.), cinematography, a beautiful depiction of the grassroot culture, vastness and magnificence of the forest, yet the storyline is not that strong. At certain places the movie becomes unnecessarily dragged. There was no need of repetitive double meaning jokes by Shiva's friends. Instead something should have been described regarding the importance of the deities (Panjurli and Guliga) in Mythology. Its a minimum expectation when those two are the core characters around which the story revolves. Also some fight scenes could have been shortened. The roar of the deities was so frequent that after certain time it lost its charm.The story could have been made much gripping when you compare with movies such as Tumbaad, Aayirathil Oruvan, Avane Srimannarayana, Rangitaranga, Ratsasana or even Karthikeya 2. Or not so far such as The Kashmir Files, which shook the entire nation to its core. For a person, who has watched all these masterpieces, Kantara is a normal movie with 6 or max 6.5 stars.

This is simply a masterpiece in the history of Indian cinema. A perfect film in all aspects. I suggest to not wait for OTT release, this film will give a next level experience in the cinema hall.After watching this movie I feel that the similar tradition is also available in my village. Also friends from Bihar, Uttrakhand, Himachal Pradesh also feels the same.The acting and the background score is amazing. You'll feel goosebumps while watching the movie.This film is a real presentation of true Indian culture and the face of cinema. You can expect such film from so called Bollywood. You can't afford to miss this!

Unbelievable and insane.The movie was so engaging from the start till the end and the climax part will take your breath out.All the technical teams have done their role so perfectly and also the cast.This movie shows in depth about our land (tulunad in Karnataka) and the culture/people so beautifully and visuals were stunning, felt so real.What a powerful performance by Rishab Shetty and his gang were just awesome, as soon as they enter, they'll make you laugh with just their appearance.This movie is made only for theatre experience.As soon as you enter the theatre, you enter into the world of Kantara.Watch it soon in your nearby theatres now.

What a masterpiece you have created Dear @shetty_rishab Sir! Saw the movie with my family and we were thrilled to the core and the entire theatre left with goosebumps. Speechless Mind-blowing Extraordinary true story of our Bhartiya Culture 👏👏👏
#Kantara has grossed over 27Cr in AP-TGAll set to break KGF records in other states as wellThe movie has grossed over 2.5C in KL and 2cr in TNThis movie has the potential to cross #KGF2 in Karnataka 👍🏻#DevineBlockbusterKantara
Watched #Kantara last night. Blown away by the profundity of the underlying idea, philosophy & its execution. Loved how the Indian native story has been told with all its originality, ordinariness & POWER hidden behind the surface. Such intellect & art, Bollywood is incapable of.

Apart from Rishab Shetty's scintillating performance, this movie doesn't offer much. The exploration of demigods and spirituality was inadequate and was mostly masked by cheap jokes and the usual South Indian commercial stunts. The storyline had real potential, but lost it's fizz in the first half itself. And who woes a girl by pinching her waist? Shouldn't happen even in a folklore village!! Gross! Disappointed to say the least.Having said that, Rishab Shetty did stand out. Outstanding performance, to say the least. The climax felt surreal and that's the only takeway in this movie. Not sure how the review has managed a 8+ in IMDB. Some people even showed the audacity of comparing this with the success of Bahubali! That's the biggest insult till date to Bahubali. Overall, the most overrated movie of the year.

Nothing its just fablous. No loopholes. Loves how they show the culture. This is the masterpiece under such a small budget. Amazing shooting location. All things are on point. I rarely like movies but i love this movie. You must watch this movie highly recommend. This is the great depection of what old culture is and good story telling, cinemagraphy, acting, light, everything is on point. This movie worth every penny of yours. Also consists of great discription of village life and their problems. Dont miss the ending especially last 20 mintues are fabulous and amazing to watch. The music is also great and engaging.

Movie gives you glimpses of Bhutharadhane followed by the people of Dakshina Kannada.Excellent composition, music and compilations coupled with extremely good work by Rishabh Shetty in the pilot role, as an actor and the director. Watched the movie yesterday but believe me I am still in trance!A movie that can compete with the Hollywood in terms of acting, making, music and directions! Daiva, kola, koli katta, kambla all in one movie, my god, I am still getting goose bumps!! Excellent team work by Rishabh Shetty, Achyuth Kumar, Kishor, Sapthami Gowda to bring out the best of every talent, a must watch for all!!All actors have contributed to bring out the best of movies, an able contestant for the national award!!!

reviews.review_title: A Powerful and Moving Faith-Based Film
reviews.content: The acting was top-notch and the cinematography was stunning, bringing the story to life in a way that was both authentic and engaging.However, I must warn those who are not into religion that this movie may not be for them. It is a deeply spiritual and religious film, and those who are not interested in may not find it as enjoyable or meaningful.For those who are open to exploring faith and spirituality, however, I highly recommend giving "Kantara" a chance. It is a truly inspiring and thought-provoking film that will leave a lasting impression on anyone who watches it.There are many such legends in this country which can be showcased in a proper way when done well like this.

dunt wait for anything Go and watch . What you have watched till now ... " Voo Sab Pani Kam Chaii " Hai Iss se aage :)

reviews.review_title: Masterpiece You cannot act without devotion

It had everything for a common village story... land grabbing issue . Forest conservation.. common folk lore and life of common villagers..

reviews.review_title: The Best Movie Of This Year!
reviews.content:
After watching a lot of reviews and rating on imdb of this movie, I finally went to watch this movie and to be honest I am blown away by every single second of this movie.From starting till end this movie will keep you entertained with the comedy scenes, dramatic turns and chilling screams & this is the best movie of this year so far for this genre because this year RRR & 777 Charlie came out and they were masterpieces too.This movie will take you to another level of the gods power.Cinematography = Perfect
Direction = Perfect
Background score = Perfect
This movie was made with heart and not to be missed.I'll recommend everyone to experience this perfection on the big screen.And Rishab Shetty , Hats off to you.

reviews.review_title: Bollywood, Hollywood, learn how to make a movie !!
reviews.content: One of the best ever made movie, across the world, in any language. Brilliant work. Every scene comes with so much conviction, excellent acting and direction. Kishore also did good job.Hats Off.

Best story, Best music, Best acting, best cinematography, Best direction, Best costume, Best art, Best film, Best dialogues, Best screenplay, Best writing, everything was best, best experience in theatre, best location, best background score want to watch again and again in theatre... never feel bored while watching again and again. We need this type of cinema in India. Realistic cinema 10 out of 10 rating for the hard working team without good team it's not possible to make this type of Masterpiece. Really proud of Indian cinema KANTARA special thanks to the producers who believe in the story, director, writer Mr Rishabh Shetty thank you so much for giving this Masterpiece to Indian cinema really thank you so much...

reviews.review_title: Awaken Self , Expand to Fuse with Mother Nature
reviews.content:
The common sentiment of this Land Bharat is beyond limitations of language geography local beliefs. Life is potential rise of One to the very Zenith of existence one with Nature .OneDivinityInAll in OneNationIndia.That is possible even with One consumed & trapped within basic instincts-ShadRipus -Laze Lust Greed Anger Jealousy & Hate dormant in us all. A extreme shock or genteel Shaktipaaat divine touch can allow that to rise step by step or in a lightening speed to the very top. Some call it SahastraHaar "1000 petaled Rose"an awakened open mind from all directions .Energy Exploding Event happens where all Shakti power physical strength included transcends all boundaries like last Glow before the lamp "goes off" to be one with TheLight beyond Sight.The self expands its limited radius to infinity to include all. Gratefulness fuels more Gratitude towards All that which Gives-Deva forces of Nature and society. Then One can easily see through the Evil hidden behind decorated facades and fake words. Injustice looses to universal judgement of GreaterGood of the innocents & vulnerable. SACRED Grove Kantara is not only in woods but within each one of us. A time will come when a "shout shriek" so shaterring will break all that binds us makes us limited .That day universe will conspire to make thing that is needed to happen.The Film takes us to Dakshin Kanara TuluLand around Mangalore. Uses great skills in art direction music sets acting & camerawork to Immerse us in its ways through revelation of lives of real people of all kinds.Selfishness looses and universal good wins-cliche is juxtaposed here in this unique scenario. It comes out winner as creators participants are all very sure ,full of self esteem and pride about its SelfLess Goodness .Go watch it to know it,
feel it and experience it just as the hidden ancient Rigvedic Verses of PurushSukta echoes from each corner of this BharatBhoomi .It Accepts Divinity in all forms Saguna to Nirguna as forces of Nature that gives us birth,sustains us and destroys us to be born again.Leave all preformed notions behind if you really wish the Film to rub in and unravel the magic within you too.

Today I am very happy and very proud to see this movie because the way tribal culture and their beliefs shown in this movie is absolutely real , their forest, village or Very happy to see the trust and love in tribal tradition and culture because I am also one of them and this is our tradition. And the way it has been shown in this movie that the tribals are being separated from the forest, it is also shown quite right. With the passage of time, now the tribal culture is slowly dying out because people have now left the village and started settling in the city and started forgetting the culture.

reviews.review_title: A MASTERPIECE Psychedelic Bone Chilling Goosebump Experience
reviews.content:
This is the first movie (i have watched a lot of movies, a lot) that sent goosebumps to my bone. Wtf is this man. What the hell did I just watched?Honest Review:
If you want pure thriller and bone chilling goosebumps then go for it. Let me tell you something more.Brace yourself for the last 20 mins of this movie. I can feel my body has goosebumps everywhere while writing this review.Acting, storyplay, character screentime I mean what else should I say. I am astounded and speechless.This is what movies should be like, this is nothing clitched thrillers or some usual jumpscares, this is pure thriller not happened before.One movie that you can relate to after watching this is TUMBBAD.

reviews.review_title: Best Indian Movie in last 5 decades
reviews.content: There are some movies that inspire you, then there are some movies which make you think and the most common movies that entertain you. But this movie has turned into a connection which one has with own soul. It is a soul stirring and TRUE to self movie which mesmerizes it's audience and leaves us with a very old still relevant message. There are something which is still not under human control in nature and there is nobody who can rule over nature. Absolutely divine, pure and honorable film making. Thanks Rishav Shetty and Hombale films. May be the best film in 2022 or at least in last 5 decades.

Really.. I think this will be the best kannada movie ever to be made..it's doesn't give a moments of boring. Full of curiosity n suspense....
really amazing... hats off Rishab Shetty sir amazing work onscreen n offscreen as a person.must watch movie in theatre....
I think this will be the best kannada movie ever to be made. No one I say no one even Rishabh can recreate what he has done in the movie. Simply awesome...Rishab shetty has performed amazingly.... Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high.....
feeling good n proud as kannadiga as always.

Pros:
Doesn't bore anywhere. Suspense, thriller and comedy well timed together.Rishabh Shetty has matured so much as an actor

Dark theme suits great, so does the locations used for the movie

When i entered the theatre i saw a massive audience geared up for the title, reading all the reviews on net, i was excited to see this film, unfortunately it didnt meet my expectations till the first 1 hr 45 min, it was a big drag at start, too much of forced comedy, i got bored but the big saver was the fight sequences in the climax, they were mind boggling.
