reviews.review_title: The real bramhastra of indian cinema
reviews.content: On first look ..i thought it would be somewhere similar to south Indian movies ..the feel and atmosphere when i saw the trailer ...but when i started watching it there is no scene which look unnecessary great background score, great cinematography and great action sequences ,this is pure work or heart of Rishabh shetty ...in the climax the acting of rishabh shetty ...is like never seen before ...the energy is pouring from head to toe..even to every single hair on the body ...great work, even the oscar is not needed for the authentication of this masterpiece...best director, best story writing ..its even greater then parasite .

What did you watch?Once again, I am watching a movie from an Indian cinema other than Bollywood, and I was impressed by this world that I discovered recently.Researching the original and inherited stories, as well as using good techniques in film making, including action tools, music, drama, character building, and storytelling for the film.This movie is worth watching and strongly because of the factors it contains that make you a hearty cinematic meal
Story, photography, music and acting
The important escalation of events down to the most important point and the high rise in the end.The final conflict of the film was considered legendary, and the director excelled in it in that he concluded the film with all force, which made himself a film that will remain forever.Kantara is a very important movie and worth watching.

This is a movie about traditions followed in Coastal Karnataka and the Tulunaadu region. Everything about this movie hits home. But it is imperative to note that I write this without any bias but based on observation. The movie starts with some backstory in the late 19th century and then goes into the future giving some context to the audience. We are then introduced to the hero whose impeccable acting has captivated with us with a plethora of elegance. I do not want to give much spoilers however this film has everything. A good plot, a good cast of actors(and for those who think the cast is horrible, let me remind you that these are veteran actors in the Tulu and Kannada film industry). The cinematography, the detail in representing culture, and literally everything about this film hits the bullseye. If you are open-minded and would love to learn more about the Tulunaadu and Coastal Karnataka culture, highly recommend watching this movie. There are scenes that might obfuscate certain users and all of them have cultural significance and reference. Overall, I would recommend folks to see this movie with zero expectations and be more understanding and curious. This is a movie that should not be missed watching in cinemas. All in all, this is my favorite film and could not recommend it enough.

reviews.review_title: Simply amazing. Must must watch. Watch it and you will keep thinking about it
reviews.content: A movie fantastically done, a story divinely executed.Must watch only in theater to experience a whole new level of marvelous screenplay.Rishab Shetty is pure gold.Entire crew delivered so well.Greatest of all time cinematography.Watch it and you will keep thinking about it.A movie fantastically done, a story divinely executed.Must watch only in theater to experience a whole new level of marvelous screenplay.Rishab Shetty is pure gold.Entire crew delivered so well.Greatest of all time cinematography.Watch it and you will keep thinking about it.Must must watch. In ages, you would get to see such a masterpiece.

Outstanding story with local culture and indian mythology as the thrust theme. Best performance by actors and amazing cinematography. Climax of the movie touches the heart and you can't stop yourself to go in the flow of emotions. What a find blend of tradition, folklore, indigenous issues. Such beautiful photography, action. This is what is cinema, what films are for. In the lead role, Shetty brings dizzying energy to bear upon his performance as the buffalo race champion Shiva, a fiery young rebel with a cause. The young man has to contend with demons of his own mind - recurring nightmares in which he sees visions of the reigning deity in a wrathful avatar drive him to the edge of despair and a constant need to give vent to his rising ire. Hats off to Rishabh Shetty! The total Masterpiece!

Kantara got its public attention in the midst of boycott Bollywood trending issue. Ever since the pandemic, there has been a setback for Bollywood as its experienced series of flop movies and audience rejection of copied content. This allowed rise of South film industry at pan-India level and enabled space for south movies to shine. Kantara is one of those movies that came out at the right time and gained some extra merit in audience similar to Karthikeya 2 (Telugu movie). As a movie, it has a unique plot and engaging story. Rishab performance was definitely a highlight to the movie. Over all it's a good movie and a one-time watch.However, it's not a GREAT movie that makes you emotionally connected to the story . There are other movies in south that has even better plot and stories. (Ex: Jai Bheem). In my opinion, Kantara is a decent movie but totally overrated. It was praised more than it deserved.

Words cannot describe the feeling I had when I came out of the movie theatre. I was dumb shocked with what I had experienced. Later sat down and was just thinking what made Rishab Shetty to think of this concept and how was his frame of mind while making this movie. I was just in Aww with film. All i can say is it's a beautiful Artistic movie. Which still cannot do justice for this outstanding movie. Looking forward to many more from Rishabh Shetty. I really hope people can appreciate such a beautiful cinematic experience and do not go stereo type comments on Kannada cinema anymore. Proud that it's an Indian cinema.

Kantara is Ambitious, tries to take you back to the early 1980s.Cinematography is accurate to the Plot, looks beautiful. The cultural heritage is captured in beautifully.Coming to Background score, must say it's TOP NOTCH, great work done on music department.The best part of the Film is Performance of Lead actor Rishabh Shetty.Especially the acting done in climax so Good that it succed to get audience goosebumps.What an inspiration, still being a low budget film, it doesn't look like it.Though the performance were extraordinary,
Story is predictive.I would say a great Attempt from the director/actor Rishabh. Kudos to his efforts.

reviews.review_title: Watch Kantara in theatres now - do not miss this gripping experience
reviews.content: Kantara is a film, which is set in the mystical forests of coastal Karnataka. There are no distracting VFX, just the raw setting and exceptional camera work which transport you into this world of the tribals living in/near the forest.The movie has all elements from subtle humour, to solid friendships, a fresh romantic angle, gorgeous music in Sanskrit, action and then the X factor. The Devas of the forest.You will find yourself sitting up with your spine erect, and goosebumps for some parts of the movie especially the climax. The experience leaves you shook. This is something totally fresh, something divinely inspired. Kantara is a must watch in theatres for the sound effects and visual treat. I watched it in Kannada with sub-titles.

A brilliant movie ! Having watched in OTT , can just imagine the theatre experience. FIrst 15 mins of the movie and the climax is mindblowing. To depict the art form, traditions with sincerity is too good. Rishabh has nailed it. Except for the dialogue delivery of Rishabh, it was a bit quick for me having watched the Kannada version. Some lines/words missed it. Otherwise it is a clean and fantastic one. Some needless controversy on song and misogyny. Song although sounds similiar ,context is different . May be they could credit this to the orignial team. To the other bit, people can just ignore and move on. Celebrate the goodness in the movie. Achuyth Kumar is brilliant and Kishore , a very neat role. The lady pc as well along with the initial artist who doned the role of the performer.Loved the theme. Great going ! Kudos to Rishabh for the creativity !

Whatever I say I will be nothing to what it is OMG i cried and i shivered this is what divine would feel like🙏🙏 What a movie... I was literally blown away by the dedication and acting of Rishabh Shetty. You need guts to pick the topic and execute in such a nice way. Mark my words this movie will get National Award. BGM, cinematography, direction and acting all were topnotch. Final 20 minutes of climax is unbelievable... never expected Rishabh Shetty got such an acting skill. Achyutha Kumar, Kishore acted really well... Daiva, kola, bootharadhane, kambala the classic culture of the Karavali Karnataka has been shown superbly.

reviews.review_title: Crazy good film surpassing language barrier....
reviews.content: This is a standout masterpiece....the film excels in all department...10/10....although I could take 1 point away in the writing department for the extreme unnecessary massacre shown in the last but this can be ignored away...this film absolutely grabs you from the throat within first few minutes and never let you go...even you walk out of the theatres back into your life...the treatment of the project is to marvel at...the BGM and cinematography are the biggest winners...then comes the Acting...and my God...Rishab Shetty acts on an another level in the climax....this film must get the National Award otherwise the government should shut down the awards programme....and thus this film should also represent India in the Oscars as well....and take it from a North Indian Hindi speaking film fan who has watched it on big screen with the aid of English subtitles....this is a blast on screen....better then RRR and KGF....do yourself a favour and watch it in theatres....

reviews.review_title: New standards set by actor Rishab Shetty
reviews.content: The whole movie is beautifully made with great cinematography, Rishab Shetty's acting is spine chilling especially in the climax one of the best climax i have ever seen in my life. The characters are so well written that none of them are brought unnecessarily when it comes to comedy the whole theater was laughing hell. Kantara is not just a movie it's an experience thanks i got to experience it in theater if your planning to watch it on OTT you will regret this decision the movie is tailored for theater please watch it on your nearest theaters please support good content oriented movies once again indian cinema will reach great heights.

Pride of Kannada movie industry...After Amruthavarshini undoubtedly the best content ever created in Karnataka if gone strictly by critical acclaim on every aspect of movie making..The Storyline, Rishabh's acting & BGM are truly iconic..
Depicting Supreme Lord Vishnu's third incarnation on earth called Varaha avtar. The forest tribal community devote to Varaha and considers bhootakola(divine dance of coastal kannada) performer to rudra demigod(Lord Shiva) who is gatekeeper of the community and protects every devotee of Lord Varaha from evil spirits(living/dead).. A promise of ancestors is under threat to be breached by people over lust of materialistic gains where the ancient king had made deal with demigods as bargain for his peace. With such powerful storyline, excellent performance by every actor keeping raw background showing beautiful traditional practices of coastal Karnataka.Must watch in theatres for experience!!

reviews.review_title: Great depiction of culture and art
reviews.content: I am surprised to see such a great movie which is made in limited budget. Cinematography is amazing. There is lots of thrill and suspense in the movie. Climax is superb. Guitarist have done well to match the climax. Some of the things that I don't like is Hindi translations was very poor. It could have been better. Rest of the things are good and you can't expect much from the new star cast. This subject is very sensitive and not only in south India this is practiced in north and widely in Himalaya where they have regional devtas that come to meet the village people every year. This is just the faith of villagers and it should be respected.

reviews.review_title: The movie is created by god on his own hand
reviews.content: As Rishab Shetty told in an interview this movie was created not just by him but by the grace and blessings of some unknown power and that power have continuously protected him during the creation of them movie. Actually he didnt told any lie or made fool to the Indian audience.If you have any interest or any direct realization of Spirituality, you must have this feelings in your span. And the way the movie have been created with an ecstatic ending, when the police man and all the good leaders of that Village was bring to the heart by the Daiva, during Bhoota Kola performance at climax not one can't shade the tear if do have any feeling, because only god can think like that kind of ending.

reviews.review_title: This movie will set new standards in Indian cinema!!
reviews.content: I am someone who made documentaries in the past and currently working on few short films. So, I understand film making as an art. This movie is a excellent example of storytelling. The acting was amazing and so was the story and bgm. The cinematography of the movie will remind you of Thumbbad. So you can understand the level of excellence of it. Every character is well written and keeps you attached till the very end. The movie is of 2.5 hour long but I genuinely didn't feel bored even for a second. I am a marathi so I might not able to understand few comic jokes but that didn't made me feel any less connected.

Amazing movie. Loved the culture, acting, comedy, cinematography, direction and story line. I was disappointed with villain.. the actor could not carry the transition.. even the character building of police officer fizzled out but can be overlooked. Rishab Shetty as Shiva was brilliant. Flawed yet a hero to his people. Aside to Rishab and Achyutha Rao rest of the cast are mostly unknown but have done brilliantly well. Comedy was subtle and enjoyable but not for kids. It was clearly mentioned 15+ yet some parents had brought in kids. These parents have lot of explaining to do at home. Must watch Kannada movie that show how diverse and beautiful my state is.

Don't miss it. Milestone for Indian cinema! Rishon and team done a grant job.Every aspects of the movie is awesome
Making and content is great
I one word content is the kingLovely location. Dialogues, songs, characters, sequences, interval, colour, cinematography, stunt, editing, bgm - all area worked with dedication with sincerity.The climax is just awestruck. Worth wait for 2 hours to watch that magnificent making. Rishb going to stay in our heart for long time and we don't know only he can break his own records which will be interesting to watch in the coming days.Overall this is finest film of 2022 and one of the best of 100 years of Indian cinemaLove it!

reviews.review_title: Mystical Forest delivers story in its entirety
reviews.content: Movies story telling and the BGM seems to excel from beginning to end.... The mystical forest And the folklore gives you the goosebumps...... Could have improved on the comedy scenes. Village fights scenes also could have been improved upon by giving some originality. Both the director, photographer and the actors have done an excellent job which will make the audience enjoy the folklore entertainment... It circles back to its triangular tension with a new design: the landlord, the people, the cop. The story has an untrammelled and unpredictable rhythm: the landlord seems compassionate, the cop villainous. But even the villagers-cops tussle doesn't play out as straight. Kantara's most resounding roar: that a benevolent ruler is still a ruler - that rights robbed will be robbed back keeps you glued to the screen.

There ain't a moment in this film when you're not absorbed, i being a non kannad was not allowed a second of peace. From the very first minute you're transported to their world and the co relation that they share with the unknown. The characters and the story telling is top notch. Every character leaves a lasting impression. The climax of the movie sends chill down the spine. Rishab Shetty is a beastThe Shetty's are just dropping one bomb after other. GGVV, 777 charlie and now this. Kannada cinemaThe best movie of the year. Easily. If this ain't recommended for the Oscars i don't know what can we say.

It's all about our devi devta devine powers. Rituals that we do in our day to day life in our festivals. It showcast that culture that is hidden or known from many of us. Sir Rishabh Shetty your Every part in this movie is commendable. Such a Raw character and acting done by everyone in the cast. This is the reality. Everyone want to see REAL not Reel. Rishabh Sir your major role was seen was obviously in the climax that may be entertaining or funny for some people but I have not witness this type of content in my life in any movie. As I'm a spiritual person I was connected by that scene! *11STAR*

Kantara has outstanding writing, direction, performances, BGM, cinematography.. it has authentic depiction of local culture of coastal Karnataka. I was mesmerized by the movie completely! Kudos to Rishab for making such an outstanding film! Such movies will help in educating our next generation of our rich heritage and preserve our culture. The climax was completely unexpected. I am happy the film was not dubbed in Hindi since the nuances would have been lost in translation. It takes deep conviction to believe in the audience and avoid the dubbing of the movie in other languages. Rishab has set the bar higher for himself!

Rishab Shetty is an epitome of a true cinephile. The story that He gave to the Indian cinema is cult, inimitable and incomparable. His Acting was masterpiece for the movie, Acting itself was so difficult for the character and on top of it He did Direction, it's unbelievable and unimaginable that how He must have managed such a strenuous work. Bow down to such personalities who are crazy about their domains. Sapthami Gowda played a simple character so perfectly that she was unrecognisable in actuality and that's a sign of great Actors. Kishore and Achyuth Kumar were the pillars for the film, very strong and intense acting given by both the icons. Loved their Acting. Music Director B. Ajaneesh Loknath has given powerful and energetic music to the film and I loved how he mixed Indian Classic and Arabic music whilst a fight scene, (I don't have much knowledge about music so I might explain it wrongly) But,anyways, the music became another reason to watch the movie again in theatre. Art Direction was a real hard work because the entire village was created, but it was beyond natural, the idea of Kailash and the way it was built was fantastic. Make Up work was beyond perfect. It gave goosebumps when the Daiv appeared on screen. Loved the entire creative work and the entire potrayal.

Hi,
This movie is typically very much authentic and originated from certain part of our Country (India).There are multiple religious ceremonies still sacred and celebrated around the year. But this one was literally Astonishingly depicted.I would definitely recommend this movie for all the believers of God.Moreover, the thing which I didn't like was the fighting scenes. They seemed unrealistic and not relatively retaining.Overall the cast was great, screenwriting and screenplay was superb with outstanding performances by the casting. Directorship was also good.Thank you for your time.Saurabh Krishan Gulab.

reviews.review_title: Bonechilling Masterpiece. Once in a lifetime experience.
reviews.content: Kantara means mighty forest. Film is a rolle coaster ride of Tulunadu culture which is coastal karnataka. Going regional is going global is proved yet again. What a masterpiece of acting, direction and writing by Rishab shetty. Go watch this movie and this movie is definitely need to be experienced only in theaters. Please watch it in theaters and support our regional indian culture. I am a tamilian but am proud of this movie as it shows our beautiful indian folkfore and culture. Please bring more movies like this. Ppppppaaaa i am not able to get out of the kantara world even after a week. Background music score running in my mind giving me tears and goosebumps and divine experience.

reviews.review_title: Don't miss it at any cost!!!!
reviews.content: Wah! What movie. Amazingly scripted ; well narrated with cultural setting to convey social message. Acting by every cast is simply wonderful . Storey takes us through fictional event built around preserving forest land, fauna and religious rituals around panjurli ( demigod).Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre.You gonna love it very much , their are some horror scene which are better then most horror movie itself,just go for it you all gonna laugh and will be thrilled and scared all at the same time.

Some of the best movie I have seen!Story -100%
Cinematography - 100%
Background music - 100%
Songs - 100%
Thrill - 100%
It's a beautiful story of a village people and their deity god, movie has some light comedy scenes with a good thrill, you can't feel off the movie even for a second, you can praise the movie in every possible sense.Some of the best movie I have seen!Story -100%
Cinematography - 100%
Background music - 100%
Songs - 100%
Thrill - 100%
It's a beautiful story of a village people and their deity god, movie has some light comedy scenes with a good thrill, you can't feel off the movie even for a second, you can praise the movie in every possible sense.

I'm from Tulunadu, where I used to see this practise as a young kid. The dedication and patience it takes to perform this over annual invocations to safe guard the village is intense. This art is so old, in fact it's common across entire India that worshiping nature and relating to a protector has been a tradition long before the modern way of living (industriali) came into existence. This movie portrays very carefully the mistakes you do when in greed, pre greed and post greed consequences of life. The last scene which many not understand as its native tongue of Tulu, the devia (demigod) simply puts out, when you seek blood for land/resource, it's the same sand I'll dissolve your blood into it! Making you worthless and void of a worthy soul.As an additional read about all the avatars vishnu had. This movies portrays to one of the avatars of Vishnu called Varaha (Boat who hold the planet earth on his boat tusks).

reviews.review_title: Why the rating is so high?
reviews.content: I am surprised with rating given to this movie. Except for the first 10 mins and last 10 minutes, the rest cant even be rated as an average movie. Everything is so predictable, and how can this be a thriller genre? Some things could have been included to add some emotions and drama, without making it so flat. Acting of all the people was good. Some narration could also be added if there is a story behind making this movie, like 7th sense movie explains about bodhidharma and why is he great.I had lot to expect from this movie to be entertaining, but whole of our family was heavily disappointed, as we felt bored through out.

reviews.review_title: Epic in every way, it will change Indian cinema forever.
reviews.content: The story is brilliant, cinematography and music are the best thing. The camera work and background music make you believe everything going on in the movie. Comedy, romance, action, thriller the film has all of the elements. The world they created looks so real thanks to the direction and acting. Everytime the horror element in the film comes I felt a very uneasy feeling because of the bgm and it's the best part. Now the climax , It was becoming a bit expected everytime the dev was coming but the climax. For 10 minutes during the climax I had that feeling you get when the ferris wheel comes down. I was screaming non-stop for at least 15 minutes. Rishab Shetty's acting combination with that bgm blown me away. I can write an essay on this movie but better go celebrate this revolutionary piece of art yourself in theatre.

The movie stands out in theatre. Rarely you get so touched by movie experience like this. The initial part and climax of movie is so powerful it will blow your mind.But the middle part is pretty mediocre and may be little bit stretched. And I think thats what made the movie to sink little bit in OTT platform.Acting is brilliant especially from lead characters. Also movie makes you sink right in to the culture and livelihood of the involved communities. Cinematography brilliant, background score up to par. Overall great movie experience with some hiccups in the middle. Also the song Varaharoopam hits different.

The movie was just awesome you did good by releasing it in hindi also because Bollywood gang would have copied it also and spoil it, just fantastic movie, a must watch movie it shows the culture of other state of our country everything is depicted so well in this movie that can't be explained, acting and expression of the actor was just outstanding no actor from Bollywood can do so. It is a master piece and should be watched by everyone in theatre what a work it is just fabulous which can't be explained in words we do have to feel the movie it is outstanding expressions of the actor in climax.

reviews.review_title: A decent film but not so good
reviews.content: As per my openion, the film was decent but not too good. Story was a bit different but actually old and predictible. All those dancers have done really mind-blowing acting and no doubt hats off to them. Of course a lot of action so too good if you like the action. Cinematography is really good. A movie totally on village life and forest conservation stuff. Too much use of alcohol and other stuffs like that .This movie is good though because some supernatural stuff has also been depicted. Too much violence which is related with story so not bad. Conclusion is that it is a good movie to watch but not too good or the best.

reviews.review_title: A tough film to create with such perfection
reviews.content: The film has no dull scene. But barring the beginning and the end, there are no memorable scenes either. The ending, however, is so good that it more than compensates for the lack of excitement in the middle part of the film.Film starts like a mythology , takes a turn to become a slice of life film showing typical village life in Karnataka and ends as a horror film which feels more spiritual actually in last 10 minutes.The characters are grounded in reality. I have not seen such perfectly cast non glamorous cast in any film till date. Only unrealistic thing is the hero beating multiple villain's henchmen easily enough.The film also raises important but opposing social issues like tribal rights and conservation of Nature without being preachy. The film uses a fake villain right until almost the end and the original villain character turns positive towards the end.The ending is the best one I have ever seen. Even if I do not see the whole film again, I can see the ending a dozen, or may be two dozen times.The film may seem simple, but it is very difficult to blend so many different genres in a single film like this. The director and writing team deserves accolades.Recommended.

reviews.review_title: First few minutes, will tell you the extraordinary ordinary story
reviews.content: I hv realised with in few minutes that this movie is going to be extraordinary. After that never git bored until the end. Story makes u engaged in the movie. Few jump scares and of all above Last few minutes, eye caotivating. The lead actors performance through outh the movie os complete, a complete actor. Ad in the end, he really acted ,no , he lived in that character. It only possible for who practices it and feels it. No one can do. And after watching this movie , It will be running behind ur mind, constantly. This is an epic movie, if you know the Indian village/ country traditions n cultures. Just go n watch , in theatre. U will love it, may adore it.

reviews.review_title: Artha, Kama, Dharma and a sequel?
reviews.content: If one understands what are Artha, Kama, Dharma and Moksha will love this movie, people who don't understand them deeply, they will subconsciously grasp it and hence it was able to connect with most of the Hindus in India.Only thing missing is Moksha, which i think will be part of sequel.Watched it twice , planning for third time just for the sheer conviction Rishab has shown unapologetically in this movie on lot of topics that are core to our culture. This is one undeniably best movie ever made in Indian film history period and it is going to stay for a very long period.I wish this movie never gets released on OTT atleast for another 6 months. This movie is strictly i repeat STRICTLY made for theatrical experience.This movie is a divine intervention the nation was awaiting for.

reviews.review_title: The movie you need to watch
reviews.content: With a small budget they did a splendid job. Direction, screenplay, cinematography, action best I ever seen in a small budget movie. They gave their best to this movie. Drama at its best. Pick social issues, make movies and people will love to watch. Rishab ji really puts all his efforts to make the movie. This is one of the best movie in recent released movies. You should watch this movie. I would like to thank all the starcast in the movie. They give their best. Sound effects was just wow. The ending was superb.Bollywood is making such crap movies and nepotisim is an issue with bollywood. You can't find stories in hindi movie.

reviews.review_title: Every second is incredible in this movie scene.
reviews.content: I am so excited to say that i am not missed on second of that movie.. love you to all team of kantara.. Not meant for review, no words to express felling after the watch. Once in life time movie😍Daivaradhane is belief and practice till day by tulunadu people and they protect our family and land from any harm. We felt deeply connected and can only done by Rishabh Shetty being deeply rooted to place can pull this off. Movie with no flaws watched it so many times brilliant acting by cast , mind-blowing music and camera work .Last few minutes felt vibration throughout body seeing Rishabh acting felt divine blessings behind it ,tears rolled down eyes at end.

*Kantara*
_..*A New Era!*_
Once Upon A Time Kannada Film Industry Is Considered As Weakest Film Industry Which Relied On Only Remakes Made With Mediocre Production Values, But Its All Dark History..Offlate Young Talent Brimming With Novel Thoughts Brought Back The Lost Fragrance Of Sandalwood To Kannada Film Industry..Heroes Are Not Scared To Experiment And Also Ventured Into 24 Crafts Of Film Making Which Resulted In Magical Marvels On Silver Screen*Kantara* Is An Latest Edition To This *Golden Era*..Based On Customs, Traditions And Beliefs Of Karnataka's South Canara Region..The Movie Was Rustic And Crude But It Was So Impactful..*Rishabh Shetty*'s Brilliant Portrayal As Shivanna Blows Out Audience Mind..30 Minutes Of Goosebumps Are Guranteed In Climax..Young Rebel Star Prabhas Heaps His Praise On His Instagram Page And Twitter Handle About This Movie And A Kannada Movie Is Running To Packed Houses In Hyderabad Itself Speak Volumes About This MovieA Must Watch!!

reviews.review_title: Hold Your Breath and Watch Movie! Masterpiece!!!
reviews.content: It's a fantastic movie. Extraordinary acting. Heart Touching Songs. Best Cultural Movie. Best Action, Direction and Screenplay. Best Story. The movie is perfect from every angle. Overall the film is Super Duper Hit. Highest Rated Movie. Love our culture Coastal Region. Love our language Kannada. Love our state Karnataka. Love our country India. Love our Dharma Sanatan Dharma. It's a fantastic movie. Extraordinary acting. Heart Touching Songs. Best Cultural Movie. Best Action, Direction and Screenplay. Best Story. The movie is perfect from every angle. Overall the film is Super Duper Hit. Highest Rated Movie. Love our culture Coastal Region. Love our language Kannada. Love our state Karnataka. Love our country India. Love our Dharma Sanatan Dharma.

What a movie!!! Great story and fantastic ending. Acting is superb all around with great music to go by. This is easily one of the best movies to come out this year!!!Kantaara world is vibrant and delightfully rich in color, tradition. The story is about a man's greed for wealth and to the extent he is willing to go. Before being shown his place. It interwines a mystique story among the rich Karnataka folklore, traditions. Visuals are beautiful and add as much to the movie as its story and acting.The climax of the movie will stay with you for a long time, haunting you and making you revisit multiple times.

reviews.review_title: Made me believe in religion strongly
reviews.content: This movie regained my faith in Hindu tradition and culture. The amount of effort put in by the entire cast and crew is applaudable and it is a movie that has stayed with me even after 2 months and left a significant impact on how I see my religion now.Rishabh Shetty has done all he can with the job of actor, producer and director, proving how capable he is to do all these 3 roles with excellence.This movie should be India's standards for Oscars and should inspire many to believe firm in their religion.The movie has well developed characters, interesting narration and a theme of supernatural elements that leave you in a sense of mystery.Brilliant movie, Truly.

Outstanding movie a must watch movie for all ages as it is a mixture of folk and environment and has a very needful message to the society uplifts coastal Karnataka culture .Culture is always related to environment which is brilliantly shown in this movie
Please support and do watch this movie
Rishab Shetty acting is very difficult but he as done it brilliantly and has not hurt any emotions but made us aware of our duties towards nature
Best cinematography
Each and every actors where amazing
Music of this movie really creates a vibe
Music really makes you to feel the movie
#save nature # save forest #
#This movie should win a award
#Kantara #Rishab Shetty #Environmen.

reviews.review_title: Riveting filmmaking - unapologetic, gritty and immersive. Experience of a lifetime!
reviews.content: Kantara, right from the get go espouses a certain veneration which becomes organically manifest as the movie proceeds. The ingenuity and lack of pretense in the screenplay is what allows a witness, a normal moviegoer to get immersed in its world. Mind this, the movie doesn't try too hard to pull you in - but its simple state of being is sufficient enough for one to try and learn more about this world. However, the charade of unfamiliarity (as I write this as a northern Indian) breaks lose when the movie reveals its soulful intent - to present a glorious tableau of divinity.There are going to be many reviews talking about the stellar performance of all departments of the movie and especially Rishab Shetty ji. But what one might cursorily fail to notice is his performance as Daiva, the revered Demigod. It's not a performance, it's a direct manifestation. For anyone familiar with the spiritual science it would not be a surprise. Kantara, then, comes across as an interplay of the divine - perhaps it would act as a beginning of a larger Dharmic revolution that awaits the land of Bharat.The prowess of Daiva is carefully revealed by the end - His howl becoming a bold foretelling of things that are about to come in this country. Kantara is a spark - the larger fire of dharmic revolution is not going to stop. The scream of Daiva, that reverberates through my ears as I write this review (struggling to collate thoughts clearly) is the scream, a roar - an announcement. The Sanatana shall rise again.Watch this movie to experience something ethereal. Especially the last 20 minutes of the movie that are beyond reviews and critical commentaries - the celebration of the Divine in its purity and pristineness. Rishab Shetty and team have been instrumental in something bigger that awaits this beautiful, beautiful nation.

I used to watch a lot of movies & gorge on books like cups of coffee. Now, I hardly read any book & don't have any interest in movies.I only watch a movie or pick a book, if they are not just a book/movie, they have to express something which is beyond articulation/presentation.One Such Movie is 'Kantara'
Kantara is a spiritual experience.It's soundtrack & background score perfectly complements the perpetual surreal experience and an ever-impending magnanimity.This movie is ideally to be watch on the big screen. It will make you hunt out all the available information on the spiritual connection between man & nature, as expressed through Buta Kola.

No words can describe the movie completely and do justice to the excellent work spanning across all departments. Everyone involved in the movie left very little room for errors or patchy display as seen in most movies these days. It was sad to see movie being given very few screens in Bangalore on the opening day. More shows were added over the weekend, thanks to the reviews and word of mouth from the audience. I had no hope for Kannada cinema few years ago as most of the scripts had same old stories, loud mouthed heroes and filth pushing them to score decently. Rishab Shetty has taken time to mature and become an ace in the industry today. All the writers have mixed well to generate a proper script that does justice to the regional priorities and the beliefs. Cinematography is really good without any vfx or over the head shots. Direction and acting stand tall across all segments and keep you on the toes throughout the run. Don't miss the movie as it has a very good message to all the humans and takes you back in time to trigger few basic questions we need to ask today from each other.

The thrill is just crazy awesome.Loved the the actors, the direction, the culture, the way it has been directed in the jungles.Shows the raw culture of the coastal Karnataka region. Rishab shetty has done a very very good job.This movie is an iconic one in Kannada film industry, the begining of a new era in Kannada industry.This shows the Hindu gods in a very good way and I am proud that this movie has covered the proud hindu culture in their movie.Congrats to everyone involved in production of this movie, You guys have created a master piece. Death to Bollywood, here rises the Indian movies.

reviews.review_title: You can't escape from Magical world of kantara
reviews.content:
Once again after " garuda gamana" Rishabh proved that you need good willpower to make content for everyone not hate towards any religion.You don't need Big names,Big banner, Huge budget,Unnecessary VFX,CGI,PR team,paid media. To sell your Rotten product. You just need pure heart, good content,class acting ,mass drama, cultural hospitality,the story belongs to each person.This is not just master piece,it's one of the best creation not only for sandalwood but Pan India level.The culture limited to south Karnataka,
today world widely known.Last 22 minutes mesmerized you.Can't come out with blank mind.Thank to Rishabh and team for bringing such a brilliant concept,ancient foot print.Specially promoting regional festival throughout India
Deities that serve and protecting nature and human being.

The Movie Has Everything From Action , Drama, Mythology, Thriller, Comedy, Culture this Is a Cult Classic. The Movie Has Rishab Shetty And his Acting was Highly Stored with Anger and The climax The Varaha Avatar Of Bhagwan Vishnu Himself came into his body just Blown my Eyes . The movie Has Character of Pramod Shetty That Character he played with Perfection. Achyut Kumar Acting was Perfect as A Villian He is A Great Actor . The Character of Shiva's mother Was Too Natural , I liked It So much. Kishore's Acting Was Rigid and Cool😎. The Character of Leela By Sapthami mam was Outstanding. The movie Is A Mythological Masterpiece . Wooooooow🔥

Wow! Amazing experience in theatre. Must watch one. The direction, camera, editing, hardwork, bgm, all good. It's very difficult to act like that for an outsider who not involved in such Bhootha kolas. The hardwork pays off. For me it's a good package where they tried to bring the reality in fighting sequences and the songs were really tremendous. This type of movies should be encouraged by movie lovers, take them to the success. I'm not a devotee but i watched this movie and really loved it the way the bring the traditional instincts. Actually from Tulunad region where this Kolas are common, so I know how difficult to act Bhootha, Rishab did it well. Hat's off.

This movie was recommended to me by a very dear friend who went for the movie by herself.I went to the cinemas to watch but had a houseful board so couldn't watch it. That same night i got a message from a fellow movie buff about this again. I saw it as a sign and went on the day of Diwali. And what a surreal experience.The movie talks about a wide array of topics like the land to its ancestry, the concept of paap, friendship, conflict of two thought points and the whole idea of rituals in a contemporary society in a very fresh and micro regional perspective.The writer / director and lead actor Rishab Shetty shines in this marvellous movie. The female lead Sapthami Gowda looks picture perfect as the woman torn between life and duty. Kishore Kumar G. As the Forest Officer Murali is top notch.The shining work by cinematographer Arvind Kashyap is visible in each frame by means of carefully blending the story with his framing of visual poetry.The background score is gritty, the music encapsulates local sounds and folklore perfectly and this movie makes you wonder how much we have to learn from our own music before going to look for melody in the west.The fight sequences, the dance of "daiva" and the makeup as well as costumes department have done magic.Locations are all real and the art department has done a beautiful job in capturing the essence of the story with utmost honesty. I can see Kantara as one prime example of how to tell a story effectively.The underlying message of inclusion and nature vs man subplot along with the importance of preservation of nature by the native dwellers coming vis a vis with the ones who look at land as a possession is also a huge takeaway from this stunning masterpiece by the Kannada movie makers who have created yet another visual extravaganza with a heart. This is probably the first movie after maybe Avatar to explore such a rooted storyline with a treatment that is strong and powerful like "Kantara"

An amazing and mind blowing movie. Climax is splendor and feast for eyes. Must watch movie for its splendid story and acting of all actors. Rishabh Shetty made it another time. reviews.content: No reviews required just go watch and pour in appreciation, it would make them to showcases such more epic movies.Legend of kantara remains in hearts 💕 forever !!! Performance of each n every cast is amazing , truly deserve more accolades and lots of positive response from audiences.The story line concept and cinematography excellent, The climax gives you goosebumps and make you sit tight and wonder how the hell did he pulled of such performance.Also this movie will open the doors for more such fascinating naturally talented actors to come forward and showcase their talents.What's next !!!

After a long time I have seen an original work of art. The movie remains true to its roots throughout. There are no forced scenes and everything ties into the story. Execution in terms of direction and acting is perfect. Not a single dull moment. Did not fall asleep while watching a movie after a really long time.The movie revolves around the rural legend of karnataka. The story seems to have been written after a lot of research into the phenomena of village God. The set, cast and dialogues are genuine.The movie revolves around the rural legend of karnataka. The story seems to have been written after a lot of research into the phenomena of village God. The set, cast and dialogues are genuine.

A humble request to everyone to watch this masterpiece. A simple and realistic story yet with such a powerful performance , message and gripped storyline that will leave u hungover even after you leave the theatre. A single scene also isn't as such which will bore u in the movie. Cinematography is top notch and I can go on and on..
Exhilarating and inhumane performance by Rishab Shetty . This movie is a benchmark in KFI. Excellent performance by every cast in the movie. Please do watch it experience it. Reviews or words cannot do justice to this movie. This movie is now available in all language so please enjoy 👍😍

Kantara has an interesting plot that highlights the importance of preserving nature. There are several moments that make you sit up. The lead actor is top notch. What could have been a high class movie has turned out to be a noisy and ordinary affair primarily because of the poor comedy and routine scenes that keep interrupting the narration. The viewer is never allowed to absorb the story as the scenes keep moving from one to the other without letting the viewer get emotionally connected. Excessive noise and violence is quite jarring and several unnecessary shots in the name of nativity could have been avoided. With a taught narration the movie would have been great.

Not meant for review, no words to express felling after the watch. Once in life time movie😍Daivaradhane is belief and practice till day by tulunadu people and they protect our family and land from any harm. We felt deeply connected and can only done by Rishabh Shetty being deeply rooted to place can pull this off. Movie with no flaws watched it so many times brilliant acting by cast , mind-blowing music and camera work .Last few minutes felt vibration throughout body seeing Rishabh acting felt divine blessings behind it ,tears rolled down eyes at end 🙏This needs to reach highest audience across India.

Beautifully shot is definitely worth a watch... Simply simply outstanding... I am truly speechless with the story line and the acting... keeps you entertained throughout... The story is beautifully written that truly captures the essence of the tuluva rituals in Coastal Karnataka... The acting from everyone in the movie deserves every bit of attention... Light humor in between keeps you engaged throughout... The screenplay, the location where the film was shot and also the technical team deserve a huge round of appreciation... Kudos to the entire team for putting on an amazing performance and in my option this one is going places for sure...

After reading lots of both positive & negative reviews, still watched it on Netflix.Is Rishabh Shetty a genius? Is Kantara the best Indian movie ever? No & No.But Rishabh Shetty is a master story teller. And Kantara is a beautiful story.The culture of Karnataka, the festivals, the food, the hunting, the daily life of people, the deep-rooted beliefs and the darkest desires depicted in Kantara gave me goosebumps. And my heart nearly exploded at the reincarnation of Shiva (Introduction of Guliga).Comedy & Romance was beautiful, subtle, not too unnecessary. Kudos to Mr Shetty & Kannada Cinema.

The only thing this movie did was promote superstition and idiocy. Once you start it and watch the first 15-20 mins, you are waiting for the movie to end, but it drags on in a loop and ends in a whimper. Some awesome movies have recently come out from Telugu, Kannada, Malyalam and Tamil film industry, but this ain't the one. Your time would be better spent watching something with an iota of content. This movie deserves a hard pass and a rating of 0.5 if that was possible.

reviews.content:
Hi Movie Lovers,
this is My first review on IMDB which is coming for Kantara Movie i watched this Movie yesterday when my wife asked to try this after seeing so much good hype on social media .I want to be truthful , i dont like South Indian and chines Movies because of over acting and kind of action they show.But this is one which is a south indian movie but due to good story and direction, changed my opinion.I dont know who is Rishab shetty . Just saw that he was shiva in Movie .I think he did a great job in movie and making of this movie he should be given credit.I am very Sorry Rishab Shetty if i could have watched this movie in Theater i would have but in my home city there is no theater which is featuring this movie right now.Brother i am thankful that you put efforts to make this movie .I am totally amazed.

reviews.review_title: Came out of theatre with Goosebumps ON..
reviews.content: Terrific movie. You will love every part of the movie. Rishab hats off for pulling up both the categories acting & direction. 90% of the movie is good but climax the last 10% of the movie is like surgical strike which happens before election. Bring us chill in our bone & will be in same Kantara world after coming out of the theatre also. Must watch in theatre to get that experience.Rishab has excelled in direction department but acting is into another level for that climax scene. BGM, camera work, supporting actors everyone has done their part very well.I have seen all these demigod worship in my native so i could relate every inch of it.

The entire Kantara team has done an exceptional job in selecting this otherwise risky & touchy subject of Kola/Bhootaradane; but has given 100% justice without demeaning the practices of coastal Karnataka. Rishab is awesome and well supported by army of actors lead by the greats Achyuth Kumar + Kishore and well supported by other good actors & comedians who hail from coastal Karnataka. I was hesitant to watch because of the subject which may end up being slow paced, but loved the pace of the movie which didn't give a chance to get bored with light hearted comedy in very serious scenes too. Wish the team very best and looking forward for loads of awards to be bagged for 2022.

Such a predictable story with over the top action scenes and non-stop screaming for no good reason.They gave this movie a religious edge to ensure people don't criticize it too much. I expected things to get better after the interval but it only got worse, especially with last action sequence. I'm not a huge fan of any Kannada movies!! But this movie has my heart!! What a movie, mind blown!! Rishab Shetty what an acting no words to describe the movie. This movie has everything in it Humour, god fearing, suspense. Can't wait to watch this movie again in the theatres!! Acting Direction is extremely good. The way they have taken the movie is too extraordinary to describe. Each and every role has its own way of showing how the movie is made. This movie definitely deserves many awards!! No wonder I started watching Rishab shetty other movies too!! His other movies are also very extraordinarily made!!

reviews.review_title: A deep spiritual journey with a riveting climax
reviews.content: Made on a medium budget meant just for Kannada audiences, it's no surprise Kantara became a huge blockbuster not just in India but worldwide. Rishabh Shetty created magic by picking a deep-rooted ancient Hindu cultural tradition and giving it a cinematic expression that will leave you stunned as the end credit rolls on the screen. Huge respect to everyone involved in the making of Kantara for preserving the essence and mysticism of "Buta Kola" without ruining it in the name of artistic license. Big budget Bollywood (Hindi) movie makers who still churn out hackneyed trash should take a lesson from Kantara on how to use a small regional tradition as theme for a movie and turn it into a pan-Indian cinema. Two standouts are the cast and the Varaha Roopam soundtrack. Those who were fortunate enough to watch Kantara in theater should thank God as they got to watch it with the original Varaha Roopam soundtrack. In the OTT release (Amazon Prime) the makers had to replace the original track with another version which sounds so ordinary and soulless compared to the original. Thanks to the music group Thaikkudam Bridge - infamous for remixing and plagiarizing heavy metal songs (listen to their song "Fish Rock" and then listen to "Joker and the Thief" by Wolfmother) litigating over copyright infringement managed to get a lower court in Kerala order a temporary stay on the original soundtrack from being shown on OTT. This has greatly affected the soul of Kantara if you watch it on streaming service.

reviews.review_title: Excellent movie - watch it on big screen
reviews.content:
Excellent movie. If you believe there is super natural power beyond human knowledge, understanding
watch it on big screen. Rishab Shetty acting in last 30 minutes is super.The movie basically based on rituals followed in coastal karnataka. Mainly in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts.In these districts even today it's followed and believed by people irrespective of any religion like people believe and worship serpent. If you are an atheist then don't watch it as you will find some fault.This movie sure going to sweep all national awards next year.It should be India's official entry to Oscar. Hope there won't be any politics.

reviews.review_title: Amazing display of art, cultures and legends of a coastal Karnataka
reviews.content: Rishabh Shetty in this directorial venture has proved that he is on track to become a great director. The nuances deployed in this movie to nudge the audience to guess, relate and understand the diverse culture (one among thousands in India), but still unique. He got the best of all the actors to create a magnum opus!The emotions displayed by Rishabh Shetty makes us go through the journey and the culmination stuns everybody - In some theatres audience just refuse to get up and others give a standing ovation.Hats off to the whole team for giving such a beautiful movie. Special mention to Kishore and Manasi Sudhir for their brilliant acting.

Watched it after hearing so much about it.Bad acting and same old story, Just another overhyped stupid kannad movie.The climax felt stupid, childish and very predictable.The movie was loaded with so many cringe scenes that we have been watching in last 2 decades:
1. Double meaning jokes
2. Toxic masculinity
3. Disrespect to women
4. Women objectification
5. Cliche hero worship and romance
6. Body shamingContradicting theme and message the movie puts forward:There are many forced comedy scenes which was not at all hilarious and often offensive.The romance angle: the hero pinches a woman's hip without her consent and wola! The next day she is in love with him.The fight scene also did not seem any special, we have seen many like in the usual mass masala movies.

reviews.review_title: I was left 'speechless' after watching Kantara.
reviews.content: ➡ Kantara is an action-thriller, written and directed by Rishab Shetty. He also plays the lead role in it.,➡ I was left 'speechless' after watching Kantara.➡ kantara movie will be given 9 🌟 by me because For bringing such a good movie in Hindi so late➡ Kantara is an action-thriller that celebrates the traditional culture of Kambla and Bhootha Kola. It features Rishab in a double role. Kantara's cast includes Kishore, Achyuth Kumar, Pramod Shetty, and Naveen D Padil among others. It is produced by Vijay Kiragandur under Hombale Films, the banner behind the KGF franchise.Congratulations For kannada Film industry.

Truly a divine experience throughout. Take a bow Rishab Shetty and team. An extravagant cinematic experience which can't be put to words. All together another level of story telling and depicting it. Not a single moment where you feel you are getting bored. The bhootakolla performance is par excellence. Goosebumps moments were too many.Everybody in the movie played their best and have set huge expectations for film industry all together.A visually stunning and elegant depiction of the cultural beauty of coastal Karnataka. Homballe films really amazing belief in producing the movie and believing in such a beautiful storytelling!

A wonderful movie experience! Apart from some extended fight scenes, I really loved the movie experience. Perfectly done. With its amazing background music and the quick story changes by the end the experience lingers on, even after the movie is over. The cast is chosen perfectly to suit the story. The plot twists are rightly timed and are made in such a way that you keep thinking about it, even after you walk out of the movie theatre. The movie is loud to replicate the kola, the screams and the music and the complete cinematography keeps ringing in your head even after the movie has ended. Highly recomend to watch this movie in the theatres only.

reviews.review_title: INTENSE 2 hour 40 mins and Climax is ... FULL TURBO MODE !!!
reviews.content: It is difficult to comprehend the intensity of this movie ... The tempo is high like a machine gun firing continuously ... no time for audience to relax (in a good way) and the climax .... boy o boy is Electrifying !!!.... I bet your mouths will be open while watching the climax in the cinema hall. This movie is meant to be experienced in the Cinema Hall because of the visuals and the music. I have never seen anything like it ...This movie is not trying to be Hollywood .... It has its own league .... Hindi movies lying in the corner ... majority trying to copy Hollywood should learn something from Kantara.The protagonist and the director of this movie Rishab Shetty ... has done a brilliant brilliant job .... he is the show stealer ... all other supporting cast have done a commendable job.Horror elements in the movie are also very scary and the jokes will make you chuckle.This movie is a MASTERPIECE !!!

It is the best movie I have seen in many years. Goosebumps in climax is guaranteed.This is the power of stories from grass root, the power of simplicity, the power of story telling. You will just not know how time flies while you watch this movie.Oscar's nomination and National Award is definitely on the cards and we will ensure this by spreading the word about the greatness of this movie.Rishab Shetty take a bow. MAy god bless you and fulfill all you wishes.The star cast is also absulutely brilliant, each and everyone plays their role with so much honesty and dedication.Please make sure you watch this masterpiece in Theatres!!

Awesome movie, Climax is extraordinary... New milestone in film industry.. Rishabh shetty is not acting in that movie, he was living in it. Climax emotions are unexpressable... Even if we don't understand tulu language, his expressions and actions will tell us the meaning. I watch movies of 7 languages but this is my favorite movie I had ever watched. Hats off to the crew. He didn't use any duplicate to support his stunts, it was done by him. Graphics are minimal, used wherever it is necessary. Music and song lyrics are awesome... All together if you miss this movie, you're missing the best movie in the industry.

reviews.review_title: A visual treat and heart melting performance movie
reviews.content: A movie which has broken all the records till date. Shiva aka Rishab Shetty's outstanding performance drove this movie across the world. Brilliant work by the director, the cinematographer and background scores which shall immerse you into the story which is relevant to each one of our lives. Songs are also very popular especially Varaha Roopam which is a classical masterpiece. Another highlight of this movie is projecting a village festival Kambala. Saptami Gowda's performance is good. Achyuta Kumar and Pramod Shetty played a significant roles. Overall each technician who worked for this movie have given their contribution to the film's success! Kudos.

I didn't Expected much from movie before going to watch, the development of a story, acting, choreography and organic development to the main plot is awesome, The final part of the movie is so awesome, u will forget that u r in a theatre and watching the Actor, u will feel like a god is infront of you. All credits goes to Rishab Shetty. In this year The Regional cinema comes up with so many good movies that Bollywood couldnt, from Malyalam, Telegu , Tamil & In Kannada cinemas we got so many beautiful movies, Kantara no doubt will be the No 1 movie of the year, and Rishab Shetty deserves the National award for his performance & vision.

It is simply a masterpiece work of Art and Divinity. We have seen mo ies of this genre, but here Rishab has brought in the class in all 3 sectors he handled - writing, directing and acting. The millage and acceptance the movie got is amazing and flawless. In this movie all the characters they were just living, they were all natural. The movie is a combination of mass and class. reviews.review_title: A movie to watch on a Big Screen
reviews.content: Excellent movie never gets bored throughout. All actors were too good.Rishab's acting top notch.But humor was too much and sentimental scene got suppressed. This was not ok which could have been avoided or could have created differently. -1 star for this.A social message could have been given by Rishab's self realization not to cut down trees in forest and hunting wild animals.Overall superb movie from a normal storyline with different outcome and a mind-blowing climax.

reviews.review_title: Deeply Rooted to the cultural heritage of Tulunadu, Karnataka
reviews.content: Kantara is a movie that takes you to it's world, you feel that the story is happening around you, feel the vibes of shiva, indulge in the divine Daivaradane, here the words of Guliga and Panjurli daiva.Conflict between human and nature have always been there since time, here in India we can see in many community that has come to an understanding with the nature, we see such examples in Kantara, Panjurli is associated with Varaaha/wild boar and to avoid conflict with it, we pray to it. Like wise we call the forest as Devara Kadu/ Forest of god, again to avoid conflict, when ever we associate something with god we avoid conflict,that is how the rich heritage of our country has been protected, So, Kantara is such conflict filled action adventure thrilling movie, that must be experienced in theaters.

Great direction, action, music, choreography and all round great in all aspects.carries a good line of story which is very close to the heart of coastal people but story takes all of people together and also takes into account of daiva which is demigod in costal region which it shows to rest of Karnataka how to show our culture to people with good cinematic experience with good storytelling which is not seen in nowadays directors and also music is awesome which adds on to the journey and also Kishore with his superb acting all adds to this gem of a movie and final 20 minutes are fantabulous and mind boggling.....

Awesome screenplay, brilliant direction, and unexpected climax with vishul treat. Director proved that he can be a very good actor. Loved the performance of all the character. All the best to the entire team. Special appreciation for kishore sir who had made the role of police officer.

I have never enjoyed a film like this one and my native is coastal Karnataka and they have clearly showed the culture and lifestyle of Kundapura and Mangalore region. Also I'm very happy to say that being a kundapurian, I'm very proud to born in this taluk. Also language used here is kundapura kannada. They are the reason to introduce lifestyle and culture of Kundapura and karavali region. I have seen many Bhootha Kola till now , but the GULIGA act was mind blowing and I think this would have not been done great if chance would have been given to actual kola artists. This film is gaining publicity through out the world should be rocking like this. KANTARA , ONDU DANTAKATHE 💥💥💥

I'm a half Karnataka guy who's settled in Andhra. I don't know why; but the change that RRR sherry's have brought to kannada movie is just awesome. I totally believe that movies become big hits when they show things in a different way but more than that, it also need to be relatable, believable which occurs in all their movies. A movie that shows the character plot of a life of a character definitely need to have the originality and Kantara definitely did it right!!! It's the first movie that I've seen entire auditorium have watched without taking out their mobiles and even clapped after the movie; that too on day 24 that too after 2nd show.The way the locations, music, costumes and the ultimate direction made us believe that we indeed are looking at lives of forest people obviously got a upright involvement of auditorium in to the story and later; whatever might be the journey of the characters, the entire auditorium were involved with them. The authenticity of the folklore, the body languages of the people all came from the extreme observation of the director and the writing is just awesome as always. There are even times which reminded me of GGVV when shiva was possessed. I don't think there was even a moment where a single person in the entire theatre watched it as a movie but watched as if the entire thing is happening in front of our eyes. Hope more and more such films of our culture would be made. I also strongly think that GGVV should be re released in all languages again.Love from Andhra.

The research,the dedication,the passion for art is just amusing. It's a rollercoaster ride filled with so much emotions and the comic timing too is so gooooood. The hindi dubbing is done very well . Last but not the least the climax , man i don't have words to describe it . You can only feel it so requesting all to not miss this masterpiece. It's definitely a Cinema at it's finest!

'Kantara' (means 'Mystical Forest').Absolutely blown away and super impressed. It's a movie based in the rural side of Western Ghats in Karnataka (Tulunadu region) with lotsa Mangaluru type kannada and accent. Reminded me of 'Guddada Bhoota' from DD days. You feel one hundred percent immersed into the lives of the villagers who live in this forest hamlet. Their language, their jokes, their banter all so authentic that you feel you're living, breathing, smelling, eating, talking, laughing along them. The lead actor, Rishab Shetty (who incidentally is also the writer director actor ) best of 20.

The story is simple. Around 150 to 200 years before, a local king ends up giving away a portion of his land to a group of tribals. The tribals settles in this land and make it their homes. Current time, Govt considers this land as forest encroachment and orders the tribals to vacate the place. The descendents of the King also get involved in this and they feel that they are the owner of this land.Everyone has given a brilliant performance and Rishab steals the show in the climax. Achyuth Kumar, Sapthami, Kishore, Pramod Shetty and other supporting actors have done great justice to their role. The last 30 minutes is the best I have seen in the recent past. Do not wait till it comes to OTT. Its a theatre movie.

reviews.review_title: Current Indian movie eligible for Oscar
reviews.content: This movie is jst a piece of art work , if you miss it you gonna miss a masterpiece which is one of its kind . This movie shows how great a storytelling can be and we Indians do know how to do it . No words can explain the general trivia of it , only your connection with the 'deyva" after watching it ,will make an life long impact on oneself . But for those who give it a watch on reviews first before booking a ticket, I want to tell you that if one loves the Indi folklores you will b delighted by the sheer excellence of the actors performance on every genre whether it may be comedy, drama etc.

I have already seen the movie twice at theaters. Every time I think of the last 15 minutes of the movie, it sends a shiver down my body and gives me goosebumps. The Guliga scene totally "consumes" anyone watching the movie.Having seen and being part of the "Daiva" culture, it's portrayal alongside a story on big screen is an unmatched experience.The movie brought back so many memories from my first Annappa Panjurli Kola in Dharmasthala.The movie is a window to one of the most sacred cultures of Karnataka. The movie carries a strong spiritual message all along, the delivers it with a bang at the end.A MUST watch in the theaters - multiple times.

I actually took the movie for granted after watching the public reviews and read other article reviews about the movie .I thought that this one of those movies that were overrated but it proved me WRONG. The mystical aspect and suspense of the film was exquisite and will leave you wanting for more. The acting and its outcome of the movie was EXCELLENT , no one can act as best as Mr. Rishab Shetty. It is actually a mediocre script but the screenplay will keep you at the edge of your sit near the climax. Worth watching in theatres for a better threatrical experience.Action :5/5
Cinematography:5/5
Camera work :5/5
Screenplay: 4/5.

Such an outstanding movie from Sandalwood industry! Hats off to Rishab shetty and team...This movie beautifully depicts about our culture and its importance. Every actors in the movie have delivered their role with utmost perfection. The climax of the movie is totally unexpected and Rishab Shetty' performance in the climax is out of the world! There's not even a single boring scene throughout the movie and it also make sure to keep the audience engaged from starting till the end. After watching this movie I really wish to go and witness this folklore festive in person at least for once in my lifetime.

What a movie. I just can't express what I saw. Fantastic just out of words. Just do yourself a favour and watch this masterpiece. But first understand Panjurli --- Divine Spirit of boar which is worshipped by Tulu Nadu people. Just watch it .Finally some praise for Rishabh Shetty Sir . Rishabh Shetty man fantastic chummi . The cinematography, Sets are so beautiful. It's actually shot in a jungle . Kishore also did brilliant job and Acyuth Kumar the guru pandian rocked again. All the actors have done fabulous job. Sapthami Gowda as Leela also looked pretty beautiful. All i can say is it's a must watch.

reviews.review_title: Let the divine enter your body to make the world a better place !
reviews.content: I watched it twice already. And may watch it again as there are so many layers to this film that it lingers on and makes you wonder and question what was that all about? And then you end up going to the theatre again to try and understand what exactly is this phenomena.The names of characters - Shiva, and his favourite place 'Kailasa' , The forest officer 'Murli' give a good hint about the roles they play. But the story is also so much about the beliefs of this land, how we consider stones and places in the forest as sacred grooves having some special power. But these beliefs have remained with the older people, the new generation thinks it's all a joke. Nothing scientific about it! It's all about greed and materialistic gains now. But that's where Kantara cuts right across all barriers. If you are an environmentalist, it speaks to you. If you are a tribal, it speaks with you. And especially if you are someone who loves to mock the beliefs of people- this film is totally for you! There are dimensions far beyond our logical understanding and the Indians and all ancient cultures have always believed that it's too small of a person to think he knows everything..because we have a tradition of bowing to that which is beyond human intellect and logic. This film reminds us of that dimension, it connects us all to that deep mystery hidden in all our hearts. The doubts we all carry- is he real? God? Does he exist? Glimpses appear, but we aren't sure and we carry on with our lives. Until one day when something shakes us to our very depths and whether it is due to 'time' , our time, or something else, but we finally stop ,we cleanse our beings so that the divine may enter us and all doubt is perished!

reviews.review_title: Divine.... your belief in God and nature
reviews.content: Such a brilliant movie. Story is of how people need to believe in God and know that God will ensure their protection. No need to go to any pilgrimage. No need to go anywhere. Believe in your own Kshetrapal/ Gramdaivat. They will protect you. The main protagonist is usual happy go lucky who finds God at the end, and then God through him does his work. Such a simple but brilliant concept. The story shows conflict between villagers who live in good symbiotic relation with the nature, and people who have come now bringing in order of Govt. Now this would be a very crude way describing the story. This movie has layers which will be peeled days later in your mind when you keep thinking of the movie. This movie makes you think long after you have seen it. The story keeps you hooked on with its fast narration hurtling towards the the inevitable end. Once you reach it, you witness divinity. The climax just brings out your reaction of namaskar to the divine protector. Just watch it. The background music keeps building on the story.

Kantara is the best movie to watch and to experience the culture of tulunadu. Rishabh Shetty one of the best director in kannada industry, will amaze us with his incredible acting skills. Became fan of his acting. Goosebumps throughout the movie, especially at last 20 mins. Tears of the devotion at end. Good number of songs in movies which won't disappoint us. Movie is beyond our imagination. Visuals, BGM , Making, cinematography and acting everything looks at it's best.Don't miss this masterpiece in theatre. It is like once in a lifetime movie. Must watch.Kantara - ondhu dantakathe🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

(As perspective from a north indian) I went to watch this movies after seeing the great reviews and great ending.Now my opinion, there is no debate on the performance of the cast, rishabh shetty has outperformed in each class direction, writing, acting. This movie was really good than the crappy movies bollywood is making. It was a real entertaining movie touching the culture which is not much known to most of the people in India itself. I felt there was a need of bit more clarification in the end given I was not that much aware of this culture, after watching it seems that that I have missed something in the movie that I was not able to connect completely with the movie.Other than that it was a really good movie to watch in theatre.
