reviews.review_title: One big applause for the entire KANTARA team....
reviews.content: A must-watch movie. This movie keeps u entertained & thrilled throughout the movie. Especially for the climax; Rishabh"s acting is unbelievable and I have Goosebumps all the way...!The film is a visual grandeur. DOP Aravind Kashyap has done a brilliant job with lighting and frames. A lot of attention is given to the making, which is dipped in folklore. Situational village comedy works well for the film. The film explores the culture of Tulunadu (Coastal Karnataka) and any compromise. It involves the culture of Kambla and Bhootha Kola (Daivaradhane). Ajaneesh Loknath's music is soothing. With plenty to savour for both mass and class audiences, Kantara undoubtedly makes for a wonderful theatrical experience.One big applause for the entire KANTARA team.... 👏 👏👏👏👏👏👏👏👏👏👏

#kantara - A movie that can neither be reviewed nor the feeling of watching it can be explained in a few words or sentences. It is just an experience that will take us to a different world. A world that lies within our own land. Be it with the story, narration, cinematography or the BGM - there is naturality in everything. I don't even want to mention about acting, as there is no acting here. Everyone has just played their role just like how it would happen in real life!I don't think I even blinked my eyes the last 20-30 minutes.It was a treat to watch Rishab Shetty on screen and I wonder how it would have been to play such a role during the shoot!Hombale Films are ensuring our Sandalwood grows to a greater level every time they make a movie 🙏Just go watch and experience this marvel. Goosebumps guaranteed...

Other than that movie shows the beautiful culture of coastal Karnataka region like Kambala and Bhootakola . First time went with less expectations and admired the movie a lot after watching today took my whole family again and everybody enjoyed the movie. This movie will be the topic for some more days to discuss with friends and fam. Thank you Rishab Shetty sir you are a gem.Don't wait for ott release and regret later just go and watch it in theatres.

The best parts about this movie are
-the premise of the story
-the art of storytelling and its pace
-the writing, the direction and dialogues
-the seriousness of the story
-the non-stop jokes where you least expect in the right amount presented appropriately
-the captivating catch of the culture, religious characteristics and their practices
-the search for truth, truthfulness and the ability to accept the cost of reality
-the importance of belief and faithfulness in the face of reality
-the awesome acting and the character development
-the best climax you could have asked for ending on the right note that there is no luck or happy ending... it's just life and we have to live with the unknowns
-the ability of the movie to make us become a part of itself and live through it
-the subtle messages (in case you catch) that makes you wonder what else you might have missed
-the fact that you might not be able to see what could have been improved!!-In Short and Long version, this movie IS LITERALLY A LEGEND.

reviews.review_title: Rishabh Shetty deserves more than Oscars for KANTARA
reviews.content: Kantara is absolutely a marvellous movie. Brilliant direction by Rishabh shetty. Screenplay is literally awesome. Rishabh shetty has shown his career best mind blowing massive action. Achyut Kumar, Kishore , Sapthami Gowda , Pramod Shetty all gave their real efforts to make the movie rich. In the film , the divine world will show its real beauty. Choreography is also appreciable. For most of the people it is not just a movie , it is a long-lasting emotion. A beautiful love story is in the film also. The whole film is on the base of divine culture , tradition, beliefs of particular region. Climax of the film will set the theatre on fire.

No words to explain.... Outstanding Cinema. All departments hardwork shows in the screen. Aravind Kashyap cinematography is next level. BGM and Song from Ajaneesh gives goosebumps. The Director and Actor Rishabh Shetty is fire. Saptami Gowda did excellent and romantic part is very raw and goes with the story well. The last climax is the must watch theatre experience and a divine moment. Proud film from Kannada industry and deeply rooted cultural but commercial entertainer. (PS: may be it's the mythological lord acted himself)

Mind blowing performance by Rishab Shetty. No boring elements in the movie. Every minute is utilised well and entertaining. The action sequences are raw and thrilling. Conflicts between man and nature have always provided enough fodder for our filmmakers to dole out one film after the other. Rishab Shetty's Kantara, though dealing with the same concept, strives to be original and wins at it by staying rooted and realistic.There are multiple viewpoints in Kantara, and it is all wonderfully brought together by Rishab, who has written and directed the film too.Rishab is only getting better with each film, and the backing of Hombale Films has allowed the filmmaker to make the movie more realistic. Even though it runs on the familiar territory of human-nature conflict, the chapters of Bhoota kola and Kambala make it unique. Every frame of the film is beautiful.

Happend to kantara today.One of the best movie I've seen so far which doesn't consists any cliche moments, there is no scene which seems boring. The movie contains good humour and also good story. The director and the hero of the movie rishab shetty has done phenomenal job in both direction and acting, one of the best acting I've seen so far.From background music to costume each and everything has been done perfectly.Choreography for few shots especially for climax has been done by raj b shetty another prominent actor.One of the best climax I've seen so far. Each and every scene contains perfection and to embrace the culture with movie, rishab has done phenomenal job.It will be a movie to remember for ages.Kantara(dark forest)- the legend.

Till date Rishab shetty's best performance, quality film with awesome cinematography and screen presence. Mind blowing climax act with proper portrayal of kudla tradition and culture. Pros in the movie are Rishab,Kishore, Achutha Kumar and comedy gang. Good music , very good narration and proper pace with audience is maintained. Good fiction with goosebumps thriller scenes and sequences. Songs are plus point. Rishab shetty intro , interval and climax are major pros . Only con is second half for few minutes the pace is slow. In total kantara is sandalwood industries best made and exhibited movie of present time.

Raw & rooted, with Kantara, you can feel the smell of the Indian soil. Representing the unique Dakshina Kannada culture of Kambala & Booth Kola, it's so colorful. Presented in an effortless, chaotic, and natural style, the world of Kantara sucks you in from the beginning. Music, comedy, fight sequences, cinematography, and esp-acting all tick the box of perfection!And then there's the climax, one of the greatest ever, which leaves you short of words and shaking. Easily among the best world movies of the year, I hope it reaches the global audience.All Heart and Art, Kantara is an experience for a lifetime.

reviews.review_title: To Infinity and Beyond - Magic of Kantara
reviews.content: Rishab Shetty, like a man possessed, sets out to drag us, the audience, into his world, intent on showing us the beauty, cruelty and the divinity of a magical landscape. When you are done with the spectacle, you, the unsuspecting viewer, leave the theater spellbound, as in, possessed.The scenes unravel in multicolor inside your eyes when you are in a shower, chase you down when you are on your morning run and scream the blood curdling scream when you are tossing and turning on your bed trying to catch some sleep. It is as if Rishab opened your skull, sucked your soul and whisked you on a ride to go visit your ancestors. Your brain, body and heart simply surrender, taking in the sights and sounds. Something alters. You can almost touch the loss, feel the grief, ride the immense joy, yet with no known way to release that energy, you will never be the same after this journey. If you think Rishab was a channel to bring this energy into this world, you will realize that you are a channel too. It may take a while, but you realize and relish the privilege you have been bestowed upon.Nature vs man, spirits vs living, societal hierarchies - there are multiple ways to slice and dice this magnum opus, this humble offering by Rishab to our forefathers. Yet, at its core, I see this as a love story between a father and a son, the paternal spirit relentlessly hovering, reminding, nudging, pushing an adamant man/child into his duties as a son of the soil. The son, as sensitive and brilliant that he is, tries to keep the wisdom at bay, in his vain attempts to keep the real world at bay.Portraying the love of a father who continues guarding his people, his son, even in death, this movie is a tribute to our guardian angels who guide us towards righteousness. The message I walked away with is, "This is yours, what you are made of. All of it - blood, sweat and beauty. Take it and cherish it."

Rishabh Shetty has produced another masterclass. One of his best movies.The movie reels you into its storyline and keeps you gripped till the very end. Not a moment of distraction or unnecessary cameos. The action sequences, the commedy, the songs, the rivalry... All so beautifully written and stitched together in a seamless manner.The Kambala and BoothaKola shown in the movie is rooted deep in the konkan coastal region of Karnataka. And for a movie to showcase this tradition and culture so elegantly and naturally is astounding.While all along, the story in the movie is being narrated from the older generation to the next in line.

Wow what a performance by rishab!!The storyline, visuals, colors, music, the divinity 🙏🏽 Everything is 100/100. Heroine is not a item number like in other movies. It is a very Where is Divine movie must watch for everyone especially kids Half today must watch this as it gives them a glimpse of what Indian culture is. It is now being dubbed into Hindi and I am hundred percent sure it's going to be a huge success throughout India. Definitely a box office hit no doubt about it. Can definitely watch it twice without losing interest. In fact I don't want to watch it again. If you don't watch it in the theatres and try to watch it on OTT platform it's not worth it. Must watch on theatres.

One of the very few movies that captivates its audience even after leaving the movie hall and this tops the chart .Amazing performance, story line and cinematography. Right from the trailer to watching the movie, the excitement hasnt died down, i am sure it wouldnt even after many days.Rishab shetty, mind blowing, you are simply amazing. A master piece and a class apart from the rest of the movies in kannada industry.The comic sense in such a serious story line is next level. Fascinating to see how captivating the movie is right from the beginning till the end.This years best movie ! Period....Great job to the whole team.

Beautiful depiction of combination of folklore, mythology, drama and storyline - something that touches you deep within. The ending climax moves you out of your chair. The movie remains in mind for weeks and forces one to think about engaging issues of the day. It is indeed a must watch for all. Also acquaints us with various struggles including tribal, rackrenting, landlordism, government excess among others. A show thriller with beautiful screenplay, characters and design.Also, focussed on subaltern perspective than the mainstream perspective touching the hearts of millions of people in India and beyond.

This movie is what Kannada film industry needs. Glad I could watch this on the first day of release, that too in America. The movie starts off well with a great background story. From then on, it's a rollercoaster ride. Every scene is so captivating that you will never take your eyes off the screen. The movie is so well made that every scene is rich of colors. Everybody in the movie has done an excellent work. Hope too see more of these gems in kannada film industry. Songs are a huge plus. Very good lyrics and music. Background music is great plus to this movie. Not even a single scene is blank without music. Do watch it.

This movie is a masterpiece trying to bring out the hidden, often misunderstood traditions into the mainstream. This is the reality, who many people in our country are not aware and it's absolutely okay. Such movies are helpful to make us all understand that India is a land of such a diversity and yet so beautiful.Acting of Rishabh Shetty. You need guts to pick the topic and execute in such a nice way. Mark my words this movie will get National Award. BGM, cinematography, direction and acting all were topnotch. Final 20 minutes of climax is unbelievable... never expected Rishabh Shetty got such an acting skill.

I never written review for any movie in my life and first time i downloaded imbd apk to write a review about the greatest cinema i had ever seen in my entire lifetime.Kantara a truly devine blockbuster. A great hats off to Rishabh and entire team for bringing our tulunadu tradition in such a fantastic manner, where one can connect to the root of his belief.A strange thing i observed when the movie ended and audience started walking out the cinema hall, THERE WAS PIN DROP SILENCE. I hope everybody are in KANTARA trance including me. Cinematography will definitely bring a joy to your eyes.A must watch in big screen i feel, definitely not once.

reviews.review_title: Simple yet will take you to the next level

Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre.

Bollywood has ruined life of youth picturizing unwanted love,lust,fashion stories
What we are seen doing same in daily life! Do we want so?India has a vast culture need to discover it and virtualize it universally
Every 20 km our language culture changes in India just imagine if we could show all these how easy it could be understanding culture of every treditions ,please stop fiction stories don't fool more
Learn from What Kantara has doneBecause of Rishab Shetty's hard work and talent movie has become such a hit..hats off sirAfter long time watched Kannada movie in theaters
Was housefull in Qatar.

reviews.review_title: Not meant for review, no words to express felling after the watch. Once in life time movie😍Daivaradhane is belief and practice till day by tulunadu people and they protect ou
reviews.content: Not meant for review, no words to express felling after the watch. Once in life time movie😍Daivaradhane is belief and practice till day by tulunadu people and they protect our family and land from any harm. We felt deeply connected and can only done by Rishabh Shetty being deeply rooted to place can pull this off. Movie with no flaws watched it so many times brilliant acting by cast , mind-blowing music and camera work .Last few minutes felt vibration throughout body seeing Rishabh acting felt divine blessings behind it ,tears rolled down eyes at end 🙏This needs to reach highest audience across India.

Starts and ends with a bang. With mid sections kept exciting and story telling is like a leaf bundle, opens one by one and you start understanding how nature and humanity is a trade of which needs to be in balance. The night visuals and forest shots are very hard to capture and they have produced it exceptionally. The background music varaha roopam is basically rip-off from Navarasa from thaikkudam bridge which is the usual steps of Ajaneesh Loknath. But yet it's still good and would be in the mind on loop. The story on man vs nature is explored not just in form of demiGod but as humans culture with it.

This is THE MOVIE, which every Indian should be proud of. This has awesome storyline, direction and the acting. Impact is such that, the character remains in you for a long time and you would want to experience it again.Go watch it in big screen and you will be amazed by the excellence in all the departments.This movie keeps you engaged all through, with comic dialogues and in the second half, the dynamics of the story changes, with an unbelievable ending. You will appreciate all the supporting characters, background music and more importantly the beautiful cinematography.To summarise this movie, "totally new and sensitive storyline with an amazing impact, which will leave you awestruck". Just go and watch it.

Outstanding movie acting , direction super from rahab Shetty. First movie i will go and watch once again. Last 20 min rahab Shetty stolen Everything and hear as well. Story will match this devotional very well. Thank you to the entire team of kantara presents every moment wonderful. There is no boring elements even in both first half and second half. As mentioned second half Last 20min will be mind blowing and still that moment which will be thinking to revisit to theatre once again and again also possible. Speechless direction and acting everyone is good and there is a comedy elements also there.

reviews.review_title: Felt like being part of the movie and connected am the way
reviews.content: Hats off to Rishabh shetty for everything he did in every department, direction, music, story telling, cinematography, climax.A must watch movie for a true cinema lover, regardless of their language and origin.Cast is fantastic, even had a good sense of humour in between.This movie has literally every thing from all the genres.Only thing missing was that there were not many layers to the story, a continuation to the premise at the end would have been a perfect end to the new beginning of the sequel.Love story was also super clean, not clinging to emotional side as many movies tend to go.

reviews.review_title: Kantara is raw n realistic approached movie
reviews.content:
Kantara is a family movie which has most realistic approach
It has fantastic story line which bought on screen so perfectly with no fake stunts and no unnecessary exposures
Have to appreciate rishab Shetty and whole kantara team
Music ,fight, costume are just so perfect.Kannada Industry gives quality films with relatively less budget
Budget of kantara movie is just 16crores !!!!!!Radheshyam,pushpa,liger and many more inspite of investing much more dint have quality of acting and decency that kantara has also kantara doesnt have unnecessary interrupting songs
All Songs are well placed and lyrics are just sooo meaningfull.

This has to be one of the best movies that I have seen in a long while. Movie makers from all across the country need to see & learn how to make a movie and bring the soul of a region to the audience! The very essence, soul and way of life of Karavali Karnataka is so beautifully brought out in the movie like no other! Rishab Shetty what a performance! Simply take a bow!!! Deserves nothing less than a National award for the story, cinematography, direction & best actor categories! The movie completely captivates you right from the start to the end! The climax especially last 15 to 20 mins takes your breath away. This movie is a must watch even if someone does not understand Kannada (there are English subtitles)! I will in fact stick my neck out and say this is one of the best movies ever made in my book!!!

This is film that one must watch just to understand the dynamics of a life lived in interior parts of kundapur, udupi, Mangalore Karnataka. There is Kambala, and Bhoota Kola, and then there is the story itself that rings true which is captured with stunning visuals. All of this, makes for a film that is definitely worth your time!The music of Kantara is also a star of the film that not only supports the narrative but elevates it as well. The inspiration from local folklore of Karnataka, the local artists that were spoken to, and the ones who were also featured in the film add authenticity to the endeavour of adapting a folklore. It is a simple tale about a community reclaiming the lands that were originally theirs, owed to them by a man who bartered with them. It would have come across as uninspired, if not for the introduction of Bhoota Kola, and the myths that surround spirit worshipping.Above all of this, what really takes the prize is Rishab's acting. This is something that the director-actor's friends had hyped up before the release of the film. However, the hype is real. The last 40 minutes of the film is where Rishab has truly outdone himself, and every moment is gravitating. There is no way you could stray away from the screen, not even momentarily.

Excellent performance by Rishab Shetty! Finally someone took the effort of showing the Daiva culture of Tulunadu! We the people of Tulunadu are really grateful to all the actors and their efforts for bringing such brilliant masterpiece to us audience! The climax was just amazing, i had goosebumps throughout the movie! Finally some recognition to the kannada industry while the bollywood is giving back to back flops, the south Indian movie industry is giving good content movies! People are changing so is their expectations from movies! Gone are the days when Bollywood once ruled the movie industry!

A masterpiece of a film. This is a phenomenal hit in theaters and will also be a cult hit among movie viewers for decades to come. The cinematography, fight choreography, the camera work in all the scenes and brilliant performances by all the cast has gone up against big names in the industry and has come out unscathed as a Goliath would.This is a movie that has to be experienced on the big screen so do not miss out on it while it's still running near you.Thanks to Hombale production house for bringing such a gem of a movie and investing in new talent instead of the usual names. This is a 11/10 movie and is a must watch for anyone.

reviews.review_title: To be watched with different views.. Ultimate Acting by the entire Team
reviews.content:
Awesome creation, beautiful locations, great acting all the actors.. This movie is different and to be watched with different level.I must say, Telugu Seetha Ramam movie was my favourite because of the director's different concept..Now this Kannada Masterpiece by Rishab Shetty also has different style of creativity..
Background music excellent, few scenes with goosebumps.A must watch movie with entire family members.Must to observe:
The Gods role
Few horror like scenes
Two beautiful songs. Thanks to Vijay Prakash for a beautiful and melodious song.Overall it's a treat to eyes, our own Kannada tradition has different stories..
wish the team to make such movies in future as well.

Beautifully crafted masterpiece. ! Kannada films are centered around south east KA esp Bengaluru. There needs to be more films coming out of Coastal KA, Malenadu, North west KA and North East KA. The climax is way too intense that you might forget to breathe !!!Beautifully crafted masterpiece. ! Kannada films are centered around south east KA esp Bengaluru. There needs to be more films coming out of Coastal KA, Malenadu, North west KA and North East KA. The climax is way too intense that you might forget to breathe !!!Beautifully crafted masterpiece. ! Kannada films are centered around south east KA esp Bengaluru. There needs to be more films coming out of Coastal KA, Malenadu, North west KA and North East KA. The climax is way too intense that you might forget to breathe !!!

A must-watch-in-theater movie. Rishab Shetty, like his pals Raj and Rakshit, clearly know how to make a solid movie. Kudos for taking us into the depths of dravidian coastal culture. But it is not without flaws. When is Indian cinema going to move away from one hero single handedly fighting 10+ henchmen? Instead of the hero's semi-funny entourage there could have been at least 1-2 other strongmen to defend the village. The main villain is so clever through most of the story but suddenly turns dumb enough to even get in a shoot-out with the police/govt which doesn't make sense from a characterisation standpoint. These and a few other minor oversights aside, this is a gripping story with excellent screenplay and direction. The climax is one of the best.

reviews.review_title: A dead would rise from the deathbed in Last 15 mins
reviews.content: My first ever review in IMDB. What a gem of a movie this Kantara is. Just mind blowing and fantabulous. Best Actor award in oscars should definitely go to Riashab Shetty. From starting to End, you will not blink even a once. I have watched this film 3 times in row. I have seen so many western and regional films but no one came close to this.I definitely recommend watching this film in a theater. Even after watching this film when you come back to home, you will keep talking about this in your circle. It won't go off of your mind easily. Such a masterpiece is this film. Hats off to the entire team.

Very rarely works of art come by in Indian cinema that are so raw, so rooted and contain performances by actors that are so immersed in their craft.Kantara did that to me.I'd missed the feeling of sheer rush and goosebumps watching a movie for some time now, and a work like Kantara coming from the region, state and country I belong to, elevates that feeling even more.A work that celebrates native Indian cultures.A work that screams celebrating local will make your recognition global.The climax will send chills down your spine and manages to raise every hair on your body.Kantara is a must watch.Rishabh Shetty is a class act. A gem to Indian cinema.

Kept me engaged, mesmerised and scared me sometimes. Loved this movie. Good to see the Daskshin Kanada culture represented very well. The movie had lots of actions. Hook for the storytelling was top of the level.... Middle of the scene throwing Bhoota kola character at was great.... I would have recommended this movie to all if some action scenes and language used could have been mellowed a bit. Would have liked couple of more songs. The background music was great and supported the play very well. Overall great movie, acting, direction and screenplay. Great job Kantara team. Looking forward to see part 2 of this... please make one....

One of the best movie experience. Divine and gripping. Everything about this movie is amazing. The culture and Divinity is wonderfully portrayed. Goosebumps guaranteed. Kola is presented wonderfully. Start and end cannot be missed. Its a must watch movie for movie lovers. The people from Karnataka specially Tulunadu region will enjoy this more and also relate to it in a better way. After watching this movie I have gained keen curiosity in the culture of Dakshina Kannada. Everything about this movie looks very genuine and deeply rooted in the culture of the place. Would love to watch is multiple times.

reviews.review_title: Better than any movie I have ever seen..!!
reviews.content:
I'm lost for words.. its a must watch in cinemas.. saw 3 times .. still feel like watching more... can't get it out of my head.. very addictive...
Rishab Shetty is an excellent artist.. very talented.. in fact I have watched his previous movies too..
Please go to cinema to experience this epic blockbuster movie.. don't wait for thr OTT platform.. this is a once in a lift time movie.. should not be missed in cinema..
It's good to see lot of regional movies are appreciated these days.. reason being bollywood is out of ideas and lack of talent.. if people like Rishab given chance in bollywood, things will be much better for bollywood..

The most beautiful & astounding depiction of 'Bhoota Aaradhane' I've witnessed! The acting, cinematography, writing, direction..whatnot, it's just simply so damn thorough. Trying to showcase regional mythology on a cinematic platform is in itself a challenging task since the stories are not just stories but the lives of people are attached to them. And this is where 'Kantara' does a spectacular job of integrating culture with entertainment. It comprises of every social aspect such as caste system, untouchability, forest encroachment, man-animal conflict, tribal rights with a touch of humor and entertainment. And the main element of the movie- bhoota kola is everything you are not prepared for.After watching so many disappointing movies with crazy budgets, this one comes as a cooling charm. Proud of you Rishab shetty and each &everyone of Kantara's team. You have made all us kannadigas proud.

I have watched many great films and then and I watched KantaraMovie What an amazing experience I felt during the last 20 mins of this movie.My legs were shivering, tears rolled out, my skin crawled. Shetty_rishab man what kind of acting was that you scared me out of my wits. The way shetty_rishab narrated the story brilliant, DOP Aravind Kashyap Outstanding visuals and taking hombalefilms you are the greatest film makers our country has.Extraordinary BGM, this movie is a complete package of all kind of stuff that a movie should havePlease DONT MISS in theatres, if possible watch it in Kannada for better experience.

Divine musical story telling. Movie was made with a budget of only 16 Crores in this expensive era.! No Big stars involved, though overtaking all Big movies, this is called Talent, this is called sucess. Every scene in the movie is so effective, when we come out of theatres, we will still be in the movie mood. Even after going home, you will still be in that mood. We watched it twice and the second time we watched, nobody was interested to get off from the seats even after movie was over, they wanted the movie to go on and on. Congrajulations to the whole team.That Divine music is still playing in our minds.!

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece by Rishabh Shetty. Bollywood, take notes.
reviews.content: An amazing movie masterpiece by actor and director Rishabh shetty. A great effort in portraying a divine relationship between humans, nature and gods. A proud representation of a famous culture of a community in coastal Karnataka.Time for Bollywood to take notes on film making. The movie shows that you do not need Bhramhastra level VFX to show magic on screen. This movie creates magic with brilliant acting and storytelling. Hoping to see many more of such movies in regional languages to bring variety to the mainstream dominated by Bollywood.Waiting for it to be released in multiple languages.

reviews.review_title: Kantara its a alive the traditional culture of Kambla and Bhootha Kola in Karnataka mainly in Dakshina Kannada
reviews.content: Kantara its a alive the traditional culture of Kambla and Bhootha Kola in Karnataka mainly in Dakshina KannadaThe choreography, acting , script everything is amazing.It's one of the My best movie in Indian film Industry.A human and nature conflict It tells the story of sub alatern people and their lives beliefs and Gods.The film is a visual grandeur. DOP Aravind Kashyap has done a brilliant job with lighting and frames. A lot of attention is given to the making, which is dipped in folklore. Situational village comedy works well for the film. The film explores the culture of Tulunadu without any compromise. B Ajaneesh Loknath's music is soothing. With plenty to savour for both mass and class audience, Kantara undoubtedly makes for a wonderful theatrical experience.Congratulation to Hombale film and Rishabh and all Movie team.

There are a few Kannada movies I have seen so far. This one took my breath away.It is such a pleasant surprise. A well researched, well scripted, well executed movie.Rishab Shetty thank you for showing our traditions so beautifully. Watching it makes me proud and happy. The comic timing of Rampa is spot on. The intensity of Rishabh shetty's climax scene took me by surprise. People should go to the theaters and watch to experience it completely.This mobie should be nominated for National Award.I will be looking forward to more Rishabh Shetty movies.It's Art in the purest form. Hatsoff guys.

reviews.review_title: Must Watch Movie by every INDIAN
reviews.content: The best aspects of the movie are the acting, the story line, the direction, and the casting. There is fun, emotion, and romance from beginning to end in this energetic movie.During the last twenty minutes of the movie.... I have no idea how to describe that feeling. There will surely be goosebumps for many people. During the last 20 minutes, you will witness one of the best performances ever.One of the highlights of the movie is the shout that attracts everyone's attention.This movie deserves a national award for Rishabh Shetty's classic acting. This type of movie should be recognized and encouraged by the Indian film industry.

reviews.review_title: KANTARA - A GOLD STANDARD IN INDIAN CINEMA
reviews.content: This movie is a cinematic experience and an absolute masterpiece courtesy of Rishabh Shetty, the whole film crew and Hombale films. It takes you in their world and astounds you with their beautiful folklore and culture. Never did this movie miss a beat , audience will experience surreal emotions. Rishabh is really genius and it shows in his effort to make this movie a masterpiece. This has to be strictly watched in theatres to explore it's auora , every actor in this and all the technical teams involved have done a brilliant job to bring this movie to life. KANTARA is a Gold Standard in Indian Cinema.

One more masterpiece looking ahead for kantara 2 by 2025.The plot and cast are so amazing and rishabh Shetty as a director, writer and actor also gel up with his whole team is awesome.Total raw content and immense scenes which make your brain to watch the scenes one more time.It's shows up the rich heritage and culture what india is being having. And encouragement to other state arts to develop on the same line and make our industry popular in the whole world.It's a masterpiece it will easily recognisable the fight between human beings and nature.We should be proud for watching this divine movie.

reviews.review_title: What are you Waiting for ? This is a classic film like bahubali that everbody will quaote hereafter :)
reviews.content: Very proud kanndiga that this Indian film has just broken all expectations and set a bench mark for future films.This movie just looks par to hollywood on the following :1) Best Background score , comparable to avenger series.2) Cinematography and creating of Kantara world , the forest , the lighting next to none.3) Climax - Just unbeatable , inline with acting skills of Soundarya in apthamitra.Overall a classic , cultural treat. We indians have so many stories to tell about our great culture , tradition and beliefs , this is just what the audeince wanted after seeing boring , drab out of touch films.

This movie is a masterclass in all departments. Detailed study would have taken place before finalising each scene. Be it the location, the local slang ( folks from the coastal district would relate) , BGM, screenplay, cinematography, acting to say the least. This movie grows on the viewer and urges oneself to watch it over and again. This is the power of world class cinema. This is purely a silver screen experience and people from all ages can go and watch this rare masterpiece. Each and every character has a role to play and is well knitted together. The viewer would feel like he is part of the movie and gets totally mesmerised.

It evokes a whole lot of life, everyone should go watch.though i am not familiar with kannada, but I cried, I had a whole lot of emotions going on.hard describe the experience for anyone who knows how the caste oppression works, how the tribals are still at the forefront fighting and safeguarding jungle, and how the landlords and Varna works, who sits on the chair, who own the vast lands, who? The cinematography is such that you are at no doubts, with such locations and the heart and soul goes to the demigods, that I might not have encountered or have I? This film to me is very important in the times when in the same region how there are still tribals Lavigne the same plights , I wish such work encourages more work, from regions , our story. Stories that matters, Stories of kindness, stories that brings a shift in EQ.

It is a complete devotional blockbuster u feel like watching again and again the climax of the film , it highlights south canara culture rituals tradition and strong and powerful beliefs of the people . It is very hrd to direct and act a film simeotaneously, Rishab Shetty has done it without any compermises. Every one should watch d film in theaters to experience the goose bumps , seriously well done by Rishab. Music by Ajaneesh is fine work .The film has lovestory ,crashes between villagers in the forest and government and also traditional kambala race and also divine which makes you feel spirutally conected this is a complete package of two and half hrs surely this film will grab all awards.

Rishabh Shetty is perhaps the greatest actor director in Indian cinema today. This movie takes you to a different world of TULUNADU and tells you an universal story of man and nature in a thrilling way. The climax is perhaps the best ever made in Indian cinema. After Heath ledger joker act in Dark Knight, this role of Rishabh is what I liked The most.It tells the story of sub altern people and their lives beliefs and Gods but in a very rooted and Indian way unlike anything you have seen on screen The action is amazing and it is very entertaining with lot of comic dialogues which lighten the movie though it is heavy story. This is what makes Rishabh such a great writer and director.

I've never seen a movie like this, ever till now. The best Indian cinema has produced till now. Never experienced anything like this before. Was on the edge of the seat throughout and stood and the moment I stood and folded my hands to pray for the divinity portrayed. The casting, the making, background music are all topnotch. Also adhering to 150 mins of runtime is a plus. Special mention to Rishabh's acting. And this can be pulled out only from someone who is from coastal region. Clearly showcased the conflict between nature and humans. And how the people are the forest border act as the last line of defence From further damage.

Amazing acting and amazing story.Wah! What movie. Amazingly scripted ; well narrated with cultural setting to convey social message. Acting by every cast is simply wonderful . Storey takes us through fictional event built around preserving forest land, fauna and religious rituals around panjurli ( demigod).Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre.Never seen a movie like this before .. they have set a level in kannada film industry, it will be very difficult to match this. Cinematography , direction , acting , fights , scripts , everything was good
Must watch movie .. iam sure I will be seeing this movie for many number of times .. . Congratulations for the team .. looking forward for future films by the same team .

-->It is the first movie I watched in a theatre and it's definitely worth it !-->The effort Rishab Shetty put on acting his character is outstanding.--> The costumes, backgrounds , bg music all are upto the mark.-->The daily life incidents , village festival environment were so natural that I felt like my own surroundings.-->Comedy is in their veins only.-->So concluding cast performances , direction, writing, production design, cinematography, proper showcasing of the Bhoota Kola, action sequences, editing, soundtrack, and musical score all are really really well.--> After watching movie also that sounds, moments keep revolving in our minds.

Simply amazing,The cinematography, choreography, acting , script everything is amazing.Everyone must watch. It's one of the best movie in Indian film Industry.We can't even imagine anyone else in Rishab place as Shiva. Each and every character will be fullfilled with naturality.This movie is raised kannada industry to an exceptional heights and proud to whole world.Rampa,. Abbu , guruva, Kamala, bulla,lacchu, sudhakara very well done by the characters.Andh achyuth Kumar( Devendra suttooru)and kishor shetty (muralidhar) this all characters are speechless.Tulunaada culture now spread world wide.thank you rishab and team.

Must go nd watch in theatres...else ll miss cinematic experience.. the movies gives the best experience of village life, our gross root culture and most importantly our belief in gods ........
Rishabh shetty is one man army he write Direct and act very spectacularly ......he is such a mind blowing performer.U must must must go nd watch........in theatres u ll thank me.Such a grounded movie ........no fiction.....no overacting.......Love the cinematography visual experience and background score every scene gives you the goosebumps and detailed camera work
Every scene looks fabulousHatts of to kanada industry.

To pull a movie with such a difficult and challenging subject is a great achievement. The intensity and the last 30m of the movie is one of the best endings I've seen in any movie till date. One needs to really experience this movie in a theatre to feel the amazing sound effects. All sensitive and rural subjects have been played to perfection and no stone left unturned. Very raw and natural acting by almost all actors .The movie is least predictable and very well scripted and executed brilliantly by the team . Vijay kirandagur is having a dream run with his dream team . May he bring more such films and keep entertaining us.

It is just not a movie it is an Epic. It's an emotion, its a feeling, its a devinity, its our culture. God bless the entire team. 👏
Its a must watch movie with entire family. Every generation every religion should watch it.It's a connection between man and God, god and forest and forest and man.It depicts the culture of dhakshina kannada where people represent the devinity and god in different roopas.I request all to please come and watch in theaters because films like this will be made one in million. Please bring your friends family and neighbors.It's a must watch movie and don't miss in theaters.

reviews.review_title: A MUST-WATCH experience on the BIG SCREEN!
reviews.content: Kantara (meaning mysterious forest) is definitely a MUST-WATCH transcendental experience on the big screen!The age-old beliefs and traditions of the TuLu NaaDu region of Karnataka and Kerala like Bhoota Kola and KambaLa are so beautifully and organically interwoven with the universal story of conflict between human greed and nature...Top notch acting, direction, cinematography, music and background score culminating in a goosebump inducing climax... The divine energy of the Daivas (demigods) Panjurli and Guliga can literally be felt by the audience in the jaw-dropping climax!!Hats off to Rishabh Shetty the entire team of Kantara for this gem 👏 👏👏

reviews.review_title: No words to describe the movie and that divine experience! !!
reviews.content: Hats off to the film makers for portraying our coastal Karnataka culture. All the departments have done fantabulous job 🙏. We had never seen such a climax in any of the film. Rishab Shetty nailed it completely.This what happens whenever strong storyline and justifications and weightage to all the characters given. Wonderful Cinematography and BGM rocks it. Film has the elementa and blend mixture of suspense,humor, action,drama,adventure what not!Climax is so engrossing that will make sit on the edge of seat and will not feeling to come out of the theatre for sure. You will be in kantara world at least for someday 😇

On one hand we have the Bollywood gang who are hell bent on insulting our gods and on the other hand we have the kannada industry taking us to our roots...Dear Mr Amir khan pls watch this movie and learn something. Our Daivas know when to strike... and they have finally struck coming before the whole India making everyone realise you are nothing before them. Hope these Bollywood fans mend their waysKantara is a movie which everyone must watch in theatresDon't wait for OTT go now.Don't miss the start 15 min. If u arrive late rebook another show. No one has ever sent sucha climax in their lifetime.

No comparison for rishabh shetty acting
Such epic screenplay and actor is just fabulous it feels like no any acting is happening there he is really performing the character of the swami gulga .Best screenplay .Best actors
Best cinematography
Its more than awesome 😎
No comparison for rishabh shetty acting
Such epic screenplay and actor is just fabulous it feels like no any acting is happening there he is really performing the character of the swami gulga .Best screenplay .Best actors
Best cinematography
Its more than awesome 😎
#Best screenplay .Best actors
Best cinematography
Its more than awesome.

Ok I happened to watch this movie 3 times, yes 3 times in theater in a span of 10 days. Not even once was I bored. I discovered new things and nuances in this wonderful creation by Rishab Shetty, the actor,writer and director of this movie.Story is straightforward but told in such a raw fashion that it holds your interest throughout. Rural raw comedy, pure relationships, and friendly locals...all keep the drama going on with hints of Demi Gods appearing in jump scare shots. Romance is just right with just one (great) song. This story has romance,drama,divinity,comedy,music,local culture all in one.Whats mindblowing is last 40 minutes of the movie. This climax will be remembered in Indian cinema as a cinematic acheivement. I came out shaking with happiness/tears as the wonderful story ends in a unimaginable climax. I usually dont watch any movie, however good, more than once. But I watched this 3 times, because this is not a movie..its once in a lifetime experience.I dont know if people will talk about whether this deserves an oscar....but I will tell that Oscar deserves this movie. Period.

It is just too good...The complete silence in the movie hall after the movie has ended clearly indicates that how the movie has absorbed everyone.. The acting of each and every character is so natural and superb.. Parallelly, it has given powerful message about the SUPERPOWER (Daiva) and the relationship between human and environment (Prakruti). I was so absorbed in the climax that it was difficult for me to realise that it has ended and I have to get up from my seat and walk out of movie hall. This is the movie which will leave a long lasting effect on the viewer.. Definitely, no doubt... Great job..,Keep going.. Rishabh and team...

I m surat Gujarat. But last two years I watched only kannada movie and now kannada movie be grow like bollywood. reviews.review_title: KANTARA is a Terrific Theatrical Experience Movie
reviews.content: KANTARA is a native Indian film that can compete hollywood films. Kudos to the makers to keep the film realistic ( shot in dense forests and real locations )the movie got released in its native language on 30 september. Whoever have watched it from then have been giving extra ordinary reviews.Looking at the quantum of positive responses from all over india, I was eagerly waiting to watch the film. But was expecting some production house to take up the responsibility of releasing the film in our telugu language. Thankfully allu aravind team quickly did the needful and released the telugu version today.Tribal people life and life style, their emotions and affection towards god and motherland portrayed very beautifully.Caste system, untouchability and greed are inherent elements of the main story line. First half of the film has all commercial elements like antagonist and protagonist confrontation, action, comedy progressing towards a thrilling intervalpost interval, the story unfolds actual crux and interestingly progresses towards a never seen on screen kind of climaxcinematography, screenplay, music & bgm and direction deserve heartful appreciation.

Watced this masterpiece the second time. The music and the performance resonates long after coming out of the theater, such is the impact of the movie. Performances by every character is commendable. The background music with local flavour enhances the story even better. Comic timing is bang on. Rishabh Shetty as a writer of the story has done his reasearch really well. Direction is top notch, so is his performance in front of the camera.The performance at the end of the movie, one gets a mixed feeling of emotions, which is unexplainable. Rock version of the song 'varaha roopam' is next level and blends well with the situation. A truly out of the world experience indeed !!

It is hard to pinpoint the one thing that makes Kantara tick. Let's start with the script. It takes a story seen very often in our daily lives and introduces some unique local flavour, rooting it to Indian culture, making it stand out from among other such tales. Then comes the real cherry on top of this beautiful cake- the breathtakingly beautiful cinematography of Arvind Kashyap. The way Arvind's lens has brought alive the folklore of Kantara is a lesson for storytellers. Some of the scenes of the buffalo racing in the beginning of the film deserve special praise, as do all the scenes from the festivities and visuals of the Daiva.The background score and music from Ajaneesh Loknath complements the camera work totally. The choice to use western instruments in some scenes depicting Indian festivities was a bold one and it pays off quite well. The score brings out the myths, culture, and feel of the land where Kantara is set, taking you into the heart of the story so easily that you forget you are sitting in a movie theatre in another part of the country.

Kantara begins where superlatives end! An unparalleled cinematic spectacle which will take the viewer by surprise. Apart from the unique theme, the flawless story-telling, taught script, breathtaking cinematography, enriching music score, lively action scenes and above all, the powerhouse performance by the lead actor who is also the writer-director, makes this movie a must watch. The supporting cast also rose to the occasion to make the movie enjoyable all through. Lastly, keep yourself primed for the last 15 mins. It will leave you with goosebumps that will remain long after you have exited the cinema hall.

This is the power of KFI....More and more films like this should come which shows of culture and tradition...#Kantara #RishabShetty.

reviews.review_title: A masterpiece depicting one of the many traditions of South India

reviews.review_title: The Finest Masterpiece Ever and will Ever Be
reviews.content:
Kantara doesn't need awards.... Awards needs Kantara....
I don't think there is any adjective to define Kanatara...We as movie lovers are too much at an adolant stage to even think of reviewing Kantara....
One of three Rs(Rakshit, Rishab and Raj), Rishab Shetty here didn't act, he just lived a character which was captured on camera....
The supporting cast is just overloaded with talent in terms of performance..
Last but not the least, the concept is a true depiction of a certain culture but the way it is presented has made even a North Indian like me literally feel the essence of the culture...

reviews.review_title: I have seen bhootakola since my childhood.
reviews.content:
Well my ancestors belong to the coastal region of Karnataka (that's showcased in the movie) so the concept of #bhootakola is something that is not new to me, having witnessed it through my childhood..
.But #bhootakola is also a concept which is extremely difficult to explain to someone who would not have witnessed this themselves & often gets misunderstood as a supernatural ritual but what we see in #kantara & the genius of @rishabshetty77 is this entire explanation weaved beautifully together in a gripping story which you would just marvel at after the movie is over (take my word on it) as today the world gets exposed to the folklore of daivas like the kingly & empathetic #panjurli & the extremely feared #guliga
..
If you find time, pls go watch it in the theatres (& not on your OTT at home) since this immersive experience would stay with you even days after you have seen this movie..
.Finally take a bow @rishabshetty77
..
.@hombalefilms @kantarafilm #kantaramovie #indianfilm #kannada #movie #india #indian #film #mangalore.

reviews.review_title: It is not a movie, but a divine experience!
reviews.content: After reading raving reviews, we drove an hour from Toronto to watch it. After a long time, good Kannada movies are being made and I wanted to support it by watching it in a theatre. This is a movie which has to be experienced on a big screen! Unfortunately, it was playing in a small screen theatre but nevertheless we are soooo glad that we got to watch it.Growing up in Tulunaad, I had heard about these practices but never got to witness them. I am so glad it took us back to our roots and culture with Bhoothakola, Panjurli and Daivaradhane. The movie grips you from the beginning and it only gets better with time. It's shocking to see how Rishabh did the Kambala. Unbelievable! Everything is presented in its raw nature. Be it the village, villagers or their talk. I loved listening to the phrase"entha saavu maraya" as this was so common to hear when we were growing up. So it brought back beautiful memories of hometown.There is nothing to match the climax. I was speechless and tried hard not to cry and I do not even remember the last song. I only remember my emotions,eyes welling up and the divine presence. How often can a movie make one feel like that? What was in it? It is beyond explanation and it is only to be experienced.But this is how India is, filled with divine aspects and this is a reminder for all of us that we cannot sideline such things calling them superstitions or blind beliefs. This is the belief with which people live! This is the reason why it has gone beyond language barriers because this divinity is present all throughout the country. Feels like this movie has connected the whole of India together.Thank you, Rishabh Shetty and team, for giving us such a beautiful movie. Every character was well etched and played amazingly. So simple and beautiful. We do not need men in 6 pack abs and skimpily dressed women in every movie. That does not represent our culture, but these do.When the movie ended, I could feel the shock and silence in the theatre, and I saw people wiping their tears. I did not know what to say myslef. I just drove back in silence trying hard to get hold of myself. I do not know what he must have experienced when he was in that role. He could not have performed like that without divine intervention. Like he said in his interview it is only to be experienced! Please go and watch this to experience the divine! Absolutely loved it and still can't get over the feeling!

reviews.review_title: A must watch for today's youth.
reviews.content: Filled with engima and spread across various time periods, Kantara seems to surprise everyone with its unique amalgamation of traditional values in modern era. In a society filled with greed where human values are depreciating, Kantara movie gives us lessons to be taken home. Not giving any spoilers here but reinstating faith in the divine is the crux of the movie. The cinematography and shots taken are beautifully edited. The struggle between uneducated and the literate clearly draws us to an important message on education too. The mysteriously killings across the village, the forest encroachment and the struggle for survival all seem to fit perfectly, it blends into a beautiful plot with an engaging storyline. The thirst to know what's next in the movie keeps the watchers hooked. It's one of the most well crafted plots ever. A must watch for today's youth.

Kantara is an adventure drama thriller movie written and directed by Rishab Shetty. The movie casts Rishab Shetty and Sapthami Gowda in the main lead roles along with Kishore, Achuth Kumar, Pramod Shetty, Vinay Biddappa, and many others seen in supporting roles. The music was composed by B Ajaneesh Loknath while the cinematography was done by Arvind S Kashyap and it is edited by Pratheek Shetty, K M Prakash. The film is produced by Vijay Kiragandur under Hombale Films banner.StoryKantara is a vast, mysterious forest, In Kantara, the forest plays a significant role. People in the town live as children of the forest, blending with it on one side. However, the Forest Officer has decided to protect the forest diligently. This is so that not a single piece of wood will be removed from it and no one will encroach upon it. Also included are the misdeeds of Devendra (Achyut), a lusty politician.Shiva (Rishabh) always fights for the village, and Muralidhar (Kishore), who says that the law applies to everyone, is not one to stand up to anyone. A key theme of Kantara is the encroachment of forest land, looting of forest wealth, and conflict between forest officials and villagers.

reviews.review_title: Class of its own.. master piece brilliant story, photography, music and authenticity
reviews.content:
Lot has been already told. So let me stay with specifics.Numbers:
A movie that returns 15 times of budget in 30 days of its release is unbelievable. As the saying goes number speaks for themselves.Direction:
Rishab Shetty studied and traveled, developed story for four months. Then went on refining, self training (Mixed marshal arts and Kambala race for 4 months). Made sure every actor in the movie had workshops and training of local dialect. Then the director has to act his role, the hero of the movie. He relentlessly did 10-20 retakes. This was extended to lyrics writing (many trials with varied tunes). Photography/shooting had to deal with incessant raining.Setting:
Rural coastal Karnataka, forest and push the possibilities to limits without getting trapped in unnecessary VFX (most big budget movies spend 30-50% on this)Photography:
Great photography needs dedication, patience and using nature to your advantage. Otherwise you will end with some studio settings and artificial light. This movie proved it what a magic can happen with director and photographer in sync.Background Music:
This movie kept people either glued to their seats while mesmerized with audio effects. Consistency and working on details for months paid off. Only a good sound system like in theater can impart the experience that music director intended to provide.Songs:
Take the example of singara siriye song:
The song is loaded.. Under 5 minutes it delivered many messages in video and audio.Video maintained the consistency in setting tells the story of its own.. humor, tradition, belief, life in the setting (rural coastal Karnataka) , their food, lifestyle, leisure all in the background while keeping the hero and heroine- blooming love, naughtiness and hero's quiet influence in the foreground.Audio has two parts. Voice/lyrics and instruments. Both were in symphony while turning into worm song. There are many instruments that are local to the place where this movie based used with painstakingly recording and seamlessly including them. Also other standard Indian instruments were used with some small western mix.

A masterpiece, never seen a movie ever in my life time. The acting, music , songs , background music, and specially the Direction is amazing. Wah! What movie. Amazingly scripted ; well narrated with cultural setting to convey social message. Acting by every cast is simply wonderful . Storey takes us through fictional event built around preserving forest land, fauna and religious rituals around panjurli ( demigod).Rishab shetty has performed amazingly. Especially climax scene is just a blast. Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Worth watching in theatre, a must watch movie for every one.

reviews.review_title: Visually stunning, great acting and beautifully woven plot
reviews.content: Beautiful film that belies the myth that stunning visuals requires big budgets. To weave a story around a cultural nuance specific to one region and yet have it connect with everyone speaks volume about the quality of the film. The climax is probably one of the best filmed ones I have seen and leaves you awestruck with the action, acting, background score. While the initial background and character building progresses at a slower pace, once the plot is established, the movie moves into high gear and keeps the audience hooked all the way. The shriek will probably stay with me for a while. Can't wait to catch this again once it releases on OTT.

KANTARA is the epitome of creative story telling. Everything from cinematography, culture appreciation to the plot and dialogue delivery is executed thoughtfully. More than anything, the way the primal instincts, defensive patriotism and downplay of skepticism has been portrayed is beyond convincing. Anyone who has ever felt such rage as to be willing to sacrifice onself for a purpose, will relate to it and acknowledge how the nuances of the feelings are shown. It reminds me of movies like Jallikattu and Asuran in a way that sense of purpose and basic instincts have been highlighted in the movie. The chaos and lack of rationale. It's a pride to have a movie like this in Kannada.

reviews.review_title: Best movie to whach in family 😁😍
reviews.content: Kantara is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language action thriller film written and directed by Rishab Shetty, and produced by Vijay Kiragandur, under Hombale Films. The film stars Shetty as a Kambala champion, who comes to loggerheads with an upright DRFO officer, Mura and You really cannot go wrong when the hero of a film is the story. There was a certain authenticity and rawness in the elements, like the Bhoota Kola festival and the Kambala competitions, that added to the movie. The biggest plus point for the movie is that it did not shy away from showing its imperfections. The actors looked believable as their characters, which strengthened the narrative. They were not just acting, but they had to shed their inhibitions at a level that is a testament to their expertise in their craft. By the looks of it, it is a mass entertainer, but you know immediately enough that it is just a cover. It certainly seeks to entertain, but it does not cater to anyone, and that is a movie with spirit. "Kantara" is one such film, and it also comes with a high rewatch value. If you had to watch one good film this week, month, or year, let it be "Kantara." Your life will be all the more enlightened for it.

Love always.....On a side note, when I was arguing that Hindi should be national language, a gentlemen gently reminded that Karnataka contributes a lot to Indian GDP... So why Hindi...I didn't have an answer .. He continued and reminded that kannada like many other languages are also Indian languages... I'm India all our languages are national language sRemember Kannada movie industry had given great movie in part, but they seem to be coming back again.

It's an amazing movie showcasing the regional culture of Dakshina Kannada and Udupi region of Karnataka.I am from this region and am familiar with the tradition of Bhoota Aradhana. This may seem superstitious and even scary initially, but it's okay, believe me, even I felt or used to feel the same. My humble request to the audience who are not familiar with this tradition, is that you to do a small research into 'Bhoota Kola' , 'Panjurli' and 'Guliga' daivas...this would make your experience and understanding this movie more enjoyable!.This movie is a masterpiece trying to bring out the hidden, often misunderstood traditions into the mainstream. This is the reality, who many people in our country are not aware and it's absolutely okay. Such movies are helpful to make us all understand that India is a land of such a diversity and yet so beautiful!

Best in all three(writing, directing and acting) Rishab Shetty. All the characters are fully understandable. Actors show their best in their characters. Real indian village is shown in best way like, men with brown tooth, gambling in village, roads of village, houses, jungle, and last but not the least Villagers, their clothing, way of thinking, relation with gods and government officials, cast system in village, etc. All jokes places in right place. Overall the movie is a masterpiece with outstanding performance.

Hats off to Rishabh Shetty for taking risks with the script and making it with conviction and making it interesting. Watch it with an open mind like a slice-of-life or a slice of india film. The cinematography is stunning, the night and forest sequences give you goosebumps and the fight sequences in the rain and the dances give you goosebumps. Rishabh Shetty joins the big league with this one. Watch in the theatre if you can.

One can enjoy the visuals and rituals of coastal Karnataka with the magical music. A must watch movie to experience the best story, music, comedy, action and performance. Don't miss this movie to watch in theatre for the best experience. Kantara movie is designed based on the culture of coastal karnataka (Tulunadu), which is amazingly depicted with world class acting of all crews and mainly by Rishabh shetty.

It is released in my theatre which is housefull and every show is not full as compare to this kantara. If you want to watch it just do it. It is Lifetime Experience.

What a class movie after so so years. I don't remember when was the last time I saw a masterpiece like this. The writing, the acting, and the story are top-notch. All credit goes to the team of Kantara for creating a masterpiece like this. The manner in which the storytelling has been done is on a totally different scale altogether. This is by far the best experience I had in my life. With the Shetty clan taking over the Karnataka Film industry I am pretty much confident that they will take Kannada cinema to new heights and will promote the culture, the preserve the heritage of Indian History.

reviews.review_title: This is how a climax should be made
reviews.content: Climax: "the most intense, exciting, or important point of something; the culmination." is Google's definition. This movie does justice to that.The Kantara team has captured brilliantly the culture of the animist form of spirit world with all the respect it deserves, and have given the audience a lot of insights into this particular tale of the legends.The performance was something that had to be watched to believe. The music score and the sound effects, along with the cinematography is spot on when it comes to giving the audience a thrilling experience of the big screen.It is truly a visual grandeur.

reviews.review_title: This movie is one of the classic master pieces in this decade.
reviews.content: Superb Direction, Superb Music, Classic cinematography, Awesome acting, etc has made this movie a classic master piece in this decade. Onetime watching will not satisfy you for sure. Though you will enjoy every minute of it, the last 20 mins climax scene is the best and is going to get you goosebumps and tears in your eyes. No words to express Rishab Shetty's acting and direction is classic. He has successfully brought the Bootha Kola, one of our coastal Karnataka tradition to the limelight very nicely. Kishore Kumar and Achuth Kumar have also done exceptionally well. Hats off to the entire team. This movie should definitely get National Award and be India's nominee for the Oscars.

reviews.review_title: What a masterpiece by Rishabh Shetty!!!
reviews.content: What a masterpiece by Rishabh Shetty. Last 30 minutes of the movie gave me goosebumps. It's a movie which every Indian with village root can correlate. Demigods is widely popular concept in India and Demigods in Kantara is practiced in few villages in Karnataka. First half was good but second half was fabulous. Fight scenes are very intense and have minimal VFX. Cinematography is fabulous. Most of the movie is shot in forest. Very impressive movie in short budget. What a amazing movie in such a short budget of merely 16 crore. I watched the movie just because of reviews. No promotion, no extremely famous characters. Just pure content!! It's a must watch movie of Indian Cinema!!

reviews.review_title: one of the best movie in history of Indian cinema
reviews.content:
Today I was going to go to Ram Setu or Thank God but after review on filmi Indian channel today we went to Kantara movie Boss what a movie its different kind of movie all in one pack Comedy, Horror, Suspense, Romance, Action in a single film and last but not the least
The background music of this film makes you feel a different world. One of the best movie in history of Indian cinema. Must watch.Today I was going to go to Ram Setu or Thank God but after review on filmi Indian channel today we went to Kantara movie Boss what a movie its different kind of movie all in one pack Comedy, Horror, Suspense, Romance, Action in a single film and last but not the least
The background music of this film makes you feel a different world. One of the best movie in history of Indian cinema. Must watch.

reviews.review_title: Legendary way to showcase The Legend
reviews.content: Bhootha kola, kambala, forest issues, religious / caste politics, untouchability, village politics, connection of nature and human through the faith, all these and much more with a sweet glimpse of romance and tadka of humor. Kantara is an All-in-one package. A family movie after a long time, once again proved that if you cater a good product, demand itself will make it super hit. The acting by rishab shetty is amazingly good, the story line, narration, music, fights and cinematography are simply amazing. No wonder its breaking the records. Not to miss the climax, even by mistake, you will regret it.

Actually I created an IMDb account only to share my views of this masterpiece..there is not even a single flaw in this film, the action the acting the perfection rishab Shetty shown in this movie is outstanding,,, speechless man the way he acted in the climax it gave me chills ,, outstanding movie no overacting not any faltu ka screenplay nd the plot of this movie is the best,,,the way they presented Tulu culture is mind-blowing,, Bollywood aka copy machine can never match the level this film is on ,,more and more films should be made like this out culture our roots which most of the so called modernists thinks are bogus should also watch this film ...thnks rishab sir thnks to all the kantara team for making this movie.

It's amazing movie mind blowing.And i respect you shetty sir you are awesome
south Indian movie getting blockbuster reasone is only one they movie showing actually real indian traditional culture. And Bollywood going to western culture side so they are most of movie going very down and floap also.I request to you south Indian director please save indian culture .And
About this movie is fantastic
Thriller feel like spiritually vibe it's awesome
Lord shiva bless you more for more movie making by you.Love you all you actor I wish i join your team.Because I love South Indian traditions and there people mind thought amzing.

So here I'm giving this movie a 10 /10 just because of the divine energy i felt while watching this movie ! I'm sure you might have watched much better stories and plot line before . But here the movie is all about the great aura which is the key take away how beautifully presented the Indian culture where people make fun of dev pravesh & rishabh shetty gave it a supreme great importance and created a masterpiece with just simple plot ! Kantara is actually conversation between human nature and god it's not just a movie it's a emotion which is really hard to feel in Theatre watch it yourself and understand what these reviews trying to say.

I can't explain how good the movie is. Even after 1 hour my heart rate is not normal. I can feel goosebumps even after movie. A masterpiece. Ankhon me anshu aa rahe the, heart rate high, i was trembling to take breath. This is beyond the imagination, i was feeling that ki mai movie ka 1 hissa hoon. Aaj tak aise movie nahi dekhi maine rongte khade ho gye.The movie talks about a wide array of topics like the land to its ancestry, the concept of paap, friendship, conflict of two thought points and the whole idea of rituals in a contemporary society in a very fresh and micro regional perspective.

Not recommended for kids.Otherwise it's fun and entertaining to watch.Superb editing, acting, story execution...Very unique concept and execution. Rural locations were considered. Cast was perfect. Everybody has played their role with such a perfection. Best experience only if you see in theatres. Oscar nomination for sure.Regional movies are rocking the industry hard.Great entertainer good watch enjoyed every bit of it.There has not been a single moment when film looses it's track. Very engaging story line, acting and execution. Film remains true to its start till its end. Hats off to rishabh Shetty and team !!!

reviews.review_title: Why the hype? Oh, It has Hindu rituals uh.. Main theme of Saving Forest and Animals is sidelined
reviews.content: Watched the movie as my wife likes the Lead Actor while I like the Antagonist. The movie is good, The theme is not conveyed properly while the hindu religious theme is what was a hit with everyone. Saving the forest and animals should be one, But people only take what they want 😂Good acting by Rishab and Achyut. Movie length can be reduced, But it keeps you engaged. Kishore role as a Forest Inspector needs kudos too. At the end the end the story surrounds around Greed! Many movies such as Karnan and Tumbadd were better by did not receive the same hype. Thanks to repeated show of Hindu Rituals which received all the attention.Nonetheless, A one time watch!

Indian cinema wants this kind of cinema
Just kicked out.Acting, script, screen play was ultimate.Mr.shetty given his full to this.The mythology is unknown by many and
Don't understand the religious rituals perform by many Hindu was explained.Soul of acting was performed by evry cast of the movie.Perfect balance between rituals and what kind of problem facing by undeveloped areas of the country.To bee a modern,we are forgotting our original culture,
And we must understand that our culture is our which we have to make them aware about our culture, rituals.Also we have to explain scientific resion behind every ritual.

reviews.review_title: Epic Movie in the Indian History
reviews.content:
What a talent hats off to Rishab Shetty for the excellence story writing, acting and direction still I'm in the kantara's world. The super natural acting and actions make this movie more realistic and effective the fight or the climax everything was perfect. The climax was so good that I can't express through words I didn't expected that this movie is going to be at this level . Team kantara has done an excellent Teamwork.It would really take a week to get out of this.My all good wishes to the upcoming new movies of Rishab Shetty
And the whole cast and crew.We are waiting foe more such epic movies .

The movie is a must watch in theaters, brilliant performances by actors. Excellent direction and the ending was really good. Rishabh Shetty has done an excellent job both as an actor and director. It is definitely one of the best Indian movie. The art was shown in a magnificent way and the music was very impactful for the scenes. The camera work was brilliant and the forest scenes were portrayed in an excellent fashion. Surely watch the movie in theaters. The movie was very nice to watch on the big screen. Would definitely watch it again for the entire efforts. Really glad to watch this masterpiece.

Proud movie and all time favorite to watch. Blend of beautiful culture,proud of Rishab Shetty and Hombale films. All artists are good and great selection by Rishab,music awsome,action and fighting scene super and never ever seen such a real action scene,linking of story excellent, all artists are too good and they all made justice in their character. From start to end full of entertainment,paisa wasool movie,and took time to write review for first time in my life to appreciate this movie,Rishab s role cannot imagine with any other hero,with low budget movie Allso rule the world this is real example.#Kantara Rocks#

reviews.review_title: A true masterpiece.. this is the power of Indian cinema
reviews.content: A must watch film .. Outstanding acting , directing story telling, music, cinematography.. in one word this movie will give you outstanding mind-blowing Indian cinema viewing experience.. If you planning to wacth movie then please go to the theater and buy a "KANTARA" move ticket , believe me it never let you down. A 16 cr budget film comes out as a master piece of Indian Cinema .. this movie is better than hundreads of big dudget Bollywood and Hollywood film . If u talk about the Storyline then I must say this is the perfect mix of Drama , Culture,social massage, romance , action , horrror.. everything thing And the climax ..this movie is going next level when it's come to the climax one of the best movie climax I have ever seen ..

Kantara is such a fruitful experience that will stay in my heart for a long time...its the power of original rooted cinema that connects deep and mesmerises you...Whenever i close my eyes and think about that climax i get goosebumps and my ok..What a performance..My God!! Take a bow!! Ufff...BGM Top Notch , story writing ,character graph, Cinematography, Production design everything is Bang On!!!I have watched it twice and may be one or two times more in theatre ..then will keep it with me through OTT forever...Truly Masterpiece ,an eternal emotional cinema!Thanks to Rishab Shetty..Kudos...

Kantara has an unreal atmosphere. This seems to be the result of a perfect blend of cinematography, acting and soundtrack. And maybe a little good old divine intervention.It is a refreshingly unique movie in an age where the entire movie industry seems saturated and every new movie feels cliched.The movie has also had a bizarre unifying effect throughout the country. Although the director thought it was a niche movie meant to be enjoyed by the Karnataka natives, it has received a resounding nationwide success.Seldom do you come across movies in which all the characters seem to fit their roles perfectly. Acting was top notch by whole crew.

Can't explain how the movie is!!!😍😍😍...Every character explain in its own way in natural path. The visuals and the character without glamour can't take any explanation.
