All those who have given less rating than 10 for this wonderful movie are morning but haters ! Action is engaging, story hooks you, music is catchy, acting is just icing on the cake, drama is amazing and so is the horror element, makes you jump out of your seat few times. Very good interval point, I mean what else do you need... story takes a different turn after the interval, movie talks about disparities in the society, shows our rich culture how the life of people are surrounded with the nature etc , climax will haunt you, you won't come out of it for some time. This is the best movie of 2022 from Karnataka India... !

reviews.review_title: It is not only movie. It is legendary of Indian films
reviews.content: This movie shows what is our culture and what is god. Not because of God story over of this Rishab shetty will play very good mind game of joining the stories. I am proud because I am Also come from same culture.If this movie not able to get the Oscar means, the management of Oscar and "Oscar" has no value.Rishab shetty did very good diraction with acting and main two songs it is just waw. What a background music and meaning of that song. In the beginning I just wonder how this movie reach to everyone, then I got the answer is like strong content of the movie will cross the district,state and country.Once again thank you Rishab and team. Proud to be kannadiga.

I watched it in movie hall thrice...and want to watch again and again...What a master piece made by Rishabh Shetty and team...you don't know what have you made ...its transforming energy from screen to body ... truly its an amazing and unique experience. Truly this movie will break all records and bags all awards...voting it for Oscars and more..This movie has shown just a glimpse of our Indian folk traditions, there are many more spirituality and beliefs that makes India a democratic country with diverse cultures and traditions. Climax of this film will give you goosebumps and tremendous energy.

Finally good script representing our Indian culture without doing any virtue signalling and being preachy like the usual movies we get to see.One thing about this movie is you know by watching that this movie very unique. It is written/directed by someone who has deep understanding of dharma, understands his culture well, has strong passion and vision, only a rooted and a devout sanatani follower can make such movie.Just blown up by nuances movie has, well made truly. Best movie watched in recent time..Theatre experience is amazing, ppl were very emotional, many had tears.. I will highly recommend!!

This movie was literally so lively. You can feel every inch of the movie. The level of direction and acting is just mind blowing. After hearing so many good reviews from friends, I went to watch this and It was truly worth it. The last scene of the movie will just burst your mind.Just one advice. Watch every single part of the movie and I assure You will thoroughly enjoy it. It's a real story and the director,writer and all the actors have given justice to this story.I guess this is one of the best (so perfect) movies of all time in the country and it deserves to be nominated for Oscar from India.Thank you the whole team for such a great movie.

reviews.review_title: This is the best movie in this year
reviews.content: Watch it in Hindi. The most extraordinary movie ever made in the history of Indian Cinema. Technically brilliant. Engaging throughout. Action is badass. BGM is out of this world, u will never forget once u listen to this score. It has thrill, it will give u chills and even scare u in some areas. It is the complete package. Every Indian should watch this. Our culture is represented very accurately and with immense pride. To overseas audience, if u want to understand the essence of Indian culture, this should be ur go to movie. Don't watch Bollywood rubbish. Rishab shetty u are a gem. Proud to be from Karnataka. It's an experience I will never forget.

Visited theatre after years since there was so much hype which has been going around but OMG - this was just another level! The fight scenes, the comedy, love story and most importantly the spirituality.. This was the first time I was watching a Rishab Shetty film and it was totally impressive.. In a way I see this movie has boight many Indians closer respecting each other's cultures and values and beliefs since we are a nation with immense diversity. The sound department and the visuals are stunning and it just delivers and very satisfying to eyes and ears. After the movie I saw people emotional and just walking like as if they witnessed GOD (same with me). Its been like 4 days I watched this movie but its still in my mind!!

reviews.review_title: The only movie who can be our emotion
reviews.content: This movie is based on mythology and social issues and south culture where they can worship their Demi gods and their Demi god protect them and movie visual effect is awesome in under 16 cr budget and music is also awesome you can try it in the song of varha room and movies actor performance is Hollywood level and the man actor in this movie is a perfect man for this movie and this movies climax is above of any hollywood movie and many scenes like felel you goosebumps and this movies storyline is outstanding and this movie definitely deserve 5/5 rating and i requested to this movies director to movie this movies 2nd part also thank you.

reviews.review_title: Extraordinary movie... the local flavors of kundapura, Karnataka have been depicted in a very touching manner.. goosebumps. Very colourful and the screen play was excellent..
reviews.content: Extraordinary movie... the local flavors of kundapura, Karnataka have been depicted in a very touching manner.. goosebumps. Very colourful and the screen play was excellent..Kudos to the team of shrikant Shetty alias Rishabh shetty.Shrikant made the job of the ministry of culture and tourism very easy. The tradition and culture of the place shown in a very realistic manner.I have seen the interview of nearly 60 min by shetty with a TV anchor. Unbelievable facts. No science can explain. The music director has done an awesome score.Overall this is THE MOVIE of the decade and worth. Class .

This movie is not worth your time if you are not from Karnataka. There is nothing much in the story, acting is top notch especially last 10 minutes of the movie. Story is predictable with little to no climax. Daiv enters into shiva who is protagonist and he starts killing people with barely one hand. I watched this movie due to overhyped, and suggested by my friends from Karnataka. Totally disappointed. I don't know what this hype is all about. I believe there is notion going on between people that if movie is based on real-cultural events, you need to say good about movie. I don't believe so.

India has been years immemorial seen as advocates of cultural richness and kantara represents an intense drama on one of our culture and ties it with why belief system is so deep rooted in our minds. It goes on to brilliantly telecast portrayal of beleif in God and nature. Concept of nation is new maybe 200 years old and protection of your land and belief is quintessential for current and future generation.Shetty Co has referenced vishnu and shiva through characters in consecutive movies. TRUST is immortal and when it is found rest is magic.OSCAR is understatement for this kind of matured movie. If this does not win OSCAR then India audience would boycott OSCAR telecast.Lots of love for Tulunadu folks, pride of karnataka and India.

The plot is different than usual Indian movies and mainly revolves around the life of the tribal people and their religious beliefs.The director narrates the two sides of the outside people ie nature of human reacting to tribes and the laws of the outside people affecting the life of tribal community to the core.Lots of tribal settlement in india are highly affected because of greedy landlords and politicians with the help of forest officials are explained seamlessly.The religious faith among the tribals are taken as it is.The way the cinematography done and colors used are perfect.The vibe is spectacular in the end.

reviews.review_title: The true combo of culture and thriller
reviews.content: The times where movies are more moving away from Indian culture, this movie is true legend. The cinematography is something I saw as an upgrade in kannada industry. As a mangalorean it is something kept me connected all the time. I kept on wondering will others understand this too, but the story the presentation was on point. I think this is what made people amazed. Truly masterpiece. I have seen Rishab Shetty's movies he constantly experiments with his movies, his risk taking attitude is appreciated. Talking about him, how can we not talk about the last scene, if anyone wants to know what is acting should check it out, goosebumps material.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movie i have ever seen!
reviews.content: Best Direction, Best Story Line, Best Sound Effect, Best Action, Best in every class.After watching Bahubali series, RRR, KGF series it's the movie i appreciate most! This movie will keep you attentive from the starting to last and if you are bored with the same story line of bollywood movie and Hollywood action movie this is the life time apportunity for you to watch this movie.Hats off to Director, Writer, sound director and actors of the movie to give us a movie like that.So must watch movie in cinema hall... Book you tickets now don't wait for ott bcz it's a masterpiece if you miss it you will regret.

No words to explain.... Outstanding Cinema. All departments hardwork shows in the screen. Aravind Kashyap cinematography is next level. BGM and Song from Ajaneesh gives goosebumps. The Director and Actor Rishabh Shetty is fire. Saptami Gowda did excellent and romantic part is very raw and goes with the story well. Kishore and Achyuth Sir perfect casting and brought justice to the role. Subtle comedy by Shiva and Gang keeps the story moving. The last climax is the must watch theatre experience and a divine moment. Proud film from Kannada industry and special mention hero rishab shetty and Ajaneesh.

Words can't be enough to express the feelings post watching the epic. It's a combo pack of acting, direction, story pitching, music & cinematography, surpassign on all aspects. The climax must have given goosebumps to each and every spectators, a must watch. After watching the movie, investigated further to acquire more details & information about the culture and tradition shown, the characters in the film portrayed the exact replica of the same. Hats off to Rishab Shetty, written, directed and led by him, just amazing, the cast including the side roles seemed perfect, flawless. Kantara- the bridge is surely estabished inbetween the creators and the viewers.

As per the name "KANTARA a legend" the movie has proved itself a legend with story, screenplay and cinematography. Story consist of action, adventure and comedy binds audiance till end. Small dialogues with comedy are the strength. A message of cherishing village and local rituals has deepened with movie, brings out the regional culture with great impact. Acting of all the actors is excellent and grounded, applause to cinematography as shooting is done at real locations in forest with all weather conditions. Idea of the story is good and presentation makes it effective. Hindi dubbing of movie is relatable and retains the spark of story.

The more i think of this film the more iam reminded of karnan (2021). It is not good to post mortem the story but i still feel this film is slightly overrated but only by few points.Story is fine but you should watch this film in theatres for its very good sound design. I liked it. I don't remember any of its songs though but what a good background score. It is a film with good direction capablities ,the scene where the policemen invades in their village and all the villagers come , very good direction. And the mere fact when the lead is the director, actor and writer ,In my memory i can remember only of nana patekar who did all the things in the movie PRAHAAR. All this wouldn't have been easyThank you for giving us such films.

Just finished watching Rishab Shetty's masterpiece #Kantara. In one word it's just WOW! Amazing experience.Its a Spiritual Experience!!This story has nativity, our roots, beliefs, rituals and sentiments - The fictional story is by the relationship shared between forests and human beings and takes place over almost two centuries . ....Purely shows the Local Games & Culture. Like Kambala, Kola.... Amazingly scripted ; well narrated with cultural setting to convey social message. Acting by every cast is simply wonderful . Story takes us through fictional event built around preserving forest land, fauna and religious rituals around panjurli ( demigod). Rishab shetty has performed his100%..amazing performance... Especially climax scene is just a blast. Rishab Shetty's performance in the last 20 minutes is chilling.... Energy flow throughout the movie is very high. Kantara undoubtedly makes for a wonderful theatrical experience.Watch it as soon as possible.

One of the best movies I have ever seen. Direction, Screenplay, Dialogues, Music, Acting, Cinematography, Art direction, Locations, Climax... Everything is just amazing. Each and every actor has justified their roles.Many thanks to Mr. Rishab Shetty, Mr. Vijaya Kiragandur & Hombale team for gifting this wonderful movie and making our India proud 🇮🇳Congratulations & Best wishes. All the very best to the entire team #KantaraEveryone should watch and support this masterpiece.I have watched three times!#30_Sep, #08_Oct & #25_Oct#SuperDirection #GreatActing #WowMusic #AwesomeStory #Blockbuster #Rocking #Inspiring #Wellmade #Unbelievable#Mohana_Thodar.

Kantara has compelled me to write my first Review on IMDB. What a movie!!!! Spellbound by Rishab Shetty's Acting and script. He is surely a one man army! Music Director Ajaneesh Loknath, hats off to you bro. You have put into melody the true ethos of Bharat, which in every sense is divine. What a plot and what a climax! Almost every actor performed impeccably. The devotion of each cast can be felt strongly. Kantara is the crystal clear reflection of Bharatiya Culture which in every sense is inspired from mother nature. And Bharat beats in my heart, and in the hearts of 1.38 Billion Bharatiyas.

The story of the film is so Good.The filmimg locations (like the Forests,villagers etc)are too good.The cinematography and the screenplay was unbelievable. The climax literally gives you the Goosebumps.Rishab shetty, what a performance sir, Kudos to your Acting skills.Kudos to the film cast and crew too.Supporting cast also performed very well.The first half is completely different than the second half.The jumpscares (there are three jump scares) which are too scary. Literally too good.The background score is too good. The Soul of the Kantara song is too good. A must watch film in the Theater.

reviews.review_title: It's not a movie..it's an experience
reviews.content: Thank u Rishabh Shetty & team for giving us this masterpiece. Twice i saw the movie in theatre,just to experience the climax once again. I haven't experienced or watched anything like this in my lifetime. Uduppi, Kundapura,kollur few of my favourite places in Karnataka..One should visit these places to experience the history & culture of South India.. Thanks once again to hombale films for producing this brilliant movie...This movie is a sheer example of brilliant cinema..Rishabh Shetty..Wat an actor u are! Respect..Respect..Respect.... Must watch in theatres..Love & respect to the entire team.

Best starcast, Good cinematography, Best CORIOGRAPHY performance of star Shri Rishabh Shetty is also worlds class.I have not seen ever this time which Shri Rohit Shetty did in this movie.Storytelling and character details are also the best in the movie.I have not seen an Indian movie of this standard till date.I am the greatest fan of Shri Rohit Shetty sir after watching this movie.I belief that this is the world class creation done by an kannad cinema.I have no words to describe I can only say one word after wathing this movie is this movie is *Antique*.I think this movie will get Oscar.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I have ever seen... awesome screenplay with top notch acting...way more better than bollywood overrated movies...
reviews.content: Best movie I have ever seen...... awesome screenplay with top notch acting......way more better than bollywood overrated movies....... please go and watch this one or else you will miss a masterpiece......rishav shetty hats off......I just loved it....... I have never seen such beautiful script with such beautiful concept........you have nailed it .......you have proved that money, foreign places, known faces doesn't matter unless the concept and the acting is tremendously beautiful......you made south indian movie proud...you deserve the respect sir ...lots of love and respect ...............

Rarely does a movie like this come out which makes you feel you have been transported into another world. As a tuluva this made me so proud. More than anything else I want to thank Rishab Shetty for bringing out and showing our motherland and its rich culture to the entire world.Coming to the movie part, it was nothing less than perfect. The acting, the story telling, the cinematography etc was class apart <3 Rishab shettre ereg dever edde malpad. Keep growing and keep delivering such master pieces throughout your life. This movie should receive National award and Rishab Anna should also receive National award for his brilliant acting.

From my childhood I am a good cinema and series lover. I have watched nos of movies in my life in every languages possible. But Kantara is something which I will carry in top of my fev movies list till now.Specially the last 15mins of the movie, the fabulous acting of Shetty sir. It's a treat to your soul. I just want to have one thing to say that if you miss this movie it's like you missed a heart beat. This movie is a milestone to our Indian cinema.The cinematography, the action, the acting, the direction, the background score and everything is fabulous. Mixture of everything which will make you say.... WAOOOW.....

One of a kind represents deep indian culture and belief an must to the younger generation and apart from that movie point of view the acting and all super combined can leave the audience dumstruck
An deep indian grinded honey from pure roots what. An true acting.Speaking movie point of view
Mind blowing, electrifying, 1000 watts movie.Nevertheless as it's said that the movie isn't a very high budget movie, but the cinematography, script, top class direction, acting, superb action sequences, sound effect of another level & nonetheless screenplay seems like PAISA VASOOL.I would thank the producers and distributors to bring it to the theatres, because overall everyone from the pre production team, production team, post production team, cast and anyone associated with the film did their job and made a product named 'KANTARA'.All I could rate it 5 stars, but it's a movie which will keep you seated from the beginning till the end.Some scenes may shock you, because the timing of those scenes and the sound effect are so perfect, nicely timed.All together a very good movie
None will walk disappointed out of the theatres.

reviews.review_title: If you break the promise,I may forgive you..but the gulikan will not
reviews.content:
A very unique culture that sees the divinity in nature has existed here since ancient times. Even if the upper part of some trees is cut off, the roots spread under the soil and new shoots are seen sprouting up. "Kantara" means the mysterious forest. In that mystery lies history, the forester, the god, and the children of the forest.The cinematic expression of a culture that embraces soil, wood, pig and cow is a must see for every Indian. We will have a family goddess to hold everyone together in the family. They have a village goddess to hold a village together, a god to hold a tribe and forest dwellers together. A god who holds the forest and its children together.God in the Varaha concept embraces nature and his children. And the mighty Gulikan as the guardian of the temple. Although he is a fierce figure, it is said that Panchuruli may forgive those who break his word because he is a god in the form of mother, but Gulikan has no such sentiments. For every drop of blood of his children Gulikan would keep the count and ask for every account.Gulikan is very well known to those in South India. It is a common practice in northern Kerala to give food for him at the family temple.There is nothing to be afraid of in the film. But we will be haunted by this story. Even if the movie is over, God's cross will come to our ears and shouts "ooowwww...." Kuladevata is someone who is always with us. She is a person we can see as a mother, a friend or a guide. A value-based life becomes its own when we hold them together and we move along with them.At the climax, Gullikan and Panchuruli uproots our conscious mind and throws us to our own existence. If you ask me why people cried, I can only say that some realizations came and went like lightning in their consciousness. Among those realizations there was the komara in the family temple where she was wearing red silk and hung drops of rice and flowers and showered her blessings.Finally there is a look of demigod who looks at us and laughs and it feels like he is asking 'did you forgot me and the promise?'
At that point it is natural for us to dig deep into our roots and get emotional."If you remember me, I will not forget you.. and if you forget, I will not forgive.."

Each frame of the movie shows the details and the blood and sweat that has gone to make this masterpiece. Best movie.Kantara transl.is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language action thriller film 2.written and directed by Rishab Shetty, and produced by Vijay Kiragandur,3. Under Hombale Films. The film stars Shetty as a Kambala champion who is at loggerheads with an upright DRFO officer, Murali (played by Kishore). Set and filmed in Keradi in coastal Karnataka, principal photography began in August 2021.4.The cinematography was handled by Arvind S. Kashyap, with B. Ajaneesh Loknath scoring music for the film and the action sequences were choreographed by the action director Vikram More. The production design was handled by debutant, Dharani Gange Putra.Kantara was released on 30 September 2022 and received acclaim from critics, who praised the cast performances (particularly those of Shetty and Kishore), direction, writing, production design, cinematography, proper showcasing of the Bhoota Kola, action sequences, editing, soundtrack, and musical score.5.The film was a huge commercial success and emerged as the second highest-grossing Kannada film of all time, as well as the second highest-grossing Kannada film of 2022.

Spectacular.Visually delightful.Splendid storytelling.This movie was recommended to me by a very dear friend who went for the movie by herself.I went to the cinemas to watch but had a houseful board so couldn't watch it. That same night i got a message from a fellow movie buff about this again. I saw it as a sign and went on the day of Diwali. And what a surreal experience.The movie talks about a wide array of topics like the land to its ancestry, the concept of paap, friendship, conflict of two thought points and the whole idea of rituals in a contemporary society in a very fresh and micro regional perspective.The writer / director and lead actor Rishab Shetty shines in this marvellous movie. The female lead Sapthami Gowda looks picture perfect as the woman torn between life and duty. Kishore Kumar G. As the Forest Officer Murali is top notch.The shining work by cinematographer Arvind Kashyap is visible in each frame by means of carefully blending the story with his framing of visual poetry.The background score is gritty, the music encapsulates local sounds and folklore perfectly and this movie makes you wonder how much we have to learn from our own music before going to look for melody in the west.The fight sequences, the dance of "daiva" and the makeup as well as costumes department have done magic.Locations are all real and the art department has done a beautiful job in capturing the essence of the story with utmost honesty. I can see Kantara as one prime example of how to tell a story effectively.

reviews.review_title: Kantara - A Movie That Stays With You
reviews.content: Watched Kantara Kannada movie in a theatre after a very long time. I was speechless after I got out theatre. What an engaging and captivating drama it is. Top-notch execution. I was not watching the movie I was in it and part of it. Truly a Cinematic masterpiece. Probably the best ending you will see in a cinema of any language. Can't describe the feeling in words.. out of a world experience.Rishab Shetty nailed it as an actor, and director. Those emotions in the movie truly if not for him I'm not sure who could have done. But seeing him as Shiva here is next-level experience, action stunts were top-notch. Raw intense acting & music makes this a classic. The music is haunting and it is uplifting. The casting is fantastic. I can see Kantara as one prime example of how to tell a story effectively.Rishab Shetty's mesmeric blend of action and mythology ranks among the best of Indian cinema. Artistic brilliance. Watching Rishab Shetty in Varah Roopam is pure bliss.The divine aspect is portrayed in a never before seen way. Makes you believe what's happening on-screen Kindles one's forgotten divine links and roots. The best part of the film however is the tenderness and respect with which the daiva aradhane, the bhoota kola is filmed.Kantara will definitely have a special place in the Kannada film industry for what it has achieved. Kantara is not just a movie. It's an experience of a lifetime.If you have not watched the movie, run now to the theaters while you can still experience it on the big screen. Don't miss it in theaters.Most mainstream cinema nowadays raises questions about our beliefs, mocks traditions & questions faith. What Kantara has managed to do is rekindle that belief in age-old traditions. It brought to life that faith so beautifully. Having faith is what brings peace.I am happy the Shetty boys aka RRR from Dakshina Kannada are getting their due. Been their fan since 2016 and watched all movies. Brightest stars from Kannada cinema. More power to them.Hats off to Team Kantara for creating a such piece of art. This movie deserves National Award.This movie is a pride that should be celebrated at many levels. A movie like Kantara comes once in a lifetime.Kantara is indeed a 10/10 movie. In every aspect - story, screenplay, music, bgm, cinematography, direction, emotional connection. Indian CINEMA of the Year!

reviews.review_title: Can't be expressed in words.... Can only be experienced...
reviews.content: Speechless.. who would have thought story of the movie of Devaa from a South Indian state can resembles that of Devtas from our Uttarakhand state... Unbelievable... It looks like Rishab made this movie for people of Uttarakhand especially when our regional cinema lags behind in filmmaking in many aspects... I want to thank Rishab Shetty ji for making Kantara..... Last 20 minutes of movie does something to the viewers that no one can explain in words.. it can only be experienced.... I m lucky to have seen the movie in theatre twice.... Unlucky are those who haven't seen the movie in theatre yet....

10 out of 10., Actually no movie can be a 10/10. But i am giving it a 10/10 to balance the 1 rating given by a few who cannot digest the fact that an INDIAN FILM from the south is breaking all previous records. The film gives a very clear message
1. The Government is a servant of the people and not the other way round.2. Governments have no business in controlling temples and its administration. At the most it must solves dispute if approached.3. Dharma and Religion are not the same. Dharma is law of nature ( like gravity ) Religion is a set of rules to understand nature. DHARMA is not dependent on your RELIGION.I think 🤔 more movies of this sort, should hit the screens, to trash out the differences between MAN - NATURE - RELIGION and GOVERNMENTS.

When you club the sandwich with mysticism and good story you get to see this movie.... Movie experience is very thrilling.... Its rare when the performance over exceeds your expectations.... I would recommend not to miss in theatres, bringing mysticism with good story telling and actors performance is just something which will leave you speechless.... I am big fan of director, but this actor and director is deadly combination....lastly the mysticism is eye throbbing.

reviews.review_title: Novel Concept, Good Camera work, Terrific sound but...
reviews.content: I seen this movie today and would like to give my two bit about the movie,firstly the good bits - I like the movie for showing traditions, culture of a region of coastal Karnataka widely know as tulunadu, storytelling was good no unnecessary dragging, camera works is well done , music is authentic, sound is something I really appreciated throughout the movie.Not so good bits - Violence, didn't like all the unnecessary violence that was there throughout, they could have made it small fight scenes that reflect the era, I didn't like promoting of superstition, they could have made it like more suspensive than bias. Finally objectifying women this is classis Indian movie cliché hope we grow out of this.As you can cons outweigh I give it 6/10, overall worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Good plot,Kannada movies are not used to proper stories,hence the hype
reviews.content: Good plot and good actors. What was missed in appreciation was shine/shayan Shetty's performance as kings grandson. Even the king did grt. Although as a negative role,he did very well. Same with forest officers role,very subtle and effective. The gun and wood factories came out good. What i did not get is if rishabs role cuts forests,kills animals,how is he in the goodwill of demigod.maybe it is his poor brothers spirit? Good act from him in the end. Crackers issue,everybody- stop blaming birds and animals getting harmed or scared with crackers, they live on the same planet with you around thunder,lightning and rain and know how to face noise and fire,enough with excuses,if you arescared of them do not participate, avoid however using false pretences to stop fireworks. The movie should have avoided cheap jokes and fights.

reviews.review_title: Perfect blend of light and dark

Every character both good and bad have been played so well, that you really start believing in the story which is a completely fictional.

One of the best movies EVER! Funny, interesting, and gripping from the beginning to the end. Rishab does a wonderful job as the lead actor. The cop and the landlord are really good as well. All the characters have done justice to the movie. The way the Bhuta Kola is shows is commendable. As someone who isn't very aware of this practise, I was mesmerized and taken into a trance with the depiction of this divine ritual. The kambala race is also shown very well.The climax is majestic. The last 20 minutes are beyond acting. It is a manifestation of the deity, 100%.A must-watch for anyone who is interested to know about the indigenous culture of Tulunadu (Karnataka, India).

reviews.review_title: Very unique Story India movie almost trying to Match Hollywood movies screenplay with India Culture and traditions
reviews.content: I dont usually write review on IMDB for any picture, But few negative review for absolutely beautiful movie forced me to write review , so that it helps who are genuinely interested in watching this movie and for foreigners who are interested in watching the movie and new to Bhoot-Kola tradition..Dont get confuse with Jealousy hater review , Just watch this Brilliant movie Without Any Doubt , Absolutely Unique concept and brilliant Indian Movie. These people either did not understand the movie or have some jealously regarding small budget movie earning so much in Box office and getting famous because of word-of mouth.These movie require to get familiar of Bhoot Kola traditions where its believed Demi-god enters and human Body and answers people questions.Also People who hate this movie have not understood the movie clearly , because they don't concentrate on Dialogues and subtitles and story mentioning during Gurvua murder clip and only concentarte on the last 20 minutes of film . This makes them think there is nothing new in the movie .But the main part story Plot revolves where Guruva get murdered . One need to clearly see the subtitles during this part and match to Bhoot-Kola tradition .Just for People who are new to Bhoot-kola traditions. This Traditions where performer dances with rhythms of beats of drums and attains a altered consciousness state. In this state Villagers believe Demi-God has entered performer body and puts the questions related to difficulties they are facing in there daily lives and Performer who is believed to be possessed state answers all there question and sometimes advices remedy to the problem.

A visually sumptuous, instantly immersive spectacle mounted with extraordinary vim and vigour, writer-director-actor Rishab Shetty's Kannada-language Kantara, now on nationwide release in Hindi and other languages, is a heady blend of history, myth, folklore, high drama and stylishly choreographed action neatly wrapped in a form firmly rooted in the cultural milieu it has sprung from.Shetty is also the writer and lead actor of the film. As screenwriter, his output is probably just a touch shy of being perfect, but the script has enough heft and vibrancy to translate into a mass entertainer that is visceral, rousing and unwaveringly riveting.

My native place is closer to where the Kantara story is told. All folklores told, each & every characters, situations depicted are real in our villages. Even for today, people go to forest during night to cut the trees, hunting the wild boars. The Kola ritual is depicted naturally to bring faith & devotion in the audience. Except the fighting scenes (which has to be exaggerated to be made in a movie), rest all seems to be any other folklore that we hear in the villages every day. Comedy dialogues are present at least in 80% of the scenes, they all are natural dialogues by common men. Each song in the movie complements & continuous the story in a beautiful way.The dramatical puzzle is revealed in such a manner, that no one can predict the ending of the story. When you rethink & join all pieces back, we'll realize that it has been told in a very wonderful way.In simpler words, the movie is technically rich, plot is real and raw, the action, narration, direction, music, background score along with Rishab Shetty's acting deserves the oscar award.

What a movie.... JUST SUPERB.It's all about the culture, people belief Traditional involvement from a small part of village in India.... by seeing this we know how many traditional & culture is there in all parts of our Country INDIA... We need to bring something like this from different parts of our country & show the whole world about our rich culture & traditional of this beautiful land.... Very good Cinematograph, story telling, background music, excellent talented acting, last but not the least CAPTAIN OF THE SHIP - Rishabh Shetty rocks in all format.... Must go direct entry to OSCAR.....

Characters are so natural and come together fantastically to create a masterpiece. The director Rishab Shetty who is also the lead has told a simple story in a very interesting way. The location is in the western ghats of India, beautiful thick forests and wildlife, the people resemble the locals and their belief is captured so well. This story couldn't have been told any better. There is nothing extraordinary in the movie but it leaves you with ideas which float in one's head for days to come. The music, soundtracks and effects are really catchy. Apparently its inspired by the songs sung over hundreds of years. Overall a great movie.

Never seen a movie like this especially the last 20mins. Great acting and perfect ending. Movie gives a great social message about society and nature. This movie will be all time great for generations to come.The story seem common and we would have watched it million times but it's treatment and especially the climax was mind blowing.Really happy that this movie was made that shows Hindu culture and also shows social issues which we all need to learn and grow and evolve towards better society.Lastly, great acting by all cast, beautiful music and action.Rishabh Shetty did brilliant and last 10mins was an divine acting and so pure.

I'm totally perplexed after watching the movie Kantara. The expressions of Bhoota Kola are subtle yet extremely gravitated. The ending scene where father & son meets in the jungle and communicate through eyebrows instantly draws a parity with Kathakali. The unmatchable energy in the 'hunkar' grunt completely consumes the atmosphere. Bhoota Kola's characteristics wouldn't have diffused into the heart & mind of the audience in absence of repeated premonitions and hallucinations of the protagonist Shiva. On a lighter note, I think some people in the theater engrossed in the movie forget to breathe.

reviews.review_title: The movie was epic, mesmerizing reflecting simultaneously to the core of local culture and style of mythology, art generes.
reviews.content: 1-Cinematography, choreography, video mixing, editing, back ground sciences view, camera angle, special effects in the video, back ground score, depth of colour and mixing was natural,camera focus and angles was absolutely perfect and matched with every details of the scenes in the movie.2-Actors are perfectly matched to their character such as delivery of speeches, their performance, skill, emotional effects of their faces, actors voices and delivery of speech tones were all natural and well balanced and their body languages are fabulous throughout the movies.3-Story telling in the movies focusing past, present and future time frames of the videos are perfectly balanced to each other.4-Direction of the movie was up to the mark and was amazing.5-Actors wearing their outfit, their hairstyles, make up were all well matched and fitted to their character and roles.6-In the movie crime scenes ,comedy, emotional scenes, romantic scenes, suspense, adventure, athleticism, stunts everything were just breathtaking.7-Story writing, dialogue writing, song writing, adding of characters, music composing were top notch.8- I feel like very moments of the movies had an emotional attachments as real life.9-Finally Rishabh Shetty acting skills and his performance was iconic.10-According to my opinion "Kantara" is the movie of decades in all Indian films history ever made. All the best to the members of the movies for their upcoming carriers.

This is surely a masterpiece every aspect of the movie let it me screenplay, music, direction editing, make up were given justice to the movie.rishab Shetty acting was out of the world and perfect for this character it was like he was born to do this, everyone has done justice to their character and special mention to achyuth excellent. I don't want to give spoilers and spoil the fun of watching the movie. The first 10 mins of the movie lays the foundation to the movie.They way rishab Shetty carried the character on his shoulders shows his dedication. This movie will keep you on the edge of the seat.

Felt each and every moment of the movie. After 4 years was not able to stop me to go to theatre. And when I came out I was still in the world of Kantara. Went with high expectations and not only enjoyed the movie but also got connected with story line, characters & Bhoota kola dance. Expressions of dancers are still roaming in my mind. Must watch in theatre. Proud that being a north Indian I am living in Udupi and feeling very much connected with film. Don't wait for OTT and don't miss theatre experience. Movie has high voltage climax which will give a awesome finishing touch to movie. After 20 days also kantara madness is on.

I usually don't do reviews, but for this it would have been injustice. A movie that instantly connects and culminates with an explosion of emotions. An epic climax, a cult classic, and a must watch.The folklore, culture and beliefs of the Daivas. The history of Jaatre and the beauty of spirituality. The essence of coastal Karnataka, the origins and traditions of Tulunadu. Our Dharma, the Gods, Bhootas and the Demigods, the nature and the language.Especially for people from Dakshina Karnataka, it just takes us to our divine roots and our ancestors. Let me not talk about it being a good movie or a bad movie, this is what I would call THE MOVIE.

I liked this movie after Etu Eduretu (1981). Expecting all the viewers will like this movie worldwide. You will get goosebumps and feels positive mind when coming out from cinema theater. Thanks to Hombale films to giving this type of movie after KGF. Congratulations and All the best to Rishab shetty and team. Oscar and india best movie award is must.Story : 10/10
Visuals : 10/10
Background Music : 10/10
Acting : 10/10.

Kantara depicts culture of Malenaadu (Karnataka western mountain region) in a very thrilling way. Acting from all cast is phenominal.Movie talk about love for mother, love for father, love for friend, love for brother, love for her, lover for him and some other sorts of love:) in a very special way. It talks about hate too. (Looks like love has many faces, hate is just hate).Music is uplifting. Picturization is perfect.But some of the fighting scenes looks unncessary but looks like peer pressure from other contemporary movies might have influenced this.Movie talks about leading light, self-realization and destiny too.Making such a good movie itself is an award for artists, but if this movie reaches more audience just like any English movie, this movie wil have few oscars for sure.

reviews.review_title: 10 out of 10 is even not enough for it....
reviews.content: This movie is beyond of any judgment. This is not an movie to watch but this is a movie everyone must experience it is all about the way a flim never been told.Acting every actor feels you that he is not Acting they are living the movie.Music everytime makes you surprise with songs and BGM.Direction is extraordinary.The movie us extraordinary even the 10 out of 10 star are not enough for the movie.When you finish watching movie the next 3 or 4 days you can't forget it everywhere in your mind it continues play.The begning and the climax leaves you thrilled with goose bumps.An must watch flim.

Rishabh Shetty delivers a masterpiece in Kantara. It is a layered story. First layer is based on the language, culture and faith of the people of Dakshina Kannada. We are introduced to Kambala (buffalo race), Bhootada Kola (worship of a demi god), and the story of a king who gives up a large tract of land for faith. Second layer consists of prime characters of the plot, their relationships and bonds. Third layer is the motivations and hidden agenda behind each of those characters. This unravels slowly in front of our eyes as the story progresses in unexpected twists and turns. The cinematography and the background score are so immersive that you become one with the cinema. This is the type of experience we all crave for. The fight choreography is surreal. The climax of the movie creates a powerful shock and awe. When the movie concludes, your mind remains in a state of trance as it is still processing what just happened. Some are stupefied, some have tears in their eyes, some are exhilarated. Most of us remained in our seats for several minutes. Mind-blowing!

As Yuval Noah, the Israeli public intellectual writes in Sapiens, our belief systems is what made our species power lot of adversaries, whether it's animals or other species. Rishabh Shetty, the director and actor understands this well and has woven a fabric around daily life with the battle for land as the prime story. What is remarkable is this movie is much more believable than Bahubali or even Ponniyin Selvan for me. Am no king, am no kingdom seeker, I have seen few inches of land taken away from family and have seen life and death around it. This movie despite the exxagerations (being possessed and killing hundreds of goons) stuck a deep impact in me. Despite not understanding the language fully, emotions soaked me up. We are our belief and the forest gods run deep in our nerves. Hats off Rishabh, thanks for making us believe within our boundaries and struggle for small land parcels and justice!

Kantara Review:"Wooooooh.... Woooooh...." The exhilarting experience I had in the last 20 mins of this goosebumps inducing masterpiece, written, directed and acted by Rishabh Shetty, will stay on for sometime. Man, what a movie, what a movie!!. The entire theatre erupted during the climax. The story is deep rooted in the mythology of the TuluNadu village of Karnataka. Many years ago in the 1847s, the King, in search of peace and happiness, stumbled upon two dieties: Panjurli and Guliga (one of them is forgiving and another is not), who were worshipped by the local tribes. The king traded his land to the villagers in exchange of the dieties' blessing for peace and happiness. There was a promise made by the king that the lands will always belong to the villagers. Cut to the 1970s, the descendants of the King as well as the villagers now live their lives. There is Shiva, the rowdy hero of the Village and there is a forest officer who is hell bent on making the lands of the Village an encroached area and declaring it a reserve forest. Shiva and the forest officer are always at loggerheads. How the calling comes for Shiva from the dieties and how the story of the promise made by the King is woven in the current age forms the crux of Kantara. This is a story of greed, religion, casteism and so much more. It won't be possible for me to do justice to the brilliance of this movie in a few words. This is simply an experience. Last time I felt so entranced was while watching 'Tumbbaad'. Rishabh Shetty as Shiva will just blow you away with his performance, just see the last 15 mins of his performance, it will definitely give you goosebumps. The rest of the cast is also phenomenal. The Cinematography is so mesmerizing, there are action sequences in mud, there are action sequences in rain, and they are choreographed very very well. The Music and Background music is awesome. Rishabh Shetty as the director and writer also does a phenomenal job. The screenplay is tight, it never loses its point.I watched the Hindi dubbed of this Kannada film, which is decent and will give you all the feels. This has to be, has to be experienced in theatres. Just watch it.

This movie is a absolute treat for movie goers, The folklore, India was always about how we as civilisation connected to Nature, We were always in balance with Nature. Nature was not a commodity for us. We coexisted with Nature. This movie touches upon the deep rooted culture of India. Wonderful movie Written Directed Acted By Rishab Shetty. Thanks You Tishab for bringing deep rooted culture folklore to Big Screen. Bhootha Kola and other rituals with Nature always existed in all parts of the world we just forgot it in the Name of Modernism. Thanks Rishab Shetty now everyone appreciates and proud about being Hindu. Humanity should never forget exploit Nature we should worship and coexist with Nature.

In every aspect, movie is excellent. I was totally surprised by Rishabh's acting. BGM,cinematogrophy,direction,cast and acting all departments have done fantabulous job.Goosebumps starts right from the starting to the end. Story actually tells about the roots of our Indian culture. The narration is simply superb.Each small things in the movie has been shown perfectly. Climax is mind-blowing, no words to explain about it. Each and every characters are terrific to watch.Overall while coming out of the theatre you feel its an emotion, which is beyond just the movie. Full marks to the entire team including the Hombale films.

Super cinematography, fantastic presentation, a decision well fulfilled about tricky topic to make a movie on, 100% apt music etc etc... All in all, I don't have enough words to comment about this movie.I usually don't leave review about any movie but then I thought this brilliant presentation definitely deserves a praise and a review is must.What a class act by all the characters in the movie. We must applaud each and every character player.As many reviews say, the last 15-20 minutes are mind boggling, mesmerising, divine and I am 100% sure that we will remember and applaud those moments again and again. The build up to the climax has also been beautifully presented.I am not from Udupi/Mangaluru region but I did get an opportunity once to visit a "Bhoota Kola". Can't remember the village name but it was near Udupi. As I was in my teens those days, I couldn't understand the kola completely (not even today) but this movie refreshed those memories. Thanks to Hombale Films, Rishabh Shetty and team for a beautiful, enthralling and divine presentation.

reviews.review_title: Its not a film. Its a FESTIVAL.
reviews.content:
I just came back from watching KANTARA. Nothing much to say except thay this is one of the Greatest Movie of Indian Cinema. It is in my opinion One of the Top 10 best movies of all time in the world. Also this is my first time writing a review on ImDB even though I have had an account for many years and having watched thounsands of films.You don't just watch this movie. You experience
it wholeheartedly. I will again watch it tomorrow. And maybe many more times while it still is in the theatres. What a privilege to have witnessed this in a cinema hall in my lifetime. What an honor. Thank you for giving this to us RISHAB SHETTY. You have made history. Congratulations. And Thank you once again.

Jai Ho🙏🙏🙏Hats off to the great masterpiece and great mastermind behind this movie -Rishab Shetty ji.This movie is a devine creation and has been directed, acted and written by Rishabh ji with an utmost sincerity. One should not miss watching this movie in theatre for the ultimate thriller experience this movie is.Many regions in India and Indians are still waiting for this movie to be released in Hindi, i hope this happens soon as well.Though have watched this movie in Hindi language and wish to watch it again in Kannada language for more authentic experience.This movie is already is a great success, but I wish this movie all the more prosperity and fame it truly deserve.
